  2126                                  ;============================================================================
  2127                                  ; ERROR.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  2128                                  ;============================================================================
  2129                                  ; 16/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 
  2130                                  
  2131                                  ;**	ERROR.INC - DOS Error Codes
  2132                                  ;
  2133                                  ;    The newer (DOS 2.0 and above) "XENIX-style" calls
  2134                                  ;    return error codes through AX. If an error occurred then
  2135                                  ;    the carry bit will be set and the error code is in AX. If no error
  2136                                  ;    occurred then the carry bit is reset and AX contains returned info.
  2137                                  ;
  2138                                  ;    Since the set of error codes is being extended as we extend the operating
  2139                                  ;    system, we have provided a means for applications to ask the system for a
  2140                                  ;    recommended course of action when they receive an error.
  2141                                  ;
  2142                                  ;    The GetExtendedError system call returns a universal error, an error
  2143                                  ;    location and a recommended course of action. The universal error code is
  2144                                  ;    a symptom of the error REGARDLESS of the context in which GetExtendedError
  2145                                  ;    is issued.
  2146                                  
  2147                                  ;	2.0 error codes
  2148                                  
  2149                                  error_invalid_function		EQU	1
  2150                                  error_file_not_found		EQU	2
  2151                                  error_path_not_found		EQU	3
  2152                                  error_too_many_open_files	EQU	4
  2153                                  error_access_denied		EQU	5
  2154                                  error_invalid_handle		EQU	6
  2155                                  error_arena_trashed		EQU	7
  2156                                  error_not_enough_memory 	EQU	8
  2157                                  error_invalid_block		EQU	9
  2158                                  error_bad_environment		EQU	10
  2159                                  error_bad_format		EQU	11
  2160                                  error_invalid_access		EQU	12
  2161                                  error_invalid_data		EQU	13

  2254                                  ;**	The GetExtendedError call takes an error code and returns CLASS,

  2292                                  ;============================================================================
  2293                                  ; INT2A.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  2294                                  ;============================================================================
  2295                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  2296                                  
  2297                                  ;**	Int 2A functions
  2298                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2299                                  ;	Int 2A is an interface to the network code; it's also overloaded
  2300                                  ;		as a critical section handler since critical sections
  2301                                  ;		were originally created to support the net.
  2302                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2303                                  
  2304                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2305                                  ;**	This table was created by examining the source and may not be
  2306                                  ;	complete or completely accurate - JGL
  2307                                  ;
  2308                                  ;	M010	MD	8/31/90 - Added definition for AH = 5
  2309                                  
  2310                                  ;	(ah) = 0	installation check
  2311                                  ;			   (returns ah !=0 if installed)
  2312                                  ;	(ah) = 1	cooked net bios call
  2313                                  ;	(ah) = 3	query drive shared
  2314                                  ;			   (ds:si) = "n:" asciz string
  2315                                  ;	(ah) = 4	net bios
  2316                                  ;	       (al) = 0	   cooked net bios call
  2317                                  ;	       (al) = 1	   raw net bios call
  2318                                  ;	       (al) = 2	   ???
  2319                                  ;
  2320                                  ;	(ah) = 5	Get Net Adaptor Resources. CX returns the number of
  2321                                  ;			NCBs available/outstanding. DX returns the number of
  2322                                  ;			sessions. Supposedly, this is documented in an old
  2323                                  ;			IBM PC-LAN reference. Lotus Notes uses it. DOS LAN
  2324                                  ;			Manager 2.0 Enhanced responds to it. But it should
  2325                                  ;			not be used, as it is a hack, only to get Lotus
  2326                                  ;			Notes running.
  2327                                  ;
  2328                                  ;	(ah) = 80h	enter critical section
  2329                                  ;	(ah) = 81h	leave critical section
  2330                                  ;	(ah) = 82h	free all critical sections (Leave-all)
  2331                                  ;	(ah) = 84h	entering idle loop (don't understand how this works)
  2332                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2333                                  
  2334                                  ;**	Critical section definitions
  2335                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2336                                  ;	Although DOS is not designed to be reentrant there are some hacks
  2337                                  ;	which various programs use to make it so, in a limited fashion.
  2338                                  ;	Both WIN386 and some servers block copy a section of the DOS data
  2339                                  ;	area so that DOS can be reentered on behalf of another thread/program.
  2340                                  ;	DOS's global data structures, such as the memory arena, are not
  2341                                  ;	in this area, so critical section indicators are used to protect
  2342                                  ;	those areas.  DOS flags a critical section by issuing an INT_IBM
  2343                                  ;	(int 2Ah) at each critical section entry and exit.  Some clients
  2344                                  ;	(such as WIN386) just don't "context switch" the DOS when one
  2345                                  ;	of these is in effect, others, such as the IBM server, go ahead
  2346                                  ;	and reenter the DOS and if they get an int 2A to reenter the same
  2347                                  ;	critical section they then switch away from that second thread and
  2348                                  ;	let the first one finish and exit the section.
  2349                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2350                                  
  2351                                  ; These below are subject to leave-all sections
  2352                                  critDisk    EQU     1			; Disk I/O critical section
  2353                                  critShare   EQU     1			; Sharer I/O critical section
  2354                                  critMem     EQU     1			; memory maintenance critical section
  2355                                  critSFT     EQU     1			; sft table allocation
  2356                                  critDevice  EQU     2			; Device I/O critical section
  2357                                  critNet     EQU     5			; network critical section
  2358                                  critIFS     EQU     6			; ifsfunc critical section
  2359                                  ; These below are not subject to leave-all sections
  2360                                  critASSIGN  EQU     8			; Assign has munged a system call
  2361                                  
  2362                                  ;============================================================================
  2363                                  ; MULT.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  2364                                  ;============================================================================
  2365                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  2366                                  
  2367                                  ;Break <Multiplex channels>
  2368                                  
  2369                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2370                                  ; The current set of defined multiplex channels is (* means documented):
  2371                                  ;
  2372                                  ;   Channel(h)  Issuer          Receiver    Function
  2373                                  ;      00       server          PSPRINT     print job control
  2374                                  ;     *01       print/apps      PRINT       Queueing of files
  2375                                  ;      02       BIOS            REDIR       signal open/close of printers
  2376                                  ;
  2377                                  ;      05       command         REDIR       obtain text of net int 24 message
  2378                                  ;     *06       server/assign   ASSIGN      Install check
  2379                                  ;
  2380                                  ;      08       external driver IBMBIO      interface to internal routines
  2381                                  ;
  2382                                  ;      10       sharer/server   Sharer      install check
  2383                                  ;      11       DOS/server      Redir       install check/redirection funcs
  2384                                  ;      12       sharer/redir    DOS         dos functions and structure maint
  2385                                  ;      13       MSNET           MSNET       movement of NCBs
  2386                                  ;      13       external driver IBMBIO      Reset_Int_13, allows installation
  2387                                  ;                                           of alternative INT_13 drivers after
  2388                                  ;                                           boot_up
  2389                                  ;      14 (IBM) DOS             NLSFUNC     down load NLS country info,DOS 3.3
  2390                                  ;      14 (MS)  APPS            POPUP       MSDOS 4 popup screen functions
  2391                                  ;      15       APPS            MSCDEX      CD-ROM extensions interface
  2392                                  ;      16       WIN386          WIN386      Windows communications
  2393                                  ;      17       Clipboard       WINDOWS     Clipboard interface
  2394                                  ;     *18       Applications    MS-Manger   Toggle interface to manager
  2395                                  ;      19       Shell

  2580                                      ;   1   IOCTL_2F                    ; 2F interface to IOCTL
  2581                                      ;   2   DA_INFO_2F                  ; J.K. Information passing to ANSI.
  2582                                  
  2583                                  multMULT        EQU     4Ah
  2584                                  multMAGIC       EQU     256*multMULT + 11h
  2585                                  multMULTRPLTOM  EQU     06h
  2586                                  
  2587                                      ;   0   swap disk function for single floppy drive m/cs
  2588                                      ;       BIOS broadcasts with cx==0, and apps who handle
  2589                                      ;       swap disk messaging set cx == -1. BIOS sets dl == requested
  2590                                      ;       drive
  2591                                      ;
  2592                                      ;   1   Get available HMA & pointer to it. Returns in BX & ES:DI
  2593                                      ;   2   Allocate HMA. BX == number of bytes in HMA to be allocated
  2594                                      ;       returns pointer in ES:DI
  2595                                      ;
  2596                                      ;   3-4 currently used by nobody
  2597                                      ;   5   Switcher API
  2598                                      ;   6   Top of Memory for RPL.
  2599                                      ;           BIOS issues INT 2f AX=4a06 & DX = Top of Mem and any RPL
  2600                                      ;           code present in TOM should respond with a new TOM in DX
  2601                                      ;           to protect itself from MSLOAD & SYSINIT tromping over it.
  2602                                      ;           SYSINIT builds an arena with owner type 8 & name 'RPL' to
  2603                                      ;           protect the RPL code from COMMAND.COM transient protion.
  2604                                      ;           It is the responsibility of RPL program to release the mem.
  2605                                      ;   7   Reserved for PROTMAN support.
  2606                                      ;  10   smartdrv 4.0
  2607                                      ;  11   dblspace api
  2608                                      ;  12   MRCI     api
  2609                                      ;  13   dblspace/mrci stealth packet api
  2610                                  
  2611                                  MultAPM     EQU     4ch             ; Obselete ???
  2612                                      ;       00h     APM_VER_CHK
  2613                                      ;       01h     APM_SUS_SYS_REQ
  2614                                      ;       FFh     APM_SUS_RES_BATT_NOTIFY
  2615                                  
  2616                                  MultPWR_BRDCST  EQU     53h     ; Used by POWER.EXE to broadcast      ; M036
  2617                                  				;  APM events                         ; M036
  2618                                  MultPWR_API     EQU     54h     ; Used for accessing POWER.EXE's API  ; M036
  2619

  2621                                  ;	  it calls Multdos 42 to set up an entry routine address
  2622                                      ;	0   Install status  (reserved)
  2623                                      ;	1   Lookup
  2624                                      ;	2   Insert

  2755                                  ;============================================================================
  2756                                  ; CURDIR.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  2757                                  ;============================================================================
  2758                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  2759                                  ; 09/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (CURDIR.INC, MSDOS 3.3, 1987)
  2760                                  
  2761                                  ;BREAK <Current directory list structure>
  2762                                  
  2763                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
  2764                                  ;	     C	A  V  E  A  T	  P  R	O  G  R  A  M  M  E  R		   ;
  2765                                  ;									   ;
  2766                                  ; CDS items are used bu the internal routines to store cluster numbers and ;
  2767                                  ; network identifiers for each logical name.  The ID field is used dually, ;
  2768                                  ; both as net ID and for a cluster number for local devices.  In the case  ;
  2769                                  ; of local devices, the cluster number will be -1 if there is a potential  ;
  2770                                  ; of the disk being changed or if the path must be recracked.		   ;
  2771                                  ;
  2772                                  ;	Some pathnames have special preambles, such as
  2773                                  ;
  2774                                  ;		\\machine\sharename\...
  2775                                  ;	For these pathnames we can't allow ".." processing to back us
  2776                                  ;	up into the special front part of the name.  The CURDIR_END field
  2777                                  ;	holds the address of the seperator character which marks
  2778                                  ;	the split between the special preamble and the regular
  2779                                  ;	path list; ".." processing isn't allowed to back us up past
  2780                                  ;	(i.e., before) CURDIR_END
  2781                                  ;	For the root, it points at the leading /.  For net
  2782                                  ;	assignments it points at the end (nul) of the initial assignment:
  2783                                  ;	A:/	\\foo\bar	    \\foo\bar\blech\bozo
  2784                                  ;	  ^		 ^		     ^
  2785                                  
  2786                                  DIRSTRLEN	EQU	64+3		; Max length in bytes of directory strings
  2787                                  TEMPLEN 	EQU	DIRSTRLEN*2
  2788                                  
  2789                                  struc curdir	; curdir_list
  2790 00000000 <res 43h>               .text:		resb DIRSTRLEN		; text of assignment and curdir
  2791 00000043 ????                    .flags:		resw 1			; various flags
  2792 00000045 ????????                .devptr:	resd 1			; local pointer to DPB or net device
  2793 00000049 ????????                .ID:		resw 2			; cluster of current dir (net ID)
  2794 0000004D ????                    .user_word:	resw 1
  2795 0000004F ????                    .end:		resw 1			; index to ".." backup limit - see above
  2796                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
  2797 00000051 ??                      .type:		resb 1			; IFS drive (2=ifs, 4=netuse)
  2798 00000052 ????????                .ifs_hdr:	resd 1			; Ptr to File System Header
  2799 00000056 ????                    .fsda:		resb 2			; File System Dependent Data Area
  2800                                  .size:
  2801                                  endstruc
  2802                                  
  2803                                  curdirLen	EQU curdir.size	; 88	; Needed for screwed up
  2804                                  
  2805                                  %define curdir_netID curdir_ID  ; dword
  2806                                  
  2807                                  ;**	Flag values for CURDIR_FLAGS
  2808                                  
  2809                                  curdir_isnet	EQU	1000000000000000B
  2810                                  CURDIR_isifs	EQU	1000000000000000B ; MSDOS 6.0	
  2811                                  curdir_inuse	EQU	0100000000000000B
  2812                                  curdir_splice	EQU	0010000000000000B
  2813                                  curdir_local	EQU	0001000000000000B
  2814                                  
  2815                                  ;									   ;
  2816                                  ;	     C	A  V  E  A  T	  P  R	O  G  R  A  M  M  E  R		   ;
  2817                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
  2818                                  
  2819                                  ;============================================================================
  2820                                  ; CPMFCB.INC (MSDOS 3.3, 1987)
  2821                                  ;============================================================================
  2822                                  ; 09/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  2823                                  
  2824                                  ;BREAK <File Control Block definition>
  2825                                  
  2826                                  ;
  2827                                  ; Field definition for FCBs
  2828                                  ; The FCB has the following structure:
  2829                                  ;
  2830                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2831                                  ;	|   Drive indicator(byte)   |
  2832                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2833                                  ;	|    Filename (8 chars)     |
  2834                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2835                                  ;	|    Extension (3 chars)    |
  2836                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2837                                  ;	|   Current Extent(word)    |
  2838                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2839                                  ;	|    Record size (word)     |
  2840                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2841                                  ;	|    File Size (2 words)    |
  2842                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2843                                  ;	|	Date of write	    |
  2844                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2845                                  ;	|	Time of write	    |
  2846                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2847                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
  2848                                  ;	     C	A  V  E  A  T	  P  R	O  G  R  A  M  M  E  R		   ;
  2849                                  ;									   ;
  2850                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2851                                  ;	|   8 bytes reserved	    |
  2852                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2853                                  ;									   ;
  2854                                  ;	     C	A  V  E  A  T	  P  R	O  G  R  A  M  M  E  R		   ;
  2855                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
  2856                                  ;	|    next record number     |
  2857                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2858                                  ;	|   random record number    |
  2859                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2860                                  ;
  2861                                  
  2862                                  struc	SYS_FCB
  2863 00000000 ??                      .drive:	resb 1
  2864 00000001 ????????????????        .name:	resb 8
  2865 00000009 ??????                  .ext:	resb 3
  2866 0000000C ????                    .EXTENT: resw 1
  2867 0000000E ????                    .RECSIZ: resw 1			; Size of record (user settable)
  2868 00000010 ????                    .FILSIZ: resw 1			; Size of file in bytes; used with the
  2869                                  				; following word
  2870 00000012 ????                    .DRVBP:	resw 1			; BP for SEARCH FIRST and SEARCH NEXT
  2871 00000014 ????                    .FDATE:	resw 1			; Date of last writing
  2872 00000016 ????                    .FTIME:	resw 1			; Time of last writing
  2873                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
  2874                                  ;	     C	A  V  E  A  T	  P  R	O  G  R  A  M  M  E  R		   ;
  2875                                  ;									   ;
  2876 00000018 ????????????????        .reserved: resb 8		; RESERVED
  2877                                  ;									   ;
  2878                                  ;	     C	A  V  E  A  T	  P  R	O  G  R  A  M  M  E  R		   ;
  2879                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
  2880 00000020 ??                      .NR:	resb 1			; Next record
  2881 00000021 ????????                .RR:	resb 4			; Random record
  2882                                  .size:
  2883                                  endstruc
  2884                                  
  2885                                  FILDIRENT EQU SYS_FCB.FILSIZ	; Used only by SEARCH FIRST and SEARCH
  2886                                  				; NEXT
  2887                                  ; 20/07/2018
  2888                                  %define fcb_sfn	SYS_FCB.reserved ; byte
  2889                                  
  2890                                  ; Note that fcb_net_handle, fcb_nsl_drive, fcb_nsld_drive and fcb_l_drive
  2891                                  ; all must point to the same byte.  Otherwise, the FCBRegen will fail.
  2892                                  ; NOTE about this byte (fcb_nsl_drive)
  2893                                  ;   The high two bits of this byte are used as follows to indicate the FCB type
  2894                                  ;	00 means a local file or device with sharing loaded
  2895                                  ;	10 means a remote (network) file
  2896                                  ;	01 means a local file with no sharing loaded
  2897                                  ;	11 means a local device with no sharing loaded
  2898                                  
  2899                                  ; 20/07/2018
  2900                                  
  2901                                  ;
  2902                                  ; Network FCB
  2903                                  ;
  2904                                  
  2905                                  %define fcb_net_drive	SYS_FCB.reserved+1  ; byte
  2906                                  %define fcb_net_handle	SYS_FCB.reserved+2  ; word
  2907                                  %define fcb_netID	SYS_FCB.reserved+4  ; dword		
  2908                                  
  2909                                  ;
  2910                                  ; No sharing local file FCB
  2911                                  ;
  2912                                  
  2913                                  %define fcb_nsl_drive	SYS_FCB.reserved+1  ; byte
  2914                                  %define fcb_nsl_bits	SYS_FCB.reserved+2  ; byte	
  2915                                  %define fcb_nsl_firclus SYS_FCB.reserved+3  ; word	
  2916                                  %define fcb_nsl_dirsec	SYS_FCB.reserved+5  ; word
  2917                                  %define fcb_nsl_dirpos  SYS_FCB.reserved+7  ; byte
  2918                                  
  2919                                  ;
  2920                                  ; No sharing local device FCB
  2921                                  ;
  2922                                  
  2923                                  %define fcb_nsld_drive	SYS_FCB.reserved+1  ; byte	
  2924                                  %define fcb_nsld_drvptr SYS_FCB.reserved+2  ; dword
  2925                                  
  2926                                  ;
  2927                                  ; Sharing local FCB
  2928                                  ;
  2929                                  
  2930                                  %define fcb_l_drive	SYS_FCB.reserved+1  ; byte
  2931                                  %define fcb_l_firclus	SYS_FCB.reserved+2  ; word
  2932                                  %define fcb_l_mfs	SYS_FCB.reserved+4  ; word
  2933                                  %define fcb_l_attr	SYS_FCB.reserved+6  ; byte
  2934                                  
  2935                                  ;
  2936                                  ; Bogusness:  the four cases are:
  2937                                  ;
  2938                                  ;   local file	    00
  2939                                  ;   local device    40
  2940                                  ;   local sharing   C0
  2941                                  ;   network	    80
  2942                                  ;
  2943                                  ; Since sharing and network collide, we cannot use a test instruction for
  2944                                  ; deciding whether a network or a share check in involved
  2945                                  ;
  2946                                  FCBDEVICE   EQU 040h
  2947                                  FCBNETWORK  EQU 080h
  2948                                  FCBSHARE    EQU 0C0h
  2949                                  
  2950                                  ; FCBSPECIAL must be able to mask off both net and share
  2951                                  FCBSPECIAL  EQU 080h
  2952                                  FCBMASK     EQU 0C0h
  2953

  3075                                  ;  Symbols and structures relating to WIN386 support.

  3087                                  Win386_Exit		equ	06h	; Win386 exit

  3095

  3106                                  endstruc

  3131                                  ; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  3132                                  
  3133                                  ;============================================================================
  3134                                  ; MSHEAD.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  3135                                  ;============================================================================
  3136                                  ; 16/07/2018 - Retro DOS 3.0
  3137                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3138                                  ; 24/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
  3139                                  
  3140                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
  3141                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3142                                  ; FILE : ORIGIN.INC
  3143                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3144                                  ; This is included in origin.asm and mshead.asm. Contains the equate that
  3145                                  ; is used for ORGing the DOS code.
  3146                                  ;
  3147                                  ; Brief Description of the necessacity of this ORG:
  3148                                  ; -------------------------------------------------
  3149                                  ;
  3150                                  ; A special problem exits when running out of the HMA. The HMA starts at 
  3151                                  ; address FFFF:10. There is no place in the HMA with an offset of zero.
  3152                                  ; This means programs running out off the HMA must use non-zero offset base
  3153                                  ; addresses. It also means that if we're running multiple programs from the
  3154                                  ; HMA, the base offset of each segment must atleast be as big as all of the
  3155                                  ; HMA segments that precede it.
  3156                                  ; 
  3157                                  ; One solution to this problem to ORG each module at 64K minus its size.
  3158                                  ; For instance a code segment 1234h bytes in length would org'd at edcbh.
  3159                                  ; This gives max. flexibility regarding it's location in the HMA. By 
  3160                                  ; selecting segment values between f124h and ffffh it could be located 
  3161                                  ; anywhere in the HMA. The problem with this is that programs with such 
  3162                                  ; high ORGs would not be able to run in low RAM.
  3163                                  ;
  3164                                  ; A compromise solution is to set the ORG address somewhere between 0010h
  3165                                  ; and ffffh - their size. In the particular case of the BIOS and the DOS 
  3166                                  ; the following solution has been implemented:
  3167                                  ;
  3168                                  ; The Bios Code segment will have a very small offset and run at the very
  3169                                  ; front of the HMA, after the VDISK header. THE Dos Code segment will have 
  3170                                  ; a base offset of (700+<min. size off RAM based BIOS>+<min. size of the DOS
  3171                                  ; DATA segment when DOS is running low>). This will reflect the lowest 
  3172                                  ; possible physical address at which DOS code will run, while still providing
  3173                                  ; max. possible flexibility in HMA positioning. This offset MUST NOT be 
  3174                                  ; smaller then that 20+size of Bios Code segment when running high. This is 
  3175                                  ; mostly true.
  3176                                  ;
  3177                                  ; Also this ORG'd value must be communicated to the BIOS. This is done by
  3178                                  ; putting this value after the first jmp instruction in the DOS code in
  3179                                  ; mshead.asm. 
  3180                                  ;
  3181                                  ; In order for the stripz utility to know how many zeroes to be stripped 
  3182                                  ; out, this value is placed at the beginning of the binary in origin.asm.
  3183                                  ;
  3184                                  ; Revision History:
  3185                                  ;
  3186                                  ; Currently this is being done manually. Therefore any change in the DOS DATA
  3187                                  ; Size or the BIOS size should be reflected here. --- Feb 90
  3188                                  ;
  3189                                  ; BDSIZE.INC contains the equates for BIODATASIZE, BIOCODESIZ and DOSDATASIZ.
  3190                                  ; A utility called getsize will obtain the corresponding values from msdos
  3191                                  ; and msbio.map and update the values in BDSIZ.INC if they are different. 
  3192                                  ; DOS should now be built using the batch file makedos.bat which invokes this
  3193                                  ; utility. The FORMAT of BDSIZE.INC should not be changed as getsize is 
  3194                                  ; dependant on that.				  --- Apr 3 '90
  3195                                  ;
  3196                                  ; For ROMDOS, however, there is no need to org the doscode to any location
  3197                                  ; other than zero.  Therefore the stripz utility will not need to be used,
  3198                                  ; so the offset will not need to be included at the beginning of the code
  3199                                  ; segment.  Also, the BIOS can just assume that the resident code begins
  3200                                  ; at offset zero within the segment.
  3201                                  ; 
  3202                                  ;
  3203                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3204                                  
  3205                                  BIODATASTART	EQU	00700h
  3206                                  ;include	bdsize.inc	; this sets the values:
  3207                                  				;	BIODATASIZ
  3208                                  				;	BIOCODESIZ
  3209                                  				;	DOSDATASIZ
  3210                                  
  3211                                  ; 05/12/2022
  3212                                  ;BIODATASIZ EQU 00910H	; 0900h for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
  3213                                  			; 0900h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS
  3214                                  ;BIOCODESIZ EQU 01A70H	; 1A70h for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
  3215                                  			; 1A60h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS
  3216                                  ;DOSDATASIZ EQU 01370H	; 1370h for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
  3217                                  			; 1370h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS
  3218                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
  3219                                  ;
  3220                                  ;BYTSTART	EQU    	BIODATASTART+BIODATASIZ+BIOCODESIZ+DOSDATASIZ
  3221                                  ;PARASTART	EQU	(BYTSTART + 0FH) AND (NOT 0FH)	
  3222                                  ;
  3223                                  ;else
  3224                                  ;
  3225                                  ;BYTSTART	EQU	0
  3226                                  ;PARASTART	EQU	0
  3227                                  ;
  3228                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
  3229                                  
  3230                                  ; 24/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 - Modification
  3231                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------
  3232                                  ;MSDAT001E equ 136Ah ; 4970 ; for MSDOS 6.21	
  3233                                  ;MSDAT001E equ 1370h ; 4976 ; for Retro DOS v4.0 modif. 25/05/2019	
  3234                                  ;DOSDATASIZE equ MSDAT001E
  3235                                  ; 05/12/2022
  3236                                  ;DOSDATASIZE equ $ ; 29/04/2019 ; -only- for RETRO DOS v4.0 :
  3237                                  ;_PARASTART_ equ DOSDATASIZE ; segment value will point to start of
  3238                                  			    ; of DOSDATA (in low memory) while
  3239                                  			    ; dos/kernel code starts just after 
  3240                                  			    ; this data block ((org = DOSDATASIZE))
  3241                                  			    ; (in low memory or in HMA)	
  3242                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------
  3243                                  
  3244                                  ; 04/11/2022

  3247                                  ; Microsoft dos programmers were calling 'IO.SYS' as dos 'BIOS'
  3248                                  ; (Also, they were calling 'ROMBIOS' as 'ROM' only!)

  3250

  3310                                  ; MSTABLE.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  3311                                  ;============================================================================
  3312                                  ; 16/07/2018 - Retro DOS 3.0
  3313                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
  3314                                  
  3315                                  	; (MSDOS version)
  3316                                  	; DOSCODE:3DE9h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  3317                                  	;db	6
  3318                                  	;db	20
  3319                                  	; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS) 
  3320                                  	; DOSCODE:3DD9h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
  3321                                  	;db	5
  3322                                  	;db	0	
  3323                                  
  3324                                  	; Offset 0C78h in IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987)
  3325                                  MSVERS:				; MS-DOS version in hex for $GET_VERSION
  3326 00000009 07                      MSMAJOR: DB	MAJOR_VERSION	; DOS_MAJOR_VERSION

  3328                                  
  3329                                  ;;hkn YRTAB & MONTAB moved to DOSDATA in ms_data.asm
  3330                                  ;	I_am	YRTAB,8,<200,166,200,165,200,165,200,165>   ; [SYSTEM]
  3331                                  ;	I_am	MONTAB,12,<31,28,31,30,31,30,31,31,30,31,30,31> ; [SYSTEM]
  3332                                  
  3333                                  ; DOSTAB.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  3334                                  ; YRTAB & MONTAB moved from TABLE segment in ms_table.asm
  3335                                  ;
  3336                                  ;	I_am    YRTAB,8,<200,166,200,165,200,165,200,165>   
  3337                                  ;	I_am    MONTAB,12,<31,28,31,30,31,30,31,31,30,31,30,31> 
  3338                                  
  3339                                  ; This is the error code mapping table for INT 21 errors. This table defines
  3340                                  ; those error codes which are "allowed" for each system call. If the error
  3341                                  ; code ABOUT to be returned is not "allowed" for the call, the correct action
  3342                                  ; is to return the "real" error via Extended error, and one of the allowed
  3343                                  ; errors on the actual call.
  3344                                  ;
  3345                                  ; The table is organized as follows:
  3346                                  ;
  3347                                  ;    Each entry in the table is of variable size, but the first
  3348                                  ;       two bytes are always:
  3349                                  ;
  3350                                  ;       Call#,Cnt of bytes following this byte
  3351                                  ;
  3352                                  ; EXAMPLE:
  3353                                  ;       Call 61 (OPEN)
  3354                                  ;
  3355                                  ;       DB      61,5,12,3,2,4,5
  3356                                  ;
  3357                                  ;       61 is the AH INT 21 call value for OPEN.
  3358                                  ;        5 indicates that there are 5 bytes after this byte (12,3,2,4,5).
  3359                                  ;       Next five bytes are those error codes which are "allowed" on OPEN.
  3360                                  ;       The order of these values is not important EXCEPT FOR THE LAST ONE (in
  3361                                  ;       this case 5).  The last value will be the one returned on the call if
  3362                                  ;       the "real" error is not one of the allowed ones.
  3363                                  ;
  3364                                  ; There are a number of calls (for instance all of the FCB calls) for which
  3365                                  ;   there is NO entry.  This means that NO error codes are returned on this
  3366                                  ;   call, so set up an Extended error and leave the current error code alone.
  3367                                  ;
  3368                                  ; The table is terminated by a call value of 0FFh
  3369                                  
  3370                                  ;PUBLIC I21_MAP_E_TAB
  3371                                  	; 10/08/2018
  3372                                  
  3373                                  ; 29/04/2019
  3374                                  ; DOSCODE:3DE9h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  3375                                  ; 04/11/2022
  3376                                  ; DOSCODE:3DDBh	(MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  3377                                  ; 01/01/2024
  3378                                  ; DOSCODE:3F1Bh	(PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  3379                                  
  3380                                  I21_MAP_E_TAB:	; LABEL	BYTE
  3381 0000000B 38020102                    DB  INTERNATIONAL,2,error_invalid_function,error_file_not_found
  3382 0000000F 3903030205                  DB  MKDIR,3,error_path_not_found,error_file_not_found,error_access_denied
  3383 00000014 3A041003                    DB  RMDIR,4,error_current_directory,error_path_not_found
  3384 00000018 0205                        DB          error_file_not_found,error_access_denied
  3385 0000001A 3B020203                    DB  CHDIR,2,error_file_not_found,error_path_not_found
  3386 0000001E 3C040302                    DB  CREAT,4,error_path_not_found,error_file_not_found
  3387 00000022 04                          DB          error_too_many_open_files

  3976                                  ; DosCode SEGMENT
  3977                                  
  3978                                  ; ==========================================================================
  3979                                  ;
  3980                                  ; $Set_CTRL_C_Trapping
  3981                                  ;
  3982                                  ; Function:
  3983                                  ;	Enable disable ^C checking in dispatcher
  3984                                  ;
  3985                                  ; Inputs:
  3986                                  ;		AL = 0 read ^C status
  3987                                  ;		AL = 1 Set ^C status, DL = 0/1 for ^C off/on
  3988                                  ;		AL = 2 Set ^C status to contents of DL.	Output is old state.
  3989                                  ;		AL = 5 get DOS boot drive
  3990                                  ;		AL = 6 Get version number
  3991                                  ;			RETURNS:
  3992                                  ;				BH = Minor version number
  3993                                  ;				BL = Major version number
  3994                                  ;				DL = DOS internal revision
  3995                                  ;				DH = DOS type flags
  3996                                  ;					Bit 3 	- DOS in ROM
  3997                                  ;					Bit 4 	- DOS in HMA
  3998                                  ;					Bit 0-2, 5-7 - Reserved
  3999                                  ; Outputs:
  4000                                  ;		If AL = 0 then DL = 0/1 for ^C off/on
  4001                                  ;
  4002                                  ; History:
  4003                                  ;      removed	AL = 3 Get CPSW state to DL	    DOS 3.4
  4004                                  ;      removed	AL = 4 Set CPSW state from DL	    DOS 3.4
  4005                                  ; ==========================================================================
  4006                                  
  4007                                  ; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  4008                                  ; DOSCODE:4045h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
  4009                                  
  4010                                  ; 01/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  4011                                  ; DOSCODE:4123h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
  4012                                  
  4013                                  _$SET_CTRL_C_TRAPPING:
  4014                                  	; 01/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  4015                                  
  4016 0000023D 3C07                    	cmp	al,7	; 01/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
  4017                                  	;cmp	AL,6			; Is this a valid subfunction?
  4018 0000023F 7603                    	jbe	short scct_1		; If yes continue processing
  4019                                  
  4020 00000241 B0FF                    	mov	AL,0FFh			; Else set AL to -1 and
  4021 00000243 CF                      	iret
  4022                                  scct_1:
  4023 00000244 1E                      	push	DS
  4024                                  
  4025                                  	;getdseg <DS>			; DS -> DosData, ASSUME DS:DosSeg
  4026 00000245 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
  4027                                  	
  4028 0000024A 50                      	push	AX			; DL only register that can change
  4029 0000024B 56                      	push	SI
  4030                                  
  4031 0000024C BE[3703]                	mov	SI,CNTCFLAG		; DS:SI --> Ctrl C Status byte
  4032 0000024F 30E4                    	xor	AH,AH			; Clear high byte of AX
  4033 00000251 09C0                    	or	AX,AX			; Check for subfunction 0
  4034 00000253 7504                    	jnz	short scct_2		; If not 0 jmp to next check
  4035                                  
  4036 00000255 8A14                    	mov	DL,[SI]			; Else move current ctrl C status
  4037 00000257 EB32                    	jmp	SHORT scct_9s		; into DL and jmp to exit
  4038                                  scct_2:
  4039 00000259 48                      	dec	AX			; Now dec AX and see if it was 1
  4040 0000025A 7507                    	jnz	short scct_3		; If not 0 it wasn't 1 so do next chk
  4041                                  
  4042 0000025C 80E201                  	and	DL,1			; Else mask off bit 0 of DL and
  4043 0000025F 8814                    	mov	[SI],DL			; save it as new Ctrl C status
  4044 00000261 EB28                    	jmp	SHORT scct_9s		; Jmp to exit
  4045                                  scct_3:
  4046 00000263 48                      	dec	AX			; Dec AX again to see if it was 2
  4047 00000264 7507                    	jnz	short scct_4		; If not 0 wasn't 2 so go to next chk
  4048                                  
  4049 00000266 80E201                  	and	DL,1			; Else mask off bit 0 of DL and
  4050 00000269 8614                    	xchg	[SI],DL			; Exchange DL with old status byte
  4051 0000026B EB1E                    	jmp	SHORT scct_9s		; Jump to exit (returning old status)
  4052                                  scct_4:
  4053 0000026D 3C03                    	cmp	al,3 ; 01/01/2024
  4054                                  	;cmp	AX,3 			; Test for 5 after it was dec twice
  4055 0000026F 7506                    	jne	short scct_5		; If not equal then not get boot drv
  4056 00000271 8A16[6900]              	mov	DL,[BOOTDRIVE]		; Else return boot drive in DL
  4057 00000275 EB14                    	jmp	SHORT scct_9s		; Jump to exit (returning boot drive)
  4058                                  scct_5:
  4059                                  	; 01/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
  4060 00000277 7212                    	jb	short scct_9s ; PCDOS 7.1
  4061                                  	;
  4062 00000279 3C04                    	cmp	al,4 ; 01/01/2024
  4063                                  	;cmp	AX,4 			; Test for 6 after it was dec twice
  4064                                  	;jne	short scct_9s		; If not equal then not get version
  4065 0000027B 7512                    	jne	short scct_6 ; 01/01/2024 ; PCDOS 7.1	
  4066                                  
  4067                                  	;mov	BX,(Minor_Version SHL 8) + Major_Version
  4068                                  
  4069                                  	;;mov	bx,1406h ; 6.20	; DOSCODE:4092h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  4070                                  	;;mov	bx,1606h ; 6.22	; DOSCODE:4092h (MSDOS 6.22, MSDOS.SYS)
  4071                                  
  4072                                  	;mov	bx,0A07h ; 7.10	; DOSCODE:4163h (PCDOS 7.1, IMBDOS.COM)
  4073 0000027D BB070A                  	mov	bx,(MINOR_VERSION<<8)+MAJOR_VERSION  ; true dos version
  4074                                  	
  4075                                  	;mov	dl,0			; revision 0
  4076                                  	;mov	DL,DOSREVNM ; 0
  4077                                  
  4078                                  	;xor	dh,dh			; assume vanilla DOS
  4079                                  	; 01/01/2024
  4080 00000280 BA0000                  	mov	dx,0	
  4081 00000283 3836[3812]              	cmp	byte [DosHasHMA],dh ; 0
  4082                                  	;cmp	byte [DosHasHMA],0	; is DOS in HMA?  (M021)
  4083                                  	;;je	short @F
  4084                                  	;je	short scct_6
  4085 00000287 7402                    	je	short scct_9s ; 01/01/2024	
  4086                                  	; 01/01/2024
  4087 00000289 B610                    	mov	dh,10h			; version flags bit 4
  4088                                  	;or	DH,DOSINHMA ; 10h	; 'DOS in HMA' status
  4089                                  ;@@:
  4090                                  ;scct_6:
  4091                                  ;ifdef ROMDOS
  4092                                  ;	or	DH,DOSINROM ; 08h
  4093                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
  4094                                  
  4095                                  	; 01/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1)
  4096                                  	;jmp	short short scct_9s
  4097                                  
  4098                                  	; 01/01/2024
  4099                                  ;scct_6:
  4100                                  	; ....
  4101                                  
  4102                                  scct_9s:
  4103 0000028B 5E                      	pop	SI
  4104 0000028C 58                      	pop	AX
  4105 0000028D 1F                      	pop	DS
  4106                                  scct_9f:
  4107 0000028E CF                      	iret
  4108                                  
  4109                                  	; 01/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  4110                                  scct_6:
  4111 0000028F 8026[8600]DF            	and	byte [DOS_FLAG],0DFh	; clear bit 5 of DOS flag
  4112 00000294 80FA01                  	cmp	dl, 1
  4113 00000297 75F2                    	jne	short scct_9s
  4114 00000299 800E[8600]20            	or	byte [DOS_FLAG],20h	; set bit 5 of DOS flag
  4115 0000029E EBEB                    	jmp	short scct_9s
  4116                                  
  4117                                  SetCtrlShortEntry:			; This allows a conditional entry
  4118                                  					; from main dispatch code
  4119 000002A0 EB9B                    	jmp	SHORT _$SET_CTRL_C_TRAPPING
  4120                                  
  4121                                  ; ==========================================================================
  4122                                  ;									   
  4123                                  ; The following two routines are dispatched to directly with ints disabled
  4124                                  ; immediately after the int 21h entry.	no DIS state is set.
  4125                                  ;
  4126                                  ; $Set_current_PDB takes BX and sets it to be the current process
  4127                                  ;   *** THIS FUNCTION CALL IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE!!! ***
  4128                                  ;
  4129                                  ; ==========================================================================
  4130                                  
  4131                                  _$SET_CURRENT_PDB:
  4132 000002A2 1E                      	push	DS
  4133                                  	;getdseg <DS>			; DS -> DosData, ASSUME DS:DosSeg
  4134 000002A3 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
  4135 000002A8 891E[3003]              	mov	[CurrentPDB],BX		; Set new PSP segment from caller's BX
  4136 000002AC 1F                      	pop	DS
  4137 000002AD CF                      	iret
  4138                                  
  4139                                  ; ==========================================================================
  4140                                  ;
  4141                                  ; $get_current_PDB returns in BX the current process
  4142                                  ;   *** THIS FUNCTION CALL IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE!!! ***
  4143                                  ;
  4144                                  ; ==========================================================================
  4145                                  
  4146                                  _$GET_CURRENT_PDB:
  4147 000002AE 1E                      	push	DS
  4148                                  	;getdseg <DS>			; DS -> DosData, ASSUME DS:DosSeg
  4149 000002AF 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
  4150 000002B4 8B1E[3003]              	mov	BX,[CurrentPDB]		; Return current PSP segment in BX
  4151 000002B8 1F                      	pop	DS
  4152 000002B9 CF                      	iret
  4153                                  
  4154                                  ; ==========================================================================
  4155                                  ;
  4156                                  ; Sets the Printer Flag to whatever is in AL.
  4157                                  ; NOTE: THIS PROCEDURE IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE!!!
  4158                                  ;
  4159                                  ; ==========================================================================
  4160                                  
  4161                                  _$SET_PRINTER_FLAG:
  4162 000002BA 1E                      	push	ds
  4163                                  	;getdseg <DS>			; DS -> DosData, ASSUME DS:DosSeg
  4164 000002BB 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
  4165 000002C0 A2[A00A]                	mov	[PRINTER_FLAG],AL 	; Set printer flag from caller's AL
  4166 000002C3 1F                      	pop	ds
  4167 000002C4 CF                      	iret
  4168                                  
  4169                                  ; 01/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  4170                                  ; 08/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  4171                                  ; (MSDISP.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  4172                                  
  4173                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4174                                  ; BREAK   <System call entry points and dispatcher>
  4175                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4176                                  
  4177                                  ; DOSCODE:40CCh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  4178                                  
  4179                                  ; ==========================================================================
  4180                                  ;
  4181                                  ; The Quit entry point is where all INT 20h's come from. These are old- style
  4182                                  ; exit system calls. The CS of the caller indicates which Process is dying.
  4183                                  ; The error code is presumed to be 0. We simulate an ABORT system call.
  4184                                  ;
  4185                                  ; ==========================================================================
  4186                                  
  4187                                  SYSTEM_CALL:    ; PROC NEAR
  4188                                  
  4189                                  ; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  4190                                  ; DOSCODE:40BFh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
  4191                                  
  4192                                  ;entry	QUIT				
  4193                                  QUIT:				; INT 20H entry point	
  4194                                  	;MOV	AH,0
  4195 000002C5 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah ; 08/07/2018
  4196 000002C7 EB36                    	JMP     SHORT SAVREGS
  4197                                  
  4198                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4199                                  
  4200                                  	; The system call in AH is out of the range that we know how
  4201                                  	; to handle. We arbitrarily set the contents of AL to 0 and
  4202                                  	; IRET. Note that we CANNOT set the carry flag to indicate an
  4203                                  	; error as this may break some programs compatability.
  4204                                  
  4205                                  BADCALL:
  4206                                          ;MOV	AL,0
  4207 000002C9 30C0                    	xor	al,al ; 08/07/2018
  4208                                  IRETT:	; 06/05/2019
  4209                                  _IRET:
  4210 000002CB CF                              IRET
  4211                                  
  4212                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4213                                  
  4214                                  ; 01/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  4215                                  ; DOSCODE:40D3h (MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS)
  4216                                  ; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  4217                                  ; DOSCODE:40C6h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  4218                                  
  4219                                  	; An alternative method of entering the system is to perform a
  4220                                  	; CALL 5 in the program segment prefix with the contents of CL
  4221                                  	; indicating what system call the user would like. A subset of
  4222                                  	; the possible system calls is allowed here only the
  4223                                  	; CPM-compatible calls may get dispatched.
  4224                                  
  4225                                  		; System call entry point and dispatcher
  4226                                  CALL_ENTRY:
  4227 000002CC 1E                      	push	DS
  4228                                  	;getdseg <DS>			; DS -> DosData, ASSUME DS:DosSeg
  4229 000002CD 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
  4230 000002D2 8F06[EC05]              	pop	word [SAVEDS]		; Save original DS
  4231                                  
  4232 000002D6 58                              POP     AX                      ; IP from the long call at 5
  4233 000002D7 58                              POP     AX                      ; Segment from the long call at 5
  4234 000002D8 8F06[8405]              	POP	WORD [USER_SP]		; IP from the CALL 5
  4235                                  
  4236                                  		; Re-order the stack to simulate an interrupt 21.
  4237                                  
  4238 000002DC 9C                      	PUSHF				; Start re-ordering the stack
  4239 000002DD FA                      	CLI
  4240 000002DE 50                              PUSH    AX                      ; Save segment
  4241 000002DF FF36[8405]                      PUSH	WORD [USER_SP]		; Stack now ordered as if INT had been used
  4242                                  	; 04/11/2022
  4243                                  	; DOSCODE:40EAh (MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS)
  4244                                  	; DOSCODE:40DDh (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

  4660                                  ; DOSCODE:423Fh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
  4661                                  
  4662                                  ; ==========================================================================
  4663                                  ;
  4664                                  ; Restore_World restores all registers ('cept SS:SP, CS:IP, flags) from
  4665                                  ; the stack prior to giving the user control
  4666                                  ;
  4667                                  ; ==========================================================================
  4668                                  
  4669                                  ; 01/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

  4671                                          ;procedure restore_world,NEAR
  4672                                  restore_world:
  4673                                  	;getdseg <es>		; es -> dosdata
  4674 00000441 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
  4675                                  
  4676 00000446 268F06[EE05]                    POP	WORD [ES:RESTORE_TMP]
  4677                                  
  4678 0000044B 58                              POP     AX
  4679 0000044C 5B                              POP     BX
  4680 0000044D 59                              POP     CX
  4681 0000044E 5A                              POP     DX
  4682 0000044F 5E                              POP     SI
  4683 00000450 5F                              POP     DI
  4684 00000451 5D                              POP     BP
  4685 00000452 1F                              POP     DS
  4686                                  
  4687 00000453 26FF26[EE05]                   	jmp	word [ES:RESTORE_TMP]
  4688                                  
  4689                                  ;restore_world	ENDP
  4690                                  
  4691                                  ; 01/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, MSDISP.ASM, 1991)
  4692                                  
  4693                                  ; DOSCODE:4263h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  4694                                  ; 04/11/2022
  4695                                  ; DOSCODE:4256h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
  4696

  4698                                  ;
  4699                                  ; Save_World saves complete registers on the stack
  4700                                  ;
  4701                                  ; ==========================================================================

  4712 00000462 1E                      	PUSH    DS

  4760                                  ; Set_OEM_Handler -- Set OEM sys call address and handle OEM Calls

  4763                                  ;	If CALL F8, DS:DX is new handler address

  4784                                  						; (message) request

  4793

  4801                                  
  4802                                  	; 01/05/2019

  4804                                  
  4805 0000049B B40E                    	mov	ah,0Eh
  4806                                  
  4807                                  	; Retro DOS v4.0 feature only!
  4808 0000049D 81FBA101                	cmp	bx,417  ; Signature to bypass
  4809                                  			; Retro DOS true version message

  4893                                  	;IF	IBM
  4894                                  ; Codes returned by BIOS
  4895                                  ERRIN:
  4896 000004CE 02                      	DB	2			; NO RESPONSE
  4897 000004CF 06                      	DB	6			; SEEK FAILURE
  4898 000004D0 0C                      	DB	12			; GENERAL ERROR
  4899 000004D1 04                      	DB	4			; BAD CRC
  4900 000004D2 08                      	DB	8			; SECTOR NOT FOUND
  4901 000004D3 00                      	DB	0			; WRITE ATTEMPT ON WRITE-PROTECT DISK
  4902                                  ERROUT:
  4903                                  ; DISK ERRORS RETURNED FROM INT 25 and 26
  4904 000004D4 80                      	DB	80H			; NO RESPONSE
  4905 000004D5 40                      	DB	40H			; Seek failure
  4906 000004D6 02                      	DB	2			; Address Mark not found
  4907 000004D7 10                      	DB	10H			; BAD CRC
  4908 000004D8 04                      	DB	4			; SECTOR NOT FOUND
  4909 000004D9 03                      	DB	3			; WRITE ATTEMPT TO WRITE-PROTECT DISK
  4910                                  
  4911                                  NUMERR	EQU	$-ERROUT
  4912                                  	;ENDIF

  4926                                  
  4927                                  ;   AbsSetup - setup for abs disk functions
  4928                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4929                                  
  4930                                  AbsSetup:
  4931                                  	; 02/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1, Retro DOS 5.0)
  4932                                  	;;;
  4933                                  	;
  4934 000004DA 1E                      	push	ds ; *
  4935 000004DB 16                      	push	ss
  4936 000004DC 1F                      	pop	ds
  4937                                  	;
  4938 000004DD 8826[E20A]              	mov	[absdrw_extd],ah
  4939                                  	;mov	[ss:absdrw_extd],ah	; Extended ABS Disk Read/Write flag
  4940                                  					; (AH=1 for INT 21h ax=7305h function)
  4941 000004E1 08E4                    	or	ah,ah
  4942 000004E3 7508                    	jnz	short AbsSetup1		; INT 21h AX=7305h
  4943                                  
  4944                                  	; INT 25h
  4945 000004E5 FE06[EB12]              	inc	byte [INDOS_FLAG]
  4946                                  	;inc	byte [ss:INDOS_FLAG]	; Windows DOSBOX's INDOS flag ?
  4947                                  	;;;
  4948 000004E9 FE06[2103]              	inc	byte [INDOS]
  4949                                  	;INC	byte [SS:INDOS]		; SS override
  4950                                  AbsSetup1:
  4951 000004ED FB                      	STI
  4952 000004EE FC                      	CLD
  4953                                  	; 02/01/2024
  4954                                  	;PUSH	DS
  4955                                  	;push	ss
  4956                                  	;pop	ds
  4957 000004EF E83A01                  	CALL	GETBP

  4959 000004F2 1F                      	pop	ds ; *
  4960 000004F3 7229                    	JC	short errdriv 		; PM. error drive ;AN000;
  4961

  4963                                  	;;mov	word [es:bp+1Fh]

  4968                                  ;AbsSetup_retn:
  4969                                  	;retn
  4970                                  
  4971                                  AbsSetup2:

  4973                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
  4974                                  					; SS override
  4975 000004F5 36C706[0706]0000        	MOV	word [SS:HIGH_SECTOR],0 ;>32mb	from API		;AN000;
  4976 000004FC E8BF04                  	CALL	RW32_CONVERT		;>32mb convert 32bit format to 16bit ;AN000;
  4977                                  	;jc	short AbsSetup_retn
  4978                                  	;call	SET_RQ_SC_PARMS 	;LB. set up SC parms		;AN000;
  4979                                  	; 02/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
  4980 000004FF 721D                    	jc	short errdriv
  4981                                  	;call	null_sub ; retn	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM

  4987

  4990                                  	
  4991 00000506 BE[BE03]                	MOV	SI,OPENBUF

  4995 00000513 B80003                  	MOV	AX,0300H
  4996 00000516 F8                      	CLC

  4998

  5000                                  		; (INT 2Ah - AX = 0300h)
  5001                                  		; Microsoft Networks - CHECK DIRECT I/O
  5002                                  		; DS:SI -> ASCIIZ disk device name (may be full path or
  5003                                  		;    only drive specifier--must include the colon)
  5004                                  		; Return: CF clear if absolute disk access allowed
  5005                                  
  5006 00000519 58                      	POP	AX
