  5021                                  
  5022                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5023                                  ;
  5024                                  ; Procedure Name : ABSDRD
  5025                                  ;
  5026                                  ; Interrupt 25 handler. Performs absolute disk read.
  5027                                  ; Inputs:	AL - 0-based drive number
  5028                                  ;		DS:BX point to destination buffer
  5029                                  ;		CX number of logical sectors to read
  5030                                  ;		DX starting logical sector number (0-based)
  5031                                  ; Outputs:	Original flags still on stack
  5032                                  ;		Carry set
  5033                                  ;		    AH error from BIOS
  5034                                  ;		    AL same as low byte of DI from INT 24
  5035                                  ;
  5036                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5037                                          ;procedure   ABSDRD,FAR
  5038                                  ABSDRD:
  5039                                  	; 15/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  5040                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 (DOSCODE:42E5h)
  5041                                  	; 04/11/2022
  5042                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 (DOSCODE:42D8h)
  5043                                  
  5044                                  	; 02/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
  5045                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:43C4h
  5046                                  	
  5047                                  	;;;
  5048 0000052D 30E4                    	xor     ah,ah	; ah=0		; Interrupt 25h handler (ah=0)
  5049 0000052F 31F6                    	xor     si,si	; si=0		; clear read/write mode flags
  5050                                  					; (used with INT 21h ax=7305h)
  5051                                  FAT32_ABSDRD:	; ah=1 si=0 cf=0 (jump from '_$FAT32EXT')
  5052 00000531 FA                      	cli
  5053                                  	;clc ; not necessary
  5054                                  				; INT 21h
  5055                                  				;	AX = 7305h
  5056                                  				; FAT32 - EXTENDED ABSOLUTE DISK READ/WRITE
  5057                                  				;	CX = FFFFh
  5058                                  				;	DL = drive number (01h=A:, etc.)
  5059                                  				;	SI = read/write mode flags
  5060                                  				;	DS:BX -> disk I/O packet
  5061                                  				;
  5062                                  				; Extended Absolute Disk Read/Write mode flags:
  5063                                  				;
  5064                                  				;	Bit(s)  Description
  5065                                  				;	0	direction (0=read, 1=write)
  5066                                  				;	12-1	reserved (0)
  5067                                  				;	14-13	write type (should be 00 on reads).
  5068                                  				;		00 unknown data.
  5069                                  				;		01 FAT data.
  5070                                  				;		10 directory data.
  5071                                  				;		11 file data
  5072                                  				;	15     reserved (0)
  5073                                  				;
  5074                                  				; Format of disk read/write packet:
  5075                                  				;
  5076                                  				;	Offset Size    Description
  5077                                  				;	00h    DWORD   sector number
  5078                                  				;	04h    WORD    number of sectors to r/w
  5079                                  				;	06h    DWORD   transfer address
  5080                                  				;
  5081                                  				; ref: Ralf Brown's Interrupt List
  5082                                  	;;;
  5083                                  absdrd_1:
  5084                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
  5085                                  	;CLI
  5086                                  	
  5087                                  ;	set up ds to point to DOSDATA
  5088                                  
  5089 00000532 50                      	push	ax			; preserve AX value
  5090 00000533 8CD8                    	mov	ax,ds			; store DS value in AX
  5091                                  	;getdseg <ds>
  5092 00000535 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
  5093 0000053A A3[5E0D]                	mov	[TEMPSEG],ax		; store DS value in TEMPSEG
  5094 0000053D 58                      	pop	ax			; restore AX value
  5095                                  
  5096                                  	; M072:
  5097                                  	; We shall save es on the user stack here. We need to use ES in
  5098                                  	; order to access the DOSDATA variables AbsRdWr_SS/SP at exit 
  5099                                  	; time in order to restore the user stack.
  5100                                  
  5101 0000053E 06                      	push	es  ; ****		; M072
  5102                                  
  5103                                  	; 02/01/2024 - Retrodos v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  5104                                  	;;;
  5105                                  	; 02/01/2024
  5106 0000053F 9C                      	pushf	; !*!
  5107 00000540 7300                    	jnc	short absdrd_2		; (not jumped from ABSDWRT) absolute disk read
  5108                                  	
  5109                                  	;(jumped from ABSDRWT)
  5110                                  	; 02/01/2023 ; (!*!)
  5111                                  	;or	ah,ah
  5112                                  	;stc				; absolute disk write
  5113                                  	;jmp	short absdrd_3
  5114                                  absdrd_2:
  5115 00000542 08E4                    	or	ah,ah
  5116                                  absdrd_3:
  5117 00000544 7510                    	jnz	short absdrd_4		; EXTENDED ABSOLUTE DISK READ/WRITE
  5118                                  	;;;
  5119                                  
  5120 00000546 8C16[1B06]              	MOV	[AbsRdWr_SS],SS		; M013
  5121 0000054A 8926[1D06]              	MOV	[AbsRdWr_SP],SP		; M013
  5122                                  
  5123                                  ; 	set up ss to point to DOSDATA
  5124                                  ;
  5125                                  ; NOTE! Due to an obscure bug in the 80286, you cannot use the ROMDOS
  5126                                  ; version of the getdseg macro with the SS register! An interrupt will
  5127                                  ; sneak through.
  5128                                  
  5129                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
  5130                                  	;getdseg <ss>			; cli in entry of routine
  5131                                  
  5132 0000054E 2E8E16[0700]            	mov     ss,[cs:DosDSeg]
  5133                                  
  5134                                  ;else
  5135                                  ;	mov	ds, cs:[BioDataSeg]
  5136                                  ;	assume	ds:bdata
  5137                                  ;
  5138                                  ;	mov	ss, ds:[DosDataSg]
  5139                                  ;	assume	ss:DOSDATA
  5140                                  ;
  5141                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
  5142                                  					; 02/01/2024
  5143 00000553 BC[2009]                	MOV	SP,DSKSTACK	 	;"@#IBM:12.01.2003.build_1.32#@ IBMDOS.COM(USA)"
  5144                                  					; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  5145                                  absdrd_4:
  5146                                  	; 02/01/2024
  5147 00000556 9D                      	popf	; !*!

  5163 00000565 E872FF                  	CALL	AbsSetup
  5164 00000568 723D                    	JC	short ILEAVE
  5165                                  
  5166                                  	; Here is a gross temporary fix to get around a serious design flaw in
  5167                                  	;  the secondary cache. The secondary cache does not check for media
  5168                                  	;  changed (it should). Hence, you can change disks, do an absolute
  5169                                  	;  read, and get data from the previous disk. To get around this,
  5170                                  	;  we just won't use the secondary cache for absolute disk reads.
  5171                                  	;                                                      -mw 8/5/88
  5172                                  
  5173                                  	;EnterCrit critDisk
  5174 0000056A E8910E                  	call	ECritDisk

  5183 0000057B 89F9                            mov     cx,di
  5184 0000057D 368C1E[0E06]                    mov     [ss:TEMP_VAR2],ds
  5185 00000582 36891E[0C06]                    mov     [ss:TEMP_VAR],bx
  5186                                  
  5187                                  ;       CX = # of contiguous sectors read. (These constitute a block of
  5188                                  ;            sectors, also termed an "Extent".)
  5189                                  ;       [HIGH_SECTOR]:DX = physical sector # of first sector in extent.
  5190                                  ;       [TEMP_VAR2]:[TEMP_VAR] = Transfer address (destination data address).
  5191                                  ;       ES:BP -> Drive Parameter Block (DPB).
  5192                                  ;
  5193                                  ;	The Buffer Queue must now be scanned: the contents of any dirty
  5194                                  ;	buffers must be "read" into the transfer memory block, so that the
  5195                                  ;       transfer memory reflects the most recent data.
  5196

  5198 00000587 E83235                          call	DskRdBufScan

  5272                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5273                                  ;
  5274                                  ; Procedure Name : ABSDWRT
  5275                                  ;
  5276                                  ; Interrupt 26 handler. Performs absolute disk write.
  5277                                  ; Inputs:	AL - 0-based drive number
  5278                                  ;		DS:BX point to source buffer
  5279                                  ;		CX number of logical sectors to write
  5280                                  ;		DX starting logical sector number (0-based)
  5281                                  ; Outputs:	Original flags still on stack
  5282                                  ;		Carry set
  5283                                  ;		    AH error from BIOS
  5284                                  ;		    AL same as low byte of DI from INT 24
  5285                                  ;
  5286                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5287                                          ;procedure   ABSDWRT,FAR
  5288                                  ABSDWRT:
  5289                                  	; 15/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  5290                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 (DOSCODE:436Ch)
  5291                                  	; 04/11/2022
  5292                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 (DOSCODE:435Fh)
  5293                                  
  5294                                  	; 03/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
  5295                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:4477h
  5296                                  
  5297                                  	;;;
  5298 000005DC 30E4                    	xor     ah,ah	; ah=0		; Interrupt 26h handler (ah=0)
  5299 000005DE BE0100                  	mov	si,1			; set direction flag/bit to write
  5300                                  					; (used with INT 21h ax=7305h)
  5301                                  FAT32_ABSDWRT:	; ah=1 si=1 cf=0 (jump from '_$FAT32EXT')
  5302                                  
  5303                                  				; INT 21h
  5304                                  				;	AX = 7305h
  5305                                  				; FAT32 - EXTENDED ABSOLUTE DISK READ/WRITE
  5306                                  				;	CX = FFFFh
  5307                                  				;	DL = drive number (01h=A:, etc.)
  5308                                  				;	SI = read/write mode flags
  5309                                  				;	DS:BX -> disk I/O packet
  5310                                  				;
  5311                                  				; Extended Absolute Disk Read/Write mode flags:
  5312                                  				;
  5313                                  				;	Bit(s)  Description
  5314                                  				;	0	direction (0=read, 1=write)
  5315                                  				;	12-1	reserved (0)
  5316                                  				;	14-13	write type (should be 00 on reads).
  5317                                  				;		00 unknown data.
  5318                                  				;		01 FAT data.
  5319                                  				;		10 directory data.
  5320                                  				;		11 file data
  5321                                  				;	15     reserved (0)
  5322                                  				;
  5323                                  				; Format of disk read/write packet:
  5324                                  				;
  5325                                  				;	Offset Size    Description
  5326                                  				;	00h    DWORD   sector number
  5327                                  				;	04h    WORD    number of sectors to r/w
  5328                                  				;	06h    DWORD   transfer address
  5329                                  				;
  5330                                  				; ref: Ralf Brown's Interrupt List
  5331 000005E1 3C02                    	cmp	al,2
  5332 000005E3 7220                    	jb	short absdrwt_2	; floppy disk
  5333                                  	; hard disk
  5334 000005E5 53                      	push	bx
  5335 000005E6 1E                      	push	ds
  5336 000005E7 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
  5337 000005EC 30FF                    	xor	bh,bh
  5338 000005EE 88C3                    	mov	bl,al			;
  5339                                  					; NOTE: PCDOS 7.1 kernel does not set
  5340                                  					; DOS_FLAG bit 6 or drive_flags bit 7
  5341                                  					; (It appears that these bits are set
  5342                                  					; by Windows or a system utility or
  5343                                  					; driver that knows the addresses of
  5344                                  					; these FLAGs in the DOSDATA segment.)
  5345                                  					; Erdogan Tan - 03/01/2024
  5346                                  					;
  5347 000005F0 F687[3B13]80            	test	byte [drive_flags+bx],80h 
  5348                                  					; test bit 7
  5349                                  					; (removable and/or writable disk bit?)
  5350 000005F5 7505                    	jnz	short absdwrt_1	; allowed
  5351 000005F7 F606[8600]40            	test	byte [DOS_FLAG],40h	; test bit 6 (large disk support bit?)
  5352                                  					; NOTE: Retro DOS v5 kernel must set this bit.
  5353                                  absdwrt_1:
  5354 000005FC 1F                      	pop     ds
  5355 000005FD 5B                      	pop     bx

  5357 00000600 F9                      	stc
  5358 00000601 E81AFF                  	call    errdriv		; error
  5359 00000604 CB                      	retf
  5360                                  
  5361                                  ;absdrwt_2:
  5362                                  	;;;
  5363                                  
  5364                                  ; 03/01/2024
  5365                                  %if 0
  5366                                  	CLI
  5367                                  
  5368                                  ;	set up ds to point to DOSDATA
  5369                                  
  5370                                  	push	ax
  5371                                  	mov	ax,ds
  5372                                  	;getdseg <ds>
  5373                                  	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
  5374                                  	mov	[TEMPSEG],ax
  5375                                  	pop	ax
  5376                                  
  5377                                  	; M072:
  5378                                  	; We shall save es on the user stack here. We need to use ES in
  5379                                  	; order to access the DOSDATA variables AbsRdWr_SS/SP at exit 
  5380                                  	; time in order to restore the user stack.
  5381                                  
  5382                                  	push	es ; ****		; M072
  5383                                  
  5384                                  	MOV	[AbsRdWr_SS],SS		; M013
  5385                                  	MOV	[AbsRdWr_SP],SP		; M013
  5386                                  
  5387                                  	; set up ss to point to DOSDATA
  5388                                  	;
  5389                                  	; NOTE! Due to an obscure bug in the 80286, you cannot use the 
  5390                                  	; ROMDOS version of the getdseg macro with the SS register!
  5391                                  	; An interrupt will sneak through.
  5392                                  
  5393                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
  5394                                  	;getdseg <ss>			; cli in entry of routine
  5395                                  	mov     ss,[cs:DosDSeg]
  5396                                  ;else
  5397                                  ;	mov	ds, cs:[BioDataSeg]
  5398                                  ;	assume	ds:bdata
  5399                                  ;
  5400                                  ;	mov	ss, ds:[DosDataSg]
  5401                                  ;	assume	ss:DOSDATA
  5402                                  ;
  5403                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
  5404                                  
  5405                                  	MOV	SP,DSKSTACK
  5406                                  		; we are now switched to DOS's disk stack
  5407                                  
  5408                                  	mov	ds,[TEMPSEG]		; restore user's ds
  5409                                  
  5410                                  	push	es ; *** (MSDOS 6.21)
  5411                                  
  5412                                  	call	save_world	      	; save all regs
  5413                                  
  5414                                  	PUSH	ES ; **
  5415                                  %endif
  5416                                  	; 03/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  5417                                  	;;;

  5431

  5433 00000612 E8E90D                  	call	ECritDisk
  5434 00000615 36C606[040E]FF          	MOV	byte [ss:CurSC_DRIVE],-1 ; invalidate SC ;AN000;
  5435 0000061B E8DF03                  	CALL	Fastxxx_Purge		 ; purge fatopen ;AN000;
  5436                                  	;LeaveCrit critDisk
  5437 0000061E E8F80D                  	call	LCritDisk
  5438                                  
  5439                                  ;M039
  5440                                  ;       DS:BX = transfer address (source data address).
  5441                                  ;       CX = # of contiguous sectors to write. (These constitute a block of
  5442                                  ;	     sectors, also termed an "Extent".)
  5443                                  ;       [HIGH_SECTOR]:DX = physical sector # of first sector in extent.
  5444                                  ;       ES:BP -> Drive Parameter Block (DPB).
  5445                                  ;       [CURSC_DRIVE] = -1 (invalid drive).
  5446                                  ;
  5447                                  ;       Free any buffered sectors which are in Extent; they are being over-
  5448                                  ;       written. Note that all the above registers are preserved for
  5449                                  ;       DSKWRITE.
  5450

  5452                                  	;invoke	DskWrtBufPurge          ; This trashes DS.

  5462                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5463                                  ;
  5464                                  ; Procedure Name : GETBP
  5465                                  ;
  5466                                  ; Inputs:
  5467                                  ;	AL = Logical unit number (A = 0)
  5468                                  ; Function:
  5469                                  ;	Find Drive Parameter Block
  5470                                  ; Outputs:
  5471                                  ;	ES:BP points to DPB
  5472                                  ;	[THISDPB] = ES:BP
  5473                                  ;	Carry set if unit number bad or unit is a NET device.
  5474                                  ;		Later case sets extended error error_I24_not_supported
  5475                                  ; No other registers alteredjjj
  5476                                  ;
  5477                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5478                                  
  5479                                  	; 07/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  5480                                  	; 04/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  5481                                  	; PCDOS 76.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:44C7h
  5482                                  GETBP:
  5483                                  	; 15/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  5484                                  	; 11/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  5485 0000062C 50                      	PUSH	AX
  5486 0000062D 0401                    	ADD	AL, 1		; No increment; need carry flag
  5487 0000062F 7216                    	JC	SHORT SKIPGET
  5488 00000631 E89E65                  	CALL	GETTHISDRV
  5489                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
  5490 00000634 7311                    	JNC	SHORT SKIPGET		;PM. good drive		;AN000;
  5491 00000636 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH			;DCR. ax= error code 	;AN000;
  5492 00000638 83F81A                  	CMP	AX,error_not_DOS_disk	;DCR. is unknown media ? ;AN000;
  5493 0000063B 740A                    	JZ	SHORT SKIPGET 		;DCR. yes, let it go 	;AN000;
  5494 0000063D F9                      	STC				;DCR.			;AN000;
  5495 0000063E A3[2403]                	MOV	[EXTERR],AX	;PM. invalid drive or Non DOS drive ;AN000;
  5496 00000641 C706[0C0E]0102          	MOV	WORD [AbsDskErr],201h
  5497                                  SKIPGET:
  5498 00000647 58                      	POP	AX
  5499 00000648 7212                    	JC	SHORT GETBP_RETN ; 15/12/2022
  5500                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
  5501                                  	;jnc	short getbp_t
  5502                                  	;retn
  5503                                  getbp_t:
  5504 0000064A C42E[A205]              	LES	BP,[THISCDS]

  5506 0000064E 26F6464480              	test	byte [es:bp+curdir.flags+1],curdir_isnet>>8

  5509                                  	;TEST	WORD [ES:BP+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet ; Clears carry
  5510 00000653 7408                    	JZ	SHORT GETBP_CDS
  5511                                  GETBP_err:	; 04/01/2024
  5512 00000655 C706[2403]3200          	MOV	WORD [EXTERR],error_not_supported  ; 32h
  5513 0000065B F9                      	STC
  5514                                  GETBP_RETN:
  5515 0000065C C3                      	RETN
  5516                                  
  5517                                  GETBP_CDS:
  5518                                  	;LES	BP,[ES:BP+45H]
  5519 0000065D 26C46E45                	LES	BP,[ES:BP+curdir.devptr]
  5520                                  	; 04/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  5521                                  	;;;

  5523 00000662 09E8                    	or	ax,bp

  5536                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5537                                  ;
  5538                                  ; Procedure Name : SYS_RETURN
  5539                                  ;
  5540                                  ; These are the general system call exit mechanisms. All internal system
  5541                                  ; calls will transfer (jump) to one of these at the end. Their sole purpose
  5542                                  ; is to set the user's flags and set his AX register for return.
  5543                                  ;
  5544                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5545                                  
  5546                                          ;procedure   SYS_RETURN,NEAR
  5547                                  SYS_RETURN:        
  5548                                          ;entry	SYS_RET_OK
  5549                                  SYS_RET_OK:   
  5550 00000670 E804FE                  	call    Get_User_Stack
  5551                                  		; turn off user's carry flag
  5552                                  SYS_RET_OK_clc: ; 25/06/2019 
  5553                                          ;;and	word [SI+16h],0FFFEh 
  5554                                  	;and	word [SI+user_env.user_F],~f_Carry 
  5555                                          ; 25/06/2019

  5557                                  	; 04/01/2024

  5561 00000677 8904                    	MOV	[SI],AX

  5563                                  
  5564                                          ;entry   SYS_RET_ERR
  5565                                  SYS_RET_ERR:

  5571                                  From_GetSet:

  5576                                  	; 25/06/2019

  5578 00000689 F9                      	STC			; also, signal internal error
  5579                                  	; 04/01/2024
  5580 0000068A EBEB                    	jmp	short DO_RET
  5581                                  ;DO_RET:
  5582                                  	;;MOV	[SI+user_env.user_AX],AX ; Really only sets AH
  5583                                  	;MOV	[SI],AX

  5594                                  FCB_RET_ERR:

  5601                                  	;entry	ErrorMap
  5602                                  ErrorMap:

  5944                                  ; We have received a message from Win386. There are three possible
  5945                                  ; messages we could get from Win386:
  5946                                  ;
  5947                                  ; Init 		- for this, we set the IsWin386 flag and return a pointer
  5948                                  ;		  to the Win386 startup info structure.
  5949                                  ; Exit		- for this, we clear the IsWin386 flag.

  5952                                  ;		  CX to a non-zero value.

  6514                                  ;win_nexti2f:
  6515                                  	;pop	ds
  6516                                  	;jmp	next_i2f		; go to BIOS i2f handler
  6517                                  
  6518                                  ;End WIN386 support
  6519                                  
  6520                                  ; 15/05/2019
  6521                                  
  6522                                  ;M044; Start of changes
  6523                                  ; Winoldap has a bug in that its calculations for the Windows memory image
  6524                                  ; to save is off by 1 para. This para can happen to be a Windows arena if the
  6525                                  ; DOS top of memory happens to be at an odd boundary (as is the case when
  6526                                  ; UMBs are present). This is because Windows builds its arenas only at even
  6527                                  ; para boundaries. This arena now gets trashed when Windows is swapped back
  6528                                  ; in leading to a crash. Winoldap issues callouts when it swaps Windows out
  6529                                  ; and back in. We sit on these callouts. On the Windows swapout, we save the
  6530                                  ; last para of the Windows memory block and then restore this para on the
  6531                                  ; Windows swapin callout. 
  6532                                  
  6533                                  getwinlast:
  6534                                  	; 07/12/2022
  6535 00000961 8B36[3003]              	mov	si,[CurrentPDB]
  6536 00000965 4E                      	dec	si
  6537 00000966 8EC6                    	mov	es,si
  6538 00000968 2603360300              	add	si,[es:3]
  6539 0000096D C3                      	retn
  6540                                  
  6541                                  ; 15/12/2022
  6542                                  %if 0
  6543                                  winold_swap:
  6544                                  	push	ds
  6545                                  	push	es
  6546                                  	push	si
  6547                                  	push	di
  6548                                  	push	cx
  6549                                  
  6550                                  	;getdseg <ds>			;ds = DOSDATA
  6551                                  	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
  6552                                  
  6553                                  	cmp	al,1			;swap Windows out call
  6554                                  	jne	short swapin		;no, check if Swap in call
  6555                                  	call	getwinlast
  6556                                  	push	ds
  6557                                  	pop	es
  6558                                  	mov	ds,si			;ds = memory arena of Windows
  6559                                  	xor	si,si
  6560                                  	mov	di,WinoldPatch1
  6561                                  	mov	cx,8
  6562                                  	cld
  6563                                  	push	cx
  6564                                  	rep	movsb			;save first 8 bytes
  6565                                  	pop	cx
  6566                                  	mov	di,WinoldPatch2
  6567                                  	rep	movsb			;save next 8 bytes
  6568                                  	jmp	short winold_done
  6569                                  swapin:
  6570                                  	cmp	al,2			;swap Windows in call?
  6571                                  	jne	short winold_done	;no, something else, pass it on
  6572                                  	call	getwinlast
  6573                                  	mov	es,si
  6574                                  	xor	di,di
  6575                                  	mov	si,WinoldPatch1
  6576                                  	mov	cx,8
  6577                                  	cld
  6578                                  	push	cx
  6579                                  	rep	movsb			;restore first 8 bytes
  6580                                  	pop	cx
  6581                                  	mov	si,WinoldPatch2
  6582                                  	rep	movsb			;restore next 8 bytes
  6583                                  winold_done:
  6584                                  	pop	cx
  6585                                  	pop	di
  6586                                  	pop	si
  6587                                  	pop	es
  6588                                  	pop	ds
  6589                                  	jmp	next_i2f		;chain on
  6590                                  
  6591                                  %endif
  6592                                  
  6593                                  ;M044; End of changes
  6594                                  
  6595                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
  6596                                  ; 06/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM/MSDOS.SYS)
  6597                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:4811h
  6598                                  
  6599                                  	; INT 2Fh AX=1231h

  6601                                  	; 			(Ref: Ralf Brown's Interrupt List)
  6602                                  int_2Fh_1231h:
  6603 0000096E 1E                      	push	ds

  6620

  6870                                  ; DOSCODE:47F4h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  6871                                  ; DOSCODE:47E7h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) - 05/11/2022 -
  6872                                  
  6873                                  ;SUBTTL EDIT FUNCTION ASSIGNMENTS AND HEADERS
  6874                                  
  6875                                  ; The following two tables implement the current buffered input editing
  6876                                  ; routines. The tables are pairwise associated in reverse order for ease
  6877                                  ; in indexing. That is; The first entry in ESCTAB corresponds to the last
  6878                                  ; entry in ESCFUNC, and the last entry in ESCTAB to the first entry in ESCFUNC.
  6879                                  
  6880                                  	;PUBLIC	CANCHAR
  6881                                  CANCHAR:
  6882 00000A95 1B                      	DB	CANCEL	; 1Bh	;Cancel line character
  6883                                  	
  6884                                  	;PUBLIC	ESCCHAR
  6885                                  ESCCHAR:
  6886 00000A96 00                      	DB	ESCCH	; 0	;Lead-in character for escape sequences
  6887                                  	
  6888                                  	;IF	NOT Rainbow
  6889                                  
  6890                                  ESCTAB:	; LABEL BYTE
  6891                                  
  6892                                  	;IF	IBM
  6893 00000A97 40                      	DB	64		; Ctrl-Z - F6
  6894 00000A98 4D                      	DB	77		; Copy one char - -->
  6895 00000A99 3B                      	DB	59		; Copy one char - F1
  6896 00000A9A 53                      	DB	83		; Skip one char - DEL
  6897 00000A9B 3C                      	DB	60		; Copy to char - F2
  6898 00000A9C 3E                      	DB	62		; Skip to char - F4
  6899 00000A9D 3D                      	DB	61		; Copy line - F3
  6900 00000A9E 3D                      	DB	61		; Kill line (no change to template ) - Not used
  6901 00000A9F 3F                      	DB	63		; Reedit line (new template) - F5
  6902 00000AA0 4B                      	DB	75		; Backspace - <--
  6903 00000AA1 52                      	DB	82		; Enter insert mode - INS (toggle)
  6904 00000AA2 52                      	DB	82		; Exit insert mode - INS (toggle)
  6905 00000AA3 41                      	DB	65		; Escape character - F7
  6906 00000AA4 41                      	DB	65		; End of table
  6907                                  	;ENDIF
  6908                                  
  6909                                  ESCEND: ; LABEL BYTE
  6910                                  
  6911                                  ESCTABLEN EQU ESCEND-ESCTAB
  6912                                  
  6913                                  ESCFUNC: ; LABEL WORD
  6914                                  	
  6915 00000AA5 [0815]                  	short_addr  GETCH	; Ignore the escape sequence
  6916 00000AA7 [F815]                  	short_addr  TWOESC
  6917 00000AA9 [8016]                  	short_addr  EXITINS
  6918 00000AAB [8016]                  	short_addr  ENTERINS

  6924 00000AB7 [0516]                  	short_addr  COPYSTR
  6925 00000AB9 [2816]                  	short_addr  SKIPONE
  6926 00000ABB [0A16]                  	short_addr  COPYONE

  6928 00000ABF [8816]                  	short_addr  CTRLZ

  6932                                  ; DOSMES.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  6933                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6934                                  ; DOSMES.ASM (MSDOS 2.11, 1983)
  6935                                  
  6936                                  ; OEMFunction key is expected to process a single function
  6937                                  ;   key input from a device and dispatch to the proper
  6938                                  ;   routines leaving all registers UNTOUCHED.
  6939                                  ;
  6940                                  ; Inputs:   CS, SS are DOSGROUP
  6941                                  ; Outputs:  None. This function is expected to JMP to onw of
  6942                                  ;           the following labels:
  6943                                  ;
  6944                                  ;           GetCh       - ignore the sequence
  6945                                  ;           TwoEsc      - insert an ESCChar in the buffer
  6946                                  ;           ExitIns     - toggle insert mode
  6947                                  ;           EnterIns    - toggle insert mode
  6948                                  ;           BackSp      - move backwards one space
  6949                                  ;           ReEdit      - reedit the line with a new template
  6950                                  ;           KilNew      - discard the current line and start from scratch
  6951                                  ;           CopyLin     - copy the rest of the template into the line
  6952                                  ;           SkipStr     - read the next character and skip to it in the template
  6953                                  ;           CopyStr     - read next char and copy from template to line until char
  6954                                  ;           SkipOne     - advance position in template one character
  6955                                  ;           CopyOne     - copy next character in template into line

  7004                                  ;----------------------------------------

  7138                                  ;SUBTTL DATE16, READTIME, DODATE -- GUTS OF TIME AND DATE
  7139                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------
  7140                                  ; Date16 returns the current date in AX, current time in DX
  7141                                  ;   AX - YYYYYYYMMMMDDDDD  years months days
  7142                                  ;   DX - HHHHHMMMMMMSSSSS  hours minutes seconds/2
  7143

  7145

  7147                                  ;

  7149                                  ; is DOSDATA

  7152                                  	;pop	ds

  7164 00000B79 D0E1                    	SHL	CL,1
  7165 00000B7B D1E1                    	SHL	CX,1		;Push hours and minutes to left end
  7166 00000B7D D1E1                    	SHL	CX,1
  7167 00000B7F D1E1                    	SHL	CX,1
  7168 00000B81 D0EE                    	SHR	DH,1		;Count every two seconds
  7169 00000B83 08F1                    	OR	CL,DH		;Combine seconds with hours and minutes
  7170 00000B85 89CA                    	MOV	DX,CX

  7173

  7393                                  ;**	DSUM - Compute the sum of a string of bytes
  7394                                  ;
  7395                                  ;	ENTRY	(cx) = byte count
  7396                                  ;		(ds:si) = byte address
  7397                                  ;		(dx) = sum register, initialized by caller
  7398                                  ;	EXIT	(dx) updated
  7399                                  ;	USES	ax, cx, dx, si, flags
  7400                                  
  7401                                  DSUM:
  7402 00000CAC B400                    	MOV	AH,0
  7403 00000CAE E305                    	JCXZ	DSUM9 ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7404                                  	;JCXZ	RET25 ; 18/07/2018
  7405                                  DSUM1:
  7406 00000CB0 AC                      	LODSB
  7407 00000CB1 01C2                    	ADD	DX,AX
  7408 00000CB3 E2FB                    	LOOP	DSUM1
  7409                                  DSUM9:
  7410 00000CB5 C3                      	RETN

  7412                                  ;============================================================================
  7413                                  ; GETSET.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)

  7415                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

  7417                                  
  7418                                  ; 12/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0 
  7419                                  
  7420                                  ;TITLE	GETSET - GETting and SETting MS-DOS system calls
  7421                                  ;NAME	GETSET
  7422                                  
  7423                                  ;CODE	SEGMENT BYTE PUBLIC  'CODE'
  7424                                  ;       ASSUME  SS:DOSGROUP,CS:DOSGROUP
  7425                                  
  7426                                  ;USERNUM:

  7433                                  ;;	ENDIF

  7436                                  ;; 08/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0

  7438                                  ;MSMINOR: DB	MINOR_VERSION	; DOS_MINOR_VERSION

  7440                                  ;BREAK <$Get_Version -- Return MSDOS version number>
  7441                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7442                                  
  7443                                  ; 05/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  7444                                  ; DOSCODE:4A0Fh (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  7445                                  
  7446                                  ; 06/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  7447                                  ; DOSCODE:4B5Fh (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  7448                                  
  7449                                  _$GET_VERSION:
  7450                                  
  7451                                  ; Inputs:
  7452                                  ;       None
  7453                                  ; Function:
  7454                                  ;       Return MS-DOS version number
  7455                                  ; Outputs:
  7456                                  ;       OEM number in BH
  7457                                  ;       User number in BL:CX (24 bits)
  7458                                  ;       Version number as AL.AH in binary
  7459                                  ;       NOTE: On pre 1.28 DOSs AL will be zero
  7460                                  
  7461                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
  7462                                  ;
  7463                                  ;	Fake_Count is used to lie about the version numbers to support
  7464                                  ;	old binarys. See ms_table.asm for more info.
  7465                                  ;
  7466                                  ;		if input al = 00
  7467                                  ;		  (bh) = OEM number			
  7468                                  ;		else if input al = 01
  7469                                  ;		  (bh) = version flags
  7470                                  ;		 
  7471                                  ;		       	 bits 0-2 = DOS internal revision
  7472                                  ;		       	 bits 3-7 = DOS type flags
  7473                                  ;		              bit 3    = DOS is in ROM
  7474                                  ;		              bit 4    = DOS in in HMA
  7475                                  ;		              bits 5-7 = reserved
  7476                                  ;               M007 change - only bit 3 is now valid. Other bits
  7477                                  ;               are 0 when AL = 1
  7478                                  
  7479                                  	; 06/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  7480 00000CB6 36C50E[B203]            	lds	cx, [ss:USERNUM]
  7481 00000CBB 8CDB                    	mov	bx, ds
  7482                                  
  7483                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM, offset 196Dh)
  7484                                  	;--------------------------------------
  7485                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, DOSCODE:4A1Ch)
  7486                                  
  7487 00000CBD 16                              PUSH    SS
  7488 00000CBE 1F                              POP     DS
  7489                                          
  7490                                  	; 06/01/2024
  7491                                  	;MOV	BX,[USERNUM+2]
  7492                                          ;MOV	CX,[USERNUM]
  7493                                  
  7494                                  	; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7495                                  
  7496                                  	;If AL == 1, ROMDOS will return BH = dos internal version # &
  7497                                  	;DOS flags
  7498                                  
  7499 00000CBF 3C01                    	cmp	AL,1
  7500 00000CC1 7502                    	jne	short Norm_Vers
  7501                                  
  7502                                  ;ifdef ROMDOS
  7503                                  ;	mov	BH,DOSINROM 	; Just set the bit for ROM version
  7504                                  ;				(DOSINROM = 8)
  7505                                  ;else
  7506 00000CC3 30FF                            xor     bh,bh		; Otherwise return 0
  7507                                  ;endif				;M007 end
  7508                                  
  7509                                  Norm_Vers:
  7510                                  	;MOV	AX,[MSVERS]  ; MSDOS 3.3
  7511                                  
  7512                                          	; MSDOS 6.0	; MSVERS is a label in TABLE segment	
  7513                                  	; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7514 00000CC5 1E                      	push	ds		; Get the version number from the
  7515 00000CC6 8E1E[3003]              	mov	ds,[CurrentPDB]	; current app's PSP segment
  7516                                  	;mov	ax,[40h]
  7517 00000CCA A14000                  	mov	ax,[PDB.Version] ; AX = DOS version number	
  7518                                  	; 07/12/2022
  7519 00000CCD 1F                      	pop	ds
  7520 00000CCE E8A6F7                  	call	Get_User_Stack
  7521                                  				; Put values for return registers
  7522                                  				; in the proper place on the user's	 
  7523                                  				; stack addressed by DS:SI
  7524                                  	; 06/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  7525                                  gdrvfspc_ret:
  7526                                          ;MOV	[SI+user_env.user_AX],AX
  7527 00000CD1 8904                            MOV	[SI],AX
  7528                                          ;MOV	[SI+4],CX
  7529 00000CD3 894C04                  	mov	[SI+user_env.user_CX],CX
  7530                                  set_user_bx:
  7531                                  	;MOV	[SI+2],BX
  7532 00000CD6 895C02                  	mov	[SI+user_env.user_BX],BX
  7533                                  
  7534 00000CD9 C3                      	RETN
  7535                                  
  7536                                  ; 18/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  7537                                  
  7538                                  ;BREAK <$Get/Set_Verify_on_Write - return/set verify-after-write flag>
  7539                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

  7541                                  ;**	$Get_Verify_On_Write - Get Status of Verify on write flag

  7570                                  ;BREAK <$International - return country-dependent information>
  7571                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7572                                  ;
  7573                                  ; Procedure Name : $INTERNATIONAL
  7574                                  ;
  7575                                  ; Inputs:
  7576                                  ;	MOV	AH,International
  7577                                  ;	MOV	AL,country	(al = 0 => current country)
  7578                                  ;      [MOV	BX,country]
  7579                                  ;	LDS	DX,block
  7580                                  ;	INT	21
  7581                                  ; Function:
  7582                                  ;	give users an idea of what country the application is running
  7583                                  ; Outputs:
  7584                                  ;	IF DX != -1 on input (get country)
  7585                                  ;	  AL = 0 means return current country table.
  7586                                  ;	  0<AL<0FFH means return country table for country AL
  7587                                  ;	  AL = 0FF means return country table for country BX
  7588                                  ;	  No Carry:
  7589                                  ;	     Register BX will contain the 16-bit country code.
  7590                                  ;	     Register AL will contain the low 8 bits of the country code.
  7591                                  ;	     The block pointed to by DS:DX is filled in with the information
  7592                                  ;	     for the particular country.
  7593                                  ;		BYTE  Size of this table excluding this byte and the next
  7594                                  ;		BYTE  Country code represented by this table
  7595                                  ;			A sequence of n bytes, where n is the number specified
  7596                                  ;			by the first byte above and is not > internat_block_max,
  7597                                  ;			in the correct order for being returned by the
  7598                                  ;			INTERNATIONAL call as follows:
  7599                                  ;		WORD	Date format 0=mdy, 1=dmy, 2=ymd
  7600                                  ;		5 BYTE	Currency symbol null terminated
  7601                                  ;		2 BYTE	thousands separator null terminated
  7602                                  ;		2 BYTE	Decimal point null terminated
  7603                                  ;		2 BYTE	Date separator null terminated
  7604                                  ;		2 BYTE	Time separator null terminated
  7605                                  ;		1 BYTE	Bit field.  Currency format.
  7606                                  ;			Bit 0.	=0 $ before #  =1 $ after #
  7607                                  ;			Bit 1.	no. of spaces between # and $ (0 or 1)
  7608                                  ;		1 BYTE	No. of significant decimal digits in currency
  7609                                  ;		1 BYTE	Bit field.  Time format.
  7610                                  ;			Bit 0.	=0 12 hour clock  =1 24 hour
  7611                                  ;		DWORD	Call address of case conversion routine
  7612                                  ;		2 BYTE	Data list separator null terminated.
  7613                                  ;	  Carry:
  7614                                  ;	     Register AX has the error code.
  7615                                  ;	IF DX = -1 on input (set current country)
  7616                                  ;	  AL = 0 is an error
  7617                                  ;	  0<AL<0FFH means set current country to country AL
  7618                                  ;	  AL = 0FF means set current country to country BX
  7619                                  ;	  No Carry:
  7620                                  ;	    Current country SET
  7621                                  ;	    Register AL will contain the low 8 bits of the country code.
  7622                                  ;	  Carry:
  7623                                  ;	     Register AX has the error code.
  7624                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7625                                  
  7626                                  ;procedure   $INTERNATIONAL,NEAR   ; DOS 3.3
  7627                                  
  7628                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7629                                  ; DOSCODE:4A4Dh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  7630                                  
  7631                                  ; 05/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  7632                                  ; DOSCODE:4A40h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
  7633                                  
  7634                                  ; 06/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 PCDOS.COM)
  7635                                  ; DOSCODE:4B8Dh (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
  7636                                  
  7637                                  _$INTERNATIONAL:  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3), offset 1992h
  7638                                  	 
  7639 00000CE6 3CFF                    	CMP	AL,0FFH
  7640 00000CE8 7404                    	JZ	short BX_HAS_CODE	; -1 means country code is in BX
  7641 00000CEA 88C3                    	MOV	BL,AL			; Put AL country code in BX
  7642 00000CEC 30FF                    	XOR	BH,BH

  7829                                  _$ExtCountryInfo:
  7830                                  			; INT 21h, AH = 70h
  7831                                  			; GET/SET INTERNATIONALIZATION INFORMATION
  7832                                  			; ****
  7833                                  			; AL = subfunction
  7834                                  			; 00h SET general internationalization info
  7835                                  			;    CX = buffer size (up to 38 bytes)
  7836                                  			;    DS:SI -> buffer containing internationalization info
  7837                                  			;  first three bytes are skipped, the rest is copied to
  7838                                  			;  somewhere in the DOS data segment
  7839                                  			; 01h SET extended internationalization info
  7840                                  			;    CX = number of bytes to set (up to 58 bytes)
  7841                                  			;    DS:SI -> buffer containing internationalization info
  7842                                  			; 02h GET extended internationalization info
  7843                                  			;    CX = buffer size in bytes (up to 58 bytes used)
  7844                                  			;    ES:DI -> buffer
  7845                                  			; ****
  7846                                  			; (Ref: Ralf Brown's Interrupt List) - had some mistakes -
  7847 00000D69 3C02                    	cmp	al,2 
  7848 00000D6B 77F8                    	ja	short errtn2
  7849 00000D6D 06                      	push    es
  7850 00000D6E 16                      	push    ss
  7851 00000D6F 750F                    	jnz	short ext_cntry_inf_1
  7852 00000D71 07                      	pop	es		; AX = GET 35 bytes info (from offset 3 to 37)
  7853                                  				; (38 bytes buffer is used)
  7854 00000D72 BF[C512]                	mov	di,_COUNTRY_ID
  7855 00000D75 268B45FE                	mov	ax,[es:di-2]	; NEW_COUNTRY_SIZE = 38
  7856 00000D79 BB0300                  	mov	bx,3		; skip the 1st 3 bytes of the buffer
  7857 00000D7C 01DE                    	add	si,bx
  7858 00000D7E EB13                    	jmp	short ext_cntry_inf_4
  7859

  7898                                  ;
  7899                                  ; Inputs:
  7900                                  ;	if AL >= 20H
  7901                                  ;	  AL= 20H    capitalize single char, DL= char
  7902                                  ;	      21H    capitalize string, CX= string length

  7906                                  ;		      1 = use file upper case table

  7919                                  ;	give users extended country dependent information

  8362                                  ;BREAK <$Get_Drive_Freespace -- Return bytes of free disk space on a drive>
  8363                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8364                                  ;**	$Get_Drive_Freespace - Return amount of drive free space
  8365                                  ;
  8366                                  ;	$Get_Drive_Freespace returns the # of free allocation units on a
  8367                                  ;		drive.
  8368                                  ;
  8369                                  ;	This call returns the same info in the same registers (except for the
  8370                                  ;	FAT pointer) as the old FAT pointer calls
  8371                                  ;
  8372                                  ;	ENTRY	DL = Drive number
  8373                                  ;	EXIT	AX = Sectors per allocation unit
  8374                                  ;		   = -1 if bad drive specified
  8375                                  ;		On User Stack
  8376                                  ;		    BX = Number of free allocation units
  8377                                  ;		    DX = Total Number of allocation units on disk
  8378                                  ;		    CX = Sector size
  8379                                  
  8380                                  ;procedure   $GET_DRIVE_FREESPACE,NEAR
  8381                                  
  8382                                  	; 09/01/2024
  8383                                  	; 06/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0

  8385                                  
  8386                                  _$GET_DRIVE_FREESPACE:
  8387

  8389                                  	;context DS
  8390 00000F1F 16                      	push	ss
  8391 00000F20 1F                      	pop	ds
  8392

  8394                                  	;invoke	GetThisDrv		; Get drive
  8395 00000F23 E8AC5C                  	call	GETTHISDRV
  8396                                  SET_AX_RET:
  8397 00000F26 721C                    	JC	short BADFDRV
  8398                                  	;invoke	DISK_INFO
  8399 00000F28 E8C51E                  	call	DISK_INFO
  8400                                  	; 09/01/2024
  8401                                  	;XCHG	DX,BX
  8402                                  	;;JC	short SET_AX_RET	; User FAILed to I 24
  8403                                  	; 06/01/2024
  8404 00000F2B 7217                    	jc	short BADFDRV
  8405                                  	; 09/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1)
  8406                                  gdrvfspc_1:
  8407 00000F2D 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH			; Chuck Fat ID byte
  8408                                  	;;;
  8409 00000F2F 57                      	push	di
  8410 00000F30 E80704                  	call	TestNet
  8411 00000F33 5F                      	pop	di
  8412 00000F34 7203                    	jc	short gdrvfspc_2
  8413 00000F36 E8416D                  	call    modify_cluster_count
  8414                                  			; if hw of total clusters (di) > 0
  8415                                  			; sectors per cluster and cluster counts
  8416                                  			; will be modified (shifted)
  8417                                  			; (but sectors per clust * clust count will be same)
  8418                                  			; /// disk size -calculation- limit = 2 GB ///
  8419                                  gdrvfspc_2:
  8420 00000F39 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; bx = free clusters (after xchg)
  8421                                  	;;;
  8422                                  DoSt:
  8423 00000F3B E839F5                  	call	Get_User_Stack
  8424                                  ;ASSUME	DS:NOTHING
  8425                                  	;mov	[si+6],dx
  8426                                  	;;mov	[si+4],cx
  8427                                  	;;mov	[si+2],bx
  8428                                  	; 09/01/2024
  8429 00000F3E 895406                  	MOV	[SI+user_env.user_DX],DX ; total clusters
  8430                                  	;MOV	[SI+user_env.user_CX],CX
  8431                                  	;MOV	[SI+user_env.user_BX],BX
  8432                                  	;;MOV	[SI+user_env.user_AX],AX
  8433                                  	;mov	[si],ax
  8434                                  	;;return
  8435                                  	;retn
  8436                                  	; 09/01/2024
  8437 00000F41 E98DFD                  	jmp     gdrvfspc_ret	; ax = sectors per cluster (modified)
  8438                                  
  8439                                  BADFDRV:
  8440                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
  8441                                  	;;mov	al,0Fh
  8442                                  	;mov	al,error_invalid_drive	; Assume error
  8443                                  
  8444                                  	; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  8445

  8517                                  ;BREAK <$Get/Set_Interrupt_Vector - Get/Set interrupt vectors>

  8520                                  ;**	$Get_Interrupt_Vector - Get Interrupt Vector

  8522                                  ;	$Get_Interrupt_Vector is the official way for user pgms to get the
  8523                                  ;	contents of an interrupt vector.
  8524                                  ;
  8525                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = interrupt number
  8526                                  ;	EXIT	(ES:BX) = current interrupt vector

  8528                                  _$GET_INTERRUPT_VECTOR:

  8540                                  
  8541                                  ;**	$Set_Interrupt_Vector - Set Interrupt Vector
  8542                                  ;---------------------------------------------------
  8543                                  ;	$Set_Interrupt_Vector is the official way for user pgms to set the
  8544                                  ;	contents of an interrupt vector.
  8545                                  ;
  8546                                  ;	M004, M068: Also set A20OFF_COUNT to 1 if EXECA20OFF bit has been set 
  8547                                  ;	and if A20OFF_COUNT is non-zero. See under tag M003 in inc\dossym.inc 
  8548                                  ;	for explanation.
  8549                                  ;

  8551                                  ;		(ds:dx) = desired new vector value
  8552                                  ;	EXIT	none
  8553                                  ;	USES	all
  8554                                  
  8555                                  ; 07/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  8556                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  8557                                  
  8558                                  _$SET_INTERRUPT_VECTOR:
  8559 00000F90 E81F00                  	CALL	RECSET
  8560 00000F93 FA                      	CLI				; Watch out!!!!! Folks sometimes use
  8561 00000F94 268917                  	MOV	[ES:BX],DX		;   this for hardware ints (like timer).
  8562 00000F97 268C5F02                	MOV	[ES:BX+2],DS
  8563 00000F9B FB                      	STI
  8564                                  					; M004, M068 - Start
  8565                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
  8566 00000F9C 36F606[8600]04          	test	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],EXECA20OFF ; 4
  8567                                  					; Q: was the previous call an int 21h
  8568                                  					;    exec call
  8569                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
  8570                                  	;jnz	short siv_1		; Y: go set count
  8571                                  	;retn				; N: return
  8572                                  	; 15/12/2022
  8573 00000FA2 740D                    	jz	short siv_2
  8574                                  siv_1:	
  8575 00000FA4 36803E[8500]00          	cmp	byte [ss:A20OFF_COUNT],0 ; Q: is count 0
  8576 00000FAA 7505                    	jnz	short siv_2		 ; N: done 
  8577                                  	; 20/09/2023
  8578 00000FAC 36FE06[8500]            	inc	byte [ss:A20OFF_COUNT]
  8579                                  	;mov	byte [ss:A20OFF_COUNT],1 ; Y: set it to 1 to indicate to dos
  8580                                  					 ; dispatcher to turn A20 Off before
  8581                                  					 ; returning to user.
  8582                                  siv_2:
  8583                                  	; 07/12/2022
  8584 00000FB1 C3                      	retn				; M004, M068 - End
  8585                                  	
  8586                                  RECSET:

  8590 00000FB8 D1E3                    	SHL	BX,1
  8591 00000FBA D1E3                    	SHL	BX,1

  8594                                  ;	BREAK <$Char_Oper - hack on paths, switches so that xenix can look like PCDOS>
  8595                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8596                                  
  8597                                  ;**	$Char_Oper - Manipulate Switch Character
  8598                                  ;
  8599                                  ;	This function was put in to facilitate XENIX path/switch compatibility
  8600                                  ;
  8601                                  ;	ENTRY	AL = function:
  8602                                  ;		    0 - read switch char
  8603                                  ;		    1 - set switch char (char in DL)
  8604                                  ;		    2 - read device availability
  8605                                  ;			Always returns available
  8606                                  ;		    3 - set device availability
  8607                                  ;			No longer supported (NOP)
  8608                                  ;	EXIT	(al) = 0xff iff error
  8609                                  ;		(al) != 0xff if ok
  8610                                  ;		  (dl) = character/flag, if "read switch char" subfunction
  8611                                  ;	USES	AL, DL
  8612                                  ;
  8613                                  ;	NOTE	This already obsolete function has been deactivated in DOS 5.0
  8614                                  ;		The character / is always returned for subfunction 0,
  8615                                  ;		subfunction 2 always returns -1, all other subfunctions are ignored.
  8616                                  
  8617                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  8618                                  ; DOSCODE:4CC9h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  8619                                  
  8620                                  ; 06/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  8621                                  ; DOSCODE:4CBCh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
  8622                                  
  8623                                  _$CHAR_OPER:
  8624                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
  8625 00000FBD 08C0                    	or	al,al				; get switch?
  8626 00000FBF B22F                    	mov	dl,'/'				; assume yes
  8627 00000FC1 7407                    	jz	short chop_1			; jump if yes
  8628 00000FC3 3C02                    	cmp	al,2				; check device availability?
  8629 00000FC5 B2FF                    	mov	dl,-1				; assume yes
  8630 00000FC7 7401                    	jz	short chop_1			; jump if yes
  8631 00000FC9 C3                      	retn					; otherwise just quit
  8632                                  
  8633                                  ; subfunctions requiring return of value to user come here. DL holds
  8634                                  ; value to return
  8635                                  
  8636                                  chop_1:
  8637 00000FCA E8AAF4                  	call	Get_User_Stack
  8638 00000FCD 895406                  	mov	[SI+user_env.user_DX],dx	; store value for user
  8639 00000FD0 C3                      	retn
  8640

  8642                                  	; Offset 1B87h in IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3), 1987

  8645                                  	;cmp	al,1

  8667                                  ;**	$GetExtendedError - Return Extended error code
  8668                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8669                                  ;	This function reads up the extended error info from the static
  8670                                  ;	variables where it was stored.
  8671                                  ;
  8672                                  ;	ENTRY	none
  8673                                  ;	EXIT	AX = Extended error code (0 means no extended error)
  8674                                  ;		BL = recommended action
  8675                                  ;		BH = class of error
  8676                                  ;		CH = locus of error
  8677                                  ;		ES:DI = may be pointer
  8678                                  ;	USES	ALL
  8679                                  
  8680                                  	; 06/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  8681                                  
  8682                                  _$GetExtendedError:
  8683 00000FD1 16                      	push	ss
  8684 00000FD2 1F                      	pop	ds
  8685 00000FD3 A1[2403]                	MOV	AX,[EXTERR]
  8686 00000FD6 C43E[2803]              	LES	DI,[EXTERRPT]
  8687 00000FDA 8B1E[2603]              	MOV	BX,[EXTERR_ACTION]	; BL = Action, BH = Class
  8688 00000FDE 8A2E[2303]              	MOV	CH,[EXTERR_LOCUS]
  8689 00000FE2 E892F4                  	call	Get_User_Stack
  8690                                  	;mov	[si+0Ah],di
  8691 00000FE5 897C0A                  	MOV	[SI+user_env.user_DI],DI
  8692                                  
  8693                                  	; 09/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  8694                                  	;;mov	[si+10h],es
  8695                                  	;MOV	[SI+user_env.user_ES],ES
  8696                                  	;;mov	[si+2],bx
  8697                                  	;MOV	[SI+user_env.user_BX],BX
  8698 00000FE8 E89FFF                  	call	set_user_es_bx
  8699                                  
  8700                                  	;mov	[si+4],cx
  8701 00000FEB 894C04                  	MOV	[SI+user_env.user_CX],CX
  8702                                  jmp_SYS_RET_OK:
  8703                                  	; 15/12/2022
  8704                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_OK
  8705                                  	; 25/06/2019
  8706 00000FEE E982F6                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK_clc ; 15/12/2022
  8707                                  	; 06/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
  8708                                  ;jmp_SYS_RET_OK:
  8709                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_OK

  8729                                  ;BREAK	<ECS_call - Extended Code System support function>
  8730                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8731                                  ; Inputs:
  8732                                  ;	AL = 0	get lead byte table
  8733                                  ;		on return DS:SI has the table location
  8734                                  ;
  8735                                  ;	AL = 1	set / reset interim console flag
  8736                                  ;		DL = flag (00H or 01H)
  8737                                  ;		no return
  8738                                  ;
  8739                                  ;	AL = 2	get interim console flag
  8740                                  ;		on return DL = current flag value
  8741                                  ;
  8742                                  ;	AL = OTHER then error, and returns with:
  8743                                  ;		AX = error_invalid_function
  8744                                  ;
  8745                                  ;  NOTE: THIS CALL DOES GUARANTEE THAT REGISTER OTHER THAN
  8746                                  ;	 SS:SP WILL BE PRESERVED!

  8786                                  ; System calls for parsing command lines
  8787                                  ;
  8788                                  ;   $PARSE_FILE_DESCRIPTOR
  8789                                  ;
  8790                                  ;   Modification history:
  8791                                  ;
  8792                                  ;       Created: ARR 30 March 1983
  8793                                  ;               EE PathParse 10 Sept 1983
  8794                                  ;
  8795                                  
  8796                                  ;BREAK <$Parse_File_Descriptor -- Parse an arbitrary string into an FCB>
  8797                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8798                                  ; Inputs:
  8799                                  ;       DS:SI Points to a command line
  8800                                  ;       ES:DI Points to an empty FCB
  8801                                  ;       Bit 0 of AL = 1 At most one leading separator scanned off
  8802                                  ;                   = 0 Parse stops if separator encountered
  8803                                  ;       Bit 1 of AL = 1 If drive field blank in command line - leave FCB
  8804                                  ;                   = 0  "    "    "     "         "      "  - put 0 in FCB
  8805                                  ;       Bit 2 of AL = 1 If filename field blank - leave FCB
  8806                                  ;                   = 0  "       "      "       - put blanks in FCB
  8807                                  ;       Bit 3 of AL = 1 If extension field blank - leave FCB
  8808                                  ;                   = 0  "       "      "        - put blanks in FCB
  8809                                  ; Function:
  8810                                  ;       Parse command line into FCB
  8811                                  ; Returns:
  8812                                  ;       AL = 1 if '*' or '?' in filename or extension, 0 otherwise
  8813                                  ;       DS:SI points to first character after filename
  8814                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8815                                  
  8816                                  _$PARSE_FILE_DESCRIPTOR:
  8817 0000100C E80B40                  	call	MAKEFCB
  8818 0000100F 56                      	PUSH    SI
  8819 00001010 E864F4                  	call	Get_User_Stack
  8820                                  	;pop	word [si+8]
  8821 00001013 8F4408                  	POP     word [SI+user_env.user_SI]
  8822 00001016 C3                      	retn
  8823
