  8839                                  ;**	$SLEAZEFUNC - Get a Pointer to the Media Byte
  8840                                  ;
  8841                                  ;	Return Stuff sort of like old get fat call
  8842                                  ;
  8843                                  ;	ENTRY	none
  8844                                  ;	EXIT	DS:BX = Points to FAT ID byte (IBM only)
  8845                                  ;			GOD help anyone who tries to do ANYTHING except
  8846                                  ;			READ this ONE byte.
  8847                                  ;		DX = Total Number of allocation units on disk
  8848                                  ;		CX = Sector size
  8849                                  ;		AL = Sectors per allocation unit
  8850                                  ;		   = -1 if bad drive specified
  8851                                  ;	USES	all
  8852                                  ;
  8853                                  ;**	$SLEAZEFUNCDL - Get a Pointer to the Media Byte
  8854                                  ;
  8855                                  ;	Identical to $SLEAZEFUNC except (dl) = drive
  8856                                  ;
  8857                                  ;	ENTRY	(dl) = drive (0=default, 1=A, 2=B, etc.)
  8858                                  ;	EXIT	DS:BX = Points to FAT ID byte (IBM only)
  8859                                  ;			GOD help anyone who tries to do ANYTHING except
  8860                                  ;			READ this ONE byte.
  8861                                  ;		DX = Total Number of allocation units on disk
  8862                                  ;		CX = Sector size
  8863                                  ;		AL = Sectors per allocation unit
  8864                                  ;		   = -1 if bad drive specified
  8865                                  ;	USES	all
  8866                                  ;
  8867                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

  9021                                  ;**	$Disk_Reset - Flush out Dirty Buffers
  9022                                  ;
  9023                                  ;	$DiskReset flushes and invalidates all buffers.  BUGBUG - do
  9024                                  ;		we really invalidate?  SHould we?  THis screws non-removable
  9025                                  ;		caching.  Maybe CHKDSK relies upon it, though....

  9028                                  ;	EXIT	none
  9029                                  ;	USES	all
  9030                                  ;
  9031                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

  9033

  9035                                  	; DOSCODE:4D94h

  9037                                  	; 15/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9038 0000108B B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh	; -1
  9039 0000108D 16                      	push	ss
  9040 0000108E 1F                      	pop	ds
  9041                                  	; 06/11/2022
  9042                                  	;MOV	AL,-1
  9043 0000108F E86C03                  	call	ECritDisk
  9044                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
  9045                                  	;;or	word [DOS34_FLAG],4
  9046                                  	;or	word [DOS34_FLAG],FROM_DISK_RESET    ;AN000;
  9047 00001092 800E[1106]04            	or	byte [DOS34_FLAG],FROM_DISK_RESET ; 4 ; 15/05/2019
  9048 00001097 E8EE4A                  	call	FLUSHBUF
  9049                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
  9050                                  	;and	word [DOS34_FLAG],0FFFBh
  9051                                  	; 06/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
  9052                                  	;and	word [DOS34_FLAG],NO_FROM_DISK_RESET ;AN000;
  9053                                  	; 15/12/2022
  9054 0000109A 8026[1106]FB            	and	byte [DOS34_FLAG],NO_FROM_DISK_RESET ; 0FBh ; 15/05/2019
  9055 0000109F C706[090E]0000          	mov	word [SC_STATUS],0	; Throw out secondary cache M041
  9056                                  ;
  9057                                  ; We will "ignore" any errors on the flush, and go ahead and invalidate.  This
  9058                                  ; call doesn't return any errors and it is supposed to FORCE a known state, so
  9059                                  ; let's do it.
  9060                                  ;
  9061                                  ; Invalidate 'last-buffer' used
  9062                                  ;
  9063 000010A5 BBFFFF                  	MOV	BX,-1 ; 0FFFFh	
  9064 000010A8 891E[2000]              	MOV	[LastBuffer+2],BX
  9065 000010AC 891E[1E00]              	MOV	[LastBuffer],BX
  9066                                  
  9067                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 
  9068                                  	; IBMDOS.COM, Offset 1C66h
  9069                                  	;;;;
  9070                                  	;lds	si,[BUFFHEAD]
  9071                                  	;mov	ax,20FFh	; .buf_ID,    AL = FFh (Free buffer)
  9072                                  				; .buf_flags, AH = 0, reset/clear

  9075                                  	;mov	[si+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],ax
  9076                                  	;lds	si,[SI]

  9078                                  	;je	short DRST_2
  9079                                  	;;mov	[si+4],ax
  9080                                  	;mov	[si+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],ax
  9081                                  	;lds	si,[SI]
  9082                                  	;cmp	si,bx
  9083                                  	;jne	short DRST_1
  9084                                  	;;;;
  9085                                  ;DRST_2:
  9086 000010B0 E86603                  	call	LCritDisk

  9090                                  	;CallInstall NetFlushBuf,MultNET,32,AX,AX

  9094                                  			; DS = DOS CS

  9103                                  ;	BREAK <$SetDPB - Create a valid DPB from a user-specified BPB>

  9105                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9106                                  ;
  9107                                  ;**	$SetDPB - Create a DPB
  9108                                  ;
  9109                                  ;	SetDPB Creates a valid DPB from a user-specified BPB
  9110                                  ;
  9111                                  ;	ENTRY	ES:BP Points to DPB
  9112                                  ;		DS:SI Points to BPB
  9113                                  ;	EXIT	DPB setup
  9114                                  ;	USES	ALL but BP, DS, ES
  9115                                  ;
  9116                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9117                                  ;
  9118                                  
  9119                                  ; 10/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9120                                  
  9121                                  ; DOSCODE:4DD6h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  9122                                  
  9123                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
  9124 000010BE 0300                    word3:	dw	3			; M008 -- word value for divides
  9125                                  
  9126                                  ; 06/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

  9134 000010C5 AD                      	LODSW

  9144

  9154 000010DA 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH
  9155                                  LOG2LOOP:
  9156 000010DC A801                    	test	AL,1
  9157 000010DE 7506                    	JNZ	short SAVLOG
  9158 000010E0 FEC4                    	INC	AH
  9159 000010E2 D0E8                    	SHR	AL,1
  9160 000010E4 EBF6                    	JMP	SHORT LOG2LOOP

  9164 000010E9 88C3                    	MOV	BL,AL

  9166 000010EC AC                      	LODSB

  9168                                  ;	OR	AL,AL			; NONFAT ?				;AN000;
  9169                                  ;	JZ	short setend		; yes, don't do anything                ;AN000;

  9173 000010F2 B105                    	MOV	CL,5

  9178 000010FB 31D2                    	XOR	DX,DX

  9181 00001101 47                      	INC	DI
  9182 00001102 47                      	INC	DI			; Skip dpb_first_sector
  9183 00001103 A5                      	MOVSW			; Total number of sectors in DSKSIZ (temp as dpb_max_cluster)

  9188                                  	
  9189                                  	;;;
  9190                                  	;MSDOS 3.3

  9257                                  	; 15/12/2022

  9259                                  	; BX = number of data sectors

  9263                                  ;	M008 - CAS
  9264                                  ;
  9265                                  	; 15/12/2022
  9266 00001144 43                      	inc	bx
  9267                                  	;INC	AX			; +2 (reserved), -1 (count -> max)
  9268                                  ;
  9269                                  ;	There has been a bug in our fatsize calculation for so long
  9270                                  ;	  that we can't correct it now without causing some user to
  9271                                  ;	  experience data loss. There are even cases where allowing
  9272                                  ;	  the number of clusters to exceed the fats is the optimal
  9273                                  ;	  case -- where adding 2 more fat sectors would make the
  9274                                  ;	  data field smaller so that there's nothing to use the extra
  9275                                  ;	  fat sectors for.
  9276                                  ;
  9277                                  ;	Note that this bug had very minor known symptoms. CHKDSK would
  9278                                  ;	  still report that there was a cluster left when the disk was
  9279                                  ;	  actually full. Very graceful failure for a corrupt system
  9280                                  ;	  configuration. There may be worse cases that were never
  9281                                  ;	  properly traced back to this bug. The problem cases only
  9282                                  ;	  occurred when partition sizes were very near FAT sector
  9283                                  ;	  rounding boundaries, which were rare cases.
  9284                                  ;
  9285                                  ;	Also, it's possible that some third-party partition program might
  9286                                  ;	  create a partition that had a less-than-perfect FAT calculation
  9287                                  ;	  scheme. In this hypothetical case, the number of allocation
  9288                                  ;	  clusters which don't actually have FAT entries to represent
  9289                                  ;	  them might be larger and might create a more catastrophic
  9290                                  ;	  failure. So we'll provide the safeguard of limiting the
  9291                                  ;	  max_cluster to the amount that will fit in the FATs.
  9292                                  ;
  9293                                  ;	ax = maximum legal cluster, ES:BP -> dpb
  9294                                  
  9295                                  ;	make sure the number of fat sectors is actually enough to
  9296                                  ;	  hold that many clusters. otherwise, back the number of
  9297                                  ;	  clusters down
  9298                                  
  9299                                  	; 15/12/2022
  9300                                  	; bx = number of clusters
  9301                                  
  9302                                  	; 19/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  9303                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
  9304                                  	; 15/12/2022
  9305                                  	;mov	bx,ax			; remember calculated # clusters
  9306                                  
  9307                                  	; 01/08/2018 (MSDOS 3.3)
  9308                                  	;mov	al,[ES:BP+DPB.FAT_SIZE]
  9309                                  	;xor	ah,ah 
  9310                                  
  9311                                  	; 10/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9312                                  	;mov	ax,[ES:BP+0Fh]
  9313 00001145 268B460F                	mov	ax,[ES:BP+DPB.FAT_SIZE]
  9314                                  
  9315                                  	;mul	word [es:bp+2]	
  9316 00001149 26F76602                	mul	word [ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE] ; how big is the FAT?
  9317 0000114D 81FBF60F                	cmp	bx,4096-10  ; 0FF6h	; test for 12 vs. 16 bit fat
  9318 00001151 720D                    	jb	short setend_fat12
  9319 00001153 D1EA                    	shr	dx,1
  9320                                  
  9321                                  ; 06/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
  9322                                  	; 15/12/2022
  9323                                  ;cs3 7/2/92
  9324 00001155 751C                    	jnz	short setend_faterr	; some bonehead gave us more fatspace
  9325                                  					; than enough for the maximum FAT,
  9326                                  					; so go ahead and use the calculated
  9327                                  					; number of clusters.
  9328                                  ;cs3 7/2/92
  9329                                  
  9330 00001157 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1			; find number of entries
  9331 00001159 3DF70F                  	cmp	ax,4096-10+1		; would this truncation move us
  9332                                  ;					;  into 12-bit fatland?
  9333 0000115C 7215                    	jb	short setend_faterr	; then go ahead and let the
  9334                                  ;					;  inconsistency pass through
  9335                                  ;					;  rather than lose data by
  9336                                  ;					;  correcting the fat type
  9337 0000115E EB0E                    	jmp	short setend_fat16
  9338                                  
  9339                                  setend_fat12:
  9340 00001160 01C0                    	add	ax,ax			; (fatsiz*2)/3 = # of fat entries
  9341 00001162 11D2                    	adc	dx,dx
  9342                                  
  9343                                  ; 06/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
  9344                                  ;cs3 7/2/92
  9345                                  	; 15/12/2022
  9346 00001164 83FA03                  	cmp	dx,3			; if our fatspace is WAY more than
  9347 00001167 730A                    	jnb	short setend_faterr	; we need, we may get an overflow
  9348                                  					; here. Check for it and use
  9349                                  					; the calculated size in this case.
  9350                                  ;cs3 7/2/92
  9351                                  
  9352 00001169 2EF736[BE10]            	div	word [cs:word3]
  9353                                  
  9354                                  setend_fat16:
  9355 0000116E 48                      	dec	ax			; limit at 1
  9356 0000116F 39D8                    	cmp	ax,bx			; is fat big enough?
  9357 00001171 7602                    	jbe	short setend_fat	; use max value that'll fit
  9358

  9360 00001173 89D8                    	mov	ax,bx			; use calculated value
  9361                                  
  9362                                  setend_fat:
  9363                                  
  9364                                  ;	now ax = maximum legal cluster
  9365                                  
  9366                                  ;	end M008
  9367                                  
  9368                                  	;mov	[es:bp+0Dh], ax
  9369 00001175 2689460D                	MOV	[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],AX
  9370                                  	;;mov	word [es:bp+1Ch],0  ; MSDOS 3.3
  9371                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Dh],0  ; MSDOS 6.0

  9598                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9599                                  ; Inputs:
  9600                                  ;	AX = Size of memory in paragraphs
  9601                                  ;	DX = Segment
  9602                                  ; Function:
  9603                                  ;	Completely prepares a program base at the
  9604                                  ;	specified segment.
  9605                                  ; Called at DOS init
  9606                                  ; Outputs:
  9607                                  ;	DS = DX
  9608                                  ;	ES = DX
  9609                                  ;	[0] has INT int_abort
  9610                                  ;	[2] = First unavailable segment
  9611                                  ;	[5] to [9] form a long call to the entry point
  9612                                  ;	[10] to [13] have exit address (from int_terminate)
  9613                                  ;	[14] to [17] have ctrl-C exit address (from int_ctrl_c)
  9614                                  ;	[18] to [21] have fatal error address (from int_fatal_abort)
  9615                                  ; DX,BP unchanged. All other registers destroyed.
  9616                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9617                                  
  9618                                  SETMEM:
  9619                                  	;XOR	CX,CX
  9620                                  	; 17/12/2022
  9621                                  	; cx = 0

  9623 0000120F 8EC2                    	MOV	ES,DX
  9624                                  	;mov	si,88h
  9625 00001211 BE8800                  	MOV	SI,addr_int_terminate

  9631 00001219 F3A5                    	REP	MOVSW
  9632 0000121B 26A30200                	MOV	[ES:2],AX
  9633 0000121F 29D0                    	SUB	AX,DX
  9634 00001221 3DFF0F                  	CMP	AX,MAXDIF ; 0FFFh
  9635 00001224 7603                    	JBE	short HAVDIF
  9636 00001226 B8FF0F                  	MOV	AX,MAXDIF
  9637                                  HAVDIF:
  9638 00001229 83E810                  	SUB	AX,10h			; Allow for 100h byte "stack"
  9639 0000122C BB0C00                  	MOV	BX,ENTRYPOINTSEG ; 0Ch	;	in .COM files
  9640 0000122F 29C3                    	SUB	BX,AX
  9641 00001231 B104                    	MOV	CL,4
  9642 00001233 D3E0                    	SHL	AX,CL
  9643 00001235 8EDA                    	MOV	DS,DX
  9644                                  
  9645                                  	; (MSDOS 6.0 note)
  9646                                  	;
  9647                                  	; The address in BX:AX will be F01D:FEF0 if there is 64K or more 
  9648                                  	; memory in the system. This is equivalent to 0:c0 if A20 is OFF.
  9649                                  	; If DOS is in HMA this equivalence is no longer valid as A20 is ON.
  9650                                  	; But the BIOS which now resides in FFFF:30 has 5 bytes in FFFF:D0
  9651                                  	; (F01D:FEF0) which is the same as the ones in 0:C0, thereby 
  9652                                  	; making this equvalence valid for this particular case. If however
  9653                                  	; there is less than 64K remaining the address in BX:AX will not 
  9654                                  	; be the same as above. We will then stuff 0:c0, the call 5 address
  9655                                  	; into the PSP.
  9656                                  	;
  9657                                  	; Therefore for the case where there is less than 64K remaining in 
  9658                                  	; the system old CPM Apps that look at PSP:6 to determine memory
  9659                                  	; requirements will not work. Call 5, however will continue to work
  9660                                  	; for all cases.
  9661                                  	;
  9662                                  
  9663                                  	;mov	[6],ax
  9664                                  	;mov	[8],bx
  9665                                  
  9666 00001237 A30600                  	MOV	[PDB.CPM_CALL+1],AX
  9667 0000123A 891E0800                	MOV	[PDB.CPM_CALL+3],BX
  9668                                  
  9669                                  	; 06/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9670 0000123E 3DF0FE                  	cmp	ax,WRAPOFFSET ; 0FEF0h	; Q: does the system have >= 64k of
  9671                                  					;    memory left
  9672 00001241 740C                    	je	short addr_ok		; Y: the above calculated address is
  9673                                  					;    OK
  9674                                  					; N: 
  9675                                  
  9676 00001243 C7060600C000            	MOV	WORD [PDB.CPM_CALL+1],0C0h
  9677 00001249 C70608000000            	MOV	WORD [PDB.CPM_CALL+3],0
  9678                                  addr_ok:
  9679                                  	;mov	word [0],20CDh
  9680 0000124F C7060000CD20            	MOV	word [PDB.EXIT_CALL],(int_abort*256) + mi_INT
  9681                                  	;mov	byte [5],9Ah
  9682 00001255 C60605009A              	MOV	BYTE [PDB.CPM_CALL],mi_Long_CALL
  9683                                  	;mov	word [50h],21CDh

  9694                                  ; The server runs several PDB's without creating them VIA EXEC.  We need to
  9695                                  ; enumerate all PDB's at CPS time in order to find all references to a
  9696                                  ; particular SFT.  We perform this by requiring that the server link together

  9771                                  ; Break <STRCMP - compare two ASCIZ strings DS:SI to ES:DI>
  9772                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9773                                  ;
  9774                                  ;   Strcmp - compare ASCIZ DS:SI to ES:DI. Case INSENSITIVE. '/' = '\'
  9775                                  ;	     Strings of different lengths don't match.
  9776                                  ;   Inputs:  DS:SI - pointer to source string  ES:DI - pointer to dest string
  9777                                  ;   Outputs: Z if strings same, NZ if different
  9778                                  ;   Registers modified: NONE

  9781                                  	; 07/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

  9784 000012A1 57                      	push	di
  9785 000012A2 50                      	push	ax
  9786                                  
  9787                                  Cmplp:

  9789 000012A4 E8AC3E                  	call	UCase			; convert to upper case
  9790 000012A7 E8FE3E                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; convert '/' to '\' ; 07/12/2022 ('\')
  9791 000012AA 88C4                    	MOV	AH,AL
  9792 000012AC 268A05                  	MOV	AL,[ES:DI]
  9793 000012AF 47                      	INC	DI
  9794 000012B0 E8A03E                  	call	UCase			; convert to upper case
  9795 000012B3 E8F23E                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; convert '/' to '\' ; 07/12/2022 ('\')
  9796 000012B6 38C4                    	CMP	AH,AL
  9797 000012B8 7504                    	JNZ	short PopRet		; Strings dif
  9798                                  
  9799 000012BA 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
  9800 000012BC 75E5                    	JNZ	short Cmplp		; More string
  9801                                  PopRet:
  9802 000012BE 58                      	pop	ax
  9803 000012BF 5F                      	pop	di
  9804 000012C0 5E                      	pop	si
  9805 000012C1 C3                      	retn

  9947                                  ;Break	<TableDispatch - dispatch to a table>
  9948                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9949                                  ;
  9950                                  ;   TableDispatch - given a table and an index, jmp to the approptiate
  9951                                  ;   routine. Preserve all input registers to the routine.
  9952                                  ;
  9953                                  ;   Inputs:	Push	return address
  9954                                  ;		Push	Table address

  9956                                  ;   Outputs:	appropriate routine gets jumped to.
  9957                                  ;		return indicates invalid index
  9958                                  ;   Registers modified: none.

  9965 00000005 ??                      .Pad:	 resb 1  ; 5  
  9966 00000006 ????                    .Tab:	 resw 1  ; 6

 10297                                  ;MSG_RETRIEVAL:
 10298                                  
 10299                                  ;;	NOTE:  This function lives in command.com resident code now.
 10300                                  ;;	If the int 2F ever gets this far, we'll return registers
 10301                                  ;;	unchanged, which produces the same result as before, if
 10302                                  ;;	command.com wasn't present (and therefore no messages available).
 10303                                  ;;
 10304                                  ;;	I didn't point the entry in the 2F table to No_Op because
 10305                                  ;;	No_Op zeroes AL.
 10306                                  ;;
 10307                                  ;;;hkn; set up ds to point to DOSDATA
 10308                                  ;;	push	ds
 10309                                  ;;	getdseg	<ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 10310                                  ;;
 10311                                  ;;	PUSH	AX		    ;AN000;;MS. save regs
 10312                                  ;;	PUSH	SI		    ;AN000;;MS. save regs
 10313                                  ;;	MOV	AX,DX		    ;AN000;;MS.
 10314                                  ;;	MOV	SI,OFFSET DOSDATA:MSG_EXTERROR ;AN000;;MS.
 10315                                  ;;	test	AL,1		    ;AN000;;MS. get ?
 10316                                  ;;	JZ	toget		    ;AN000;;MS. yes
 10317                                  ;;	DEC	AL		    ;AN000;;MS.
 10318                                  ;;toget:				    ;AN000;
 10319                                  ;;	SHL	AL,1		    ;AN000;;MS. times 2
 10320                                  ;;	XOR	AH,AH		    ;AN000;;MS.
 10321                                  ;;	ADD	SI,AX		    ;AN000;;MS. position to the entry
 10322                                  ;;	test	DL,1		    ;AN000;;MS. get ?
 10323                                  ;;	JZ	getget			     ;AN000;;MS. yes
 10324                                  ;;	MOV	WORD PTR DS:[SI],DI    ;AN000;;MS. set MSG
 10325                                  ;;	MOV	WORD PTR DS:[SI+2],ES  ;AN000;;MS. address to ES:DI
 10326                                  ;;	JMP	SHORT MSGret		     ;AN000;;MS. exit
 10327                                  ;;getget: 				     ;AN000;
 10328                                  ;;	LES	DI,DWORD PTR DS:[SI]	     ;AN000;;MS. get msg addr
 10329                                  ;;MSGret: 				     ;AN000;
 10330                                  ;;	POP	SI			     ;AN000;;MS.
 10331                                  ;;	POP	AX			     ;AN000;;MS.
 10332                                  ;;
 10333                                  ;;	pop	ds
 10334                                  
 10335                                  ;	return				     ;AN000;;MS. exit

 10396                                  ;============================================================================
 10397                                  ; CRIT.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 10398                                  ;============================================================================
 10399                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10400                                  
 10401                                  ; Critical Section Routines
 10402                                  
 10403                                  ; MSDOS 6.21 - MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:513Ah
 10404                                  
 10405                                  ; 06/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 10406                                  ; DOSCODE:5126h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 10407                                  
 10408                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10409                                  ; Each handler must leave everything untouched; including flags!
 10410                                  ;
 10411                                  ; Sleaze for time savings:  first instruction is a return. This is patched
 10412                                  ; by the sharer to be a PUSH AX to complete the correct routines.
 10413                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10414                                  
 10415                                  ; (DOSMAC.INC, MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 10416                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10417                                  ; Some old versions of the 80286 have a bug in the chip. The popf instruction
 10418                                  ; will enable interrupts. Therefore in a section of code with interrupts
 10419                                  ; disabled and you need a popf instruction use the 'popff' macro instead.
 10420                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10421                                  
 10422                                  ;%macro POPFF 0
 10423                                  ;	jmp	$+3
 10424                                  ;	iret
 10425                                  ;	push	cs
 10426                                  ;	call	$-2
 10427                                  ;%endmacro
 10428                                  
 10429                                  ; ---------------------------
 10430                                  
 10431                                  ;Procedure  ECritDisk,NEAR
 10432                                  	;public  ECritMEM
 10433                                  	;public  ECritSFT
 10434                                  ECritMEM:
 10435                                  ECritSFT:
 10436                                  ;
 10437                                  ECritDisk:
 10438                                  
 10439                                  ;SR; Check if critical section is to be entered
 10440                                  
 10441 000013FE 9C                      	pushf
 10442 000013FF 36803E[600D]00          	cmp	byte [ss:redir_patch],0
 10443 00001405 740D                    	jz	short ECritDisk_2
 10444                                  
 10445                                  ; 06/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 10446                                  ;	;popff  ; * (macro)
 10447                                  ;	jmp	short ECritDisk_1 ; *
 10448                                  ;
 10449                                  ;ECritDisk_iret: ; *
 10450                                  ;	iret ; *
 10451                                  
 10452                                  	; 16/12/2022
 10453                                  	; 13/11/2022
 10454                                  	;jmp	short ECritDisk_1
 10455                                  	; 06/11/2022
 10456                                  ;ECritDisk_iret:
 10457                                  ;	iret	
 10458

 10624                                  	;jmp	short ECritDevice_3
 10625                                  ;ECritDevice_iret2:
 10626                                  	;iret
 10627                                  
 10628                                  ECritDevice_3:
 10629 00001449 0E                      	push    cs ; *
 10630                                  	; 13/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 10631                                  	;call	ECritDevice_iret2 ; *
 10632                                  	;retn
 10633                                  	; 16/12/2022
 10634 0000144A E8FBFF                  	call	ECritDevice_iret
 10635 0000144D C3                      	retn
 10636                                  
 10637                                  ;EndProc ECritDevice
 10638                                  
 10639                                  ; ---------------------------
 10640                                  
 10641                                  ;Procedure   LCritDevice,NEAR
 10642                                  
 10643                                  LCritDevice:
 10644                                  
 10645                                  ;SR; Check if critical section is to be entered
 10646                                  
 10647 0000144E 9C                      	pushf
 10648 0000144F 36803E[600D]00          	cmp	byte [ss:redir_patch],0
 10649 00001455 740C                    	jz	short LCritDevice_2
 10650                                  	;popff  ; * (macro)
 10651                                  ;	jmp	short LCritDevice_1 ; *
 10652                                  ;
 10653                                  ;LCritDevice_iret: ; *
 10654                                  ;	iret ; *
 10655                                  
 10656                                  	; 16/12/2022
 10657                                  	; 13/11/2022
 10658                                  	;jmp	short LCritDevice_1
 10659                                  ;LCritDevice_iret:
 10660                                  	;iret
 10661                                  
 10662                                  LCritDevice_1:
 10663 00001457 0E                      	push	cs ; *
 10664 00001458 E8EDFF                  	call	LCritDevice_iret ; *		
 10665                                  	
 10666                                  LCritDevice_0:
 10667 0000145B 50                      	PUSH	AX
 10668                                  	;MOV	AX,8100h+critDevice
 10669                                  	;INT	int_IBM
 10670 0000145C B80281                  	mov	ax,8102h
 10671 0000145F CD2A                    	int	2Ah	; Microsoft Networks - END DOS CRITICAL SECTION
 10672                                  			; AL = critical section number (00h-0Fh)
 10673 00001461 58                      	POP     AX
 10674 00001462 C3                      	retn
 10675                                  
 10676                                  ;LCritDevice_iret:  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 
 10677                                  ;	iret
 10678                                  
 10679                                  LCritDevice_2:
 10680                                  	;;popff ; *
 10681                                  	;;retn
 10682                                  ;	jmp	short LCritDevice_3 ; *
 10683                                  ;LCritDevice_iret2: ; *
 10684                                  ;	iret
 10685                                  
 10686                                  	; 16/12/2022
 10687                                  	; 13/11/2022
 10688                                  	;jmp	short LCritDevice_3
 10689                                  ;LCritDevice_iret2:
 10690                                  	;iret
 10691                                  
 10692                                  LCritDevice_3:
 10693 00001463 0E                      	push    cs ; *
 10694                                  	; 13/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 10695                                  	;call	LCritDevice_iret2 ; *
 10696                                  	;retn
 10697                                  	; 16/12/2022
 10698 00001464 E8E1FF                  	call	LCritDevice_iret
 10699 00001467 C3                      	retn
 10700                                  
 10701                                  ;EndProc LCritDevice

 10759                                  ;
 10760                                  ; NOTE for Retro DOS v2.0 :  (ERDOGAN TAN - 13/03/2018)

 10762                                  ;	  INSTEAD of IO.ASM, I have disassembled IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 2.0)

 10775                                  
 10776                                  ;============================================================================
 10777                                  ; CPMIO.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 10778                                  ;============================================================================
 10779                                  ; Retro DOS v4.0 by Erdogan Tan, 04/05/2019
 10780                                  
 10781                                  	; 08/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 10782                                  
 10783                                  ;**	Standard device IO for MSDOS (first 12 function calls)
 10784                                  ;
 10785                                  ;	TITLE	IBMCPMIO - device IO for MSDOS
 10786                                  ;	NAME	IBMCPMIO
 10787                                  
 10788                                  ;	Old style CP/M 1-12 system calls to talk to reserved devices
 10789                                  ;
 10790                                  ;	$Std_Con_Input_No_Echo
 10791                                  ;	$Std_Con_String_Output
 10792                                  ;	$Std_Con_String_Input
 10793                                  ;	$RawConIO
 10794                                  ;	$RawConInput
 10795                                  ;	RAWOUT
 10796                                  ;	RAWOUT2
 10797                                  ;
 10798                                  
 10799                                  ; The following routines form the console I/O group (funcs 1,2,6,7,8,9,10,11).
 10800                                  ; They assume ES and DS NOTHING, while not strictly correct, this forces data
 10801                                  ; references to be SS or CS relative which is desired.
 10802                                  
 10803                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10804                                  
 10805                                  ;	TITLE	CPMIO2 - device IO for MSDOS
 10806                                  ;	NAME	CPMIO2
 10807                                  
 10808                                  ;
 10809                                  ;	Microsoft Confidential
 10810                                  ;	Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation 1991
 10811                                  ;	All Rights Reserved.
 10812                                  ;
 10813                                  
 10814                                  ;**	Old style CP/M 1-12 system calls to talk to reserved devices
 10815                                  ;
 10816                                  ;	$Std_Con_Input
 10817                                  ;	$Std_Con_Output
 10818                                  ;	OUTT
 10819                                  ;	TAB
 10820                                  ;	BUFOUT
 10821                                  ;	$Std_Aux_Input
 10822                                  ;	$Std_Aux_Output
 10823                                  ;	$Std_Printer_Output
 10824                                  ;	$Std_Con_Input_Status
 10825                                  ;	$Std_Con_Input_Flush
 10826                                  ;
 10827                                  ;	Revision History:
 10828                                  ;
 10829                                  ;	  AN000	 version 4.00 - Jan. 1988
 10830                                  
 10831                                  ; The following routines form the console I/O group (funcs 1,2,6,7,8,9,10,11).
 10832                                  ; They assume ES and DS NOTHING, while not strictly correct, this forces data
 10833                                  ; references to be SS or CS relative which is desired.
 10834                                  
 10835                                  ;DOSCODE SEGMENT
 10836                                  ;	ASSUME	SS:DOSDATA,CS:DOSCODE
 10837                                  
 10838                                  
 10839                                  ;hkn; 	All the variables use SS override or DS. Therefore there is
 10840                                  ;hkn;	no need to specifically set up any seg regs unless SS assumption is
 10841                                  ;hkn;	not valid. 
 10842                                  
 10843                                  ; DOSCODE:51BAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 10844                                  ; 08/11/2022
 10845                                  ; DOSCODE:51A6h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 10846                                  
 10847                                  ;
 10848                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10849                                  ;
 10850                                  ; Procedure : $Std_Con_Input_No_Echo
 10851                                  ;
 10852                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10853                                  ;
 10854                                  
 10855                                  _$STD_CON_INPUT_NO_ECHO:   ;System call 8
 10856                                  
 10857                                  ; Inputs:
 10858                                  ;	None
 10859                                  ; Function:
 10860                                  ;	Input character from console, no echo
 10861                                  ; Returns:
 10862                                  ;	AL = character
 10863                                  
 10864 00001468 1E                      	push	ds
 10865 00001469 56                      	push	si
 10866                                  INTEST:
 10867 0000146A E8053E                  	call	STATCHK
 10868 0000146D 753B                    	jnz	short GET ; 08/09/2018
 10869                                  ;*************************************************************************
 10870                                  ;hkn; SS override
 10871 0000146F 36803E[A00A]00          	cmp	byte [SS:PRINTER_FLAG],0  ; is printer idle?
 10872 00001475 7505                    	jnz	short no_sys_wait
 10873 00001477 B405                    	mov	ah,5			; get input status with system wait
 10874 00001479 E82D31                  	call	IOFUNC
 10875                                  no_sys_wait:
 10876                                  ;**************************************************************************
 10877 0000147C B484                    	MOV	AH,84h
 10878 0000147E CD2A                    	INT	int_IBM	 ; int 2Ah
 10879                                  
 10880                                  ;;; 7/15/86  update the date in the idle loop
 10881                                  ;;; Dec 19, 1986 D.C.L. changed following CMP to Byte Ptr from Word Ptr
 10882                                  ;;;;		 to shorten loop in consideration of the PC Convertible
 10883                                  
 10884                                  ;hkn; SS override
 10885 00001480 36803E[E50D]FF          	CMP	byte [SS:DATE_FLAG],-1	; date is updated may be every
 10886 00001486 751B                    	JNZ	short NoUpdate		; 65535 x ? ms if no one calls
 10887                                  
 10888 00001488 50                      	PUSH	AX
 10889 00001489 53                      	PUSH	BX			; following is tricky,
 10890 0000148A 51                      	PUSH	CX			; it may be called by critical handler
 10891 0000148B 52                      	PUSH	DX			; at that time, DEVCALL is used by
 10892                                  					; other's READ or WRITE
 10893 0000148C 1E                      	PUSH	DS			; save DS = SFT's segment
 10894                                  
 10895                                  ;hkn; READTIME must use ds = DOSDATA
 10896                                  ;hkn;	PUSH	CS			; READTIME must use DS=CS
 10897                                  
 10898 0000148D 16                      	PUSH	SS ; 04/05/2019
 10899 0000148E 1F                      	POP	DS
 10900                                  
 10901 0000148F B80000                  	MOV	AX,0			; therefore, we save DEVCALL
 10902 00001492 E89A02                  	CALL	Save_Restore_Packet	; save DEVCALL packet
 10903                                  	;invoke	READTIME		; readtime
 10904 00001495 E8FEF6                  	call	READTIME
 10905 00001498 B80100                  	MOV	AX,1
 10906 0000149B E89102                  	CALL	Save_Restore_Packet	; restore DEVCALL packet
 10907                                  
 10908                                  ;	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM, Offset 1F8Ch)
 10909                                  ;	; (MSDOS 6.0 code does not contain IBM DOS FETCHI_TAG check)
 10910                                  ;	push	bx
 10911                                  ;	mov	bx,DATE_FLAG
 10912                                  ;	add	bx,2  ; mov bx,FETCHI_FLAG
 10913                                  ;	cmp	word [cs:bx],5872h
 10914                                  ;	jz	short FETCHI_TAG_chk_ok
 10915                                  ;	call	DOSINIT
 10916                                  ;FETCHI_TAG_chk_ok:
 10917                                  ;	pop	bx
 10918                                  
 10919 0000149E 1F                      	POP	DS			; restore DS
 10920 0000149F 5A                      	POP	DX
 10921 000014A0 59                      	POP	CX
 10922 000014A1 5B                      	POP	BX
 10923 000014A2 58                      	POP	AX
 10924                                  NoUpdate:
 10925                                  
 10926                                  ;hkn; SS override
 10927 000014A3 36FF06[E50D]            	INC	word [SS:DATE_FLAG]
 10928                                  
 10929                                  ;;; 7/15/86 ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
 10930 000014A8 EBC0                    	JMP	short INTEST
 10931                                  GET:
 10932 000014AA 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH
 10933 000014AC E8FA30                  	call	IOFUNC
 10934 000014AF 5E                      	POP	SI
 10935 000014B0 1F                      	POP	DS
 10936                                  ;;; 7/15/86
 10937                                  
 10938                                  ;hkn; SS override
 10939                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 10940 000014B1 36C606[E40D]00          	MOV	BYTE [SS:SCAN_FLAG],0
 10941                                  	;
 10942 000014B7 3C00                    	CMP	AL,0	    ; extended code ( AL )
 10943 000014B9 7505                    	JNZ	short noscan
 10944                                  
 10945                                  ;hkn; SS override
 10946                                  	;MOV	BYTE [SS:SCAN_FLAG],1 ; set this flag for ALT_Q key
 10947                                  	; 20/06/2023
 10948 000014BB 36FE06[E40D]            	inc	byte [SS:SCAN_FLAG]
 10949                                  noscan:
 10950 000014C0 C3                      	retn
 10951                                  ;
 10952                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10953                                  ;
 10954                                  ;**	$STD_CON_STRING_OUTPUT - Console String Output
 10955                                  ;
 10956                                  ;
 10957                                  ;	ENTRY	(DS:DX) Point to output string '$' terminated
 10958                                  ;	EXIT	none
 10959                                  ;	USES	ALL
 10960                                  ;
 10961                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10962                                  ;
 10963                                  
 10964                                  _$STD_CON_STRING_OUTPUT:	;System call 9
 10965                                  
 10966 000014C1 89D6                    	mov	si,dx
 10967                                  STRING_OUT1:	
 10968 000014C3 AC                      	lodsb
 10969 000014C4 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'
 10970 000014C6 74F8                    	je	short noscan
 10971                                  NEXT_STR1:
 10972 000014C8 E88F02                  	call	OUTT
 10973 000014CB EBF6                    	jmp	short STRING_OUT1
 10974                                  
 10975                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10976                                  ;
 10977                                  ;**	$STD_CON_STRING_INPUT - Input Line from Console
 10978                                  ;
 10979                                  ;	$STD_CON_STRING_INPUT Fills a buffer from console input until CR
 10980                                  ;
 10981                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds:dx) = input buffer
 10982                                  ;	EXIT	none
 10983                                  ;	USES	ALL
 10984                                  ;
 10985                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10986                                  
 10987                                  _$STD_CON_STRING_INPUT:		;System call 10
 10988                                  
 10989 000014CD 8CD0                    	mov	ax,ss
 10990 000014CF 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 10991 000014D1 89D6                    	mov	si,dx
 10992 000014D3 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 10993 000014D5 AD                      	lodsw
 10994                                  
 10995                                  ;	(AL) = the buffer length
 10996                                  ;	(AH) = the template length
 10997                                  
 10998 000014D6 08C0                            or	al,al
 10999 000014D8 74E6                            jz	short noscan	;Buffer is 0 length!!?
 11000 000014DA 88E3                    	mov	bl,ah		;Init template counter
 11001 000014DC 88EF                            mov	bh,ch		;Init template counter
 11002                                  
 11003                                  ;	(BL) = the number of bytes in the template
 11004                                  
 11005 000014DE 38D8                            cmp	al,bl
 11006 000014E0 7605                            jbe	short NOEDIT	;If length of buffer inconsistent with contents
 11007 000014E2 80380D                          cmp	byte [bx+si],c_CR ; 0Dh
 11008 000014E5 7402                            jz	short EDITON	;If CR correctly placed EDIT is OK
 11009                                  
 11010                                  ; The number of chars in the template is >= the number of chars in buffer or
 11011                                  ; there is no CR at the end of the template.  This is an inconsistant state
 11012                                  ; of affairs.  Pretend that the template was empty:
 11013                                  ;
 11014                                  
 11015                                  NOEDIT:	
 11016 000014E7 88EB                    	mov	bl,ch		;Reset buffer
 11017                                  EDITON: 
 11018 000014E9 88C2                    	mov	dl,al
 11019 000014EB 4A                      	dec	dx		;DL is # of bytes we can put in the buffer
 11020                                  
 11021                                  ;	Top level. We begin to read a line in.
 11022                                  
 11023                                  NEWLIN: 
 11024 000014EC 36A0[F901]              	mov	al,[SS:CARPOS]
 11025 000014F0 36A2[FA01]              	mov	[SS:STARTPOS],al ;Remember position in raw buffer
 11026                                  
 11027 000014F4 56                      	push	si
 11028 000014F5 BF[FB01]                	mov	di,INBUF ;Build the new line here
 11029 000014F8 36882E[7905]            	mov	byte [SS:INSMODE],ch ;Insert mode off
 11030 000014FD 88EF                    	mov	bh,ch		;No chars from template yet
 11031 000014FF 88EE                    	mov	dh,ch		;No chars to new line yet
 11032 00001501 E864FF                  	call	_$STD_CON_INPUT_NO_ECHO ;Get first char
 11033 00001504 3C0A                    	cmp	al,c_LF		; 0Ah	;Linefeed 
 11034 00001506 7503                    	jnz	short GOTCH
 11035                                  
 11036                                  ;	This is the main loop of reading in a character and processing it.
 11037                                  ;
 11038                                  ;	(BH) = the index of the next byte in the template
 11039                                  ;	(BL) = the length of the template
 11040                                  ;	(DH) = the number of bytes in the buffer
 11041                                  ;	(DL) = the length of the buffer
 11042                                  
 11043                                  GETCH:
 11044 00001508 E85DFF                  	call	_$STD_CON_INPUT_NO_ECHO
 11045                                  GOTCH:
 11046                                  ;
 11047                                  ; Brain-damaged Tim Patterson ignored ^F in case his BIOS did not flush the
 11048                                  ; input queue.
 11049                                  ;
 11050 0000150B 3C06                            cmp	al,"F"-"@"  ; CMP AL, 6  ; Ignore ^F
 11051 0000150D 74F9                    	jz	short GETCH
 11052                                  
 11053                                  ;	If the leading char is the function-key lead byte
 11054                                  
 11055                                  	;cmp	al,[SS:ESCCHAR]
 11056                                  
 11057                                  	; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 11058                                  
 11059                                  ;hkn; 	ESCCHAR is in TABLE seg (DOSCODE)
 11060                                  
 11061 0000150F 2E3A06[960A]            	CMP	AL,[cs:ESCCHAR]
 11062 00001514 743B                            jz	short ESCAPE	;change reserved keyword DBM 5-7-87
 11063                                  
 11064                                  ;	Rubout and ^H are both destructive backspaces.
 11065                                  
 11066 00001516 3C7F                            cmp	al,c_DEL ; 7FH
 11067 00001518 742E                            jz	short BACKSPJ
 11068 0000151A 3C08                            cmp	al,c_BS  ; 8
 11069 0000151C 742A                            jz	short BACKSPJ
 11070                                  
 11071                                  	; 04/05/2019 -	MSDOS 6.0, also MSDOS 6.21 has bug (bullshit) here. 
 11072                                  	;		Two NOPs -instead of a JMP short, as two bytes-
 11073                                  	;	   	after CMP and a CMP again!
 11074                                  	;		
 11075                                  	;		-It would be better if they use a 'JMP short' to 
 11076                                  	;	      	DOSCODE:5279h from DOSCODE:5271h and leave NOPs
 11077                                  	;		between them. Then, they would be able use a patch
 11078                                  	;		between 5271h and 5279h when if it will be required.
 11079                                  	;		I think Tim Patterson would not do this CMP mistake!-
 11080                                  	;	
 11081                                  	; (MSDOS.SYS, from DOSCODE:5271h to DOSCODE:5279h)
 11082                                  
 11083                                  	; 08/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 11084                                  	;
 11085                                  	; (Note: nops below might be used for patching code for Windows 3.1)
 11086                                  
 11087                                  ;DOSCODE:526D	cmp     al, 8
 11088                                  ;DOSCODE:526F	jz      short BACKSPJ
 11089                                  ;DOSCODE:5271	cmp     al, 17h
 11090                                  ;DOSCODE:5273	nop
 11091                                  ;DOSCODE:5274	nop
 11092                                  ;DOSCODE:5275	cmp     al, 15h
 11093                                  ;DOSCODE:5277	nop
 11094                                  ;DOSCODE:5278	nop
 11095                                  ;DOSCODE:5279	cmp     al, 0Dh
 11096                                  ;DOSCODE:527B	jz      short ENDLIN
 11097                                  ;DOSCODE:527D	cmp     al, 0Ah
 11098                                  ;DOSCODE:527F	jz      short PHYCRLF
 11099                                  	
 11100                                  	; 08/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 11101                                  	; DOSCODE:525Dh
 11102                                  
 11103                                  ; 16/12/2022
 11104                                  %if 0
 11105                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 11106                                  ;	^W deletes backward once and then backs up until a letter is before the
 11107                                  ;	cursor
 11108                                  
 11109                                  	CMP     AL,"W"-"@" ; 17h
 11110                                  
 11111                                  ;	The removal of the comment characters before the jump statement will
 11112                                  ;	cause ^W to backup a word.
 11113                                  
 11114                                  ;***	JZ	short WordDel
 11115                                  	NOP
 11116                                  	NOP
 11117                                  
 11118                                  	CMP     AL,"U"-"@" ; 15h
 11119                                  
 11120                                  ;	The removal of the comment characters before the jump statement will
 11121                                  ;	cause ^U to clear a line.
 11122                                  
 11123                                  ;***	JZ	short LineDel
 11124                                  	NOP
 11125                                  	NOP
 11126                                  
 11127                                  %endif
 11128                                  
 11129                                  ;	CR terminates the line.
 11130                                  
 11131 0000151E 3C0D                            cmp	al,c_CR ; 0Dh
 11132 00001520 7432                            jz	short ENDLIN
 11133                                  
 11134                                  ;	LF goes to a new line and keeps on reading.
 11135                                  
 11136 00001522 3C0A                            cmp	al,c_LF ; 0Ah
 11137 00001524 7444                    	jz	short PHYCRLF
 11138                                  
 11139                                  ;	^X (or ESC) deletes the line and starts over
 11140                                  
 11141                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 11142                                  	;cmp	al,[ss:CANCHAR] ; 1Bh
 11143                                  	;jz	short KILNEW
 11144                                  
 11145                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 6.21)
 11146                                  
 11147                                  ;hkn; 	CANCHAR is in TABLE seg (DOSCODE), so CS override
 11148                                  
 11149 00001526 2E3A06[950A]            	cmp	al,[cs:CANCHAR] ; 1Bh
 11150 0000152B 7442                    	jz	short KILNEW
 11151                                  	
 11152                                  	;cmp	al,CANCEL ; 1Bh	; Retro DOS v3.0
 11153                                  	;jz	short KILNEW
 11154                                  
 11155                                  ; Otherwise, we save the input character.
 11156                                  
 11157                                  SAVCH:	
 11158 0000152D 38D6                    	cmp	dh,dl
 11159 0000152F 7319                    	jnb	short BUFFUL		; buffer is full.
 11160 00001531 AA                              stosb
 11161 00001532 FEC6                    	inc	dh                      ; increment count in buffer.
 11162 00001534 E8B702                  	call	BUFOUT			; Print control chars nicely
 11163                                  
 11164 00001537 36803E[7905]00                  cmp	byte [SS:INSMODE], 0
 11165 0000153D 75C9                    	jnz	short GETCH		; insertmode => don't advance template
 11166 0000153F 38DF                            cmp	bh,bl
 11167 00001541 73C5                            jnb	short GETCH		; no more characters in template
 11168 00001543 46                              inc	si                      ; Skip to next char in template

 11296                                  
 11297                                  ; DOSCODE:52F3h (MSDOS 621, MSDOS.SYS)
 11298                                  
 11299                                  ; The user wants to throw away what he's typed in and wants to start over.
 11300                                  ; We print the backslash and then go to the next line and tab to the correct
 11301                                  ; spot to begin the buffered input.
 11302                                  
 11303                                  KILNEW:
 11304 0000156F B05C                            mov	al,'\'
 11305 00001571 E8E601                          call	OUTT            ;Print the CANCEL indicator
 11306 00001574 5E                              pop	si		;Remember start of edit buffer
 11307                                  PUTNEW:
 11308 00001575 E81501                  	call	CRLF            ;Go to next line on screen
 11309 00001578 36A0[FA01]              	mov	al,[SS:STARTPOS]
 11310 0000157C E84F02                  	call	TAB             ;Tab over
 11311 0000157F E96AFF                          JMP     NEWLIN		;Start over again
 11312                                  
 11313                                  ;	Destructively back up one character position
 11314                                  
 11315                                  BACKSP:
 11316                                  	; 09/09/2018
 11317 00001582 E80200                  	Call    BackSpace
 11318 00001585 EB81                    	JMP     GETCH
 11319                                  
 11320                                  BackSpace:
 11321 00001587 08F6                    	or	dh,dh
 11322 00001589 7419                    	jz	short OLDBAK	;No chars in line, do nothing to line
 11323 0000158B E85800                  	call	BACKUP          ;Do the backup
 11324 0000158E 268A05                  	mov	al,[es:di]	;Get the deleted char
 11325 00001591 3C20                            cmp	al,20h	; ' '
 11326 00001593 730F                    	jnb	short OLDBAK	;Was a normal char
 11327 00001595 3C09                            cmp	al,c_HT ; 9
 11328 00001597 741B                    	jz	short BAKTAB	;Was a tab, fix up users display
 11329                                  ;; 9/27/86 fix for ctrl-U backspace
 11330 00001599 3C15                    	CMP     AL,"U"-"@" ; 15h ; ctrl-U is a section symbol not ^U
 11331 0000159B 7407                    	JZ	short OLDBAK
 11332 0000159D 3C14                           	CMP     AL,"T"-"@" ; 14h ; ctrl-T is a paragraphs symbol not ^T
 11333 0000159F 7403                    	JZ	short OLDBAK
 11334                                  ;; 9/27/86 fix for ctrl-U backspace
 11335 000015A1 E84500                          call	BACKMES         ;Was a control char, zap the '^'
 11336                                  OLDBAK:
 11337 000015A4 36803E[7905]00                  cmp	byte [SS:INSMODE], 0
 11338 000015AA 75BD                    	jnz	short OLDBAK_RETN ;In insert mode, done
 11339 000015AC 08FF                    	or	bh,bh
 11340 000015AE 74B9                            jz	short OLDBAK_RETN 
 11341                                  				;Not advanced in template, stay where we are
 11342 000015B0 FECF                    	dec	bh		;Go back in template
 11343 000015B2 4E                              dec	si
 11344 000015B3 C3                      	retn
 11345                                  BAKTAB:
 11346 000015B4 57                              push	di
 11347 000015B5 4F                              dec	di		;Back up one char
 11348 000015B6 FD                              std			;Go backward
 11349 000015B7 88F1                            mov	cl,dh		;Number of chars currently in line
 11350 000015B9 B020                            mov	al,20h	; ' '
 11351 000015BB 53                              push	bx
 11352 000015BC B307                            mov	bl,7		;Max
 11353 000015BE E30E                            jcxz	FIGTAB		;At start, do nothing
 11354                                  FNDPOS:
 11355 000015C0 AE                              scasb			;Look back
 11356 000015C1 7609                    	jbe	short CHKCNT
 11357 000015C3 26807D0109              	cmp	byte [es:di+1],9
 11358 000015C8 7409                    	jz	short HAVTAB	;Found a tab
 11359 000015CA FECB                    	dec	bl		;Back one char if non tab control char
 11360                                  CHKCNT:
 11361 000015CC E2F2                            loop	FNDPOS
 11362                                  FIGTAB:		
 11363 000015CE 362A1E[FA01]            	sub	bl,[SS:STARTPOS]
 11364                                  HAVTAB:
 11365 000015D3 28F3                    	sub	bl,dh
 11366 000015D5 00D9                    	add	cl,bl
 11367 000015D7 80E107                  	and	cl,7		;CX has correct number to erase
 11368 000015DA FC                      	cld			;Back to normal
 11369 000015DB 5B                      	pop	bx
 11370 000015DC 5F                      	pop	di
 11371 000015DD 74C5                    	jz	short OLDBAK	;Nothing to erase
 11372                                  TABBAK:

 11374 000015E2 E2FB                    	loop	TABBAK		;Erase correct number of chars
 11375 000015E4 EBBE                    	jmp	short OLDBAK
 11376                                  
 11377                                  BACKUP:

 11379 000015E8 4F                              dec	di
 11380                                  BACKMES:

 11384 000015F0 E86701                          call	OUTT
 11385 000015F3 B008                            mov	al,c_BS ; 8	;Backspace
 11386 000015F5 E96201                  	jmp	OUTT		;Done
 11387                                  
 11388                                  ;User really wants an ESC character in his line

 11406                                  ;Copy CX chars from template to line
 11407                                  COPYEACH:

 11409 00001612 38D6                    	cmp	dh,dl
 11410 00001614 740F                            jz	short GETCH2		;At end of line, can't do anything

 11433 00001637 00CF                            add	bh,cl
 11434 00001639 E9CCFE                          jmp	GETCH
 11435                                  
 11436                                  ;Get the next user char, and look ahead in template for a match
 11437                                  ;CX indicates how many chars to skip to get there on output
 11438                                  ;NOTE: WARNING: If the operation cannot be done, the return
 11439                                  ;       address is popped off and a jump to GETCH is taken.
 11440                                  ;       Make sure nothing extra on stack when this routine
 11441                                  ;       is called!!! (no PUSHes before calling it).
 11442                                  
 11443                                  FINDOLD:
 11444 0000163C E829FE                          call	_$STD_CON_INPUT_NO_ECHO
 11445                                  
 11446                                  	; STRIN.ASM (MSDOS 2.11, 19/07/2018) 
 11447                                  
 11448                                  	;CMP     AL,[SS:ESCCHAR]	
 11449                                  	;JNZ     SHORT FINDSETUP
 11450                                  
 11451                                  	; CPMIO.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0)
 11452                                  
 11453                                  ;hkn; ESCCHAR is in TABLE seg (DOSCODE), so CS override
 11454                                  
 11455 0000163F 2E3A06[960A]            	CMP	AL,[CS:ESCCHAR]		; did he type a function key?
 11456 00001644 7505                    	JNZ     SHORT FINDSETUP		; no, set up for scan
 11457                                  
 11458 00001646 E81FFE                  	CALL	_$STD_CON_INPUT_NO_ECHO	; eat next char
 11459 00001649 EB1D                            JMP     SHORT NOTFND		; go try again
 11460                                  FINDSETUP:
 11461 0000164B 88D9                    	mov	cl,bl
 11462 0000164D 28F9                            sub	cl,bh		;CX is number of chars to end of template
 11463 0000164F 7417                    	jz	short NOTFND	;At end of template
 11464 00001651 49                              dec	cx		;Cannot point past end, limit search
 11465 00001652 7414                            jz	short NOTFND	 ;If only one char in template, forget it
 11466 00001654 06                      	push	es
 11467 00001655 1E                      	push	ds
 11468 00001656 07                      	pop	es
 11469 00001657 57                      	push	di
 11470 00001658 89F7                    	mov	di,si		;Template to ES:DI
 11471 0000165A 47                      	inc	di
 11472 0000165B F2AE                    	repne	scasb		;Look
 11473 0000165D 5F                      	pop	di
 11474 0000165E 07                      	pop	es
 11475 0000165F 7507                    	jnz	short NOTFND	;Didn't find the char
 11476 00001661 F6D1                            not	cl		;Turn how far to go into how far we went
 11477 00001663 00D9                            add	cl,bl		;Add size of template
 11478 00001665 28F9                            sub	cl,bh		;Subtract current pos, result distance to skip
 11479                                  FINDOLD_RETN:
 11480 00001667 C3                      	retn
 11481                                  
 11482                                  NOTFND:

 11484 00001669 E99CFE                          jmp	GETCH
 11485                                  
 11486                                  REEDIT:
 11487 0000166C B040                    	mov	al,'@'		;Output re-edit character
 11488 0000166E E8E900                  	call	OUTT
 11489 00001671 5F                      	pop	di
 11490 00001672 57                      	push	di
 11491 00001673 06                      	push	es
 11492 00001674 1E                      	push	ds

 11494 00001678 1F                      	pop	ds

 11520                                  ;**	$RAW_CON_IO - Do Raw Console I/O
 11521                                  ;
 11522                                  ;	Input or output raw character from console, no echo
 11523                                  ;
 11524                                  ;	ENTRY	DL = -1 if input
 11525                                  ;		   =  output character if output
 11526                                  ;	EXIT	(AL) = input character if input
 11527                                  ;	USES	all

 11529                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 11531

 11533                                  ; DOSCODE:541Ch (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 11534                                  
 11535                                  ; 08/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 11536                                  ; DOSCODE:5408h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 11537

 11539

 11544                                  	;jz	short rci1
 11545                                  	;jmp	short RAWOUT
 11546                                  	; 16/12/202
 11547                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 11548                                  	;nop
 11549                                  rci1:	        
 11550                                  			; Get pointer to register save area
 11551 0000169D 36C43E[8405]                    LES     DI,[SS:USER_SP] ; 12/03/2018
 11552 000016A2 31DB                    	XOR     BX,BX
 11553                                      	;CALL	GET_IO_FCB	; MSDOS 2.11 (Retro DOS v2.0)
 11554 000016A4 E8BD20                  	CALL	GET_IO_SFT	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0

 11606                                  	;XOR	AH,AH

 11620                                  ;       Output the character in AL to stdout
 11621                                  ;

 11626                                  
 11627                                          ;CALL	GET_IO_FCB	; MSDOS 2.11 (Retro DOS v2.0)

 11631                                  	;
 11632                                  	; MSDOS 2.11
 11633                                          ;TEST	BYTE [SI+18H],080H	; output to file?
 11634                                          ;JZ	SHORT RAWNORM		; if so, do normally

 11665                                  
 11666                                          ;JMP	SHORT RAWRET
 11667                                  ;RAWNORM:

 11669                                  RAWRET:

 11709                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 11712                                  ;the user failed. We do not send a char if this happens. We however return

 12270                                  ;
 12271                                  ;   $Get_FCB_Position - look at an FCB, retrieve the current position from the
 12272                                  ;	extent and next record field and set the random record field to point
 12273                                  ;	to that record
 12274                                  ;
 12275                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to a possible extended FCB
 12276                                  ;   Outputs:	The random record field of the FCB is set to the current record
 12277                                  ;   Registers modified: all

 12285                                  	;mov	[si+21h],ax

 12287                                  	;mov	[si+23h],dl

 12294                                  GoodPath:	; 16/12/2022
