 12510                                  ;**	$FCB_Rename - Rename a File
 12511                                  ;
 12512                                  ;	$FCB_Rename - rename a file in place within a directory. Renames
 12513                                  ;	multiple files copying from the meta characters.
 12514                                  ;
 12515                                  ;	ENTRY	DS:DX point to an FCB. The normal name field is the source
 12516                                  ;		    name of the files to be renamed. Starting at offset 11h
 12517                                  ;		    in the FCB is the destination name.
 12518                                  ;	EXIT	AL = 0 -> no error occurred and all files were renamed
 12519                                  ;		AL = FF -> some files may have been renamed but:
 12520                                  ;			rename to existing file or source file not found
 12521                                  ;	USES	ALL
 12522                                  ;
 12523                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12524                                  ;
 12525                                  	; 08/11/2022 Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 12526                                  
 12527                                  _$FCB_RENAME:		; System call 23
 12528                                  
 12529 0000195F E80904                  	call	GetExtended		; get pointer to real FCB
 12530 00001962 52                      	push	dx
 12531 00001963 8A04                    	MOV	AL,[SI] 		; get drive byte
 12532 00001965 83C610                  	ADD	SI,10h			; point to destination
 12533                                  
 12534                                  					; RenBuf is in DOSDATA
 12535 00001968 BF[3E04]                	MOV	DI,RENBUF		; point to destination buffer
 12536 0000196B FF34                    	push	word [SI]
 12537 0000196D 1E                      	push	ds
 12538 0000196E 57                      	push	di			; save source pointer for TransFCB
 12539 0000196F 8804                    	MOV	[SI],AL			; drop in real drive
 12540 00001971 89F2                    	MOV	DX,SI			; let TransFCB know where the FCB is
 12541 00001973 E8D152                  	call	TransFCB		; munch this pathname
 12542 00001976 5E                      	pop	si
 12543 00001977 1F                      	pop	ds	
 12544 00001978 8F04                    	pop	WORD [SI]		; get path back
 12545 0000197A 5A                      	pop	dx			; Original FCB pointer
 12546 0000197B 72DF                    	JC	short fren90		; bad path -> error
 12547                                  
 12548                                  					; SS override for WFP_Start & Ren_WFP
 12549 0000197D 368B36[B205]            	MOV	SI,[ss:WFP_START]	; get pointer
 12550 00001982 368936[B405]            	MOV	[ss:REN_WFP],SI		; stash it
 12551                                  
 12552                                  					; OpenBuf is in DOSDATA
 12553 00001987 BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; appropriate spot
 12554 0000198A E8BA52                  	call	TransFCB		; wham
 12555                                  					; NOTE that this call is pointing
 12556                                  					;  back to the ORIGINAL FCB so
 12557                                  					;  SATTRIB gets set correctly
 12558 0000198D 72CD                    	JC	short fren90		; error
 12559 0000198F E8840E                  	call	DOS_RENAME
 12560 00001992 72C8                    	JC	short fren90

 12565                                  ;
 12566                                  ;	(al) = error code
 12567

 12569                                  ;fren90:	
 12570                                  ;	;jmp	FCB_RET_ERR
 12571                                  ;	; 08/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 12572                                  ;	jmp	short fcb_close_err
 12573                                  
 12574                                  ;Break <Misbehavior fixers>
 12575                                  ;
 12576                                  ;   FCBs suffer from several problems. First, they are maintained in the
 12577                                  ;   user's space so he may move them at will. Second, they have a small
 12578                                  ;   reserved area that may be used for system information. Third, there was
 12579                                  ;   never any "rules for behavior" for FCBs; there was no protocol for their
 12580                                  ;   usage.
 12581                                  ;
 12582                                  ;   This results in the following misbehavior:
 12583                                  ;
 12584                                  ;	infinite opens of the same file:
 12585                                  ;
 12586                                  ;	While (TRUE) {			While (TRUE) {
 12587                                  ;	    FCBOpen (FCB);		    FCBOpen (FCB);
 12588                                  ;	    Read (FCB); 		    Write (FCB);
 12589                                  ;	    }				    }
 12590                                  ;
 12591                                  ;	infinite opens of different files:
 12592                                  ;
 12593                                  ;	While (TRUE) {			While (TRUE) {
 12594                                  ;	    FCBOpen (FCB[i++]); 	    FCBOpen (FCB[i++]);
 12595                                  ;	    Read (FCB); 		    Write (FCB);
 12596                                  ;	    }				    }
 12597                                  ;
 12598                                  ;	multiple closes of the same file:
 12599                                  ;
 12600                                  ;	FCBOpen (FCB);
 12601                                  ;	while (TRUE)
 12602                                  ;	    FCBClose (FCB);
 12603                                  ;
 12604                                  ;	I/O after closing file:
 12605                                  ;
 12606                                  ;	FCBOpen (FCB);
 12607                                  ;	while (TRUE) {
 12608                                  ;	    FCBWrite (FCB);
 12609                                  ;	    FCBClose (FCB);
 12610                                  ;	    }
 12611                                  ;
 12612                                  ;   The following is am implementation of a methodology for emulating the
 12613                                  ;   above with the exception of I/O after close. We are NOT attempting to
 12614                                  ;   resolve that particular misbehavior. We will enforce correct behaviour in
 12615                                  ;   FCBs when they refer to a network file or when there is file sharing on
 12616                                  ;   the local machine.
 12617                                  ;
 12618                                  ;   The reserved fields of the FCB (10 bytes worth) is divided up into various
 12619                                  ;   structures depending on the file itself and the state of operations of the
 12620                                  ;   OS. The information contained in this reserved field is enough to
 12621                                  ;   regenerate the SFT for the local non-shared file. It is assumed that this
 12622                                  ;   regeneration procedure may be expensive. The SFT for the FCB is
 12623                                  ;   maintained in a LRU cache as the ONLY performance inprovement.
 12624                                  ;
 12625                                  ;   No regeneration of SFTs is attempted for network FCBs.
 12626                                  ;
 12627                                  ;   To regenerate the SFT for a local FCB, it is necessary to determine if the
 12628                                  ;   file sharer is working. If the file sharer is present then the SFT is not
 12629                                  ;   regenerated.
 12630                                  ;
 12631                                  ;   Finally, if there is no local sharing, the full name of the file is no
 12632                                  ;   longer available. We can make up for this by using the following
 12633                                  ;   information:
 12634                                  ;
 12635                                  ;	The Drive number (from the DPB).
 12636                                  ;	The physical sector of the directory that contains the entry.
 12637                                  ;	The relative position of the entry in the sector.
 12638                                  ;	The first cluster field.
 12639                                  ;	The last used SFT.
 12640                                  ;      OR In the case of a device FCB
 12641                                  ;	The low 6 bits of sf_flags (indicating device type)
 12642                                  ;	The pointer to the device header
 12643                                  ;
 12644                                  ;   We read in the particular directory sector and examine the indicated
 12645                                  ;   directory entry. If it matches, then we are kosher; otherwise, we fail.
 12646                                  ;
 12647                                  ;   Some key items need to be remembered:
 12648                                  ;
 12649                                  ;	Even though we are caching SFTs, they may contain useful sharing
 12650                                  ;	information. We enforce good behavior on the FCBs.
 12651                                  ;
 12652                                  ;	Network support must not treat FCBs as impacting the ref counts on
 12653                                  ;	open VCs. The VCs may be closed only at process termination.
 12654                                  ;
 12655                                  ;	If this is not an installed version of the DOS, file sharing will
 12656                                  ;	always be present.
 12657                                  ;
 12658                                  ;	We MUST always initialize lstclus to = firclus when regenerating a
 12659                                  ;	file. Otherwise we start allocating clusters up the wazoo.
 12660                                  ;
 12661                                  ;	Always initialize, during regeneration, the mode field to both isFCB
 12662                                  ;	and open_for_both. This is so the FCB code in the sharer can find the
 12663                                  ;	proper OI record.
 12664                                  ;
 12665                                  ;   The test bits are:
 12666                                  ;
 12667                                  ;	00 -> local file
 12668                                  ;	40 -> sharing local
 12669                                  ;	80 -> network
 12670                                  ;	C0 -> local device
 12671                                  
 12672                                  ;Break	<SaveFCBInfo - store pertinent information from an SFT into the FCB>
 12673                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12674                                  ;
 12675                                  ;   SaveFCBInfo - given an FCB and its associated SFT, copy the relevant
 12676                                  ;	pieces of information into the FCB to allow for subsequent
 12677                                  ;	regeneration. Poke LRU also.
 12678                                  ;
 12679                                  ;   Inputs:	ThisSFT points to a complete SFT.
 12680                                  ;		DS:SI point to the FCB (not an extended one)
 12681                                  ;   Outputs:	The relevant reserved fields in the FCB are filled in.
 12682                                  ;		DS:SI preserved
 12683                                  ;		ES:DI point to sft
 12684                                  ;   Registers modified: All
 12685                                  ;
 12686                                  ;
 12687                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12688                                  ;
 12689                                  
 12690                                  	; 08/11/2022 Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 12691                                  
 12692                                  SaveFCBInfo:
 12693                                  
 12694 00001997 36C43E[9E05]            	LES	DI,[SS:THISSFT]		; SS override
 12695 0000199C E8B4F9                  	call	IsSFTNet
 12696 0000199F 740B                    	JZ	short SaveLocal		; if not network then save local info
 12697                                  ;
 12698                                  ;----- In net support -----
 12699                                  ;
 12700                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 12883                                  ;Break	<ResetLRU - reset overflowed lru counts>
 12884                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12885                                  ;
 12886                                  ;   ResetLRU - during lru updates, we may wrap at 64K. We must walk the
 12887                                  ;   entire set of SFTs and subtract 8000h from their lru counts and truncate
 12888                                  ;   at 0.
 12889                                  ;
 12890                                  ;   Inputs:	BX is offset into SFT field where lru firld is kept
 12891                                  ;		ES:DI point to SFT currently being updated
 12892                                  ;   Outputs:	All FCB SFTs have their lru fields truncated
 12893                                  ;		AX has 8000h
 12894                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 12895                                  ;
 12896                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12897                                  ;
 12898                                  
 12899                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 12900                                  ResetLRU:
 12901                                  	; ResetLRU is only called from fcbio.asm. So SS can be assumed to be 
 12902                                  	; DOSDATA
 12903                                  
 12904 00001A43 B80080                  	MOV	AX,8000h
 12905 00001A46 06                      	push	es
 12906 00001A47 57                      	push	di
 12907                                  	;LES	DI,[CS:SFTFCB]		; get pointer to head
 12908 00001A48 36C43E[4000]            	LES	DI,[SS:SFTFCB] ; MSDOS 6.0
 12909                                  	;mov	cx,[es:di+4]
 12910 00001A4D 268B4D04                	MOV	CX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]
 12911                                  	;lea	di,[di+6]
 12912 00001A51 8D7D06                  	LEA	DI,[DI+SFT.SFTable] 	; point at table
 12913                                  ovScan:
 12914 00001A54 262901                  	SUB	[ES:DI+BX],AX		; decrement lru count
 12915 00001A57 7703                    	JA	short ovLoop
 12916 00001A59 268901                  	MOV	[ES:DI+BX],AX		; truncate at 0
 12917                                  ovLoop:
 12918                                  	;;add	di,53	; MSDOS 3.3
 12919                                  	;add	di,59	; MSDOS 6.0	
 12920 00001A5C 83C73B                  	ADD	DI,SF_ENTRY.size	; advance to next
 12921 00001A5F E2F3                    	LOOP	ovScan
 12922 00001A61 5F                      	pop	di
 12923 00001A62 07                      	pop	es
 12924 00001A63 268901                  	MOV	[ES:DI+BX],AX
 12925 00001A66 C3                      	retn

 12966                                  ; LRUFCB for MSDOS 6.0 !
 12967                                  
 12968                                  ;Break	<LRUFCB - perform LRU on FCB sfts>
 12969                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12970                                  ;
 12971                                  ;   LRUFCB - find LRU fcb in cache. Set ThisSFT and return it. We preserve
 12972                                  ;	the first keepcount sfts if they are network sfts or if sharing is
 12973                                  ;	loaded.  If carry is set then NO BLASTING is NECESSARY.
 12974                                  ;
 12975                                  ;   Inputs:	none
 12976                                  ;   Outputs:	ES:DI point to SFT
 12977                                  ;		ThisSFT points to SFT
 12978                                  ;		SFT is zeroed
 12979                                  ;		Carry set of closes failed
 12980                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 12981                                  ;
 12982                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12983                                  ;
 12984                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 12985                                  ;IF 0	; rewritten this routine
 12986                                  ;
 12987                                  ;LRUFCB: ; MSDOS 3.3 - IBMDOS.COM (1987) - Offset 25ADh
 12988                                  ;	call	save_world
 12989                                  ;	
 12990                                  ; Find nth oldest NET/SHARE FCB. We want to find its age for the second scan
 12991                                  ; to find the lease recently used one that is younger than the open age.  We
 12992                                  ; operate be scanning the list n times finding the least age that is greater
 12993                                  ; or equal to the previous minimum age.
 12994                                  ;
 12995                                  ;   BP is the count of times we need to go through this loop.
 12996                                  ;   AX is the current acceptable minimum age to consider
 12997                                  ;
 12998                                  ;	mov	bp,[CS:KEEPCOUNT]	; k = keepcount;
 12999                                  ;	XOR	AX,AX			; low = 0;
 13000                                  ;

 13002                                  ;
 13003                                  ;lru1:

 13005                                  ;	JZ	short lru75
 13006                                  ;	DEC	bp

 13009                                  ;
 13010                                  ;   AX is the minimum age for consideration
 13011                                  ;   BX is the minimum age found during the scan
 13012                                  ;   SI is the position of the entry that corresponds to BX
 13013                                  ;
 13014                                  ;	MOV	BX,-1			;     min = 0xffff;
 13015                                  ;	MOV	si,BX			;     pos = 0xffff;

 13017                                  ;	;mov	cx,[es:di+4]
 13018                                  ;	MOV	CX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]
 13019                                  ;	;lea	di,[di+6]
 13020                                  ;	LEA	DI,[DI+SFT.SFTable]
 13021                                  ;
 13022                                  ; Innermost loop.  If the current entry is free, then we are done.  Or, if the
 13023                                  ; current entry is busy (indicating a previous aborted allocation), then we
 13024                                  ; are done.  In both cases, we use the found entry.
 13025                                  ;
 13026                                  ;lru2:

 13031                                  ;	;cmp	word [es:di+SFT_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 13032                                  ;	cmp	word [es:di],sf_busy
 13033                                  ;	jnz	short lru3
 13034                                  ;
 13035                                  ; The entry is usable without further scan.  Go and use it.
 13036                                  ;
 13037                                  ;lru25:
 13038                                  ;	MOV	si,DI			;	      pos = i;
 13039                                  ;	JMP	short lru11		;	      goto got;
 13040                                  ;
 13041                                  ; See if the entry is for the network or for the sharer.
 13042                                  ;
 13043                                  ;  If for the sharer or network then
 13044                                  ;	if the age < current minimum AND >= allowed minimum then
 13045                                  ;	    this entry becomes current minimum

 13053                                  ;	call	CheckShare		;		&& !sharing)
 13054                                  ;	JZ	short lru5		;	  else
 13055                                  ;ENDIF
 13056                                  ;

 13058                                  ; current minimum.
 13059                                  ;

 13062                                  ;	MOV	DX,[ES:DI+sf_OpenAge]

 13064                                  ;	JB	short lru5
 13065                                  ;	CMP	DX,BX
 13066                                  ;	JAE	short lru5		;	      age[i] < min) {

 13081                                  ; set then threshold value to this new minimum + 1. Otherwise, the scan is
 13082                                  ; complete.  Go find LRU.

 13095                                  ; that is local-no-share or has age >= AX
 13096                                  ;

 13139                                  ;

 13141                                  ; out. The conditions here are:

 13164                                  ; Repeat close until ref count is 0
 13165                                  ;

 13178                                  ;	stc

 13180                                  ;LRUDone:
 13181                                  ;	XOR	AL,AL
 13182                                  ;	call	BlastSFT		; fill SFT with 0 (AL), 'C' cleared
 13183                                  ;
 13184                                  ;LRUDead:
 13185                                  ;	call	restore_world
 13186                                  ;	LES     DI,[CS:THISSFT]
 13187                                  ;	jnc	short LRUFCB_retn
 13188                                  ;LRUFCB_err:
 13189                                  ;	; mov	al, 23h	
 13190                                  ;	MOV	AL,error_FCB_unavailable

 13192                                  ;	retn:
 13193                                  ;
 13194                                  ;ENDIF	; LRUFCB has been rewritten below.
 13195                                  
 13196                                  ; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 13197                                  ; LRUFCB for MSDOS 6.0 !
 13198                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13199                                  ;
 13200                                  ; LruFCB -- allocate the LRU SFT from the SFT Table. The LRU scheme
 13201                                  ; maintains separate counts for net/Share and local SFTs. We allocate a 
 13202                                  ; net/Share SFT only if we do not find a local SFT. This helps keep
 13203                                  ; net/Share SFTs which cannot be regenerated for as long as possible. We
 13204                                  ; optimize regeneration operations by keeping track of the current local
 13205                                  ; SFT. This avoids scanning of the SFTs as long as we have at least one 
 13206                                  ; local SFT in the SFT Block.
 13207                                  ;
 13208                                  ; Inputs: al = 0 => Regenerate SFT operation
 13209                                  ;	    = 1 => Allocate new SFT for Open/Create
 13210                                  ;
 13211                                  ; Outputs: Carry clear
 13212                                  ;	 	es:di = Address of allocated SFT
 13213                                  ;	  	ThisSFT = Address of allocated SFT
 13214                                  ;
 13215                                  ;	  carry set if closes of net/Share files failed 
 13216                                  ;		al = error_FCB_unavailable
 13217                                  ;
 13218                                  ; Registers affected: None
 13219                                  ;
 13220                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13221                                  
 13222                                  ;LruFCB	PROC	NEAR
 13223                                  LRUFCB:
 13224                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 13225                                  	; DOSCODE:5805h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 13226                                  
 13227                                  	; 08/11/2022 Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 13228                                  	; DOSCODE:57F1h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 13229                                  
 13230 00001A67 06                      	push	es	; * (MSDOS 6.21)
 13231                                  	
 13232 00001A68 E8EDE9                  	call	save_world
 13233                                  	
 13234                                  	;getdseg <ds>		;ds = DOSDATA
 13235 00001A6B 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 13236                                  
 13237 00001A70 08C0                    	or	al,al		;Check if regenerate allocation
 13238 00001A72 751A                    	jnz	short lru1	;Try to find SFT to use
 13239                                  
 13240                                  	; This is a regen call. If LocalSFT contains the address of a valid 
 13241                                  	; local SFT, just return that SFT to reuse
 13242                                  
 13243 00001A74 8B3E[8910]              	mov	di,[LocalSFT]
 13244 00001A78 0B3E[8B10]              	or	di,[LocalSFT+2]	;is address == 0?
 13245 00001A7C 7410                    	jz	short lru1	;invalid local SFT, find one
 13246                                  
 13247                                  	; We have found a valid local SFT. Recycle this SFT
 13248                                  
 13249 00001A7E C43E[8910]              	les	di,[LocalSFT]
 13250                                  
 13251                                  gotlocalSFT:
 13252 00001A82 893E[9E05]              	mov	[THISSFT],di
 13253 00001A86 8C06[A005]              	mov	[THISSFT+2],es
 13254 00001A8A F8                      	clc
 13255 00001A8B E9AD00                  	jmp	LRUDone		;clear up SFT and return
 13256                                  
 13257                                  lru1:
 13258 00001A8E C43E[4000]              	les	di,[SFTFCB]	;es:di = SF Table for FCBs
 13259                                  	;mov	cx,[es:di+4]
 13260 00001A92 268B4D04                	mov	cx,[es:di+SFT.SFCount]	;cx = number of SFTs
 13261                                  	;lea	di,[di+6]
 13262 00001A96 8D7D06                  	lea	di,[di+SFT.SFTable]	;es:di = first SFT
 13263                                  
 13264                                  	; We scan through all the SFTs scanning for a free one. It also 
 13265                                  	; remembers the LRU SFT for net/Share SFTs and local SFTs separately. 
 13266                                  	; bx = min. LRU for local SFTs
 13267                                  	; si = pos. of local SFT with min. LRU
 13268                                  	; dx = min. LRU for net/Share SFTs
 13269                                  	; bp = pos. of net/Share SFT with min. LRU
 13270                                  
 13271 00001A99 BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,-1		; init. to 0xffff ( max. LRU value )
 13272 00001A9C 89DE                    	mov	si,bx
 13273 00001A9E 89DA                    	mov	dx,bx
 13274 00001AA0 89DD                    	mov	bp,bx
 13275                                  
 13276                                  findSFT:
 13277                                  	;See if this SFT is a free one. If so, return it
 13278 00001AA2 26830D00                	or	word [es:di],0
 13279                                  	;or	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],0 ;reference count = 0 ?
 13280 00001AA6 744D                    	jz	short gotSFT	;yes, SFT is free
 13281                                  	;;cmp	word [es:di],-1
 13282                                  	;cmp	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy ;Is it busy?
 13283 00001AA8 26833DFF                	cmp	word [es:di],sf_busy ; -1 
 13284 00001AAC 7447                    	jz	short gotSFT	;no, can use it
 13285                                  
 13286                                  	; Check if this SFT is local and store its address in LocalSFT. Can be 
 13287                                  	; used for a later regen.
 13288                                  
 13289                                  	; 16/12/2022
 13290                                  	; 08/11/2022
 13291                                  	;test	byte [es:di+6],80h
 13292 00001AAE 26F6450680              	test	byte [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags+1],(sf_isnet>>8) ; 80h
 13293                                  	; 08/11/2022 Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 13294                                  	;;test	word [es:di+5],8000h
 13295                                  	;test	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],sf_isnet ; network SFT?
 13296 00001AB3 7532                    	jnz	short lru5	;yes, get net/Share LRU
 13297                                  
 13298                                  ;IF installed
 13299 00001AB5 E8BB59                  	call	CheckShare	;Share present?
 13300                                  ;ENDIF
 13301 00001AB8 752D                    	jnz	short lru5	;yes, get net/Share LRU
 13302                                  
 13303                                  	;Local SFT, register its address
 13304                                  
 13305                                  	; !!HACK!!!
 13306                                  	; There is a slightly dirty hack out here in a desperate bid to save  
 13307                                  	; code space. There is similar code duplicated at label 'gotSFT'. We 
 13308                                  	; enter from there if al = 0, update the LocalSFT variable, and since 
 13309                                  	; al = 0, we jump out of the loop to the exit point. I have commented 
 13310                                  	; out the code that previously existed at label 'gotSFT'
 13311                                  
 13312                                  hackpoint:
 13313 00001ABA 893E[8910]              	mov	[LocalSFT],di
 13314 00001ABE 8C06[8B10]              	mov	[LocalSFT+2],es	;store local SFT address
 13315                                  
 13316 00001AC2 08C0                    	or	al,al		;Is operation = REGEN?
 13317 00001AC4 74BC                    	jz	short gotlocalSFT ;yes, return this SFT for reuse
 13318                                  
 13319                                  	;Get LRU for local files
 13320                                  	
 13321                                  	;cmp	[es:di+15h],bx
 13322 00001AC6 26395D15                	cmp	[es:di+sf_LRU],bx ;SFT.LRU < min?
 13323 00001ACA 7306                    	jae	short lru4	;no, skip 
 13324                                  
 13325                                  	;mov	bx,[es:di+15h]
 13326 00001ACC 268B5D15                	mov	bx,[es:di+sf_LRU] ;yes, store new minimum
 13327 00001AD0 89FE                    	mov	si,di		;store SFT position
 13328                                  lru4:
 13329                                  	;add	di,59
 13330 00001AD2 83C73B                  	add	di,SF_ENTRY.size ;go to next SFT
 13331 00001AD5 E2CB                    	loop	findSFT
 13332                                  
 13333                                  	; Check whether we got a net/Share or local SFT. If local SFT 
 13334                                  	; available, we will reuse it instead of net/Share LRU
 13335                                  
 13336 00001AD7 89F7                    	mov	di,si
 13337 00001AD9 83FEFF                  	cmp	si,-1		;local SFT available?
 13338 00001ADC 7517                    	jnz	short gotSFT	;yes, return it
 13339                                  
 13340                                  	;No local SFT, see if we got a net/Share SFT
 13341                                  
 13342 00001ADE 89EF                    	mov	di,bp
 13343 00001AE0 83FDFF                  	cmp	bp,-1		;net/Share SFT available?
 13344 00001AE3 7530                    	jnz	short gotnetSFT	;yes, return it
 13345                                  noSFT:
 13346                                  	; NB: This error should never occur. We always must have an LRU SFT. 
 13347                                  	; This error can occur only if the SFT has been corrupted or the LRU 
 13348                                  	; count is not maintained properly.
 13349                                  
 13350 00001AE5 EB51                    	jmp	short errorbadSFT ;error, no FCB available.
 13351                                  
 13352                                  	; Handle the LRU for net/Share SFTs
 13353                                  lru5:
 13354                                  	;cmp	[es:di+15h],dx
 13355 00001AE7 26395515                	cmp	[es:di+sf_LRU],dx ;SFT.LRU < min?
 13356 00001AEB 73E5                    	jae	short lru4	;no, skip 
 13357                                  
 13358                                  	;mov	dx,[es:di+15h]
 13359 00001AED 268B5515                	mov	dx,[es:di+sf_LRU] ;yes, store new minimum
 13360                                  
 13361 00001AF1 89FD                    	mov	bp,di		;store SFT position
 13362 00001AF3 EBDD                    	jmp	short lru4	;continue with next SFT
 13363                                  
 13364                                  gotSFT:
 13365 00001AF5 08C0                    	or	al,al
 13366 00001AF7 74C1                    	jz	short hackpoint	;save es:di in LocalSFT
 13367                                  
 13368                                  	; HACK!!!
 13369                                  	; The code here differs from the code at 'hackpoint' only in the 
 13370                                  	; order of the check for al. If al = 0, we can jump to 'hackpoint' 
 13371                                  	; and then from there jump out to 'gotlocalSFT'. The original code 
 13372                                  	; has been commented out below and replaced by the code just above.
 13373                                  
 13374                                  ;If regen, then this SFT can be registered as a local one ( even if free ).
 13375                                  ;
 13376                                  ;	or	al,al		  ;Regen?
 13377                                  ;	jnz	short notlocaluse ;yes, register it and return
 13378                                  ;
 13379                                  ;Register this SFT as a local one
 13380                                  ;
 13381                                  ;	mov	[LocalSFT],di
 13382                                  ;	mov	[LocalSFT+2],es
 13383                                  ;	jmp	gotlocalSFT	;return to caller
 13384                                  ;
 13385                                  ;notlocaluse:
 13386                                  
 13387                                  	; The caller is probably going to use this SFT for a net/Share file. 
 13388                                  	; We will come here only on a Open/Create when the caller($FCB_OPEN) 
 13389                                  	; does not really know whether it is a local file or not. We 
 13390                                  	; invalidate LocalSFT if the SFT we are going to use was previously 
 13391                                  	; registered as a local SFT that can be recycled.
 13392                                  
 13393 00001AF9 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 13394 00001AFB 393E[8910]              	cmp	[LocalSFT],di		;Offset same?
 13395 00001AFF 7506                    	jne	short notinvalid
 13396 00001B01 3906[8B10]              	cmp	[LocalSFT+2],ax		;Segments same?
 13397 00001B05 7403                    	je	short zerolocalSFT	;no, no need to invalidate
 13398                                  notinvalid:
 13399 00001B07 E978FF                  	jmp	gotlocalSFT
 13400                                  
 13401                                  	; The SFT we are going to use was registered in the LocalSFT variable. 
 13402                                  	; Invalidate this variable i.e LocalSFT = NULL
 13403                                  
 13404                                  zerolocalSFT:
 13405 00001B0A 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax ; 0
 13406 00001B0C A3[8910]                	mov	[LocalSFT],ax
 13407 00001B0F A3[8B10]                	mov	[LocalSFT+2],ax
 13408                                  
 13409 00001B12 E96DFF                  	jmp	gotlocalSFT
 13410                                  
 13411                                  gotnetSFT:
 13412                                  	; We have an SFT that is currently net/Share. If it is going to be 
 13413                                  	; used for a regen, we know it has to be a local SFT. Update the 
 13414                                  	; LocalSFT variable
 13415                                  
 13416 00001B15 08C0                    	or	al,al
 13417 00001B17 7508                    	jnz	short closenet
 13418                                  
 13419 00001B19 893E[8910]              	mov	[LocalSFT],di
 13420 00001B1D 8C06[8B10]              	mov	[LocalSFT+2],es	;store local SFT address
 13421                                  closenet:
 13422 00001B21 893E[9E05]              	mov	[THISSFT],di	; set thissft
 13423 00001B25 8C06[A005]              	mov	[THISSFT+2],es	
 13424                                  
 13425                                  	; If we have sharing or thisSFT is a net sft, then close it until ref 
 13426                                  	; count is 0.
 13427                                  	; NB: We come here only if it is a net/Share SFT that is going to be 
 13428                                  	; recycled -- no need to check for this.
 13429                                  
 13430                                  LRUClose:
 13431 00001B29 26833D00                	cmp	word [es:di],0
 13432                                  	;cmp	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],0 ; is ref count still <> 0?
 13433 00001B2D 740C                    	jz	short LRUDone	; nope, all done
 13434                                  
 13435 00001B2F E80F15                  	call	DOS_CLOSE
 13436 00001B32 73F5                    	jnc	short LRUClose	; no error => clean up
 13437                                  
 13438                                  	; Bugbug: I dont know why we are trying to close after we get an 
 13439                                  	; error closing. Seems like we could have a potential infinite loop  
 13440                                  	; here. This has to be verified.
 13441                                  
 13442 00001B34 3C06                    	cmp	al,error_invalid_handle ; 6
 13443 00001B36 74F1                    	je	short LRUClose
 13444                                  errorbadSFT:
 13445 00001B38 F9                      	stc
 13446 00001B39 EB05                    	JMP	short LRUDead
 13447                                  LRUDone:
 13448 00001B3B 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL
 13449 00001B3D E80E01                  	call	BlastSFT		; fill SFT with 0 (AL), 'C' cleared
 13450                                  
 13451                                  LRUDead:
 13452 00001B40 E8FEE8                  	call	restore_world		; use macro
 13453                                  	
 13454 00001B43 07                      	pop	es ; * (MSDOS 6.21)
 13455                                  
 13456                                  	;getdseg <es>
 13457 00001B44 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 13458 00001B49 26C43E[9E05]            	les	di,[es:THISSFT]		;es:di points at allocated SFT
 13459                                  
 13460                                  	;;retnc
 13461                                  	;jc	short LruFCB_err
 13462                                  	;retn
 13463                                  
 13464                                  	; 16/12/2022
 13465                                  	; 08/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 13466 00001B4E 7302                    	jnc	short LruFCB_retn
 13467                                  	;jc	short LruFCB_err
 13468                                  	;retn
 13469                                  		
 13470                                  LruFCB_err:
 13471 00001B50 B023                    	MOV	AL,error_FCB_unavailable ; 23h
 13472                                  LruFCB_retn:
 13473 00001B52 C3                      	retn
 13474                                  	
 13475                                  ;LruFCB	ENDP

 13479                                  ; DOSCODE:58F3h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 13480                                  
 13481                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13482                                  ;**** RegenCopyName -- This function copies the filename from the FCB to
 13483                                  ; SFT and also to DOS local buffers. There was duplicate code in FCBRegen
 13484                                  ; to copy the name to different destinations
 13485                                  ;
 13486                                  ; Inputs: ds:si = source string
 13487                                  ;	 es:di = destination string
 13488                                  ;	 cx = length of string
 13489                                  ;
 13490                                  ; Outputs: String copied to destination
 13491                                  ;
 13492                                  ; Registers affected: cx,di,si
 13493                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13494                                  
 13495                                  RegenCopyName:
 13496                                  CopyName:
 13497 00001B53 AC                      	lodsb			;load character
 13498 00001B54 E8FC35                  	call	UCase		; convert char to upper case
 13499                                  StuffChar2:
 13500 00001B57 AA                      	STOSB			;store converted character
 13501 00001B58 E2F9                    	LOOP	CopyName	;
 13502                                  DoneName:
 13503 00001B5A C3                      	retn
 13504                                  
 13505                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13506                                  
 13507                                  	; 09/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 13508                                  FCBRegen:
 13509                                  	; called from SFTFromFCB. SS already DOSDATA
 13510                                  
 13511                                  	; General data filling. Mode is sf_isFCB + open_for_both, date/time 
 13512                                  	; we do not fill, size we do no fill, position we do not fill,
 13513                                  	; bit 14 of flags = TRUE, other bits = FALSE
 13514                                  
 13515                                  	;mov	al,[si+19h]
 13516 00001B5B 8A4419                  	MOV	AL,[SI+fcb_l_drive]
 13517                                  
 13518                                  	; We discriminate based on the first two bits in the reserved field.
 13519                                  	
 13520                                  	;test	al,80h
 13521 00001B5E A880                    	test	AL,FCBSPECIAL		; check for no sharing test
 13522 00001B60 741C                    	JZ	short RegenNoSharing	; yes, go regen from no sharing
 13523                                  
 13524                                  	; The FCB is for a network or a sharing based system. At this point 
 13525                                  	; we have already closed the SFT for this guy and reconnection is 
 13526                                  	; impossible.
 13527                                  	;
 13528                                  	; Remember that he may have given us a FCB with bogus information in
 13529                                  	; it. Check to see if sharing is present or if the redir is present.
 13530                                  	; If either is around, presume that we have cycled out the FCB and 
 13531                                  	; give the hard error. Otherwise, just return with carry set.
 13532                                  
 13533 00001B62 E80E59                  	call	CheckShare		; test for sharer
 13534 00001B65 7509                    	JNZ	short RegenFail		; yep, fail this.
 13535                                  	
 13536                                  	;mov	ax,1100h
 13537 00001B67 B80011                  	MOV	AX,MultNET<<8		; install check on multnet
 13538 00001B6A CD2F                    	int     2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - INSTALLATION CHECK
 13539                                  			; Return: AL = 00h  not installed, OK to install
 13540                                  			; 01h  not installed, not OK to install
 13541                                  			; FFh  installed
 13542 00001B6C 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL			; is it there?
 13543 00001B6E 740C                    	JZ	short RegenDead		; no, just fail the operation
 13544                                  RegenFail:
 13545                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 13546                                  	;MOV	AX,[CS:USER_IN_AX]	; SS override
 13547 00001B70 36A1[3A03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_IN_AX] ; MSDOS 6.0
 13548                                  
 13549                                  	;cmp	ah,10h
 13550 00001B74 80FC10                  	cmp	AH,FCB_CLOSE
 13551 00001B77 7403                    	jz	short RegenDead
 13552 00001B79 E89301                  	call	FCBHardErr		; massive hard error.
 13553                                  RegenDead:
 13554 00001B7C F9                      	STC				; carry set
 13555                                  FCBRegen_retn:
 13556 00001B7D C3                      	retn
 13557                                  
 13558                                  	; Local FCB without sharing. Check to see if sharing is loaded. If 
 13559                                  	; so fail the operation.
 13560                                  
 13561                                  RegenNoSharing:
 13562 00001B7E E8F258                  	call	CheckShare		; Sharing around?
 13563 00001B81 75ED                    	JNZ	short RegenFail
 13564                                  	
 13565                                  	; Find an SFT for this guy.
 13566                                  	
 13567                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 13568                                  
 13569                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 13570                                  	;call	LRUFCB
 13571                                  	;jc	short FCBRegen_retn
 13572                                  	
 13573                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 13574 00001B83 50                      	push	ax
 13575 00001B84 B000                    	mov	al,0			;indicate it is a regen operation
 13576 00001B86 E8DEFE                  	call	LRUFCB
 13577 00001B89 58                      	pop	ax
 13578 00001B8A 72F1                    	jc	short FCBRegen_retn
 13579                                  
 13580                                  	;mov	word [es:di+2],8002h
 13581 00001B8C 26C745020280            	MOV	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode],sf_isFCB+open_for_both+SHARING_COMPAT
 13582 00001B92 243F                    	AND	AL,3Fh			; get drive number for flags
 13583 00001B94 98                      	CBW
 13584                                  	;or	ax,4000h
 13585 00001B95 0D0040                  	OR	AX,sf_close_nodate	; normal FCB operation
 13586                                  
 13587                                  	; The bits field consists of the upper two bits (dirty and device) 
 13588                                  	; from the SFT and the low 4 bits from the open mode.
 13589                                  
 13590                                  	;mov	cl,[si+1Ah]
 13591 00001B98 8A4C1A                  	MOV	CL,[SI+fcb_nsl_bits]	; stick in dirty bits.
 13592 00001B9B 88CD                    	MOV	CH,CL
 13593 00001B9D 80E5C0                  	AND	CH,0C0h 		; mask off the dirty/device bits
 13594 00001BA0 08E8                    	OR	AL,CH
 13595                                  	;and	cl,0Fh
 13596 00001BA2 80E10F                  	AND	CL,access_mask		; get the mode bits
 13597                                  	;mov	[es:di+2],cl
 13598 00001BA5 26884D02                	MOV	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode],CL
 13599                                  	;mov	[es:di+5],ax
 13600 00001BA9 26894505                	MOV	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],AX ; initial flags
 13601                                  	;MOV	AX,[CS:PROC_ID]		; SS override
 13602 00001BAD 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[ss:PROC_ID] ; MSDOS 6.0
 13603                                  	;mov	[es:di+31h],ax
 13604 00001BB1 26894531                	MOV	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],AX
 13605 00001BB5 1E                      	push	ds
 13606 00001BB6 56                      	push	si
 13607 00001BB7 06                      	push	es

 13609 00001BB9 16                      	push	ss
 13610 00001BBA 07                      	pop	es

 13612

 13614 00001BC1 46                      	INC	SI			; Skip past drive byte to name in FCB
 13615                                  
 13616                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 13617                                  ;RegenCopyName:
 13618                                  	;lodsb
 13619                                  	;call	UCase
 13620                                  	;stosb
 13621                                  	;loop	RegenCopyName

 13630 00001BC7 C606[6B05]16            	MOV	byte [ATTRIB],attr_hidden+attr_system+attr_directory

 13638 00001BD3 7219                    	JC	short RegenFileNoSharing ; not found on device list => file
 13639

 13641

 13644                                  	;mov	byte [es:di+4],0

 13646                                  					; SS override
 13647                                  	;LDS	SI,[CS:DEVPT]		; get device driver

 13649                                  	;mov	[es:di+7],si
 13650 00001BE3 26897507                	MOV	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_devptr],SI

 13653 00001BEB C3                      	retn				; carry is clear
 13654                                  
 13655                                  RegenDeadJ:
 13656 00001BEC EB8E                    	JMP	short RegenDead
 13657                                  
 13658                                  	; File found. Just copy in the remaining pieces.
 13659                                  
 13660                                  RegenFileNoSharing:
 13661                                  	;mov	ax,[es:di+5]
 13662 00001BEE 268B4505                	MOV	AX,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags]

 13673 00001C04 72E6                    	jc	short RegenDeadJ	; if find DPB fails, then drive
 13674                                  					; indicator was bogus

 13676 00001C06 8B441D                  	MOV	AX,[SI+fcb_nsl_dirsec]

 13680                                  
 13681                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 13682                                  
 13683                                  	; SR;
 13684                                  	; Extract the read-only and archive bits from the top 2 bits of the sector
 13685                                  	; number
 13686                                  
 13687                                  	;mov	al,[si+18h]
 13688 00001C0D 8A4418                  	mov	al,[si+fcb_sfn]

 13690 00001C12 88C4                    	mov	ah,al
 13691 00001C14 D0C4                    	rol	ah,1

 13748                                  ;**	BlastSFT - FIll SFT with Garbage
 13749                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13750                                  ;	BlastSFT is used when an SFT is no longer needed; it's called with
 13751                                  ;	various garbage values to put into the SFT.  I don't know why,
 13752                                  ;	presumably to help with debugging (jgl).  We clear the few fields
 13753                                  ;	necessary to show that the SFT is free after filling it.
 13754                                  ;
 13755                                  ;	ENTRY	(es:di) = address of SFT
 13756                                  ;		(al) = fill character
 13757                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = -1
 13758                                  ;		'C' clear
 13759                                  ;	USES	AX, CX, Flags
 13760                                  
 13761                                  BlastSFT:
 13762 00001C4E 57                      	push	di
 13763                                  	;mov	cx,53 ; MSDOS 3.3
 13764                                  	;mov	cx,59 ; MSDOS 6.0
 13765 00001C4F B93B00                  	mov	cx,SF_ENTRY.size
 13766 00001C52 F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 13767 00001C54 5F                      	pop	di
 13768 00001C55 29C0                    	sub	ax,ax	; 0		; clear 'C'-----------------;
 13769 00001C57 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax
 13770                                  	;mov	[es:di+SFT_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],ax ; set ref count   ;
 13771                                  	;mov	[es:di+15h],ax
 13772 00001C5A 26894515                	mov	[es:di+sf_LRU],ax	; set lru		    ;
 13773 00001C5E 48                      	dec	ax	; -1					    ;
 13774                                  	;mov	[es:di+17h],ax ; 0FFFFh ; -1
 13775 00001C5F 26894517                	mov	[es:di+sf_OpenAge],ax	; set open age to -1	    ;
 13776                                  BlastSFT_retn:
 13777 00001C63 C3                      	retn				; return with 'C' clear     ;
 13778                                  
 13779                                  ;Break	<CheckFCB - see if the SFT pointed to by the FCB is still OK>
 13780                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13781                                  ;
 13782                                  ;   CheckFCB - examine an FCB and its contents to see if it needs to be
 13783                                  ;   regenerated.
 13784                                  ;
 13785                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI point to FCB (not extended)
 13786                                  ;		AL is SFT index
 13787                                  ;   Outputs:	Carry Set - FCB needs to be regened
 13788                                  ;		Carry clear - FCB is OK. ES:DI point to SFT
 13789                                  ;   Registers modified: AX and BX
 13790                                  ;
 13791                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13792                                  
 13793                                  	; 09/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 13794                                  	; DOSCODE:59F0h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 13795                                  CheckFCB:
 13796                                  		
 13797                                  	; called from $fcb_open and sftfromfcb. SS already set up to DOSDATA
 13798                                  
 13799                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 13800                                  
 13801                                  	; LES	DI,[CS:SFTFCB]
 13802                                  
 13803                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 13804                                  	
 13805                                  	; SR;
 13806                                  	; We check if the given FCB is for a local file. If so, we return a 
 13807                                  	; bad SFT status forcing the caller to regenerate the SFT.
 13808                                  
 13809                                  	;test	byte [si+19h],0C0h
 13810 00001C64 F64419C0                	test	byte [si+fcb_l_drive],FCBNETWORK|FCBSHARE|FCBDEVICE
 13811 00001C68 744F                    	jz	short BadSFT		;Local file, return bad SFT
 13812 00001C6A 36C43E[4000]            	LES     DI,[SS:SFTFCB]		; SS override
 13813                                  
 13814                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 13815                                  	;cmp	[es:di+4],al
 13816 00001C6F 26384504                	CMP	[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount],AL
 13817 00001C73 7244                    	JC	short BadSFT

 13819                                  	;mov	bl,59 ; MSDOS 6.0
 13820 00001C75 B33B                    	MOV	BL,SF_ENTRY.size
 13821 00001C77 F6E3                    	MUL	BL
 13822                                  	;lea	di,[di+6]
 13823 00001C79 8D7D06                  	LEA	DI,[DI+SFT.SFTable]
 13824 00001C7C 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX
 13825                                  	;MOV	AX,[CS:PROC_ID]	; MSDOS 3.3
 13826 00001C7E 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID] ; MSDOS 6.0  ; SS override
 13827                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 13828 00001C82 26394531                	CMP	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],AX
 13829 00001C86 7531                    	JNZ	short BadSFT		; must match process
 13830 00001C88 26833D00                	cmp	word [es:di],0
 13831                                  	;CMP	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],0
 13832 00001C8C 742B                    	JZ	short BadSFT		; must also be in use
 13833                                  	;mov	al,[si+19h]
 13834 00001C8E 8A4419                  	MOV	AL,[SI+fcb_l_drive]
 13835                                  	;test	al,80h
 13836 00001C91 A880                    	test	AL,FCBSPECIAL		; a special FCB?
 13837 00001C93 7430                    	JZ	short CheckNoShare	; No. try local or device
 13838                                  
 13839                                  	; Since we are a special FCB, try NOT to use a bogus test instruction.
 13840                                  	; FCBSHARE is a superset of FCBNETWORK.
 13841                                  
 13842 00001C95 50                      	PUSH	AX
 13843                                  	;and	al,0C0h
 13844 00001C96 24C0                    	AND	AL,FCBMASK
 13845                                  	;cmp	al,0C0h
 13846 00001C98 3CC0                    	CMP	AL,FCBSHARE		; net FCB?
 13847 00001C9A 58                      	POP	AX
 13848 00001C9B 751E                    	JNZ	short CheckNet		; yes
 13849                                  ;
 13850                                  ;----- In share support -----
 13851                                  ;
 13852                                  	;call	far [cs:JShare+(11*4)]
 13853 00001C9D 36FF1E[BC00]            	Call    far [ss:JShare+(11*4)] ; 11 = ShChk ; SS Override
 13854 00001CA2 7215                    	JC	short BadSFT
 13855 00001CA4 EB06                    	JMP	SHORT CheckD
 13856                                  ;
 13857                                  ;----- End in share support -----
 13858                                  ;
 13859                                  	; 09/11/2022
 13860                                  	; (There is not any procedure/sub
 13861                                  	;  which calls or jumps to CheckFirClus here)
 13862                                  	;;;
 13863                                  CheckFirClus:
 13864                                  	;cmp     bx,[es:di+0Bh]
 13865                                  	; 07/12/2022
 13866 00001CA6 263B5D0B                	CMP	BX,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_firclus]
 13867 00001CAA 750D                    	JNZ	short BadSFT
 13868                                  	;;;
 13869                                  CheckD: 
 13870 00001CAC 243F                    	AND	AL,3Fh
 13871                                  	;mov	ah,[es:di+5]

 13873 00001CB2 80E43F                  	AND	AH,3Fh
 13874 00001CB5 38C4                    	CMP	AH,AL

 13876 00001CB7 74AA                    	jz	short BlastSFT_retn	; carry is clear
 13877                                  	; 09/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 13878                                  	;jnz	short BadSFT
 13879                                  ;CheckD_retn:
 13880                                  	;retn
 13881                                  BadSFT: 
 13882 00001CB9 F9                      	STC
 13883 00001CBA C3                      	retn

 13898                                  	;jnz     short BadSFT

 13901                                  	;;cmp	ax,[es:di+1Bh]

 13986                                  ;Break	<SFTFromFCB - take a FCB and obtain a SFT from it>
 13987                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13988                                  ;
 13989                                  ;   SFTFromFCB - the workhorse of this compatability crap. Check to see if
 13990                                  ;	the SFT for the FCB is Good. If so, make ThisSFT point to it. If not
 13991                                  ;	good, get one from the cache and regenerate it. Overlay the LRU field
 13992                                  ;	with PID
 13993                                  ;
 13994                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI point to FCB
 13995                                  ;   Outputs:	ThisSFT point to appropriate SFT
 13996                                  ;		Carry clear -> OK ES:DI -> SFT
 13997                                  ;		Carry set -> error in ax
 13998                                  ;   Registers modified: ES,DI, AX
 13999                                  ;
 14000                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14001                                  
 14002                                  SFTFromFCB:
 14003                                  	; called from fcbio and $fcb_close. SS already set up to DOSDATA
 14004                                  
 14005                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14006                                  
 14007 00001CD9 50                      	push	ax
 14008 00001CDA 53                      	push	bx
 14009                                  	;mov	al,[si+18h]
 14010 00001CDB 8A4418                  	MOV	AL,[SI+fcb_sfn] 	; set SFN for check
 14011 00001CDE E883FF                  	call	CheckFCB
 14012 00001CE1 5B                      	pop	bx
 14013 00001CE2 58                      	pop	ax
 14014                                  	;MOV	[CS:THISSFT],DI		; SS override
 14015                                  	;MOV	[CS:THISSFT+2],ES
 14016 00001CE3 36893E[9E05]            	MOV	[SS:THISSFT],DI		; SS override
 14017 00001CE8 368C06[A005]            	MOV	[SS:THISSFT+2],ES
 14018 00001CED 7311                    	JNC	short Set_SFT		; no problems, just set thissft
 14019                                  	
 14020                                  	; 09/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0)
 14021                                  	; 31/05/2019
 14022 00001CEF 06                      	push	es ; * (MSDOS 6.21) & (MSDOS 5.0)
 14023 00001CF0 E865E7                  	call	save_world
 14024 00001CF3 E865FE                  	call	FCBRegen
 14025 00001CF6 E848E7                  	call	restore_world		; use macro restore world
 14026 00001CF9 07                      	pop	es ; * (MSDOS 6.21) ; 31/05/2019 ; 09/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0)	
 14027                                  
 14028                                  	;MOV	AX,[CS:EXTERR]		; SS override
 14029 00001CFA 36A1[2403]              	MOV	AX,[SS:EXTERR]		; SS override
 14030 00001CFE 72C4                    	jc	short CheckNet_retn
 14031                                  
 14032                                  Set_SFT: 
 14033                                  	;LES	DI,[CS:THISSFT]		; SS override for THISSFT & PROC_ID
 14034 00001D00 36C43E[9E05]            	les	di,[ss:THISSFT]
 14035                                  	;PUSH	word [CS:PROC_ID]	; set process id
 14036 00001D05 36FF36[3C03]            	push	word [ss:PROC_ID]
 14037                                  	;pop	word [es:di+31h]
 14038 00001D0A 268F4531                	POP     word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID]
 14039 00001D0E C3                      	retn				; carry is clear
 14040                                  
 14041                                  ;Break	<FCBHardErr - generate INT 24 for hard errors on FCBS>
 14042                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14043                                  ;
 14044                                  ;   FCBHardErr - signal to a user app that he is trying to use an
 14045                                  ;	unavailable FCB.
 14046                                  ;
 14047                                  ;   Inputs:	none.
 14048                                  ;   Outputs:	none.
 14049                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 14050                                  ;
 14051                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14052                                  
 14053                                  FCBHardErr:
 14054                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14055 00001D0F 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 14056                                  	;
 14057                                  	;mov	ax,23h
 14058 00001D14 B82300                  	MOV	AX,error_FCB_unavailable
 14059                                  	;;mov	byte [cs:ALLOWED],8
 14060                                  	;MOV	byte [CS:ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL
 14061 00001D17 26C606[4B03]08          	mov	byte [es:ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL	
 14062                                  	
 14063                                  	;LES	BP,[CS:THISDPB]
 14064 00001D1D 26C42E[8A05]            	les	bp,[es:THISDPB]
 14065                                  	
 14066 00001D22 BF0100                  	MOV	DI,1			; Fake some registers
 14067 00001D25 89F9                    	MOV	CX,DI
 14068                                  	;mov	dx,[es:bp+0Bh]
 14069 00001D27 268B560B                	MOV	DX,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_SECTOR]
 14070 00001D2B E8E336                  	call	HARDERR
 14071 00001D2E F9                      	STC
