 15768                                  ;============================================================================
 15769                                  ; IOCTL.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 15770                                  ;============================================================================
 15771                                  ; 07/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 15772                                  ; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15773                                  
 15774                                  ;**	IOCTL system call.
 15775                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15776                                  ;	$IOCTL
 15777                                  ;
 15778                                  ;	  Revision history:
 15779                                  ;
 15780                                  ;		Created: ARR 4 April 1983
 15781                                  ;
 15782                                  ;		GenericIOCTL added:		KGS	22 April 1985
 15783                                  ;
 15784                                  ;		A000	version 4.00	Jan. 1988
 15785                                  ;
 15786                                  ;		Used jump table to dispatch IOCTL functions. HKN 3/12/90
 15787                                  ;
 15788                                  
 15789                                  ;BREAK <IOCTL - munge on a handle to do device specific stuff>
 15790                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15791                                  ;
 15792                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 15793                                  ;	    MOV     BX, Handle
 15794                                  ;	    MOV     DX, Data
 15795                                  ;
 15796                                  ;	(or LDS     DX,BUF
 15797                                  ;	    MOV     CX,COUNT)
 15798                                  ;
 15799                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Ioctl
 15800                                  ;	    MOV     AL, Request
 15801                                  ;	    INT     21h
 15802                                  ;
 15803                                  ;   AH = 0  Return a combination of low byte of sf_flags and device driver
 15804                                  ;	    attribute word in DX, handle in BX:
 15805                                  ;	    DH = high word of device driver attributes
 15806                                  ;	    DL = low byte of sf_flags
 15807                                  ;	 1  Set the bits contained in DX to sf_flags.  DH MUST be 0.  Handle
 15808                                  ;	    in BX.
 15809                                  ;	 2  Read CX bytes from the device control channel for handle in BX
 15810                                  ;	    into DS:DX.  Return number read in AX.
 15811                                  ;	 3  Write CX bytes to the device control channel for handle in BX from
 15812                                  ;	    DS:DX.  Return bytes written in AX.
 15813                                  ;	 4  Read CX bytes from the device control channel for drive in BX
 15814                                  ;	    into DS:DX.  Return number read in AX.
 15815                                  ;	 5  Write CX bytes to the device control channel for drive in BX from
 15816                                  ;	    DS:DX.  Return bytes written in AX.
 15817                                  ;	 6  Return input status of handle in BX. If a read will go to the
 15818                                  ;	    device, AL = 0FFh, otherwise 0.
 15819                                  ;	 7  Return output status of handle in BX. If a write will go to the
 15820                                  ;	    device, AL = 0FFh, otherwise 0.
 15821                                  ;	 8  Given a drive in BX, return 1 if the device contains non-
 15822                                  ;	    removable media, 0 otherwise.
 15823                                  ;	 9  Return the contents of the device attribute word in DX for the
 15824                                  ;	    drive in BX.  0200h is the bit for shared.	1000h is the bit for
 15825                                  ;	    network. 8000h is the bit for local use.
 15826                                  ;	 A  Return 8000h if the handle in BX is for the network or not.
 15827                                  ;	 B  Change the retry delay and the retry count for the system. BX is
 15828                                  ;	    the count and CX is the delay.
 15829                                  ;
 15830                                  ;   Error returns:
 15831                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 15832                                  ;	       = error_invalid_function
 15833                                  ;	       = error_invalid_data
 15834                                  ;
 15835                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15836                                  ;
 15837                                  ;   This is the documentation copied from DOS 4.0 it is much better
 15838                                  ;   than the above
 15839                                  ;
 15840                                  ;	There are several basic forms of IOCTL calls:
 15841                                  ;
 15842                                  ;
 15843                                  ;	** Get/Set device information:	**
 15844                                  ;
 15845                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 15846                                  ;		  0 - Get device information
 15847                                  ;		  1 - Set device information
 15848                                  ;		(BX) = file handle
 15849                                  ;		(DX) = info for "Set Device Information"
 15850                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 15851                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 15852                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 15853                                  ;		  (DX) = info for "Get Device Information"
 15854                                  ;	USES	ALL
 15855                                  ;
 15856                                  ;
 15857                                  ;	**  Read/Write Control Data From/To Handle  **
 15858                                  ;
 15859                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 15860                                  ;		  2 - Read device control info
 15861                                  ;		  3 - Write device control info
 15862                                  ;		(BX) = file handle
 15863                                  ;		(CX) = transfer count
 15864                                  ;		(DS:DX) = address for data
 15865                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 15866                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 15867                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 15868                                  ;		  (AX) = count of bytes transfered
 15869                                  ;	USES	ALL
 15870                                  ;
 15871                                  ;
 15872                                  ;	**  Read/Write Control Data From/To Block Device  **
 15873                                  ;
 15874                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 15875                                  ;		  4 - Read device control info
 15876                                  ;		  5 - Write device control info
 15877                                  ;		(BL) = Drive number (0=default, 1='A', 2='B', etc)
 15878                                  ;		(CX) = transfer count
 15879                                  ;		(DS:DX) = address for data
 15880                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 15881                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 15882                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 15883                                  ;		  (AX) = count of bytes transfered
 15884                                  ;	USES	ALL
 15885                                  ;
 15886                                  ;
 15887                                  ;	**  Get Input/Output Status  **
 15888                                  ;
 15889                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 15890                                  ;		  6 - Get Input status
 15891                                  ;		  7 - Get Output Status
 15892                                  ;		(BX) = file handle
 15893                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 15894                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 15895                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 15896                                  ;		  (AL) = 00 if not ready
 15897                                  ;		  (AL) = FF if ready
 15898                                  ;	USES	ALL
 15899                                  ;
 15900                                  ;
 15901                                  ;	**  Get Drive Information  **
 15902                                  ;
 15903                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 15904                                  ;		  8 - Check for removable media
 15905                                  ;		  9 - Get device attributes
 15906                                  ;		(BL) = Drive number (0=default, 1='A', 2='B', etc)
 15907                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 15908                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 15909                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 15910                                  ;		  (AX) = 0/1 media is removable/fixed (func. 8)
 15911                                  ;		  (DX) = device attribute word (func. 9)
 15912                                  ;	USES	ALL
 15913                                  ;
 15914                                  ;
 15915                                  ;	**  Get Redirected bit	**
 15916                                  ;
 15917                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 15918                                  ;		  0Ah - Network stuff
 15919                                  ;		(BX) = file handle
 15920                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 15921                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 15922                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 15923                                  ;		  (DX) = SFT flags word, 8000h set if network file
 15924                                  ;	USES	ALL
 15925                                  ;
 15926                                  ;
 15927                                  ;	**  Change sharer retry parameters  **
 15928                                  ;
 15929                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 15930                                  ;		  0Bh - Set retry parameters
 15931                                  ;		(CX) = retry loop count
 15932                                  ;		(DX) = number of retries
 15933                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 15934                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 15935                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 15936                                  ;	USES	ALL
 15937                                  ;
 15938                                  ;
 15939                                  ;   =================================================================
 15940                                  ;
 15941                                  ;	**  New Standard Control  **
 15942                                  ;
 15943                                  ;	ALL NEW IOCTL FACILITIES SHOULD USE THIS FORM.	THE OTHER
 15944                                  ;	FORMS ARE OBSOLETE.
 15945                                  ;
 15946                                  ;   =================================================================
 15947                                  ;
 15948                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 15949                                  ;		  0Ch - Control Function subcode
 15950                                  ;		(BX) = File Handle
 15951                                  ;		(CH) = Category Indicator
 15952                                  ;		(CL) = Function within category
 15953                                  ;		(DS:DX) = address for data, if any
 15954                                  ;		(SI) = Passed to device as argument, use depends upon function
 15955                                  ;		(DI) = Passed to device as argument, use depends upon function
 15956                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 15957                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 15958                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 15959                                  ;		  (SI) = Return value, meaning is function dependent
 15960                                  ;		  (DI) = Return value, meaning is function dependent
 15961                                  ;		  (DS:DX) = Return address, use is function dependent
 15962                                  ;	USES	ALL
 15963                                  ;
 15964                                  ;    ============== Generic IOCTL Definitions for DOS 3.2 ============
 15965                                  ;     (See inc\ioctl.inc for more info)
 15966                                  ;
 15967                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 15968                                  ;		  0Dh - Control Function subcode
 15969                                  ;		(BL) = Drive Number (0 = Default, 1= 'A')
 15970                                  ;		(CH) = Category Indicator
 15971                                  ;		(CL) = Function within category
 15972                                  ;		(DS:DX) = address for data, if any
 15973                                  ;		(SI) = Passed to device as argument, use depends upon function
 15974                                  ;		(DI) = Passed to device as argument, use depends upon function
 15975                                  ;
 15976                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 15977                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 15978                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 15979                                  ;		  (DS:DX) = Return address, use is function dependent
 15980                                  ;	USES	ALL
 15981                                  ;
 15982                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15983                                  	
 15984                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15985                                  	; DOSCODE:611Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 15986                                  
 15987                                  	; 11/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 15988                                  	; DOSCODE:610Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 15989

 16183                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16184                                  ;
 16185                                  ; Generic IOCTL entry point. AL = C, D, 10h, 11h
 16186                                  ;
 16187                                  ;	here we invoke the Generic IOCTL using the IOCTL_Req structure.
 16188                                  ;	SI:DX -> Users Device Parameter Table
 16189                                  ;	IOCALL -> IOCTL_Req structure
 16190                                  ;
 16191                                  ; 	If on entry AL >= IOCTL_QUERY_HANDLE the function is a
 16192                                  ;	QueryIOCtlSupport call ELSE it's a standard generic IOCtl
 16193                                  ;	call.
 16194                                  ;
 16195                                  ; BUGBUG: Don't push anything on the stack between GENERIOCTL: and 
 16196                                  ;         the call to Check_If_Net because Check_If_Net gets our
 16197                                  ;         return address off the stack if the drive is invalid.
 16198                                  ;
 16199                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16200                                  
 16201                                  query_handle_support:	; Entry point for handles
 16202                                  GENERICIOCTLHANDLE:
 16203 00002432 E87943                  	call	SFFromHandle		; Get SFT for device.
 16204 00002435 726F                    	jc	short ioctl_bad_handlej
 16205                                  
 16206                                  	;test	word [es:di+5],8000h
 16207                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],sf_isnet	; M031;
 16208                                  	;test	byte [es:di+6],80h
 16209 00002437 26F6450680              	test	byte [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags+1],(sf_isnet>>8)
 16210 0000243C 7563                    	jnz	short ioctl_bad_fun	; Cannot do this over net.
 16211                                  
 16212 0000243E C606[2303]04            	mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_SerDev ; 4
 16213                                  	;les	di,[es:di+7]
 16214 00002443 26C47D07                	les	di,[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_devptr]	; Get pointer to device.
 16215 00002447 EB0F                    	jmp	short Do_GenIOCTL
 16216                                  
 16217                                  query_device_support:	; Entry point for devices:
 16218                                  GENERICIOCTL:
 16219 00002449 C606[2303]02            	mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Disk ; 2
 16220 0000244E 80FD08                  	cmp	ch,IOC_DC ; 8		; Only disk devices are allowed to use
 16221 00002451 754E                    	jne	short ioctl_bad_fun	; no handles with Generic IOCTL.
 16222                                  
 16223 00002453 E88101                  	CALL	Check_If_Net		; ES:DI := Get_hdr_block of device in BL
 16224 00002456 7549                    	JNZ	short ioctl_bad_fun	; There are no "net devices", and they
 16225

 16542                                  ; Proc name : Get_Driver_BL
 16543                                  ;
 16544                                  ;	DS is DOSDATA

 16569                                  	;les	di,[es:di+13h]

 16571                                  got_dev_ptr:
 16572 000025D4 F8                      	CLC
 16573                                  ioctl_bad_drv:

 16575 000025D6 C3                      	retn

 16577                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16578                                  ; Proc Name : Check_If_Net:
 16579                                  ;
 16580                                  ;
 16581                                  ; Checks if the device is over the net or not. Returns result in ZERO flag.
 16582                                  ; If no device is found, the return address is popped off the stack, and a
 16583                                  ; jump is made to ioctl_drv_err.
 16584                                  ;
 16585                                  ; On Entry:
 16586                                  ; Registers same as those for Get_Driver_BL
 16587                                  ;
 16588                                  ; On Exit:
 16589                                  ; ZERO flag	- set if not a net device
 16590                                  ;		- reset if net device
 16591                                  ; ES:DI -> the device
 16592                                  ;
 16593                                  ;
 16594                                  ; BUGBUG: This function assumes the following stack setup on entry
 16595                                  ;
 16596                                  ;	  SP+2 -> Error return address
 16597                                  ;	  SP   -> Normal return address
 16598                                  ;
 16599                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16600                                  
 16601                                  Check_If_Net:
 16602                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 16603 000025D7 E8CFFF                  	CALL	Get_Driver_BL
 16604 000025DA 720E                    	JC	short ioctl_drv_err_pop	; invalid drive letter
 16605 000025DC 06                      	PUSH	ES
 16606 000025DD 57                      	PUSH	DI
 16607 000025DE C43E[A205]              	LES	DI,[THISCDS]
 16608                                  	;test	word [es:di+43h],8000h
 16609                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet
 16610                                  	;test	byte [es:di+44h],80h
 16611 000025E2 26F6454480              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],(curdir_isnet>>8)
 16612 000025E7 5F                      	POP	DI
 16613 000025E8 07                      	POP	ES
 16614 000025E9 C3                      	retn
 16615                                  
 16616                                  ioctl_drv_err_pop:
 16617 000025EA 58                      	pop	ax			; pop off return address
 16618 000025EB E941FF                  	jmp	ioctl_drv_err
 16619

 16621 000025EE E9B0FE                  	jmp	ioctl_bad_fun

 16624 000025F1 EBA2                    	jmp	short ioctl_string_err  ; 25/05/2019

 16688                                  ;	TITLE	DOS_DELETE - Internal DELETE call for MS-DOS
 16689                                  ;	NAME	DOS_DELETE
 16690                                  
 16691                                  ;
 16692                                  ;	Microsoft Confidential
 16693                                  ;	Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation 1991
 16694                                  ;	All Rights Reserved.
 16695                                  ;
 16696                                  
 16697                                  ;**	DELETE.ASM - Low level routine for deleting files
 16698                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16699                                  ;		DOS_DELETE
 16700                                  ;		REN_DEL_Check
 16701                                  ;		FastOpen_Delete	       ; DOS 3.3
 16702                                  ;		FastOpen_Update	       ; DOS 3.3
 16703                                  
 16704                                  ;   Revision history:
 16705                                  ;
 16706                                  ;   A000  version 4.00	Jan. 1988
 16707                                  ;   A001  Fastopen Rename fix	April 1989
 16708                                  
 16709                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 16710                                  
 16711                                  ;	i_need	NoSetDir,BYTE
 16712                                  ;	i_need	Creating,BYTE
 16713                                  ;	i_need	DELALL,BYTE
 16714                                  ;	i_need	THISDPB,DWORD
 16715                                  ;	i_need	THISSFT,DWORD
 16716                                  ;	i_need	THISCDS,DWORD
 16717                                  ;	i_need	CURBUF,DWORD
 16718                                  ;	i_need	ATTRIB,BYTE
 16719                                  ;	i_need	SATTRIB,BYTE
 16720                                  ;	i_need	WFP_START,WORD
 16721                                  ;	i_need	REN_WFP,WORD			 ;BN001
 16722                                  ;	i_need	NAME1,BYTE			 ;BN001
 16723                                  ;	i_need	FoundDel,BYTE
 16724                                  ;	i_need	AUXSTACK,BYTE
 16725                                  ;	i_need	VOLCHNG_FLAG,BYTE
 16726                                  ;	i_need	JShare,DWORD
 16727                                  ;	i_need	FastOpenTable,BYTE		  ; DOS 3.3
 16728                                  ;	i_need	FastTable,BYTE			  ; DOS 4.00
 16729                                  ;
 16730                                  ;	i_need	Del_ExtCluster,WORD		  ; DOS 4.00
 16731                                  ;
 16732                                  ;	i_need	SAVE_BX,WORD			  ; DOS 4.00
 16733                                  ;	i_need	DMAADD,DWORD
 16734                                  ;	i_need	RENAMEDMA,BYTE
 16735                                  
 16736                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16737                                  ;
 16738                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_DELETE
 16739                                  ;
 16740                                  ; Inputs:
 16741                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:/" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 16742                                  ;		terminated)
 16743                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 16744                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 16745                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 16746                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 16747                                  ;		(Low word = -1 if NUL CDS (Net direct request))
 16748                                  ;	[SATTRIB] Is attribute of search, determines what files can be found
 16749                                  ; Function:
 16750                                  ;	Delete the specified file(s)
 16751                                  ; Outputs:
 16752                                  ;	CARRY CLEAR
 16753                                  ;		OK
 16754                                  ;	CARRY SET
 16755                                  ;	    AX is error code
 16756                                  ;		error_file_not_found
 16757                                  ;			Last element of path not found
 16758                                  ;		error_path_not_found
 16759                                  ;			Bad path (not in curr dir part if present)
 16760                                  ;		error_bad_curr_dir
 16761                                  ;			Bad path in current directory part of path
 16762                                  ;		error_access_denied
 16763                                  ;			Attempt to delete device or directory
 16764                                  ;		***error_sharing_violation***
 16765                                  ;			Deny both access required, generates an INT 24.
 16766                                  ;			This error is NOT returned. The INT 24H is generated,
 16767                                  ;			  and the file is ignored (not deleted). Delete will
 16768                                  ;			  simply continue on looking for more files.
 16769                                  ;			  Carry will NOT be set in this case.
 16770                                  ; DS preserved, others destroyed
 16771                                  ;
 16772                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16773                                  
 16774                                  FILEFOUND   equ 01h
 16775                                  FILEDELETED equ 10h
 16776                                  
 16777                                  
 16778                                  	; 12/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 16779                                  	; DOSCODE:63E9h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 16780                                  
 16781                                  DOS_DELETE:
 16782                                  
 16783                                  ;hkn; DOS_Delete is called from file.asm and fcbio.asm. DS has been set up 
 16784                                  ;hkn; appropriately at this point.
 16785                                  
 16786 00002638 E8FFEC                  	call	TestNet
 16787 0000263B 7306                    	JNC	short LOCAL_DELETE
 16788                                  
 16789                                  ;IF NOT Installed
 16790                                  ;	transfer NET_DELETE
 16791                                  ;ELSE
 16792                                  	;MOV	AX,(MultNET SHL 8) | 19
 16793                                  	;INT	2FH
 16794                                  	;return
 16795                                  
 16796 0000263D B81311                  	mov	ax,1113h
 16797 00002640 CD2F                    	int     2Fh 	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - DELETE REMOTE FILE
 16798                                  			; SS = DS = DOS CS, SDA first filename pointer -> 
 16799                                  			;		fully-qualified filename in DOS CS
 16800                                  			; SDA CDS pointer -> current directory structure for drive with file
 16801                                  			; Return: CF set on error
 16802 00002642 C3                      	retn
 16803                                  ;ENDIF
 16804                                  
 16805                                  LOCAL_DELETE:
 16806 00002643 C606[6F05]00            	MOV	byte [FOUNDDEL],0	; No files found and no files deleted
 16807 00002648 E8B3ED                  	call	ECritDisk
 16808                                  	;mov	word [CREATING],0E500h
 16809 0000264B C706[7E05]00E5          	MOV	WORD [CREATING],DIRFREE*256+0 ; Assume not del *.*
 16810 00002651 8B36[B205]              	MOV	SI,[WFP_START]
 16811                                  SKPNUL:
 16812 00002655 AC                      	LODSB
 16813 00002656 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 16814 00002658 75FB                    	JNZ	short SKPNUL		; go to end
 16815 0000265A 83EE04                  	SUB	SI,4			; Back over possible "*.*"
 16816 0000265D 813C2A2E                	CMP	WORD [SI],2E2Ah ; "*."
 16817 00002661 7506                    	JNZ	short TEST_QUEST
 16818 00002663 807C022A                	CMP	BYTE [SI+2],"*"
 16819 00002667 741F                    	JZ	short CHECK_ATTS
 16820                                  TEST_QUEST:
 16821 00002669 83EE09                  	SUB	SI,9		; Back over possible "????????.???"
 16822 0000266C 87FE                    	XCHG	DI,SI
 16823                                  
 16824 0000266E 16                      	push	ss
 16825                                  	;pop	ds ; ! Retro DOS v3.0 BUG !
 16826 0000266F 07                      	pop	es ; 17/05/2019
 16827                                  
 16828 00002670 B83F3F                  	MOV	AX,"??" ; 3F3Fh
 16829 00002673 B90400                  	MOV	CX,4		; four sets of "??"
 16830 00002676 F3AF                    	REPE	SCASW
 16831 00002678 751C                    	JNZ	short NOT_ALL
 16832 0000267A 87FE                    	XCHG	DI,SI
 16833 0000267C AD                      	LODSW
 16834 0000267D 3D2E3F                  	CMP	AX,3F2Eh ; ".?"
 16835 00002680 7514                    	JNZ	short NOT_ALL
 16836 00002682 AD                      	LODSW
 16837 00002683 3D3F3F                  	CMP	AX,"??"
 16838 00002686 750E                    	JNZ	short NOT_ALL
 16839                                  CHECK_ATTS:
 16840 00002688 A0[6D05]                	MOV	AL,[SATTRIB]
 16841                                  	;and	al,1Fh
 16842 0000268B 241F                    	AND	AL,attr_hidden+attr_system+attr_directory+attr_volume_id+attr_read_only
 16843                                  					; Look only at hidden bits
 16844                                  	;cmp	al,1Fh
 16845 0000268D 3C1F                    	CMP	AL,attr_hidden+attr_system+attr_directory+attr_volume_id+attr_read_only
 16846                                  					; All must be set
 16847 0000268F 7505                    	JNZ	short NOT_ALL
 16848                                  
 16849                                  ; NOTE WARNING DANGER-----
 16850                                  ;    This DELALL stuff is not safe. It allows directories to be deleted.
 16851                                  ;	It should ONLY be used by FORMAT in the ROOT directory.
 16852                                  
 16853 00002691 C606[7F05]00            	MOV	byte [DELALL],0		; DEL *.* - flag deleting all
 16854                                  NOT_ALL:
 16855 00002696 C606[4C03]01            	MOV	byte [NoSetDir],1
 16856 0000269B E89519                  	call	GetPathNoSet
 16857 0000269E 7312                    	JNC	short Del_found
 16858 000026A0 750B                    	JNZ	short _bad_path
 16859 000026A2 08C9                    	OR	CL,CL
 16860 000026A4 7407                    	JZ	short _bad_path
 16861                                  No_file:
 16862 000026A6 B80200                  	MOV	AX,error_file_not_found
 16863                                  ErrorReturn:
 16864 000026A9 F9                      	STC
 16865                                  	;call	LCritDisk
 16866                                  	;retn
 16867                                  	; 18/12/2022
 16868 000026AA E96CED                  	jmp	LCritDisk
 16869                                  
 16870                                  _bad_path:
 16871 000026AD B80300                  	MOV	AX,error_path_not_found
 16872 000026B0 EBF7                    	JMP	short ErrorReturn
 16873                                  
 16874                                  Del_found:
 16875 000026B2 750C                    	JNZ	short NOT_DIR		; Check for dir specified
 16876 000026B4 803E[7F05]00            	CMP	byte [DELALL],0		; DelAll = 0 allows delete of dir.
 16877 000026B9 7405                    	JZ	short NOT_DIR
 16878                                  Del_access_err:
 16879 000026BB B80500                  	MOV	AX,error_access_denied
 16880 000026BE EBE9                    	JMP	short ErrorReturn
 16881                                  
 16882                                  NOT_DIR:
 16883 000026C0 08E4                    	OR	AH,AH			; Check if device name
 16884 000026C2 78F7                    	JS	short Del_access_err	; Can't delete I/O devices
 16885                                  
 16886                                  ; Main delete loop. CURBUF+2:BX points to a matching directory entry.
 16887                                  
 16888                                  DELFILE:
 16889 000026C4 800E[6F05]01            	OR	byte [FOUNDDEL],FILEFOUND ; file found, not deleted yet
 16890                                  
 16891                                  ; If we are deleting the Volume ID, then we set VOLUME_CHNG flag to make
 16892                                  ; DOS issue a build BPB call the next time this drive is accessed.
 16893                                  
 16894 000026C9 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 16895 000026CA 8A26[7F05]              	MOV	AH,[DELALL]
 16896 000026CE C53E[E205]              	LDS	DI,[CURBUF]
 16897                                  	
 16898                                  ;hkn; SS override
 16899 000026D2 36F606[6B05]01          	TEST	byte [SS:ATTRIB],attr_read_only ; are we deleting RO files too?
 16900 000026D8 7509                    	JNZ	short DoDelete		; yes
 16901                                  
 16902 000026DA F6470B01                	TEST	byte [BX+dir_entry.dir_attr],attr_read_only
 16903 000026DE 7403                    	JZ	short DoDelete		; not read only
 16904                                  
 16905 000026E0 1F                      	POP	DS
 16906 000026E1 EB32                    	JMP	SHORT DELNXT		; Skip it (Note ES:BP not set)
 16907                                  
 16908                                  DoDelete:
 16909 000026E3 E88400                  	call	REN_DEL_Check		; Sets ES:BP = [THISDPB]
 16910 000026E6 7303                    	JNC	short DEL_SHARE_OK
 16911 000026E8 1F                      	POP	DS
 16912 000026E9 EB2A                    	JMP	SHORT DELNXT		; Skip it
 16913                                  
 16914                                  DEL_SHARE_OK:
 16915                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16916                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 16917                                  	;test	byte [di+5],40h
 16918 000026EB F6450540                	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty
 16919                                  					;LB. if already dirty		  ;AN000;

 16921 000026F1 E89935                  	call	INC_DIRTY_COUNT		;LB.				  ;AN000;
 16922                                  	;or	byte [di+5],40h
 16923 000026F4 804D0540                	OR	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty
 16924                                  yesdirty:
 16925 000026F8 8827                    	mov	[bx],ah 
 16926                                  	;MOV	[BX+dir_entry.dir_name],AH ; Put in E5H or 0
 16927 000026FA 8B1C                    	MOV	BX,[SI] 		; Get firclus pointer
 16928 000026FC 1F                      	POP	DS
 16929 000026FD 800E[6F05]10            	OR	byte [FOUNDDEL],FILEDELETED ; 10h ; Deleted file
 16930                                  
 16931 00002702 83FB02                  	CMP	BX,2
 16932 00002705 720E                    	JB	short DELNXT		; File has invalid FIRCLUS (too small)
 16933                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:bp+0Dh]
 16934 00002707 263B5E0D                	CMP	BX,[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER]
 16935 0000270B 7708                    	JA	short DELNXT		; File has invalid FIRCLUS (too big)
 16936                                  
 16937 0000270D E8BD28                  	call	RELEASE 		; Free file data
 16938 00002710 7252                    	JC	short No_fileJ
 16939                                  
 16940                                  ; DOS 3.3  FastOpen
 16941                                  
 16942 00002712 E8C300                  	CALL	FastOpen_Delete 	; delete the dir info in fastopen
 16943                                  
 16944                                  ; DOS 3.3  FastOpen
 16945                                  
 16946                                  DELNXT:
 16947 00002715 C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]		; Possible to get here without this set
 16948 00002719 E88218                  	call	GETENTRY		; Registers need to be reset
 16949 0000271C 7246                    	JC	short No_fileJ
 16950 0000271E E8BB17                  	call	NEXTENT
 16951 00002721 73A1                    	JNC	short DELFILE
 16952 00002723 C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]		; NEXTENT sets ES=DOSGROUP
 16953                                  	; 12/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 16954                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]
 16955                                  	;;mov	al,[es:bp+0]
 16956                                  	; 15/12/2022
 16957 00002727 268A4600                	MOV	AL,[ES:BP]
 16958 0000272B E85A34                  	call	FLUSHBUF
 16959 0000272E 7234                    	JC	short No_fileJ
 16960                                  ;
 16961                                  ; Now we need to test FoundDel for our flags. The cases to consider are:
 16962                                  ;
 16963                                  ;   not found not deleted		file not found
 16964                                  ;   not found	  deleted		*** impossible ***
 16965                                  ;	found not deleted		access denied (read-only)
 16966                                  ;	found	  deleted		no error
 16967                                  ;
 16968 00002730 F606[6F05]10            	TEST	byte [FOUNDDEL],FILEDELETED ; did we delete a file?
 16969 00002735 7426                    	JZ	short DelError		; no, figure out what's wrong.
 16970                                  ; We set VOLCHNG_FLAG to indicate that we have changed the volume label
 16971                                  ; and to force the DOS to issue a media check.
 16972 00002737 F606[6B05]08            	TEST	byte [ATTRIB],attr_volume_id ; 8
 16973 0000273C 741C                    	jz	short No_Set_Flag
 16974 0000273E 50                      	PUSH	AX
 16975 0000273F 06                      	PUSH	ES
 16976 00002740 57                      	PUSH	DI
 16977 00002741 C43E[A205]              	LES	DI,[THISCDS]

 16979 00002748 80EC41                  	SUB	AH,'A'                  ; Convert to 0-based
 16980 0000274B 8826[A10A]              	mov	[VOLCHNG_FLAG],AH
 16981                                  	
 16982                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 16983 0000274F 30FF                    	XOR	BH,BH			;>32mb delete volume id from boot record ;AN000;
 16984 00002751 E8DC04                  	call	Set_Media_ID		;>32mb set volumme id to boot record	 ;AN000;
 16985                                  	 
 16986 00002754 E88B30                  	call	FATREAD_CDS		; force media check
 16987 00002757 5F                      	POP	DI
 16988 00002758 07                      	POP	ES
 16989 00002759 58                      	POP	AX
 16990                                  No_Set_Flag:
 16991                                  	;call	LCritDisk		; carry is clear
 16992                                  	;retn
 16993                                  	; 18/12/2022
 16994 0000275A E9BCEC                  	jmp	LCritDisk
 16995                                  DelError:
 16996 0000275D F606[6F05]01            	TEST	byte [FOUNDDEL],FILEFOUND ; not deleted. Did we find file?
 16997 00002762 7503                    	JNZ	short Del_access_errJ 	; yes. Access denied
 16998                                  No_fileJ:
 16999 00002764 E93FFF                  	JMP	No_file ; 10/08/2018 		; Nope
 17000                                  Del_access_errJ:

 17003                                  ; 08/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 17004                                  
 17005                                  ;Break	<REN_DEL_Check - check for access for rename and delete>
 17006                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17007                                  ; Procedure Name : REN_DEL_Check
 17008                                  ;
 17009                                  ; Inputs:
 17010                                  ;	[THISDPB] set
 17011                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:BX points to entry
 17012                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:SI points to firclus field of entry
 17013                                  ;	[WFP_Start] points to name
 17014                                  ; Function:
 17015                                  ;	Check for Exclusive access on given file.
 17016                                  ;	  Used by RENAME, SET_FILE_INFO, and DELETE.
 17017                                  ; Outputs:
 17018                                  ;	ES:BP = [THISDPB]
 17019                                  ;	NOTE: The WFP string pointed to by [WFP_Start] Will be Modified.  The
 17020                                  ;		last element will be loaded from the directory entry.  This is
 17021                                  ;		so the name given to the sharer doesn't have any meta chars in
 17022                                  ;		it.
 17023                                  ;	Carry set if sharing violation, INT 24H generated
 17024                                  ;	    NOTE THAT AX IS NOT error_sharing_violation.
 17025                                  ;		This is because input AX is preserved.
 17026                                  ;		Caller must set the error if needed.
 17027                                  ;	Carry clear
 17028                                  ;		OK
 17029                                  ; AX,DS,BX,SI,DI preserved
 17030                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17031                                  
 17032                                  REN_DEL_Check:
 17033                                  
 17034 0000276A 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 17035 0000276B 57                      	PUSH	DI
 17036 0000276C 50                      	PUSH	AX
 17037 0000276D 53                      	PUSH	BX
 17038 0000276E 56                      	PUSH	SI		; Save CURBUF pointers
 17039                                  	
 17040 0000276F 16                      	push	ss
 17041 00002770 07                      	pop	es
 17042                                  
 17043                                  ;hkn; context ES will assume ES to DOSDATA
 17044                                  ;hkn; ASSUME	ES:DOSGROUP
 17045                                  
 17046                                  ;hkn; SS override
 17047 00002771 368B3E[B205]            	MOV	DI,[SS:WFP_START] ; ES:DI -> WFP
 17048 00002776 89DE                    	MOV	SI,BX
 17049                                  
 17050                                  ;hkn; SS override
 17051 00002778 368E1E[E405]            	MOV	DS,[SS:CURBUF+2] ; DS:SI -> entry (FCB style name)
 17052 0000277D 89FB                    	MOV	BX,DI		; Set backup limit for skipback
 17053 0000277F 83C302                  	ADD	BX,2		; Skip over d: to point to leading '\'
 17054 00002782 E855EB                  	call	StrLen		; CX is length of ES:DI including NUL
 17055 00002785 49                      	DEC	CX		; Don't include nul in count
 17056 00002786 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX		; Point to NUL at end of string
 17057 00002788 E80147                  	call	SkipBack	; Back up one element
 17058 0000278B 47                      	INC	DI		; Point to start of last element
 17059                                  
 17060                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17061                                  ;hkn; SS override
 17062                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 17063 0000278C 36893E[0106]            	MOV	[SS:SAVE_BX],DI	;IFS. save for DOS_RENAME   ;AN000;
 17064                                  	;
 17065 00002791 E830FA                  	call	PackName	; Transfer name from entry to ASCIZ tail.
 17066 00002794 5E                      	POP	SI		; Get back entry pointers
 17067 00002795 5B                      	POP	BX
 17068 00002796 53                      	PUSH	BX
 17069 00002797 56                      	PUSH	SI		; Back on stack
 17070                                  	
 17071 00002798 16                      	push	ss
 17072 00002799 1F                      	pop	ds
 17073                                  
 17074                                  ;hkn; context DS will assume ES to DOSDATA
 17075                                  ;hkn; ASSUME	DS:DOSGROUP
 17076                                  
 17077                                  ; Close the file if possible by us.
 17078                                  ;
 17079                                  ;if installed
 17080 0000279A FF1E[C400]              	Call	far [JShare+(13*4)] ; 13 = ShCloseFile
 17081                                  ;else
 17082                                  ;	Call	ShCloseFile
 17083                                  ;endif
 17084 0000279E 8C1E[A005]              	MOV	[THISSFT+2],DS
 17085                                  
 17086                                  ;hkn; AUXSTACK is in DOSDATA
 17087 000027A2 C706[9E05][6507]        	MOV	word [THISSFT],AUXSTACK-SF_ENTRY.size  ; RENAMEDMA+(384-59)
 17088                                  				; Scratch space
 17089 000027A8 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH		; Indicate file to DOOPEN (high bit off)
 17090 000027AA E8AA24                  	call	DOOPEN		; Fill in SFT for share check
 17091 000027AD C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 17092                                  	;mov	word [es:di+2],10h
 17093 000027B1 26C745021000            	MOV	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode],SHARING_DENY_BOTH ; 10h
 17094                                  				; requires exclusive access
 17095                                  	;MOV	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],1 ; Pretend open
 17096 000027B7 26C7050100              	mov	word [ES:DI],1
 17097 000027BC E8F14C                  	call	ShareEnter
 17098 000027BF 720D                    	jc	short CheckDone
 17099 000027C1 C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 17100                                  	;MOV	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],0
 17101 000027C5 26C7050000              	mov	word [ES:DI],0	; Pretend closed and free
 17102                                  	
 17103 000027CA E8DE4C                  	call	ShareEnd	; Tell sharer we're done with THISSFT
 17104 000027CD F8                      	CLC
 17105                                  CheckDone:
 17106 000027CE C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]
 17107 000027D2 5E                      	POP	SI
 17108 000027D3 5B                      	POP	BX
 17109 000027D4 58                      	POP	AX
 17110 000027D5 5F                      	POP	DI
 17111 000027D6 1F                      	POP	DS
 17112 000027D7 C3                      	retn
 17113                                  
 17114                                  ;Break	<FastOpen_Delete - delete dir info in fastopen>
 17115                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17116                                  ; Procedure Name : FastOpen_Delete
 17117                                  ; Inputs:
 17118                                  ;	None
 17119                                  ; Function:
 17120                                  ;	Call FastOpen to delete the dir info.
 17121                                  ; Outputs:
 17122                                  ;	None
 17123                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17124                                  
 17125                                  FastOpen_Delete:

 17128 000027DA 53                      	PUSH	BX

 17131                                  ;hkn; SS override

 17133                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 17134 000027DC 368B36[B205]            	MOV	SI,[ss:WFP_START] ; ds:si points to path name
 17135                                  	
 17136 000027E1 B003                    	MOV	AL,FONC_delete	; al = 3
 17137                                  fastinvoke:
 17138                                  ;hkn; FastTable is in DOSDATA
 17139 000027E3 BB[860D]                	MOV	BX,FastTable+2
 17140 000027E6 FF1F                    	CALL	far [BX]	; call fastopen
 17141 000027E8 58                      	POP	AX		; restore registers
 17142 000027E9 5B                      	POP	BX
 17143 000027EA 5E                      	POP	SI
 17144 000027EB 9D                      	POPF			; restore flag
 17145 000027EC C3                      	retn
 17146                                  
 17147                                  	; 13/11/2022 Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 17148                                  	; DOSCODE:65A0h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 17149                                  
 17150                                  ;Break	<FastOpen_Rename - Rename directory>	   ; PTR 5622
 17151                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17152                                  ; PROCEDURE Name : FastOpen_Rename
 17153                                  ;
 17154                                  ; Inputs:
 17155                                  ;	 REN_WFP   = Path Name
 17156                                  ;	 NAME1	   = New Name
 17157                                  ; Function:

 17184

 17229                                  ; RENAME.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 17230                                  ;============================================================================
 17231                                  ; 08/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 17232                                  ; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17233                                  
 17234                                  ;	TITLE	DOS_RENAME - Internal RENAME call for MS-DOS
 17235                                  ;	NAME	DOS_RENAME
 17236                                  
 17237                                  ;**	Low level routine for renaming files
 17238                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17239                                  ;	DOS_RENAME
 17240                                  ;
 17241                                  ;	Modification history:
 17242                                  ;
 17243                                  ;	    Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 17244                                  
 17245                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17246                                  ;
 17247                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_RENAME
 17248                                  ;
 17249                                  ; Inputs:
 17250                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to SOURCE WFP string ("d:/" must be first 3
 17251                                  ;		chars, NUL terminated)
 17252                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string [SOURCE]
 17253                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 17254                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 17255                                  ;	[REN_WFP] Points to DEST WFP string ("d:/" must be first 3
 17256                                  ;		chars, NUL terminated)
 17257                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 17258                                  ;		(Low word = -1 if NUL CDS (Net direct request))
 17259                                  ;	[SATTRIB] Is attribute of search, determines what files can be found
 17260                                  ; Function:
 17261                                  ;	Rename the specified file(s)
 17262                                  ;	NOTE: This routine uses most of AUXSTACK as a temp buffer.
 17263                                  ; Outputs:
 17264                                  ;	CARRY CLEAR
 17265                                  ;	    OK
 17266                                  ;	CARRY SET
 17267                                  ;	    AX is error code
 17268                                  ;		error_file_not_found
 17269                                  ;			No match for source, or dest path invalid
 17270                                  ;		error_not_same_device
 17271                                  ;			Source and dest are on different devices
 17272                                  ;		error_access_denied
 17273                                  ;			Directory specified (not simple rename),
 17274                                  ;			Device name given, Destination exists.
 17275                                  ;			NOTE: In third case some renames may have
 17276                                  ;			 been done if metas.
 17277                                  ;		error_path_not_found
 17278                                  ;			Bad path (not in curr dir part if present)
 17279                                  ;			SOURCE ONLY
 17280                                  ;		error_bad_curr_dir
 17281                                  ;			Bad path in current directory part of path
 17282                                  ;			SOURCE ONLY
 17283                                  ;		error_sharing_violation
 17284                                  ;			Deny both access required, generates an INT 24.
 17285                                  ; DS preserved, others destroyed
 17286                                  ;
 17287                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17288                                  
 17289                                  	; 14/11/2022 Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 17290                                  
 17291                                  DOS_RENAME:
 17292                                  
 17293                                  ;hkn; DOS_RENAME is called from file.asm and fcbio.asm. DS has been set up
 17294                                  ;hkn; at this point to DOSDATA.
 17295                                  
 17296 00002816 E821EB                  	call	TestNet
 17297 00002819 7306                    	JNC	short LOCAL_RENAME
 17298                                  
 17299                                  ;IF NOT Installed
 17300                                  ;	transfer NET_RENAME
 17301                                  ;ELSE
 17302                                  	;MOV	AX,(MultNET SHL 8) OR 17
 17303                                  	;INT	2FH
 17304                                  	;return
 17305                                  
 17306 0000281B B81111                  	mov     ax, 1111h
 17307 0000281E CD2F                    	int     2Fh 	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - RENAME REMOTE FILE
 17308                                  			; SS = DS = DOS CS, 
 17309                                  			; SDA first filename pointer = offset of fully-qualified old name
 17310                                  			; SDA CDS pointer -> current directory
 17311                                  			; Return: CF set on error
 17312 00002820 C3                      	retn
 17313                                  ;ENDIF
 17314                                  
 17315                                  LOCAL_RENAME:
 17316 00002821 C606[2303]02            	MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Disk ; 2
 17317 00002826 8B36[B205]              	MOV	SI,[WFP_START]
 17318 0000282A 8B3E[B405]              	MOV	DI,[REN_WFP]
 17319 0000282E 8A04                    	MOV	AL,[SI]
 17320 00002830 8A25                    	MOV	AH,[DI]
 17321 00002832 0D2020                  	OR	AX,2020H		; Lower case
 17322 00002835 38E0                    	CMP	AL,AH
 17323 00002837 7405                    	JZ	short SAMEDRV
 17324 00002839 B81100                  	MOV	AX,error_not_same_device ; 11h
 17325 0000283C F9                      	STC
 17326 0000283D C3                      	retn
 17327                                  
 17328                                  SAMEDRV:
 17329 0000283E FF36[2E03]              	PUSH	WORD [DMAADD+2]
 17330 00002842 FF36[2C03]              	PUSH	WORD [DMAADD]
 17331 00002846 8C1E[2E03]              	MOV	[DMAADD+2],DS
 17332                                  
 17333                                  ;hkn; RENAMEDMA is in DOSDATA
 17334 0000284A C706[2C03][2006]        	MOV	WORD [DMAADD],RENAMEDMA
 17335 00002850 C606[7005]00            	MOV	byte [FOUND_DEV],0	; Rename fails on DEVS, assume not a dev
 17336 00002855 E8A6EB                  	call	ECritDisk
 17337 00002858 E8F505                  	call	DOS_SEARCH_FIRST	; Sets [NoSetDir] to 1, [CURBUF+2]:BX
 17338                                  					;    points to entry
 17339 0000285B 7314                    	JNC	short Check_Dev

 17732                                  ;

 17759                                  ;Procedure: NEW_RENAME

 17764                                  ;Function: replace ? chars of raw string with chars in source string and
 17765                                  ;	   put in destination string

 17769                                  NEW_RENAME:
 17770                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17771                                  NEWNAM:
 17772                                  	; DOSCODE:680Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)

 17780 00002A45 E2F5                    	LOOP	NEWNAM
 17781                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 17782                                  gs_ret_label:	; 18/12/2022
 17783 00002A47 C3                      	retn

 17791                                  ;**	Low level routines for returning file information and setting file
 17792                                  ;	attributes
 17793                                  ;
 17794                                  ;	GET_FILE_INFO
 17795                                  ;	SET_FILE_ATTRIBUTE
 17796                                  ;
 17797                                  ;	Modification history:
 17798                                  ;
 17799                                  ;	    Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 17800                                  ;
 17801                                  ;	M025: Return access_denied if attempting to set
 17802                                  ;	      attribute of root directory.
 17803                                  ;
 17804                                  
 17805                                  ;SUBTTL GET_FILE_INFO -- Get File Information
 17806                                  
 17807                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17808                                  ; Procedure Name : GET_FILE_INFO
 17809                                  ;
 17810                                  ; Inputs:
 17811                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:/" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 17812                                  ;		terminated)
 17813                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 17814                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 17815                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 17816                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 17817                                  ;		(Low word = -1 if NUL CDS (Net direct request))
 17818                                  ;	[SATTRIB] Is attribute of search, determines what files can be found
 17819                                  ; Function:
 17820                                  ;	Get Information about a file
 17821                                  ; Returns:
 17822                                  ;	CARRY CLEAR
 17823                                  ;	    AX = Attribute of file
 17824                                  ;	    CX = Time stamp of file
 17825                                  ;	    DX = Date stamp of file
 17826                                  ;	    BX:DI = Size of file (32 bit)
 17827                                  ;	CARRY SET
 17828                                  ;	    AX is error code
 17829                                  ;		error_file_not_found
 17830                                  ;			Last element of path not found
 17831                                  ;		error_path_not_found
 17832                                  ;			Bad path (not in curr dir part if present)
 17833                                  ;		error_bad_curr_dir
 17834                                  ;			Bad path in current directory part of path
 17835                                  ; DS preserved, others destroyed
 17836                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17837                                  
 17838                                  	; 14/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 17839                                  
 17840                                  GET_FILE_INFO:
 17841                                  
 17842                                  ;hkn; get_file_info is called from file.asm and fcbio.asm. DS has been set 
 17843                                  ;hkn; to DOSDATA at this point. So DOSassume is OK.
 17844                                  
 17845 00002A48 E8EFE8                  	call	TestNet
 17846 00002A4B 7306                    	JNC	short LOCAL_INFO
 17847                                  
 17848                                  ;IF NOT Installed
 17849                                  ;	transfer NET_GET_FILE_INFO
 17850                                  ;ELSE
 17851                                  ;	MOV	AX,(MultNET SHL 8) OR 15
 17852                                  ;	INT	2FH
 17853                                  ;	return
 17854                                  
 17855 00002A4D B80F11                  	mov     ax, 110Fh
 17856 00002A50 CD2F                    	int     2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - GET REMOTE FILE'S ATTRIBUTES
 17857                                  			; SS = DOS CS, SDA first filename pointer -> fully-qualified name of file
 17858                                  			; SDA CDS pointer -> current directory
 17859                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AX = file attributes
 17860 00002A52 C3                      	retn
 17861                                  ;ENDIF
 17862                                  
 17863                                  LOCAL_INFO:
 17864 00002A53 E8A8E9                  	call	ECritDisk
 17865 00002A56 C606[4C03]01            	MOV	byte [NoSetDir],1	; if we find a dir, don't change to it
 17866                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 17867                                  	;call	GETPATH
 17868                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 17869 00002A5B E8D800                  	call	GET_FAST_PATH
 17870                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 17871 00002A5E 7312                    	JNC	short info_check_dev
 17872                                  NO_PATH:
 17873 00002A60 750B                    	JNZ	short bad_path1
 17874 00002A62 08C9                    	OR	CL,CL
 17875 00002A64 7407                    	JZ	short bad_path1
 17876                                  info_no_file:
 17877 00002A66 B80200                  	MOV	AX,error_file_not_found
 17878                                  BadRet:
 17879 00002A69 F9                      	STC
 17880                                  JustRet:
 17881                                  	;call	LCritDisk
 17882                                  	;retn
 17883                                  	; 18/12/2022
 17884 00002A6A E9ACE9                  	jmp	LCritDisk
 17885                                  
 17886                                  bad_path1:
 17887 00002A6D B80300                  	MOV	AX,error_path_not_found
 17888 00002A70 EBF7                    	jmp	short BadRet
 17889                                  
 17890                                  info_check_dev:
 17891 00002A72 08E4                    	OR	AH,AH
 17892 00002A74 78F0                    	JS	short info_no_file	; device
 17893                                  
 17894                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 17895                                  ;SR;
 17896                                  ; If root dir then CurBuf == -1. Check for this case and return subdir attr
 17897                                  ;for a root dir
 17898                                  
 17899 00002A76 833E[E205]FF            	cmp	word [CURBUF],-1	;is it a root dir?
 17900 00002A7B 7506                    	jne	short not_root		;no, CurBuf ptr is valid
 17901                                  
 17902 00002A7D 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah
 17903 00002A7F B010                    	mov	al,attr_directory ; 10h
 17904                                  	;clc
 17905                                  	; 14/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 17906                                  	; (DOSCODE:683Eh)
 17907                                  	; 16/12/2022
 17908                                  	;clc
 17909 00002A81 EBE7                    	jmp	short JustRet
 17910                                  
 17911                                  not_root:
 17912                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 17913 00002A83 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 17914 00002A84 8E1E[E405]              	MOV	DS,[CURBUF+2]
 17915 00002A88 89DE                    	MOV	SI,BX
 17916 00002A8A 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX			; Assume size=0 (dir)
 17917 00002A8C 89DF                    	MOV	DI,BX
 17918                                  	;mov	cx,[si+16h]
 17919 00002A8E 8B4C16                  	MOV	CX,[SI+dir_entry.dir_time]
 17920                                  	;mov	dx,[si+18h]
 17921 00002A91 8B5418                  	MOV	DX,[SI+dir_entry.dir_date]
 17922 00002A94 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH
 17923                                  	;mov	al,[si+0Bh]
 17924 00002A96 8A440B                  	MOV	AL,[SI+dir_entry.dir_attr]
 17925                                  	;test	al,10h
 17926 00002A99 A810                    	TEST	AL,attr_directory
 17927 00002A9B 7506                    	JNZ	short NO_SIZE
 17928                                  	;mov	di,[si+1Ch]
 17929 00002A9D 8B7C1C                  	MOV	DI,[SI+dir_entry.dir_size_l]
 17930                                  	;mov	bx,[si+1Eh]
 17931 00002AA0 8B5C1E                  	MOV	BX,[SI+dir_entry.dir_size_h]
 17932                                  NO_SIZE:
 17933 00002AA3 1F                      	POP	DS
 17934                                  	;CLC
 17935                                  	; 14/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 17936                                  	; (DOSCODE:6864h)
 17937                                  	; 16/12/2022
 17938                                  	;clc
 17939 00002AA4 EBC4                    	jmp	short JustRet
 17940                                  
 17941                                  ;Break	<SET_FILE_ATTRIBUTE -- Set File Attribute>
 17942                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17943                                  ; Procedure Name : SET_FILE_ATTRIBUTE
 17944                                  ; Inputs:
 17945                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:/" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 17946                                  ;		terminated)
 17947                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 17948                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 17949                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 17950                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 17951                                  ;		(Low word = -1 if NUL CDS (Net direct request))
 17952                                  ;	[SATTRIB] is attribute of search (determines what files may be found)
 17953                                  ;	AX is new attributes to give to file
 17954                                  ; Function:
 17955                                  ;	Set File Attributes
 17956                                  ; Returns:
 17957                                  ;	CARRY CLEAR
 17958                                  ;	    No error
 17959                                  ;	CARRY SET
 17960                                  ;	    AX is error code
 17961                                  ;		error_file_not_found
 17962                                  ;			Last element of path not found
 17963                                  ;		error_path_not_found
 17964                                  ;			Bad path (not in curr dir part if present)
 17965                                  ;		error_bad_curr_dir
 17966                                  ;			Bad path in current directory part of path
 17967                                  ;		error_access_denied
 17968                                  ;			Attempt to set an attribute which cannot be set
 17969                                  ;			(attr_directory, attr_volume_ID)
 17970                                  ;		error_sharing_violation
 17971                                  ;			Sharing mode of file did not allow the change
 17972                                  ;			(this request requires exclusive write/read access)
 17973                                  ;			(INT 24H generated)
 17974                                  ; DS preserved, others destroyed
 17975                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17976                                  
 17977                                  SET_FILE_ATTRIBUTE:
 17978                                  
 17979                                  ;hkn; set_file_attr is called from file.asm. DS has been set 
 17980                                  ;hkn; to DOSDATA at this point. So DOSassume is OK.
 17981                                  
 17982 00002AA6 A9D8FF                  	TEST	AX,~attr_changeable ; 0FFD8h
 17983 00002AA9 7414                    	JZ	short set_look
 17984                                  _BAD_ACC:
 17985 00002AAB C606[2303]01            	MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Unk ; 1
 17986 00002AB0 C606[2703]07            	MOV	byte [EXTERR_CLASS],errCLASS_Apperr ; 7
 17987 00002AB5 C606[2603]04            	MOV	byte [EXTERR_ACTION],errACT_Abort ; 4
 17988 00002ABA B80500                  	MOV	AX,error_access_denied ; 5
 17989 00002ABD F9                      	STC
 17990 00002ABE C3                      	retn
 17991

 17994 00002AC2 7308                    	JNC	short LOCAL_SET
 17995                                  
 17996                                  ;IF NOT Installed
 17997                                  ;	transfer NET_SEQ_SET_FILE_ATTRIBUTE
 17998                                  ;ELSE
 17999 00002AC4 50                      	PUSH	AX
 18000                                  	
 18001                                  	;MOV	AX,(MultNET SHL 8) OR 14
 18002                                  	;INT	2FH
 18003                                  
 18004 00002AC5 B80E11                  	mov     ax, 110Eh
 18005 00002AC8 CD2F                    	int     2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - SET REMOTE FILE'S ATTRIBUTES
 18006                                  			; SS = DOS CS, SDA first filename pointer -> fully-qualified name of file
 18007                                  			; SDA CDS pointer -> current directory
 18008                                  			; STACK: WORD new file attributes
 18009                                  			; Return: CF set on error
 18010                                  
 18011 00002ACA 5B                      	POP	BX			; clean stack
 18012 00002ACB C3                      	retn
 18013                                  ;ENDIF
 18014                                  
 18015                                  LOCAL_SET:
 18016 00002ACC E82FE9                  	call	ECritDisk
 18017 00002ACF 50                      	PUSH	AX			; Save new attributes
 18018 00002AD0 C606[4C03]01            	MOV	byte [NoSetDir],1	; if we find a dir, don't change to it
 18019 00002AD5 E85515                  	call	GETPATH 		; get path through fastopen if there	;AC000;
 18020 00002AD8 7303                    	JNC	short set_check_device
 18021 00002ADA 5B                      	POP	BX			; Clean stack (don't zap AX)
 18022 00002ADB EB83                    	JMP	short NO_PATH
 18023                                  
 18024                                  set_check_device:

 18026 00002ADF 7906                    	JNS	short set_check_share
 18027 00002AE1 58                      	POP	AX
