 19702                                  ;============================================================================
 19703                                  ; ABORT.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 19704                                  ;============================================================================
 19705                                  ; 23/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 19706                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19707                                  
 19708                                  ;**
 19709                                  ;
 19710                                  ; Internal Abort call closes all handles and FCBs associated with a process.
 19711                                  ;  If process has NET resources a close all is sent out over the net.
 19712                                  ;
 19713                                  ;   DOS_ABORT
 19714                                  ;
 19715                                  ;   Modification history:
 19716                                  ;
 19717                                  ;       Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 19718                                  ;
 19719                                  ;	M038	SR	10/16/90	Free SFT with the PSP of the process
 19720                                  ;				being terminated only if it is busy.
 19721                                  ;
 19722                                  
 19723                                  ;Break   <DOS_ABORT -- CLOSE all files for process>
 19724                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 19725                                  ;
 19726                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_ABORT
 19727                                  ;
 19728                                  ; Inputs:
 19729                                  ;       [CurrentPDB] set to PID of process aborting
 19730                                  ; Function:
 19731                                  ;       Close all files and free all SFTs for this PID
 19732                                  ; Returns:
 19733                                  ;       None
 19734                                  ; All destroyed except stack
 19735                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 19736                                  
 19737                                  DOS_ABORT:
 19738 00002FD5 368E06[3003]            	MOV     ES,[SS:CurrentPDB]	; SS override
 19739 00002FDA 268B0E3200              	MOV     CX,[ES:PDB.JFN_Length]  ; Number of JFNs
 19740                                  reset_free_jfn:
 19741 00002FDF 89CB                    	MOV     BX,CX
 19742 00002FE1 51                      	PUSH    CX
 19743 00002FE2 4B                      	DEC     BX                      ; get jfn (start with last one)
 19744                                  
 19745 00002FE3 E86338                  	CALL	_$CLOSE
 19746 00002FE6 59                      	POP     CX
 19747 00002FE7 E2F6                    	LOOP    reset_free_jfn          ; and do 'em all
 19748                                  
 19749                                  ; Note: We do need to explicitly close FCBs. Reasons are as follows: If we
 19750                                  ; are running in the no-sharing no-network environment, we are simulating the
 19751                                  ; 2.0 world and thus if the user doesn't close the file, that is his problem
 19752                                  ; BUT... the cache remains in a state with garbage that may be reused by the
 19753                                  ; next process. We scan the set and blast the ref counts of the FCBs we own.
 19754                                  ;
 19755                                  ; If sharing is loaded, then the following call to close process will
 19756                                  ; correctly close all FCBs. We will then need to walk the list AFTER here.
 19757                                  ;
 19758                                  ; Finally, the following call to NET_Abort will cause an EOP to be sent to all
 19759                                  ; known network resources. These resources are then responsible for cleaning
 19760                                  ; up after this process.
 19761                                  ;
 19762                                  ; Sleazy, eh?
 19763                                  
 19764                                  	;context DS			; SS is DOSDATA
 19765 00002FE9 16                      	push	ss
 19766 00002FEA 1F                      	pop	ds  ; 09/09/2018
 19767                                  
 19768                                  	;CallInstall Net_Abort, MultNET, 29
 19769 00002FEB B81D11                  	mov	ax, 111Dh
 19770 00002FEE CD2F                    	int     2Fh 	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR 
 19771                                  			;	    - CLOSE ALL REMOTE FILES FOR PROCESS
 19772                                  			; DS???, SS = DOS CS
 19773                                  ;if installed
 19774 00002FF0 FF1E[A000]              	call	far [JShare+(4*4)]	; 4 = MFTCloseP
 19775                                  ;else
 19776                                  ;	call 	MFTCloseP
 19777                                  ;endif
 19778                                  
 19779                                  ; Scan the FCB cache for guys that belong to this process and zap their ref
 19780                                  ; counts.
 19781                                  					; SS override
 19782 00002FF4 36C43E[4000]            	les     di,[ss:SFTFCB]		; grab the pointer to the table
 19783                                  	;mov	cx,[es:di+4]
 19784 00002FF9 268B4D04                	mov     cx,[es:di+SFT.SFCount]
 19785 00002FFD E317                    	jcxz    FCBScanDone
 19786                                  	;lea	di,[di+6]
 19787 00002FFF 8D7D06                  	LEA     DI,[DI+SFT.SFTable]	; point at table
 19788 00003002 36A1[3C03]              	mov     ax,[SS:PROC_ID]		; SS override
 19789                                  FCBTest:
 19790                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 19791 00003006 26394531                	cmp	[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax ; is this one of ours
 19792 0000300A 7505                    	jnz	short FCBNext		; no, skip it
 19793 0000300C 26C7050000              	mov	word [es:di],0
 19794                                  	;mov	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],0  ; yes, blast ref count
 19795                                  FCBNext:
 19796 00003011 83C73B                  	add     di,SF_ENTRY.size ; 59 (for MSDOS 6.0)
 19797 00003014 E2F0                    	loop    FCBTest
 19798                                  FCBScanDone:
 19799                                  
 19800                                  ; Walk the SFT to eliminate all busy SFT's for this process.
 19801                                  
 19802 00003016 31DB                    	XOR     BX,BX
 19803                                  Scan:
 19804 00003018 53                      	push    bx
 19805 00003019 E8A837                  	call	SFFromSFN
 19806 0000301C 5B                      	pop     bx
 19807                                  	;jnc	short Scan1
 19808                                  	;retn
 19809                                  	; 18/12/2022
 19810 0000301D 72B5                    	jc	short NO_Question ; retn
 19811                                  
 19812                                  ;M038
 19813                                  ; Do what the comment above says, check for busy state
 19814                                  
 19815                                  Scan1:
 19816                                  	;cmp	word [es:di],0
 19817                                  	;jz	short scan_next  ; MSDOS 3.3
 19818                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 19819 0000301F 26833DFF                	cmp	word [es:di],sf_busy ; -1
 19820                                  	;cmp	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 19821                                  				; Is Sft busy? ;M038
 19822 00003023 7519                    	jnz	short scan_next
 19823                                  ;
 19824                                  ; we have a SFT that is busy. See if it is for the current process
 19825                                  ;
 19826 00003025 36A1[3C03]              	mov     ax,[SS:PROC_ID]		; SS override
 19827                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 19828 00003029 26394531                	cmp	[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 19829 0000302D 750F                    	jnz	short scan_next
 19830 0000302F 36A1[3E03]              	mov     ax,[SS:USER_ID]		; SS override
 19831                                  	;cmp	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 19832 00003033 2639452F                	cmp	[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 19833 00003037 7505                    	jnz	short scan_next
 19834                                  
 19835                                  ; This SFT is labelled as ours.
 19836                                  
 19837 00003039 26C7050000              	mov	word [es:di],0
 19838                                  	;mov	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],0
 19839                                  scan_next:
 19840 0000303E 43                      	inc     bx
 19841 0000303F EBD7                    	jmp     short Scan
 19842                                  
 19843                                  ;============================================================================
 19844                                  ; CLOSE.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 19845                                  ;============================================================================
 19846                                  ; 23/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 19847                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19848                                  
 19849                                  ;**	Internal Close and Commit calls to close a local or NET SFT.
 19850                                  ;
 19851                                  ;	DOS_CLOSE
 19852                                  ;	DOS_COMMIT
 19853                                  ;	FREE_SFT
 19854                                  ;	SetSFTTimes
 19855                                  ;
 19856                                  ;	Revision history:
 19857                                  ;
 19858                                  ;	   AN000  version 4.00	Jan. 1988
 19859                                  ;	   A005   PTM 3718 --- lost clusters when fastopen installed
 19860                                  ;	   A011   PTM 4766 --- C2 fastopen problem
 19861                                  
 19862                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 19863                                  
 19864                                  ;Break <DOS_CLOSE -- CLOSE FILE from SFT>
 19865                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 19866                                  ;
 19867                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_CLOSE
 19868                                  ;
 19869                                  ; Inputs:
 19870                                  ;	[THISSFT] set to the SFT for the file being used
 19871                                  ; Function:
 19872                                  ;	Close the indicated file via the SFT
 19873                                  ; Returns:
 19874                                  ;	sf_ref_count decremented otherwise
 19875                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 19876                                  ;	Carry set if error
 19877                                  ;	    AX has error code
 19878                                  ; DS preserved, others destroyed
 19879                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 19880                                  
 19881                                  ;hkn; DOS_CLOSE called from fcbio.asm and handle.asm. DS alreday set up.
 19882                                  
 19883                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19884                                  ; DOSCODE:6E2Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 19885                                  
 19886                                  ; 14/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 19887                                  ; DOSCODE:6E1Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 19888                                  
 19889                                  ; 23/07/2018 - IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3), 1987 - Offset 39D0h
 19890                                  
 19891                                  DOS_CLOSE:
 19892 00003041 C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 19893                                  	;mov	bx,[ES:DI+5]
 19894 00003045 268B5D05                	MOV	BX,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags]
 19895                                  
 19896                                  ; Network closes are handled entirely by the net code.
 19897                                  
 19898                                  	;;test	bx,8000h
 19899                                  	;TEST	BX,sf_isnet
 19900                                  	; 17/12/2022
 19901                                  	;test	bh,80h
 19902 00003049 F6C780                  	test	bh,(sf_isnet>>8)
 19903 0000304C 7406                    	JZ	short LocalClose
 19904                                  
 19905                                  	;CallInstall Net_Close,MultNET,6
 19906 0000304E B80611                  	mov     ax,1106h
 19907 00003051 CD2F                    	int     2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - CLOSE REMOTE FILE
 19908                                  			; ES:DI -> SFT
 19909                                  			; SFT DPB field -> DPB of drive containing file
 19910                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AX = DOS error code
 19911                                  			; CF clear if successful
 19912 00003053 C3                      	retn
 19913                                  
 19914                                  ; All closes release the sharing information.
 19915                                  ; No commit releases sharing information
 19916                                  ;
 19917                                  ; All closes decrement the ref count.
 19918                                  ; No commit decrements the ref count.
 19919                                  
 19920                                  LocalClose:
 19921 00003054 E8A7E3                  	call	ECritDisk
 19922 00003057 E86401                  	CALL	SetSFTTimes
 19923 0000305A E8E200                  	CALL	FREE_SFT		; dec ref count or mark as busy
 19924                                  
 19925                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 19926                                  	;Context DS
 19927 0000305D 16                      	push	ss
 19928 0000305E 1F                      	pop	ds
 19929                                  
 19930 0000305F 50                      	push	ax
 19931 00003060 53                      	push	bx
 19932 00003061 E84744                  	call	ShareEnd
 19933 00003064 5B                      	pop	bx
 19934 00003065 58                      	pop	ax
 19935                                  
 19936                                  ; Commit enters here. AX from commit MUST be <> 1, BX is flags word
 19937                                  
 19938                                  CloseEntry:
 19939 00003066 50                      	PUSH	AX
 19940                                  
 19941                                  ; File clean or device does not get stamped nor disk looked at.
 19942                                  
 19943                                  	;test	bx,0C0h
 19944                                  	; 17/12/2022

 19946                                  	;TEST	BX,devid_file_clean+devid_device

 19950                                  	;jnz	short FREE_SFT_OK ; 24/07/2019	
 19951                                  
 19952                                  ; Retrieve the directory entry for the file
 19953                                  
 19954                                  rdir:
 19955 0000306F E8DA00                  	CALL	DirFromSFT
 19956                                  	;mov	al,5
 19957 00003072 B005                    	MOV	AL,error_access_denied
 19958 00003074 7303                    	JNC	short clook
 19959                                  	; 14/11/2022
 19960 00003076 E9B400                  	JMP	CloseFinish		; pretend the close worked.
 19961                                  	;jc	short CloseFinish ; 24/07/2019
 19962                                  clook:
 19963                                  
 19964                                  ; ES:DI points to entry
 19965                                  ; DS:SI points to SFT
 19966                                  ; ES:BX points to buffer header
 19967                                  
 19968 00003079 57                      	push	di
 19969 0000307A 56                      	push	si
 19970                                  	;lea	si,[si+20h]
 19971 0000307B 8D7420                  	LEA	SI,[SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_name]
 19972

 19974                                  ; DS:SI point to unpacked name
 19975                                  
 19976 0000307E E86DE2                  	call	XCHGP
 19977

 19979                                  ; DS:SI point to directory entry
 19980

 19982 00003084 E867E2                  	call	XCHGP
 19983 00003087 5E                      	pop	si
 19984 00003088 5F                      	pop	di
 19985 00003089 740C                    	JZ	short CLOSE_GO		; Name OK
 19986                                  Bye:	
 19987 0000308B 89F7                    	MOV	DI,SI
 19988 0000308D 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 19989 0000308E 07                      	POP	ES			; ES:DI points to SFT
 19990 0000308F 16                      	PUSH	SS
 19991 00003090 1F                      	POP	DS
 19992 00003091 F9                      	STC
 19993                                  	;mov	al,2
 19994 00003092 B002                    	MOV	AL,error_file_not_found
 19995 00003094 E99600                  	JMP	CloseFinish ; 24/07/2019
 19996                                  
 19997                                  	; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19998                                  CLOSE_GO:
 19999                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 20000                                  	;test	word [si+2],8000h

 20006                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0

 20126 0000312E E8D115                  	call	DEV_CLOSE_SFT
 20127 00003131 9D                      	POPF
 20128                                  ;;;; 7/21/86
 20129                                  ;
 20130                                  ; See if the ref count indicates that we have busied the SFT. If so, mark the
 20131                                  ; SFT as being free. Note that we do NOT need to be in critSFT as we are ONLY
 20132                                  ; going to be moving from busy to free.
 20133                                  ;
 20134 00003132 59                      	POP	CX			; get old ref count
 20135 00003133 9C                      	PUSHF
 20136 00003134 49                      	DEC	CX			; if cx != 1
 20137 00003135 7503                    	JNZ	short NoFree		; then do NOT free SFT
 20138 00003137 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx
 20139                                  	;MOV	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_Count],CX ; mov [es:di+0],cx
 20140                                  NoFree:
 20141 0000313A E8DCE2                  	call	LCritDisk
 20142 0000313D 9D                      	POPF
 20143 0000313E C3                      	retn
 20144                                  
 20145                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20146                                  ;
 20147                                  ; Procedure Name : FREE_SFT
 20148                                  ;
 20149                                  ; ES:DI -> SFT. Decs sft_ref_count. If the count goes to 0, mark it as busy.
 20150                                  ; Flags preserved. Return old ref count in AX
 20151                                  ;
 20152                                  ; Note that busy is indicated by the SFT ref count being -1.
 20153                                  ;
 20154                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20155                                  
 20156                                  FREE_SFT:
 20157 0000313F 9C                      	PUSHF		; Save carry state
 20158 00003140 268B05                  	mov	ax,[es:di]
 20159                                  	;MOV	AX,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count]
 20160 00003143 48                      	DEC	AX
 20161 00003144 7501                    	JNZ	short SetCount
 20162 00003146 48                      	DEC	AX
 20163                                  SetCount:
 20164 00003147 268705                  	xchg	ax,[es:di]
 20165                                  	;XCHG	AX,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count]
 20166 0000314A 9D                      	POPF
 20167 0000314B C3                      	retn

 20260                                  	;hkn; called from srvcall. DS already set up.

 20282                                  			; ES:DI -> SFT
 20283                                  			; SFT DPB field -> DPB of drive containing file
 20284                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AX = DOS error code
 20285                                  			; CF clear if successful
 20286                                  localcommit_retn: ; 18/12/2022	
 20287 000031A6 C3                      	retn
 20288                                  ;ENDIF
 20289                                  
 20290                                  ; Perform local commit operation by doing a close but not releaseing the SFT.
 20291                                  ; There are three ways we can do this. One is to enter a critical section to
 20292                                  ; protect a potential free. The second is to increment the ref count to mask
 20293                                  ; the close decrementing.
 20294                                  ;
 20295                                  ; The proper way is to let the caller's of close decide if a decrement should
 20296                                  ; be done. We do this by providing another entry into close after the
 20297                                  ; decrement and after the share information release.
 20298                                  
 20299                                  ; DOSCODE:6FA0h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 20300                                  ; DOSCODE:6F8Ch (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) 
 20301                                  
 20302                                  LOCAL_COMMIT:
 20303 000031A7 E854E2                  	call	ECritDisk
 20304                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 20305 000031AA E851E2                  	call	ECritDisk	;PTM.
 20306 000031AD E80E00                  	call	SetSFTTimes
 20307 000031B0 B8FFFF                  	MOV	AX,-1
 20308 000031B3 E8B0FE                  	call	CloseEntry
 20309                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 20310 000031B6 9C                      	PUSHF			;PTM.				;AN000;
 20311 000031B7 E84015                  	call	DEV_OPEN_SFT	;PTM.  increment device count	;AN000;
 20312 000031BA 9D                      	POPF			;PTM.				;AN000;
 20313                                  	;call	LCritDisk	;PTM.				;AN000;
 20314                                  	; 18/12/2022
 20315 000031BB E95BE2                  	jmp	LCritDisk
 20316                                  ;localcommit_retn:
 20317                                  ;	retn

 20319                                  ;Break	<SetSFTTimes - signal a change in the times for an SFT>

 20322                                  ; Procedure Name : SetSFTTimes
 20323                                  ;
 20324                                  ;   SetSFTTimes - Examine the flags for a SFT and set the time appropriately.
 20325                                  ;   Reflect these times in other SFT's for the same file.
 20326                                  ;

 20328                                  ;		BX = sf_flags set apprpriately
 20329                                  ;   Outputs:	Set sft times to current time if File & dirty & !nodate

 20350                                  	;TEST	BX,sf_close_nodate
 20351                                  	;retnz				; nodate => no timestamp
 20352 000031C6 75DE                    	jnz	short localcommit_retn
 20353                                  
 20354 000031C8 50                      	push	ax
 20355 000031C9 53                      	push	bx
 20356 000031CA E89FD9                  	call	DATE16			; Date/Time to AX/DX
 20357                                  	;mov	[es:di+0Fh],ax
 20358 000031CD 2689450F                	MOV	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_date],AX

 20362                                  ;if installed
 20363                                  	;call	JShare + 14 * 4
 20364 000031D7 FF1E[C800]              	call	far [JShare+(14*4)]	; 14 = ShSU
 20365                                  ;else
 20366                                  ;	call	ShSU
 20367                                  ;endif
 20368 000031DB 5B                      	pop	bx
 20369 000031DC 58                      	pop	ax

 20397                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_MkDir
 20398                                  ;
 20399                                  ; Inputs:

 20408                                  ;	Make a new directory

 20600                                  ;BREAK <DOS_ChDir -- Verify a directory>
 20601                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20602                                  ;
 20603                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_ChDir
 20604                                  ;
 20605                                  ; Inputs:
 20606                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:/" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 20607                                  ;		terminated)
 20608                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 20609                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 20610                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)

 20613                                  ;	Validate the path for potential new current directory
 20614                                  ; Returns:

 20616                                  ;	    [SATTRIB] is modified by this call
 20617                                  ;	Carry Clear
 20618                                  ;	    CX is cluster number of the DIR, LOCAL CDS ONLY
 20619                                  ;		Caller must NOT set ID fields on a NET CDS.
 20620                                  ;	Carry Set
 20621                                  ;	    AX is error code
 20622                                  ;		error_path_not_found
 20623                                  ;			Bad path
 20624                                  ;		error_access_denied
 20625                                  ;			device or file name
 20626                                  ; DS preserved, Others destroyed
 20627                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 20647                                  			; SS = DOS CS

 20695                                  ;BREAK <DOS_RmDir -- Remove a directory>
 20696                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20697                                  ;
 20698                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_RmDir
 20699                                  ;
 20700                                  ; Inputs:
 20701                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:/" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 20702                                  ;		terminated)
 20703                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 20704                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 20705                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 20706                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 20707                                  ;		(Low word = -1 if NUL CDS (Net direct request))
 20708                                  ; Function:
 20709                                  ;	Remove a directory
 20710                                  ;	NOTE: Attempt to remove current directory must be detected by caller
 20711                                  ; Returns:
 20712                                  ;	NOTE:
 20713                                  ;	    [SATTRIB] is modified by this call
 20714                                  ;	Carry Clear
 20715                                  ;		No error
 20716                                  ;	Carry Set
 20717                                  ;	    AX is error code
 20718                                  ;		error_path_not_found

 20720                                  ;		error_bad_curr_dir
 20721                                  ;			Bad path in current directory part of path
 20722                                  ;		error_access_denied
 20723                                  ;			device or file name, root directory
 20724                                  ;			Bad directory ('.' '..' messed up)
 20725                                  ; DS preserved, Others destroyed
 20726                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20727                                  
 20728                                  ;hkn; called from path.asm. DS already set up.
 20729                                  
 20730                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 20731                                  ; DOSCODE:711Fh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 20732                                  
 20733                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 20734                                  ; DOSCODE:710Bh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)

 20746                                  			; SS = DOS CS

 20748                                  			; SDA CDS pointer -> current directory
 20749                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AX = DOS error code
 20750                                  			; CF clear if successful
 20751 0000331B C3                      	retn

 20890                                  
 20891                                  ;	TITLE	DISK - Disk utility routines
 20892                                  ;	NAME	Disk
 20893                                  
 20894                                  ;**	Low level Read and write routines for local SFT I/O on files and devs
 20895                                  ;
 20896                                  ;	SWAPCON
 20897                                  ;	SWAPBACK
 20898                                  ;	DOS_READ
 20899                                  ;	DOS_WRITE
 20900                                  ;	get_io_sft
 20901                                  ;	DirRead
 20902                                  ;	FIRSTCLUSTER
 20903                                  ;	SET_BUF_AS_DIR
 20904                                  ;	FATSecRd
 20905                                  ;	DREAD
 20906                                  ;	CHECK_WRITE_LOCK
 20907                                  ;	CHECK_READ_LOCK
 20908                                  ;
 20909                                  ;	Revision history:
 20910                                  ;
 20911                                  ;		A000   version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 20912                                  ;
 20913                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20914                                  ;
 20915                                  ; M065 : B#5276. On raw read/write of a block of characters if a critical
 20916                                  ;		error happens, DOS retries the entire block assuming that
 20917                                  ;		zero characters were transferred. Modified the code to take
 20918                                  ;		into account the number of characters transfered before
 20919                                  ;		retrying the operation.
 20920                                  ;
 20921                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20922                                  ;
 20923                                  
 20924                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 20925                                  
 20926                                  ;Break	<SwapCon, Swap Back - Old-style I/O to files>
 20927                                  
 20928                                  ; **** Drivers for file input from devices ****
 20929                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20930                                  ;   Indicate that there is no more I/O occurring through another SFT outside
 20931                                  ;   of handles 0 and 1
 20932                                  ;
 20933                                  ;   Inputs:	DS is DOSDATA
 20934                                  ;   Outputs:	CONSWAP is set to false.
 20935                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 20936                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20937                                  
 20938                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 3CF8h
 20939                                  
 20940                                  ; DOSCODE:71E3h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 20941                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 20942                                  
 20943                                  ; DOSCODE:71CFh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 20944                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 20945                                  
 20946                                  SWAPBACK:
 20947 000033CE C606[5703]00            	MOV	BYTE [CONSWAP],0	; signal no conswaps
 20948 000033D3 C3                      	retn
 20949                                  
 20950                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20951                                  ;
 20952                                  ; Procedure Name : SWAPCON
 20953                                  ;
 20954                                  ;   Copy ThisSFT to CONSFT for use by the 1-12 primitives.
 20955                                  ;
 20956                                  ;   Inputs:	ThisSFT as the sft of the desired file
 20957                                  ;		DS is DOSDATA
 20958                                  ;   Outputs:	CONSWAP is set.  CONSFT = ThisSFT.
 20959                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 20960                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20961                                  
 20962                                  SWAPCON:
 20963                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 20964                                  	;push	es
 20965                                  	;push	di
 20966                                  	;mov	byte [CONSWAP],1
 20967                                  	;les	di,[THISSFT]
 20968                                  	;mov	word [CONSFT],di
 20969                                  	;mov	word [CONSFT+2],es
 20970                                  	;pop	di
 20971                                  	;pop	es
 20972                                  	;retn
 20973                                  
 20974                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 20975 000033D4 C606[5703]01            	mov	byte [CONSWAP],1	; ConSwap = TRUE
 20976 000033D9 50                      	push	ax
 20977 000033DA A1[9E05]                	mov	ax,[THISSFT]
 20978 000033DD A3[E605]                	mov	[CONSFT],ax
 20979 000033E0 A1[A005]                	mov	ax,[THISSFT+2]
 20980 000033E3 A3[E805]                	mov	[CONSFT+2],ax
 20981 000033E6 58                      	pop	ax
 20982 000033E7 C3                      	retn
 20983                                  
 20984                                  ; DOSCODE:71FDh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 20985                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 20986                                  
 20987                                  ;Break	<DOS_READ -- MAIN READ ROUTINE AND DEVICE IN ROUTINES>
 20988                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20989                                  ;
 20990                                  ; Inputs:
 20991                                  ;	ThisSFT set to the SFT for the file being used
 20992                                  ;	[DMAADD] contains transfer address
 20993                                  ;	CX = No. of bytes to read
 20994                                  ;	DS = DOSDATA
 20995                                  ; Function:
 20996                                  ;	Perform read operation
 20997                                  ; Outputs:
 20998                                  ;    Carry clear
 20999                                  ;	SFT Position and cluster pointers updated
 21000                                  ;	CX = No. of bytes read
 21001                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 21002                                  ;    Carry set
 21003                                  ;	AX is error code
 21004                                  ;	CX = 0
 21005                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 21006                                  ; DS preserved, all other registers destroyed
 21007                                  ;
 21008                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21009                                  
 21010                                  ;hkn; called from fcbio.asm, handle.asm and dev.asm. DS is be set up.
 21011                                  
 21012                                  ; DOSCODE:71E9h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 21013                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 21014                                  
 21015                                  DOS_READ:
 21016 000033E8 C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 21017                                  
 21018                                  ; Verify that the sft has been opened in a mode that allows reading.
 21019                                  
 21020                                  	;mov	al,[es:di+2]
 21021 000033EC 268A4502                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode]
 21022                                  	;and	al,0Fh
 21023 000033F0 240F                    	AND	AL,access_mask
 21024                                  	;cmp	al,1
 21025 000033F2 3C01                    	CMP	AL,open_for_write
 21026 000033F4 7503                    	JNE	short READ_NO_MODE	; Is read or both
 21027 000033F6 E90306                  	jmp	SET_ACC_ERR
 21028                                  
 21029                                  READ_NO_MODE:
 21030 000033F9 E8E104                  	call	SETUP
 21031 000033FC E30B                    	JCXZ	NoIORet 		; no bytes to read - fast return
 21032 000033FE E852DF                  	call	IsSFTNet
 21033 00003401 7408                    	JZ	short LOCAL_READ
 21034                                  
 21035                                  ;IF NOT Installed
 21036                                  ;	transfer NET_READ
 21037                                  ;ELSE
 21038                                  	;mov	ax,1108h
 21039 00003403 B80811                  	MOV	AX,(MultNET<<8)|8
 21040 00003406 CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - READ FROM REMOTE FILE
 21041                                  			; ES:DI -> SFT
 21042                                  			; SFT DPB field -> DPB of drive containing file
 21043                                  			; CX = number of bytes, SS = DOS CS, SDA DTA field -> user buffer
 21044                                  			; Return: CF set on error, CX = bytes read
 21045 00003408 C3                      	retn
 21046                                  ;ENDIF
 21047                                  
 21048                                  ; The user ended up requesting 0 bytes of input. We do nothing for this case
 21049                                  ; except return immediately.
 21050                                  
 21051                                  NoIORet:
 21052 00003409 F8                      	CLC
 21053 0000340A C3                      	retn
 21054                                  
 21055                                  LOCAL_READ:
 21056                                  	;test	word [es:di+5],80h
 21057                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],devid_device  ; Check for named device I/O
 21058 0000340B 26F6450580              	test	byte [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],devid_device ; 02/06/2019
 21059 00003410 750E                    	JNZ	short READDEV
 21060                                  
 21061                                  	;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],2
 21062 00003412 C606[2303]02            	MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Disk

 21064 0000341A E89B05                  	call	DISKREAD
 21065                                  
 21066                                  critexit:
 21067                                  	;call	LCritDisk
 21068                                  	;retn
 21069                                  	; 16/12/2022
 21070 0000341D E9F9DF                  	jmp	LCritDisk
 21071                                  
 21072                                  ; We are reading from a device. Examine the status of the device to see if we
 21073                                  ; can short-circuit the I/O. If the device in the EOF state or if it is the
 21074                                  ; null device, we can safely indicate no transfer.
 21075                                  
 21076                                  READDEV:
 21077                                  	;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],4
 21078 00003420 C606[2303]04            	MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_SerDev
 21079                                  	;mov	bl,[es:di+5]
 21080 00003425 268A5D05                	MOV	BL,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags]
 21081 00003429 C43E[2C03]              	LES	DI,[DMAADD]
 21082                                  	;test	bl,40h

 21089                                  ENDRDDEVJ3:
 21090                                  	; 17/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility!)
 21091                                  	;JMP	short ENDRDDEVJ2
 21092                                  	; 16/12/2022

 21094                                  
 21095                                  ; We need to hit the device. Figure out if we do a raw read or we do the
 21096                                  ; bizarre std_con_string_input.
 21097

 21099                                  	;test	bl,20h

 21102                                  	;test	bl,1

 21106                                  
 21107                                  DVRDRAW:

 21109 0000344A 1F                      	POP	DS			; Xaddr to DS:DI
 21110                                  
 21111                                  	; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21112                                  
 21113                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 21115                                  ;Check for win386 presence -- if present, do polled read of characters
 21116

 21122                                  
 21123                                  ReadRawRetry:

 21125 0000345D 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX			; Media Byte, unit = 0
 21126 0000345F 89C2                    	MOV	DX,AX			; Start at 0

 21129

 21135

 21144                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 21145 0000347A E8631F                  	call	CHARHARD
 21146 0000347D 89D7                    	MOV	DI,DX			; DS:DI is Xaddr
 21147                                  
 21148                                  	; 04/05/2019
 21149                                  
 21150                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 21151 0000347F 36033E[6C03]            	add	di,[ss:CALLSCNT]	; update ptr and count to reflect the	M065
 21152 00003484 362B0E[6C03]            	sub	cx,[ss:CALLSCNT]	; number of chars xferred		M065
 21153

 21155 00003489 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL

 21158 0000348F 7403                    	JZ	short CRDFERR 		; fail.
 21159 00003491 1F                      	POP	DS			; Recover saved seg part of Xaddr
 21160 00003492 EBC7                    	JMP	short ReadRawRetry	; Retry
 21161                                  
 21162                                  ; We have encountered a device-driver error. We have informed the user of it
 21163                                  ; and he has said for us to fail the system call.
 21164

 21179                                  	;JMP	SHORT ENDRDDEVJ3
 21180                                  	; 16/12/2022

 21182                                  
 21183                                  ; We are going to do a cooked read on some character device. There is a
 21184                                  ; problem here, what does the data look like? Is it a terminal device, line
 21185                                  ; CR line CR line CR, or is it file data, line CR LF line CR LF? Does it have
 21186                                  ; a ^Z at the end which is data, or is the ^Z not data?  In any event we're
 21187                                  ; going to do this: Read in pieces up to CR (CRs included in data) or ^z (^z
 21188                                  ; included in data). this "simulates" the way con works in cooked mode
 21189                                  ; reading one line at a time. With file data, however, the lines will look
 21190                                  ; like, LF line CR. This is a little weird.
 21191

 21274                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 21275                                  ;SR;

 21279                                  ;		  cx is count

 21347

 21378

 21381                                  	;jmp	ENDRDDEVJ3	;jump back to normal DOS raw read exit
 21382                                  	;jmp	ENDRDDEV ; 04/05/2019
 21383                                  
 21384                                  	; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21385                                  ENDRDDEV:
 21386 000035A3 16                      	push	ss
 21387 000035A4 1F                      	pop	ds
 21388 000035A5 EB1F                    	jmp	short endrddev1
 21389                                  
 21390                                  	; 17/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 21391                                  	;jmp	ENDRDDEVJ3	;jump back to normal DOS raw read exit
 21392                                  
 21393                                  TRANBUF:
 21394 000035A7 AC                      	LODSB
 21395 000035A8 AA                      	STOSB

 21397 000035AB 7503                    	JNZ	short NORMCH

 21399                                  NORMCH:

 21402 000035B4 7507                    	JNZ	short ENDRDCON

 21404 000035B8 E89FE1                  	call	OUTT		; Transmit linefeed
 21405 000035BB 0C01                    	OR	AL,1		; Clear zero flag--not end of file

 21412                                  
 21413                                  	; 16/12/2022

 21416                                  ;	push	ss
 21417                                  ;	pop	ds
 21418                                  endrddev1:	; 04/05/2019

 21424                                  				; Mark as no more data available

 21430                                  
 21431                                  ; 16/12/2022
 21432                                  %if 0
 21433                                  	; 17/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)

 21450                                  READCON:

 21483                                  
 21484                                  ; 24/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 21485                                  
 21486                                  ;Break	<DOS_WRITE -- MAIN WRITE ROUTINE AND DEVICE OUT ROUTINES>
 21487                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21488                                  ;
 21489                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_WRITE
 21490                                  ;
 21491                                  ; Inputs:
 21492                                  ;	ThisSFT set to the SFT for the file being used
 21493                                  ;	[DMAADD] contains transfer address
 21494                                  ;	CX = No. of bytes to write
 21495                                  ; Function:
 21496                                  ;	Perform write operation
 21497                                  ;	NOTE: If CX = 0 on input, file is truncated or grown
 21498                                  ;		to current sf_position
 21499                                  ; Outputs:
 21500                                  ;    Carry clear
 21501                                  ;	SFT Position and cluster pointers updated
 21502                                  ;	CX = No. of bytes written
 21503                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 21504                                  ;    Carry set
 21505                                  ;	AX is error code
 21506                                  ;	CX = 0
 21507                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 21508                                  ; DS preserved, all other registers destroyed
 21509                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21510                                  
 21511                                  ;hkn; called from fcbio2.asm, handle.asm and dev.asm. DS is set up at this 
 21512                                  ;hkn; point to DOSDATA.
 21513                                  
 21514                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21515                                  ; DOSCODE:742Ch (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 21516                                  
 21517                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 21518                                  ; DOSCODE:7418h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 21519                                  
 21520                                  DOS_WRITE:
 21521 00003611 C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 21522                                  	;mov	al,[ES:DI+2]
 21523 00003615 268A4502                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode]
 21524                                  	;and	al,0Fh
 21525 00003619 240F                    	AND	AL,access_mask
 21526                                  	;cmp	al,0
 21527 0000361B 3C00                    	CMP	AL,open_for_read
 21528 0000361D 7503                    	JNE	short Check_FCB_RO		 ;Is write or both
 21529                                  BadMode:
 21530 0000361F E9DA03                  	jmp	SET_ACC_ERR
 21531                                  
 21532                                  ; NOTE: The following check for writting to a Read Only File is performed
 21533                                  ;	    ONLY on FCBs!!!!
 21534                                  ;	We ALLOW writes to Read Only files via handles to allow a CREATE
 21535                                  ;	    of a read only file which can then be written to.
 21536                                  ;	This is OK because we are NOT ALLOWED to OPEN a RO file via handles
 21537                                  ;	    for writting, or RE-CREATE an EXISTING RO file via handles. Thus,
 21538                                  ;	    CREATing a NEW RO file, or RE-CREATing an existing file which
 21539                                  ;	    is NOT RO to be RO, via handles are the only times we can write
 21540                                  ;	    to a read-only file.
 21541                                  
 21542                                  Check_FCB_RO:

 21805                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21806                                  ;
 21807                                  ; Procedure Name : get_io_sft
 21808                                  ;
 21809                                  ;   Convert JFN number in BX to sf_entry in DS:SI We get the normal SFT if
 21810                                  ;   CONSWAP is FALSE or if the handle desired is 2 or more. Otherwise, we
 21811                                  ;   retrieve the sft from ConSFT which is set by SwapCon.
 21812                                  ;
 21813                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21814                                  
 21815                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21816                                  ; DOSCODE:7583h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 21817                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 21818                                  ; DOSCODE:756Fh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 21819                                  
 21820                                  GET_IO_SFT:
 21821                                  	;test	byte [SS:CONSWAP],0FFh
 21822 00003764 36803E[5703]00          	cmp	byte [SS:CONSWAP],0			;smr;SS Override
 21823 0000376A 7512                    	JNZ	short GetRedir
 21824                                  GetNormal:
 21825 0000376C 16                      	push	ss
 21826 0000376D 1F                      	pop	ds
 21827 0000376E 06                      	PUSH	ES
 21828 0000376F 57                      	PUSH	DI
 21829 00003770 E83B30                  	call	SFFromHandle
 21830 00003773 7206                    	JC	short RET44P
 21831 00003775 8CC6                    	MOV	SI,ES
 21832 00003777 8EDE                    	MOV	DS,SI
 21833 00003779 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI
 21834                                  RET44P:
 21835 0000377B 5F                      	POP	DI
 21836 0000377C 07                      	POP	ES
 21837 0000377D C3                      	retn
 21838                                  GetRedir:

 21840 00003781 77E9                    	JA	short GetNormal

 21842 00003788 F8                      	CLC
 21843                                  get_io_sft_retn:
 21844 00003789 C3                      	retn

 21846                                  ;Break	<DIRREAD -- READ A DIRECTORY SECTOR>
 21847                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21848                                  ;
 21849                                  ; Procedure Name : DIRREAD
 21850                                  ;
 21851                                  ; Inputs:
 21852                                  ;	AX = Directory block number (relative to first block of directory)
 21853                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 21854                                  ;	[DIRSEC] = First sector of first cluster of directory
 21855                                  ;	[CLUSNUM] = Next cluster
 21856                                  ;	[CLUSFAC] = Sectors/Cluster
 21857                                  ; Function:
 21858                                  ;	Read the directory block into [CURBUF].
 21859                                  ; Outputs:
 21860                                  ;	[NXTCLUSNUM] = Next cluster (after the one skipped to)
 21861                                  ;	[SECCLUSPOS] Set
 21862                                  ;	ES:BP unchanged
 21863                                  ;	[CURBUF] Points to Buffer with dir sector
 21864                                  ;	Carry set if error (user said FAIL to I 24)
 21865                                  ; DS preserved, all other registers destroyed.
 21866                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21867                                  
 21868                                  ;hkn; called from dir.asm. DS already set up to DOSDATA.
 21869                                  
 21870                                  DIRREAD:
 21871                                  
 21872                                  ; Note that ClusFac is the sectors per cluster. This is NOT necessarily
 21873                                  ; the same as what is in the DPB! In the case of the root directory, we have
 21874                                  ; ClusFac = # sectors in the root directory. The root directory is detected
 21875                                  ; by DIRStart = 0.
 21876                                  
 21877 0000378A 31D2                    	XOR	DX,DX
 21878                                  	;CMP	word [DIRSTART],0
 21879                                  	; 21/09/2023
 21880 0000378C 3916[C205]              	cmp	[DIRSTART],dx ; 0
 21881 00003790 7503                    	jnz	short SubDir
 21882 00003792 92                      	XCHG	AX,DX
 21883 00003793 EB0C                    	JMP	short DoRead
 21884                                  
 21885                                  ; Convert the sector number in AX into cluster and sector-within-cluster pair
 21886                                  
 21887                                  SubDir:
 21888 00003795 88C2                    	MOV	DL,AL
 21889                                  	;and	dl,[es:bp+4]
 21890 00003797 26225604                	AND	DL,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_MASK]
 21891                                  
 21892                                  ;	(DX) = sector-in-cluster
 21893                                  
 21894                                  	;mov	cl,[es:bp+5]
 21895 0000379B 268A4E05                	MOV	CL,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_SHIFT]
 21896 0000379F D3E8                    	SHR	AX,CL
 21897                                  
 21898                                  ;	(DX) = position in cluster
 21899                                  ;	(AX) = number of clusters to skip
 21900                                  
 21901                                  DoRead:
 21902 000037A1 8816[7305]              	MOV	[SECCLUSPOS],DL
 21903 000037A5 89C1                    	MOV	CX,AX
 21904 000037A7 88D4                    	MOV	AH,DL
 21905                                  
 21906                                  ;	(CX) = number of clusters to skip.
 21907                                  ;	(AH) = remainder
 21908                                  
 21909                                  	; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21910                                  	 
 21911                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 21912                                  	;MOV	DX,[DIRSEC+2]	     	  ;>32mb
 21913                                  	;MOV	[HIGH_SECTOR],DX	  ;>32mb
 21914                                  	;MOV	DX,[DIRSEC]
 21915                                  	;ADD	DL,AH
 21916                                  	;ADC	DH,0
 21917                                  	;ADC	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0	  ;>32mb
 21918                                  	; 21/09/2023
 21919 000037A9 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx ; 0
 21920 000037AB 8B16[BE05]              	mov	dx,[DIRSEC]
 21921 000037AF 00E2                    	add	dl,ah
 21922 000037B1 10DE                    	adc	dh,bl ; 0
 21923 000037B3 131E[C005]              	adc	bx,[DIRSEC+2]
 21924 000037B7 891E[0706]              	mov	[HIGH_SECTOR],bx
 21925                                  
 21926 000037BB 8B1E[BC05]              	MOV	BX,[CLUSNUM]
 21927 000037BF 891E[DC05]              	MOV	[NXTCLUSNUM],BX
 21928 000037C3 E319                    	JCXZ	FIRSTCLUSTER
 21929                                  SKPCLLP:
 21930 000037C5 E8831E                  	call	UNPACK
 21931 000037C8 72BF                    	jc	short get_io_sft_retn
 21932 000037CA 87DF                    	XCHG	BX,DI
 21933 000037CC E8651E                  	call	IsEOF			; test for eof based on fat size
 21934 000037CF 7302                    	JAE	short HAVESKIPPED
 21935 000037D1 E2F2                    	LOOP	SKPCLLP
 21936                                  HAVESKIPPED:
 21937 000037D3 891E[DC05]              	MOV	[NXTCLUSNUM],BX
 21938 000037D7 89FA                    	MOV	DX,DI
 21939 000037D9 88E3                    	MOV	BL,AH
 21940 000037DB E81617                  	call	FIGREC
 21941                                  
 21942                                  	;entry	FIRSTCLUSTER
 21943                                  
 21944                                  FIRSTCLUSTER:
 21945                                  	; 22/09/2023
 21946                                  	;;mov	byte [ALLOWED],18h
 21947                                  	;MOV	byte [ALLOWED],Allowed_RETRY+Allowed_FAIL ; *
 21948                                  	;XOR	AL,AL ; *	; Indicate pre-read
 21949                                  	;call	GETBUFFR
 21950 000037DE E8A322                  	call	GETBUFFER ; *	; pre-read
 21951 000037E1 72A6                    	jc	short get_io_sft_retn
 21952                                  
 21953                                  	;entry	SET_BUF_AS_DIR
 21954                                  
 21955                                  SET_BUF_AS_DIR:
 21956                                  
 21957                                  ;	Set the type of CURBUF to be a directory sector.
 21958                                  ;	Only flags are modified.
 21959                                  
 21960 000037E3 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 21961 000037E4 56                      	PUSH	SI
 21962 000037E5 C536[E205]              	LDS	SI,[CURBUF]
 21963                                  	;or	byte [si+5],4
 21964 000037E9 804C0504                	OR	byte [SI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_isDIR	; Clears carry
 21965 000037ED 5E                      	POP	SI
 21966 000037EE 1F                      	POP	DS
 21967                                  dirread_retn:
 21968 000037EF C3                      	retn

 21970                                  ;Break	<FATSECRD -- READ A FAT SECTOR>
 21971                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21972                                  ;
 21973                                  ; Procedure Name : FATSECRD
 21974                                  ; Inputs:
 21975                                  ;	Same as DREAD
 21976                                  ;	DS:BX = Transfer address
 21977                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors
 21978                                  ;	DX = Absolute record number
 21979                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 21980                                  ; Function:

 21985

 21999                                  	;XOR	AH,AH
 22000                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 22001                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bp+0Fh]
 22002 000037FC 268B460F                	MOV	AX,[ES:BP+DPB.FAT_SIZE] ;>32mb
 22003 00003800 30ED                    	XOR	CH,CH

 22005                                  NXTFAT:
 22006                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 22007                                  ;hkn; SS override
 22008 00003803 36C706[0706]0000        	MOV	word [SS:HIGH_SECTOR],0	;>32mb FAT sectors cannot exceed
 22009 0000380A 51                      	PUSH	CX			;32mb
 22010 0000380B 50                      	PUSH	AX
 22011 0000380C 89F9                    	MOV	CX,DI
 22012 0000380E E85B00                  	call	DSKREAD
 22013 00003811 58                      	POP	AX
 22014 00003812 59                      	POP	CX
 22015 00003813 7420                    	JZ	short RET41P		; Carry clear
 22016 00003815 01C2                    	ADD	DX,AX

 22018 00003819 5A                      	POP	DX
 22019 0000381A 89F9                    	MOV	CX,DI
 22020

 22023                                  ;Break	<DREAD -- DO A DISK READ>
 22024                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22025                                  ;
 22026                                  ; Procedure Name : DREAD
 22027                                  ;
 22028                                  ; Inputs:
 22029                                  ;	DS:BX = Transfer address
 22030                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors
 22031                                  ;	DX = Absolute record number	      (LOW)
 22032                                  ;	[HIGH_SECTOR] = Absolute record number (HIGH)
 22033                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 22034                                  ;	[ALLOWED] must be set in case call to HARDERR needed
 22035                                  ; Function:
 22036                                  ;	Calls BIOS to perform disk read. If BIOS reports
 22037                                  ;	errors, will call HARDERRRW for further action.
 22038                                  ; Outputs:
 22039                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILED to INT 24)
 22040                                  ; DS,ES:BP preserved. All other registers destroyed.
 22041                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22042                                  
 22043                                  	;entry	DREAD
 22044                                  DREAD:
 22045 0000381C E84D00                  	call	DSKREAD
 22046 0000381F 74CE                    	jz	short dirread_retn	; Carry clear
 22047                                  ;hkn; SS override
 22048 00003821 36C606[7505]00          	MOV	BYTE [SS:READOP],0
 22049 00003827 E89A00                  	call	HARDERRRW
 22050 0000382A 3C01                    	CMP	AL,1			; Check for retry
 22051 0000382C 74EE                    	JZ	short DREAD
 22052 0000382E 3C03                    	CMP	AL,3			; Check for FAIL
 22053 00003830 F8                      	CLC
 22054 00003831 7501                    	JNZ	short NO_CAR		; Ignore
 22055 00003833 F9                      	STC
 22056                                  NO_CAR:
 22057 00003834 C3                      	retn
 22058                                  RET41P: 
 22059 00003835 5A                      	POP	DX
 22060 00003836 C3                      	retn

 22099 0000383E E9B901                  	jmp	SET_ACC_ERR_DS

 22105 00003846 49                      	dec	cx			;(cx) = -1; check for lock on whole file
 22106                                  Not_Truncate:				;

 22113                                  WRITE_OK:				;

 22162                                  ;	TITLE	DISK2 - Disk utility routines
 22163                                  ;	NAME	Disk2
 22164                                  
 22165                                  ;**	Low level Read and write routines for local SFT I/O on files and devs
 22166                                  ;
 22167                                  ;	DskRead
 22168                                  ;	DWRITE

 22182                                  ;	Revision history:
 22183                                  ;
 22184                                  ;		AN000 version 4.00 Jan. 1988
 22185                                  ;		M039 DB 10/17/90 - Disk read/write optimization
 22186

 22188                                  ; DOSCODE:7699h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 22189                                  ; 18/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
