 28584                                  
 28585                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28586                                  ; DOSCODE:8DC2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 28587                                  
 28588                                  ; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 28589                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 
 28590                                  
 28591                                  ;Break   <ALLOCATE -- Assign disk space>
 28592                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28593                                  ;
 28594                                  ; Procedure Name : ALLOCATE - Allocate Disk Space
 28595                                  ;
 28596                                  ;   ALLOCATE is called to allocate disk clusters. The new clusters are
 28597                                  ;   FAT-chained onto the end of the existing file.
 28598                                  ;
 28599                                  ;   The DPB contains the cluster # of the last free cluster allocated
 28600                                  ;   (dpb_next_free). We start at this cluster and scan towards higher
 28601                                  ;   numbered clusters, looking for the necessary free blocks.
 28602                                  ;
 28603                                  ;   Once again, fancy terminology gets in the way of correct coding. When
 28604                                  ;   using next_free, start scanning AT THAT POINT and not the one following it.
 28605                                  ;   This fixes the boundary condition bug when only free = next_free = 2.
 28606                                  ;
 28607                                  ;       If we get to the end of the disk without satisfaction:
 28608                                  ;
 28609                                  ;           if (dpb_next_free == 2) then we've scanned the whole disk.
 28610                                  ;               return (insufficient_disk_space)
 28611                                  ;           ELSE
 28612                                  ;               dpb_next_free = 2; start scan over from the beginning.
 28613                                  ;
 28614                                  ;   Note that there is no multitasking interlock. There is no race when
 28615                                  ;   examining the entrys in an in-core FAT block since there will be no
 28616                                  ;   context switch. When UNPACK context switches while waiting for a FAT read
 28617                                  ;   we are done with any in-core FAT blocks, so again there is no race. The
 28618                                  ;   only special concern is that V2 and V3 MSDOS left the last allocated
 28619                                  ;   cluster as "00"; marking it EOF only when the entire alloc request was
 28620                                  ;   satisfied. We can't allow another activation to think this cluster is
 28621                                  ;   free, so we give it a special temporary mark to show that it is, indeed,
 28622                                  ;   allocated.
 28623                                  ;
 28624                                  ;   Note that when we run out of space this algorithem will scan from
 28625                                  ;   dpb_next_free to the end, then scan from cluster 2 through the end,
 28626                                  ;   redundantly scanning the later part of the disk. This only happens when
 28627                                  ;   we run out of space, so sue me.
 28628                                  ;
 28629                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
 28630                                  ;            C  A  V  E  A  T     P  A  T  T  E  R  S  O  N                ;
 28631                                  ;                                                                          ;
 28632                                  ;   The use of FATBYT and RESTFATBYT is somewhat mysterious. Here is the
 28633                                  ;   explanation:
 28634                                  ;
 28635                                  ;   In the NUL file case (sf_firclus currently 0) ALLOCATE is called with
 28636                                  ;   entry BX = 0. What needs to be done in this case is to stuff the cluster
 28637                                  ;   number of the first cluster allocated in sf_firclus when the ALLOCATE is
 28638                                  ;   complete. THIS VALUE IS SAVED TEMPORARILY IN CLUSTER 0, HENCE THE CURRENT
 28639                                  ;   VALUE IN CLUSTER 0 MUST BE SAVED AND RESTORED. This is a side effect of
 28640                                  ;   the fact that PACK and UNPACK don't treat requests for clusters 0 and 1 as
 28641                                  ;   errors. This "stuff" is done by the call to PACK which is right before
 28642                                  ;   the
 28643                                  ;           LOOP   findfre         ; alloc more if needed
 28644                                  ;   instruction when the first cluster is allocated to the nul file. The
 28645                                  ;   value is recalled from cluster 0 and stored at sf_firclus at ads4:
 28646                                  ;
 28647                                  ;   This method is obviously useless (because it is non-reentrant) for
 28648                                  ;   multitasking, and will have to be changed. Storing the required value on
 28649                                  ;   the stack is recommended. Setting sf_firclus at the PACK of cluster 0
 28650                                  ;   (instead of actually doing the PACK) is BAD because it doesn't handle
 28651                                  ;   problems with INT 24 well.
 28652                                  ;
 28653                                  ;            C  A  V  E  A  T     P  A  T  T  E  R  S  O  N                ;
 28654                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
 28655                                  ;                                                                          ;
 28656                                  ;       ENTRY   BX = Last cluster of file (0 if null file)
 28657                                  ;               CX = No. of clusters to allocate
 28658                                  ;               ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 28659                                  ;               [THISSFT] = Points to SFT
 28660                                  ;
 28661                                  ;       EXIT    'C' set if insufficient space
 28662                                  ;                 [FAILERR] can be tested to see the reason for failure
 28663                                  ;                 CX = max. no. of clusters that could be added to file
 28664                                  ;               'C' clear if space allocated
 28665                                  ;                 BX = First cluster allocated
 28666                                  ;                 FAT is fully updated
 28667                                  ;                 sf_FIRCLUS field of SFT set if file was null
 28668                                  ;
 28669                                  ;       USES    ALL but SI, BP
 28670                                  
 28671                                  ;callmagic  proc near
 28672                                  ;       push    ds                             ;push segment of routine 
 28673                                  ;       push    Offset MagicPatch              ;push offset for routine
 28674                                  ;       retf                                   ;simulate jmp far
 28675                                  ;                                              ;far return address is on
 28676                                  ;                                              ;stack, so far return from
 28677                                  ;                                              ;call will return this routine
 28678                                  ;callmagic  endp
 28679                                  
 28680                                  
 28681                                  ; 25/09/2023
 28682                                  %if 0
 28683                                  callmagic:
 28684                                  	push	ds
 28685                                  	push	MagicPatch
 28686                                  	retf	
 28687                                  %endif
 28688                                  
 28689                                  ALLOCATE:
 28690                                  	; 10/09/2018
 28691                                  ;BEGIN MAGICDRV MODIFICATIONS
 28692                                  ;
 28693                                  ;7/5/92 scottq
 28694                                  ;
 28695                                  ;This is the disk compression patch location which allows
 28696                                  ;the disk compression software to fail allocations if the
 28697                                  ;FAT would allows allocation, but the free space for compressed
 28698                                  ;data would not.
 28699                                  ;        
 28700                                  ;;;	call    far ptr MAGICPATCH
 28701                                  ;;; We cannot do a far call since we cannot have fix-ups[romdos,hidos],
 28702                                  ;;; but we do know the segment and offset of the routine
 28703                                  ;;; so simulate a far call to dosdata:magicpatch
 28704                                  ;;; note dosassume above, so DS -> dosdata
 28705                                  
 28706                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 28707                                          ;clc				;clear carry so we fall through
 28708                                  	;				;if no patch is present
 28709                                  	;push	cs			;push segment for far return
 28710                                          ;call	callmagic		;this is a near call
 28711                                          ;jnc	short Regular_Allocate_Path
 28712                                  	;jmp	Disk_Full_Return
 28713                                  
 28714                                  ; 25/09/2023
 28715                                  %if 0
 28716                                  	clc
 28717                                  	push	cs
 28718                                  	call	callmagic
 28719                                  	jnc	short Regular_Allocate_Path
 28720                                  	jmp	Disk_Full_Return
 28721                                  Regular_Allocate_Path:
 28722                                  %endif
 28723                                  
 28724                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28725                                  ;END MAGICDRV MODIFICATIONS
 28726                                  
 28727                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28728                                  	; DOSCODE:8D87h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 28729                                  
 28730 00004F21 53                              PUSH    BX                      ; save (bx)
 28731 00004F22 31DB                            XOR     BX,BX
 28732 00004F24 E82407                  	call	UNPACK
 28733 00004F27 893E[9605]                      MOV     [FATBYT],DI             ; save correct cluster 0 value
 28734 00004F2B 5B                              POP     BX
 28735 00004F2C 72F2                            jc	short figrec_retn	; abort if error   [INTERR?]
 28736                                  
 28737 00004F2E 51                              PUSH    CX
 28738 00004F2F 53                              PUSH    BX
 28739                                  
 28740 00004F30 89DA                            MOV     DX,BX
 28741                                  	;;mov	bx,[es:bp+1Ch]  ; MSDOS 3.3
 28742                                  	;mov	bx,[es:bp+1Dh]	; MSDOS 6.0
 28743 00004F32 268B5E1D                        mov     bx,[ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE]
 28744 00004F36 83FB02                          cmp     bx,2
 28745 00004F39 7709                            ja	short FINDFRE
 28746                                  
 28747                                  ;   couldn't find enough free space beyond dpb_next_free, or dpb_next_free is
 28748                                  ;   <2 or >dpb_max_clus. Reset it and restart the scan
 28749                                  
 28750                                  ads1:
 28751                                  	;;mov	word [es:bp+1Ch],2 ; MSDOS 3.3
 28752                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Dh],2 ; MSDOS 6.0
 28753 00004F3B 26C7461D0200                    mov     word [ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE],2
 28754 00004F41 BB0100                          mov     bx,1                    ; Counter next instruction so first
 28755                                                                          ;       cluster examined is 2
 28756                                  
 28757                                  ;   Scanning both forwards and backwards for a free cluster
 28758                                  ;
 28759                                  ;       (BX) = forwards scan pointer
 28760                                  ;       (CX) = clusters remaining to be allocated
 28761                                  ;       (DX) = current last cluster in file
 28762                                  ;       (TOS) = last cluster of file
 28763                                  
 28764                                  FINDFRE:
 28765 00004F44 43                              INC     BX
 28766                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:bp+0Dh]
 28767 00004F45 263B5E0D                        CMP	BX,[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER]
 28768 00004F49 7757                    	ja	short ads7	; at end of disk
 28769 00004F4B E8FD06                          call	UNPACK          ; check out this cluster
 28770 00004F4E 722F                            jc	short ads4	; FAT error             [INTERR?]
 28771 00004F50 75F2                            jnz	short FINDFRE	; not free, keep on truckin
 28772                                  
 28773                                  ;   Have found a free cluster. Chain it to the file
 28774                                  ;
 28775                                  ;       (BX) = found free cluster #
 28776                                  ;       (DX) = current last cluster in file
 28777                                  
 28778                                  	;;mov	[es:bp+1Ch],bx
 28779                                  	;mov	[es:bp+1Dh],bx ; MSDOS 6.0
 28780 00004F52 26895E1D                        mov	[ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE],bx ; next time start search here
 28781 00004F56 92                              xchg    ax,dx           ; save (dx) in ax
 28782 00004F57 BA0100                          mov     dx,1            ; mark this free guy as "1"
 28783 00004F5A E84207                  	call	PACK            ; set special "temporary" mark
 28784 00004F5D 7220                            jc	short ads4	; FAT error             [INTERR?]
 28785                                  	;;cmp	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1
 28786                                          ;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 28787 00004F5F 26837E1FFF              	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Free count valid?
 28788 00004F64 7404                            JZ	short NO_ALLOC	; No
 28789                                  	;;dec	word [es:bp+1Eh]
 28790                                          ;dec	word [es:bp+1Fh] ; MSDOS 6.0
 28791 00004F66 26FF4E1F                        DEC     word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT] ; Reduce free count by 1
 28792                                  NO_ALLOC:
 28793 00004F6A 92                              xchg    ax,dx           ; (dx) = current last cluster in file
 28794 00004F6B 87DA                            XCHG    BX,DX
 28795 00004F6D 89D0                            MOV     AX,DX
 28796 00004F6F E82D07                  	call	PACK            ; link free cluster onto file
 28797                                                                  ;  CAVEAT.. On Nul file, first pass stuffs
 28798                                                                  ;    cluster 0 with FIRCLUS value.
 28799 00004F72 720B                            jc	short ads4	; FAT error [INTERR?]
 28800 00004F74 93                              xchg    BX,AX           ; (BX) = last one we looked at
 28801 00004F75 89DA                            mov     dx,bx           ; (dx) = current end of file
 28802 00004F77 E2CB                            LOOP    FINDFRE         ; alloc more if needed
 28803                                  
 28804                                  ;   We've successfully extended the file. Clean up and exit
 28805                                  ;
 28806                                  ;       (BX) = last cluster in file
 28807                                  
 28808 00004F79 BAFFFF                          MOV     DX,0FFFFH
 28809 00004F7C E82007                  	call	PACK            ; mark last cluster EOF
 28810                                  
 28811                                  ;   Note that FAT errors jump here to clean the stack and exit. This saves us
 28812                                  ;   2 whole bytes. Hope its worth it...
 28813                                  ;
 28814                                  ;       'C' set if error
 28815                                  ;       calling (BX) and (CX) pushed on stack
 28816                                  
 28817                                  ads4:   
 28818 00004F7F 5B                      	POP     BX
 28819 00004F80 59                              POP     CX              ; Don't need this stuff since we're successful
 28820 00004F81 729D                            jc	short figrec_retn
 28821 00004F83 E8C506                          call	UNPACK          ; Get first cluster allocated for return
 28822                                                                  ; CAVEAT... In nul file case, UNPACKs cluster 0.
 28823 00004F86 7298                            jc	short figrec_retn
 28824 00004F88 E83200                  	call	RESTFATBYT      ; Restore correct cluster 0 value
 28825 00004F8B 7293                            jc	short figrec_retn
 28826 00004F8D 87DF                            XCHG    BX,DI           ; (DI) = last cluster in file upon our entry
 28827 00004F8F 09FF                            OR      DI,DI           ; clear 'C'
 28828 00004F91 758D                    	jnz	short figrec_retn ; we were extending an existing file
 28829                                  
 28830                                  ;   We were doing the first allocation for a new file. Update the SFT cluster
 28831                                  ;   info
 28832                                  dofastk:
 28833                                  	; 20/05/2019
 28834                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 28835                                  	;push	dx ; * MSDOS 6.0
 28836                                  	;;mov	dl,[es:bp+0]
 28837                                  	;;MOV	DL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]	; get drive #
 28838                                  	;mov	dl,[es:bp]
 28839                                  
 28840                                  	; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 28841                                  	; DOSCODE:8DF9h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 28842                                  	
 28843                                  	; 16/12/2022
 28844                                  	;push	dx ; *
 28845                                  	;mov	dl,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] 
 28846                                  	; 15/12/2022
 28847                                  	;mov	dl,[es:bp]
 28848                                  	
 28849                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 28850 00004F93 06                      	PUSH	ES
 28851 00004F94 C43E[9E05]              	LES     DI,[THISSFT]
 28852                                  	;mov	[es:di+0Bh],bx
 28853 00004F98 26895D0B                	MOV     [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_firclus],BX
 28854                                  	;;mov	[es:di+1Bh],bx ; MSDOS 3.3
 28855                                  	;mov	[es:di+35h],bx ; MSDOS 6.0
 28856 00004F9C 26895D35                	MOV     [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_lstclus],BX
 28857 00004FA0 07                      	POP	ES
 28858                                  	;retn
 28859                                  
 28860                                  	;pop	dx ; * MSDOS 6.0
 28861                                  
 28862                                  	; 16/12/2022
 28863                                  	; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 28864                                  	;pop	dx ; *
 28865                                  
 28866 00004FA1 C3                      	retn	
 28867                                  
 28868                                  ;** we're at the end of the disk, and not satisfied. See if we've scanned ALL
 28869                                  ;   of the disk...
 28870                                  
 28871                                  ads7:   
 28872 00004FA2 26837E1D02              	cmp	word [ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE],2
 28873 00004FA7 7592                    	jnz	short ads1	; start scan from front of disk
 28874                                  
 28875                                  ;   Sorry, we've gone over the whole disk, with insufficient luck. Lets give
 28876                                  ;   the space back to the free list and tell the caller how much he could have
 28877                                  ;   had.  We have to make sure we remove the "special mark" we put on the last
 28878                                  ;   cluster we were able to allocate, so it doesn't become orphaned.
 28879                                  ;
 28880                                  ;       (CX) = clusters remaining to be allocated
 28881                                  ;       (TOS) = last cluster of file (before call to ALLOCATE)
 28882                                  ;       (TOS+1) = # of clusters wanted to allocate
 28883                                  
 28884 00004FA9 5B                              POP     BX              ; (BX) = last cluster of file
 28885 00004FAA BAFFFF                          MOV     DX,0FFFFH
 28886 00004FAD E81F00                  	call	RELBLKS         ; give back any clusters just alloced
 28887 00004FB0 58                              POP     AX              ; No. of clusters requested
 28888                                                                  ; Don't "retc". We are setting Carry anyway,
 28889                                                                  ;   Alloc failed, so proceed with return CX
 28890                                                                  ;   setup.
 28891 00004FB1 29C8                            SUB     AX,CX           ; AX=No. of clusters allocated
 28892 00004FB3 E80700                  	call	RESTFATBYT      ; Don't "retc". We are setting Carry anyway,
 28893                                                                  ;   Alloc failed.
 28894                                  Disk_Full_Return:               ;label added for magic patch 8-6-92 scottq
 28895                                          ; MSDOS 6.0
 28896 00004FB6 C606[0B06]01            	MOV	byte [DISK_FULL],1 ;MS. indicating disk full
 28897 00004FBB F9                              STC
 28898 00004FBC C3                              retn
 28899                                  
 28900                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 28901                                  ;
 28902                                  ; Procedure Name : RESTFATBYT
 28903                                  ;
 28904                                  ; SEE ALLOCATE CAVEAT
 28905                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 28906                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 28907                                  
 28908                                  RESTFATBYT:
 28909 00004FBD 53                              PUSH    BX
 28910 00004FBE 52                              PUSH    DX
 28911 00004FBF 57                              PUSH    DI
 28912 00004FC0 31DB                            XOR     BX,BX
 28913 00004FC2 8B16[9605]                      MOV     DX,[FATBYT]
 28914 00004FC6 E8D606                  	call	PACK
 28915 00004FC9 5F                              POP     DI
 28916 00004FCA 5A                              POP     DX
 28917 00004FCB 5B                              POP     BX
 28918                                  ; 16/12/2022
 28919                                  ; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 28920                                  ;RELEASE_flush:
 28921 00004FCC C3                      	retn
 28922                                  
 28923                                  ;Break	<RELEASE -- DEASSIGN DISK SPACE>
 28924                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28925                                  ;
 28926                                  ; Procedure Name : RELEASE
 28927                                  ;
 28928                                  ; Inputs:
 28929                                  ;       BX = Cluster in file
 28930                                  ;       ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 28931                                  ; Function:
 28932                                  ;       Frees cluster chain starting with [BX]
 28933                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 28934                                  ; AX,BX,DX,DI all destroyed. Other registers unchanged.
 28935                                  ;
 28936                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28937                                  
 28938                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28939                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28940                                  RELEASE:
 28941 00004FCD 31D2                            XOR     DX,DX
 28942                                  
 28943                                  	;entry	RELBLKS
 28944                                  RELBLKS:
 28945                                  
 28946                                  ;   Enter here with DX=0FFFFH to put an end-of-file mark in the first cluster
 28947                                  ;   and free the rest in the chain.
 28948                                  
 28949 00004FCF E87906                  	call	UNPACK
 28950 00004FD2 7224                    	jc	short RELEASE_flush
 28951 00004FD4 7422                    	jz	short RELEASE_flush
 28952 00004FD6 89F8                            MOV     AX,DI
 28953 00004FD8 52                              PUSH    DX
 28954 00004FD9 E8C306                  	call	PACK
 28955 00004FDC 5A                              POP     DX
 28956 00004FDD 7219                    	jc	short RELEASE_flush
 28957 00004FDF 09D2                            OR      DX,DX
 28958 00004FE1 750B                            JNZ	short NO_DEALLOC	; Was putting EOF mark
 28959                                  	;;cmp	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1 ; MSDOS 3.3
 28960                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 28961 00004FE3 26837E1FFF              	CMP     word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Free count valid?
 28962 00004FE8 7404                            JZ	short NO_DEALLOC	; No
 28963 00004FEA 26FF461F                        INC	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT] ; Increase free count by 1
 28964                                  NO_DEALLOC:
 28965 00004FEE 89C3                            MOV     BX,AX
 28966 00004FF0 48                              dec     ax              ; check for "1"
 28967 00004FF1 7405                    	jz	short RELEASE_flush	; is last cluster of incomplete chain
 28968 00004FF3 E83E06                  	call	IsEOF
 28969 00004FF6 72D5                            JB	short RELEASE	; Carry clear if JMP not taken
 28970                                  
 28971                                  	; 16/12/2022
 28972                                  ; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 28973                                  ;%if 0
 28974                                  RELEASE_flush:
 28975                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 28976 00004FF8 268A4600                	mov	al,[es:bp]
 28977                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]
 28978 00004FFC 56                      	push	si		; FLUSHBUF may trash these and we guarantee
 28979 00004FFD 51                      	push	cx		;  them to be preserved.
 28980 00004FFE 06                      	push	es
 28981 00004FFF 55                      	push	bp
 28982 00005000 E8850B                  	call	FLUSHBUF	; commit buffers for this drive
 28983 00005003 5D                      	pop	bp
 28984 00005004 07                      	pop	es
 28985 00005005 59                      	pop	cx
 28986 00005006 5E                      	pop	si
 28987                                  ;%endif
 28988                                  RET12:
 28989 00005007 C3                      	retn
 28990                                  
 28991                                  ;Break	<GETEOF -- Find the end of a file>
 28992                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28993                                  ;
 28994                                  ; Procedure Name : GETEOF
 28995                                  ;
 28996                                  ; Inputs:
 28997                                  ;       ES:BP Points to DPB
 28998                                  ;       BX = Cluster in a file
 28999                                  ;       DS = CS
 29000                                  ; Outputs:
 29001                                  ;       BX = Last cluster in the file
 29002                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 29003                                  ; DI destroyed. No other registers affected.
 29004                                  ;
 29005                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29006                                  
 29007                                  GETEOF:
 29008 00005008 E84006                  	call	UNPACK
 29009 0000500B 72FA                            jc	short RET12
 29010 0000500D 53                              PUSH    BX
 29011 0000500E 89FB                            MOV     BX,DI
 29012 00005010 E82106                  	call	IsEOF
 29013 00005013 5B                              POP     BX
 29014 00005014 73F1                            JAE     short RET12
 29015 00005016 89FB                            MOV     BX,DI
 29016 00005018 EBEE                            JMP     short GETEOF
 29017                                  
 29018                                  ;============================================================================
 29019                                  ; FCB.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 29020                                  ;============================================================================
 29021                                  ; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 29022                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29023                                  
 29024                                  ;	TITLE	FCB - FCB parse calls for MSDOS
 29025                                  ;	NAME	FCB
 29026                                  
 29027                                  ;**	FCB.ASM - Low level routines for parsing names into FCBs and analyzing
 29028                                  ;		  filename characters
 29029                                  ;
 29030                                  ;	MakeFcb
 29031                                  ;	NameTrans
 29032                                  ;	PATHCHRCMP
 29033                                  ;	GetLet
 29034                                  ;	UCase
 29035                                  ;	GetLet3
 29036                                  ;	GetCharType
 29037                                  ;	TESTKANJ
 29038                                  ;	NORMSCAN
 29039                                  ;	DELIM
 29040                                  ;
 29041                                  ;	Revision history:
 29042                                  ;
 29043                                  ;		A000  version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 29044                                  ;	
 29045                                  ;	M048 - access FILE_UCASE_TAB using DS rather than SS.
 29046                                  
 29047                                  TableLook	EQU	-1
 29048                                  
 29049                                  SCANSEPARATOR	EQU	1
 29050                                  DRVBIT		EQU	2
 29051                                  NAMBIT		EQU	4
 29052                                  EXTBIT		EQU	8
 29053                                  
 29054                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29055                                  ;
 29056                                  ; Procedure : MakeFcb
 29057                                  ;
 29058                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29059                                  
 29060                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 29061                                  	; DOSCODE:8E77h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 29062                                  MAKEFCB:
 29063                                  ;hkn; SS override
 29064 0000501A 36C606[4E03]00          	MOV	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],0
 29065 00005020 30D2                    	XOR	DL,DL		; Flag--not ambiguous file name
 29066                                  	;test	al,2
 29067 00005022 A802                    	test	AL,DRVBIT	; Use current drive field if default?
 29068 00005024 7504                    	JNZ	short DEFDRV
 29069 00005026 26C60500                	MOV	BYTE [ES:DI],0	; No - use default drive
 29070                                  DEFDRV:
 29071 0000502A 47                      	INC	DI
 29072 0000502B B90800                  	MOV	CX,8
 29073                                  	;test	al,4
 29074 0000502E A804                    	test	AL,NAMBIT	; Use current name fields as default?
 29075 00005030 93                      	XCHG	AX,BX		; Save bits in BX
 29076 00005031 B020                    	MOV	AL," "
 29077 00005033 7404                    	JZ	short FILLB	; If not, go fill with blanks
 29078 00005035 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX
 29079 00005037 31C9                    	XOR	CX,CX		; Don't fill any
 29080                                  FILLB:
 29081 00005039 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 29082 0000503B B103                    	MOV	CL,3
 29083 0000503D F6C308                  	test	BL,EXTBIT	; Use current extension as default
 29084 00005040 7404                    	JZ	short FILLB2
 29085 00005042 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX
 29086 00005044 31C9                    	XOR	CX,CX
 29087                                  FILLB2:
 29088 00005046 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 29089 00005048 91                      	XCHG	AX,CX		; Put zero in AX
 29090 00005049 AB                      	STOSW
 29091 0000504A AB                      	STOSW			; Initialize two words after to zero
 29092 0000504B 83EF10                  	SUB	DI,16		; Point back at start
 29093                                  	;test	bl,1
 29094 0000504E F6C301                  	test	BL,SCANSEPARATOR; Scan off separators if not zero
 29095 00005051 7409                    	JZ	short SKPSPC
 29096 00005053 E88800                  	CALL	SCANB		; Peel off blanks and tabs
 29097 00005056 E82201                  	CALL	DELIM		; Is it a one-time-only delimiter?
 29098 00005059 7504                    	JNZ	short NOSCAN
 29099 0000505B 46                      	INC	SI		; Skip over the delimiter
 29100                                  SKPSPC:
 29101 0000505C E87F00                  	CALL	SCANB		; Always kill preceding blanks and tabs
 29102                                  NOSCAN:
 29103 0000505F E8F000                  	CALL	GETLET
 29104 00005062 761E                    	JBE	short NODRV	; Quit if termination character
 29105 00005064 803C3A                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],":"	; Check for potential drive specifier
 29106 00005067 7519                    	JNZ	short NODRV
 29107 00005069 46                      	INC	SI		; Skip over colon
 29108 0000506A 2C40                    	SUB	AL,"@"          ; Convert drive letter to drive number (A=1)
 29109 0000506C 760F                    	JBE	short BADDRV	; Drive letter out of range
 29110                                  
 29111 0000506E 50                      	PUSH	AX
 29112 0000506F E8441B                  	call	GetVisDrv
 29113 00005072 58                      	POP	AX
 29114 00005073 730A                    	JNC	short HAVDRV
 29115                                  
 29116                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29117                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 29118                                  ;hkn; SS override
 29119 00005075 36803E[1006]1A          	CMP	byte [SS:DrvErr],error_not_DOS_disk ; 1Ah
 29120                                  					; if not FAT drive ;AN000;
 29121 0000507B 7402                    	JZ	short HAVDRV		; assume ok	   ;AN000;
 29122                                  BADDRV:
 29123 0000507D B2FF                    	MOV	DL,-1
 29124                                  HAVDRV:
 29125 0000507F AA                      	STOSB			; Put drive specifier in first byte
 29126 00005080 46                      	INC	SI
 29127 00005081 4F                      	DEC	DI		; Counteract next two instructions
 29128                                  NODRV:
 29129 00005082 4E                      	DEC	SI		; Back up
 29130 00005083 47                      	INC	DI		; Skip drive byte
 29131                                  
 29132                                  	;entry	NORMSCAN
 29133                                  NORMSCAN:
 29134 00005084 B90800                  	MOV	CX,8
 29135 00005087 E82200                  	CALL	GETWORD 	; Get 8-letter file name
 29136 0000508A 803C2E                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],"."
 29137 0000508D 7510                    	JNZ	short NODOT
 29138 0000508F 46                      	INC	SI		; Skip over dot if present
 29139                                  
 29140                                  	; 24/09/2023
 29141                                  	;mov	cx,3
 29142 00005090 B103                    	mov	cl,3	; ch=0
 29143                                  
 29144                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 29145                                  ;hkn; SS override
 29146                                  	;TEST	word [SS:DOS34_FLAG],DBCS_VOLID2 ; 100h ;AN000;
 29147                                  	; 10/06/2019
 29148 00005092 36F606[1206]01          	test	byte [SS:DOS34_FLAG+1],(DBCS_VOLID2>>8) ; 1
 29149 00005098 7402                    	JZ	short VOLOK				;AN000;
 29150 0000509A A4                      	MOVSB			; 2nd byte of DBCS	;AN000;
 29151                                  	; 24/09/2023
 29152                                  	;MOV	CX,2					;AN000;
 29153 0000509B 49                      	dec	cx  ; cx=2
 29154                                  	;JMP	SHORT contvol				;AN000;
 29155                                  VOLOK:
 29156                                  	;MOV	CX,3		; Get 3-letter extension
 29157                                  contvol:
 29158 0000509C E81300                  	CALL	MUSTGETWORD
 29159                                  NODOT:
 29160 0000509F 88D0                    	MOV	AL,DL
 29161                                  
 29162                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 29163                                  	;and	word [ss:DOS34_FLAG],0FEFFh
 29164                                  	; 18/12/2022
 29165 000050A1 368026[1206]FE          	and	byte [ss:DOS34_FLAG+1],0FEh ; (~DBCS_VOLID2)>>8
 29166                                  	;and	word [ss:DOS34_FLAG],~DBCS_VOLID2 ; ### BUG FIX ###
 29167                                  
 29168 000050A7 C3                      	retn
 29169                                  
 29170                                  NONAM:
 29171 000050A8 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX
 29172 000050AA 4E                      	DEC	SI
 29173 000050AB C3                      	retn
 29174                                  
 29175                                  GETWORD:
 29176 000050AC E8A300                  	CALL	GETLET		
 29177 000050AF 76F7                    	JBE	short NONAM	; Exit if invalid character
 29178 000050B1 4E                      	DEC	SI
 29179                                  
 29180                                  ;	UGH!!! Horrible bug here that should be fixed at some point:
 29181                                  ;	If the name we are scanning is longer than CX, we keep on reading!
 29182                                  
 29183                                  MUSTGETWORD:
 29184 000050B2 E89D00                  	CALL	GETLET
 29185                                  
 29186                                  ;	If spaceFlag is set then we allow spaces in a pathname
 29187                                  
 29188                                  ;IF NOT TABLELOOK
 29189                                  ;	JB	short FILLNAM  ; MSDOS 3.3
 29190                                  ;ENDIF
 29191 000050B5 750C                    	JNZ	short MustCheckCX
 29192                                  
 29193                                  ;hkn; SS override
 29194 000050B7 36F606[4E03]FF          	test	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],0FFh
 29195 000050BD 7419                    	JZ	short FILLNAM
 29196 000050BF 3C20                    	CMP	AL," "
 29197 000050C1 7515                    	JNZ	short FILLNAM
 29198                                  
 29199                                  MustCheckCX:
 29200 000050C3 E3ED                    	JCXZ	MUSTGETWORD
 29201 000050C5 49                      	DEC	CX
 29202 000050C6 3C2A                    	CMP	AL,"*"          ; Check for ambiguous file specifier
 29203 000050C8 7504                    	JNZ	short NOSTAR
 29204 000050CA B03F                    	MOV	AL,"?"
 29205 000050CC F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 29206                                  NOSTAR:
 29207 000050CE AA                      	STOSB
 29208 000050CF 3C3F                    	CMP	AL,"?"
 29209 000050D1 75DF                    	JNZ	short MUSTGETWORD
 29210 000050D3 80CA01                  	OR	DL,1		; Flag ambiguous file name
 29211 000050D6 EBDA                    	JMP	short MUSTGETWORD
 29212                                  FILLNAM:
 29213 000050D8 B020                    	MOV	AL," "
 29214 000050DA F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 29215 000050DC 4E                      	DEC	SI
 29216 000050DD C3                      	retn
 29217                                  
 29218                                  SCANB:
 29219 000050DE AC                      	LODSB
 29220 000050DF E8A100                  	CALL	SPCHK
 29221 000050E2 74FA                    	JZ	short SCANB
 29222 000050E4 4E                      	DEC	SI
 29223                                  scanb_retn:
 29224 000050E5 C3                      	retn
 29225                                  
 29226                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29227                                  ;
 29228                                  ; Procedure Name : NameTrans
 29229                                  ;
 29230                                  ; NameTrans is used by FindPath to scan off an element of a path. We must
 29231                                  ; allow spaces in pathnames
 29232                                  ;
 29233                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI points to start of path element
 29234                                  ;   Outputs:	Name1 has unpacked name, uppercased
 29235                                  ;		ES = DOSGroup
 29236                                  ;		DS:SI advanced after name
 29237                                  ;   Registers modified: DI,AX,DX,CX
 29238                                  ;
 29239                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29240                                  
 29241                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 29242                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29243                                  NameTrans:
 29244                                  ;hkn; SS override
 29245 000050E6 36C606[4E03]01          	MOV	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],1
 29246 000050EC 16                      	push	ss
 29247 000050ED 07                      	pop	es
 29248                                  
 29249                                  ;hkn; NAME1 is in DOSDATA
 29250 000050EE BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 29251 000050F1 57                      	PUSH	DI
 29252 000050F2 B82020                  	MOV	AX,'  '
 29253 000050F5 B90500                  	MOV	CX,5
 29254 000050F8 AA                      	STOSB
 29255 000050F9 F3AB                    	REP	STOSW		; Fill "FCB" at NAME1 with spaces
 29256 000050FB 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL		; Set stuff for NORMSCAN
 29257 000050FD 88C2                    	MOV	DL,AL
 29258 000050FF AA                      	STOSB
 29259 00005100 5F                      	POP	DI
 29260                                  
 29261 00005101 E880FF                  	CALL	NORMSCAN
 29262                                  
 29263                                  ;hkn; SS override for NAME1
 29264 00005104 36803E[4B05]E5          	CMP	byte [SS:NAME1],0E5H
 29265 0000510A 75D9                    	jnz	short scanb_retn
 29266 0000510C 36C606[4B05]05          	MOV	byte [SS:NAME1],5 ; Magic name translation
 29267 00005112 C3                      	retn
 29268                                  
 29269                                  ;Break	<GETLET, DELIM -- CHECK CHARACTERS AND CONVERT>
 29270                                  ;============================================================================
 29271                                  
 29272                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29273                                  ; DOSCODE:8FD2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 29274                                  
 29275                                  ;If TableLook
 29276                                  
 29277                                  ;hkn; Table	SEGMENT
 29278                                  ;	PUBLIC	CharType
 29279                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29280                                  
 29281                                  ; Character type table for file name scanning
 29282                                  ; Table provides a mapping of characters to validity bits.
 29283                                  ; Four bits are provided for each character. Values 7Dh and above
 29284                                  ; have all bits set, so that part of the table is chopped off, and
 29285                                  ; the translation routine is responsible for screening these values.
 29286                                  ; The bit values are defined in DOSSYM.INC
 29287                                  
 29288                                  ;	      ; ^A and NUL
 29289                                  ;CharType:
 29290                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 29291                                  ;	      ; ^C and ^B
 29292                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 29293                                  ;	      ; ^E and ^D
 29294                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 29295                                  ;	      ; ^G and ^F
 29296                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 29297                                  ;	      ; TAB and BS
 29298                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM+FSPCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 29299                                  ;	      ; ^K and ^J
 29300                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 29301                                  ;	      ; ^M and ^L
 29302                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 29303                                  ;	      ; ^O and ^N
 29304                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 29305                                  ;	      ; ^Q and ^P
 29306                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 29307                                  ;	      ; ^S and ^R
 29308                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 29309                                  ;	      ; ^U and ^T
 29310                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 29311                                  ;	      ; ^W and ^V
 29312                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 29313                                  ;	      ; ^Y and ^X
 29314                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 29315                                  ;	      ; ESC and ^Z
 29316                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 29317                                  ;	      ; ^] and ^;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 29319                                  ;	      ; ^_ and ^^
 29320                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 29321                                  ;	      ; ! and SPACE
 29322                                  ;	 db   LOW (NOT FCHK+FDELIM+FSPCHK)
 29323                                  ;	      ; # and "
 29324                                  ;	 db   LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK)
 29325                                  ;	      ; $ - )
 29326                                  ;	 db   3 dup (0FFh)
 29327                                  ;	      ; + and *
 29328                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR 0Fh
 29329                                  ;	      ; - and '
 29330                                  ;	 db   NOT (FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM)
 29331                                  ;	      ; / and .
 29332                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FCHK) AND 0Fh
 29333                                  ;	      ; 0 - 9
 29334                                  ;	 db   5 dup (0FFh)
 29335                                  ;	      ; ; and :
 29336                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) AND 0Fh
 29337                                  ;	      ; = and <
 29338                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) AND 0Fh
 29339                                  ;	      ; ? and >
 29340                                  ;	 db   NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM
 29341                                  ;	      ; A - Z
 29342                                  ;	 db   13 dup (0FFh)
 29343                                  ;	      ; \ and [
 29344                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR 0Fh
 29345                                  ;	      ; ^ and ]
 29346                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 29347                                  ;	      ; _ - {
 29348                                  ;	 db   15 dup (0FFh)
 29349                                  ;	      ; } and |
 29350                                  ;	 db   NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM
 29351                                  
 29352                                  ;CharType_last equ ($ - CharType) * 2	; This is the value of the last
 29353                                  ;					; character in the table
 29354                                  
 29355                                  ;FCHK	equ 1		; normal name char, no chks needed
 29356                                  ;FDELIM	equ 2		; is a delimiter
 29357                                  ;FSPCHK	equ 4		; set if character is not a space or equivalent
 29358                                  ;FFCB	equ 8		; is valid in an FCB
 29359                                  
 29360                                  ; DOSCODE:8FD2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 29361                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29362                                  ; DOSCODE:8F76h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 29363                                  
 29364                                  CharType: ; 63 bytes
 29365 00005113 6666666606666666                db  66h, 66h, 66h, 66h, 06h, 66h, 66h, 66h ; 0-7
 29366 0000511B 6666666666666666        	db  66h, 66h, 66h, 66h, 66h, 66h, 66h, 66h ; 8-15
 29367 00005123 F8F6FFFFFF4FF46E        	db 0F8h,0F6h,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh, 4Fh,0F4h, 6Eh ; 16-23
 29368 0000512B FFFFFFFFFF4444F4        	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh, 44h, 44h,0F4h ; 24-31
 29369 00005133 FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF        	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh ; 32-39
 29370 0000513B FFFFFFFFFF6F66FF        	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh, 6Fh, 66h,0FFh ; 40-47
 29371 00005143 FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF        	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh ; 48-55
 29372 0000514B FFFFFFFFFFFFF4          	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0F4h	   ; 56-62
 29373                                  
 29374                                  CharType_last equ ($ - CharType) * 2
 29375                                  
 29376                                  ; Offset 12CAh of IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3), 1987
 29377                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29378                                  ;CharType:
 29379                                  ;       db 0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h
 29380                                  ;	db 0F6h,0F0h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h
 29381                                  ;	db 0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h
 29382                                  ;	db 0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h
 29383                                  ;	db 0F8h,0FFh,0F6h,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29384                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0F4h,0F4h,0FFh,0FEh,0F6h
 29385                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29386                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0F4h,0F4h,0F4h,0F4h,0F4h,0FFh
 29387                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29388                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29389                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29390                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0FFh,0FFh
 29391                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29392                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29393                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29394                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0F4h,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29395                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29396                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29397                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29398                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29399                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29400                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29401                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29402                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29403                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29404                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29405                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29406                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29407                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29408                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh

 29416                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29417                                  ; DOSCODE:9011h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 29418                                  
 29419                                  ; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 29420                                  ; DOSCODE:8FB5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 29421                                  
 29422                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29423                                  ;
 29424                                  ; Procedure Names : GetLet, UCase, GetLet3
 29425                                  ;
 29426                                  ; These routines take a character, convert it to upper case, and check
 29427                                  ; for delimiters.  Three different entry points:
 29428                                  ;	GetLet -  DS:[SI] = character to convert
 29429                                  ;	UCase  -  AL = character to convert
 29430                                  ;	GetLet3 - AL = character
 29431                                  ;		  [BX] = translation table to use
 29432                                  ;
 29433                                  ;	Exit (in all cases) : AL = upper case character
 29434                                  ;			      CY set if char is control char other than TAB
 29435                                  ;			      ZF set if char is a delimiter
 29436                                  ;	Uses : AX, flags
 29437                                  ;
 29438                                  ; NOTE: This routine exists in a fast table lookup version, and a slow
 29439                                  ; inline version.  Return with carry set is only possible in the inline
 29440                                  ; version. The table lookup version is the one in use.
 29441                                  ;
 29442                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29443                                  
 29444                                  ; This entry point has character at [SI]
 29445                                  
 29446                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5517h
 29447                                  GETLET:	
 29448 00005152 AC                      	LODSB
 29449                                  
 29450                                  ; This entry point has character in AL
 29451                                  
 29452                                  	;entry	UCase
 29453                                  UCase:	
 29454                                  	; 09/08/2018
 29455                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5518h
 29456                                  _UCase:
 29457 00005153 53                      	PUSH	BX
 29458 00005154 BB[850B]                	MOV	BX,FILE_UCASE_TAB+2
 29459                                  
 29460                                  ; Convert the character in AL to upper case
 29461                                  
 29462                                  gl_0:
 29463 00005157 3C61                    	CMP	AL,"a"
 29464 00005159 7214                    	JB	short gl_2	; Already upper case, go check type
 29465 0000515B 3C7A                    	CMP	AL,"z"
 29466 0000515D 7702                    	JA	short gl_1
 29467 0000515F 2C20                    	SUB	AL,20H		; Convert to upper case
 29468                                  
 29469                                  ; Map European character to upper case
 29470                                  
 29471                                  gl_1:
 29472 00005161 3C80                    	CMP	AL,80H
 29473 00005163 720A                    	JB	short gl_2	; Not EuroChar, go check type
 29474 00005165 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80H		; translate to upper case with this index
 29475                                  
 29476                                  	; M048 - Start 
 29477                                  	; Lantastic call Ucase thru int 2f without setting SS to DOSDATA.
 29478                                  	; So we shall set up DS and to access FILE_UCASE_TAB in BX and also 
 29479                                  	; preserve it.
 29480                                  
 29481                                  	; 09/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 29482                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 29483                                  	;;XLAT	BYTE [CS:BX]	; ds as file_ucase_tab is in DOSDATA
 29484                                  	;CS	XLAT
 29485                                  
 29486                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29487                                  
 29488                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 29489 00005167 1E                      	push	ds
 29490                                  	;getdseg <ds>
 29491 00005168 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 29492 0000516D D7                      	XLAT			; ds as file_ucase_tab is in DOSDATA
 29493 0000516E 1F                      	pop	ds
 29494                                  
 29495                                  	; M048 - End
 29496                                  
 29497                                  ; Now check the type
 29498                                  
 29499                                  ;If TableLook
 29500                                  gl_2:
 29501                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29502 0000516F 50                      	PUSH	AX
 29503                                  
 29504                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 29505                                  	;mov	bx,CharType
 29506                                  	;; 09/08/2018
 29507                                  	;;xlat	byte [cs:bx]
 29508                                  	;cs	xlat	
 29509                                  	
 29510                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 29511 00005170 E81800                  	CALL	GetCharType	; returns type flags in AL
 29512                                  	
 29513                                  	;test	al,1	
 29514 00005173 A801                    	TEST	AL,FCHK 	; test for normal character
 29515 00005175 58                      	POP	AX
 29516                                  
 29517 00005176 5B                      	POP	BX
 29518 00005177 C3                      	RETN
 29519                                  
 29520                                  ; This entry has character in AL and lookup table in BX
 29521                                  
 29522                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 29523                                  ;	;entry GetLet3
 29524                                  GETLET3: ; 10/08/2018
 29525 00005178 53                      	PUSH	BX
 29526 00005179 EBDC                    	JMP	short gl_0
 29527                                  ;ELSE
 29528                                  ;
 29529                                  ;gl_2:
 29530                                  ;	POP	BX
 29531                                  ;	CMP	AL,"."
 29532                                  ;	retz
 29533                                  ;	CMP	AL,'"'
 29534                                  ;	retz
 29535                                  ;	CALL	PATHCHRCMP
 29536                                  ;	retz
 29537                                  ;	CMP	AL,"["
 29538                                  ;	retz
 29539                                  ;	CMP	AL,"]"
 29540                                  ;	retz
 29541                                  ;ENDIF
 29542

 29544                                  ;
 29545                                  ; DELIM - check if character is a delimiter
 29546                                  ;	Entry : AX = character to check

 29548                                  ;	Uses  : Flags

 29632                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29633                                  ;
 29634                                  ;  GetCharType - return flag bits indicating character type
 29635                                  ;	Bits are defined in DOSSYM.INC. Uses lookup table
 29636                                  ;	defined above at label CharType.
 29637                                  ;
 29638                                  ;	Entry : AL = character to return type flags for
 29639                                  ;	Exit  : AL = type flags
 29640                                  ;	Uses  : AL, flags
 29641                                  ;
 29642                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29643                                  
 29644                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 29645                                  
 29646                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29647                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 29648                                  GetCharType:
 29649                                  	;cmp	al,7Eh
 29650 0000518B 3C7E                    	cmp	al,CharType_last 	; beyond end of table?
 29651 0000518D 7316                    	jae	short gct_90		; return standard value
 29652                                  
 29653 0000518F 53                      	push	bx
 29654 00005190 BB[1351]                	mov	bx,CharType		; load lookup table
 29655 00005193 D0E8                    	shr	al,1			; adjust for half-byte table entry size
 29656                                  	;xlat	cs:[bx] 		; get flags
 29657 00005195 2ED7                    	cs	xlat	
 29658 00005197 5B                      	pop	bx
 29659                                  
 29660                                  ; carry clear from previous shift means we want the low nibble.  Otherwise
 29661                                  ; we have to shift the flags down to the low nibble
 29662                                  
 29663 00005198 7308                    	jnc	short gct_80		; carry clear, no shift needed
 29664                                  
 29665 0000519A D0E8                    	shr	al,1			; we want high nibble, shift it down
 29666 0000519C D0E8                    	shr	al,1
 29667 0000519E D0E8                    	shr	al,1
 29668 000051A0 D0E8                    	shr	al,1
 29669                                  gct_80:
 29670 000051A2 240F                    	and	al,0Fh			; clear the unused nibble
 29671 000051A4 C3                      	retn
 29672                                  gct_90:
 29673 000051A5 B00F                    	mov	al,0Fh			; set all flags
 29674 000051A7 C3                      	retn

 29705                                  ;	NAME	IBMCTRLC

 29723                                  ;
 29724                                  ;	    AN000	version 4.0   Jan 1988

 29727                                  ;
 29728                                  ; 	M011: NEC's 8086 clone chip uses Intel's undocumented bit number in
 29729                                  ;	      flags register. In order to return to user normally DOS used to
 29730                                  ;	      move F202 into flags, which sets bit number 1 in flags uncondit-
 29731                                  ;	      ionally. Now it is modified to maintain the state of bit 1.
 29732                                  ;

 29907                                  ; Procedure Name : SpoolInt
 29908                                  ;
 29909                                  ; SpoolInt - signal processes that the DOS is truly idle. We are allowed to
 29910                                  ; do this ONLY if we are working on a 1-12 system call AND if we are not in
 29911                                  ; the middle of an INT 24.
 29912                                  ;
 29913                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29914                                  
 29915                                  SPOOLINT:
 29916 00005244 9C                              PUSHF
 29917                                  	; 15/03/2018
 29918 00005245 36803E[5803]00                  CMP     BYTE [SS:IDLEINT],0	; SS override
 29919 0000524B 7423                            JZ      SHORT POPFRET
 29920 0000524D 36803E[2003]00                  CMP     BYTE [SS:ERRORMODE],0
 29921 00005253 751B                            JNZ     SHORT POPFRET		;No spool ints in error mode
 29922                                  
 29923                                  	; 30/07/2018
 29924                                  
 29925                                  	; Note that we are going to allow an external program to issue system 
 29926                                  	; calls at this time. We MUST preserve IdleInt across this.
 29927                                  
 29928 00005255 36FF36[5803]            	PUSH	WORD [SS:IDLEINT]
 29929                                  
 29930                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29931                                   
 29932                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 29933 0000525A 36803E[3812]00          	cmp	byte [SS:DosHasHMA],0	; Q: is dos running in HMA (M021)
 29934 00005260 7504                    	jne	short do_low_int28	; Y: the int must be done from low mem
 29935 00005262 CD28                    	INT	int_spooler  ; int 28h 	; N: Execute user int 28 handler
 29936 00005264 EB05                    	jmp	short spool_ret_addr
 29937

 29939                                  	;call	far [ss:LowInt28Addr]
 29940 00005266 2EFF1E[BD51]            	call	far [cs:LowInt28Addr]	; 05/05/2019
 29941

 29943                                  	;INT	int_spooler		; INT 28h
 29944                                  
 29945 0000526B 368F06[5803]            	POP	WORD [SS:IDLEINT]
 29946                                  POPFRET:
 29947 00005270 9D                              POPF
 29948                                  _RET18:  
 29949 00005271 C3                      	RETN
