 30080                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30081                                  ;
 30082                                  ; Procedure Name : CNTHAND ( CTRLC_C HANDLER )
 30083                                  ;
 30084                                  ; "^C" and CR/LF is printed. Then the user registers are restored and the
 30085                                  ; user CTRL-C handler is executed. At this point the top of the stack has 1)
 30086                                  ; the interrupt return address should the user CTRL-C handler wish to allow
 30087                                  ; processing to continue; 2) the original interrupt return address to the code
 30088                                  ; that performed the function call in the first place. If the user CTRL-C
 30089                                  ; handler wishes to continue, it must leave all registers unchanged and RET
 30090                                  ; (not IRET) with carry CLEAR. If carry is SET then an terminate system call
 30091                                  ; is simulated.
 30092                                  ;
 30093                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30094                                  
 30095                                  CNTCHAND:
 30096                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; SS override
 30097                                  					; AN002; from RAWOUT
 30098                                  	;TEST	word [SS:DOS34_FLAG],CTRL_BREAK_FLAG  
 30099                                  	;JNZ	short around_deadlock 	; AN002;
 30100                                  
 30101                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30102                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS DOSCODE:91C4h, 29/12/2022)
 30103 000052FF 36F606[1206]02          	TEST	byte [SS:DOS34_FLAG+1],(CTRL_BREAK_FLAG>>8)  ; 2 
 30104 00005305 7508                    	JNZ	short around_deadlock 	; AN002;
 30105                                  
 30106 00005307 B003                            MOV     AL,3			; Display "^C"
 30107 00005309 E8E2C4                          CALL	BUFOUT
 30108 0000530C E87EC3                          CALL	CRLF
 30109                                  around_deadlock:
 30110 0000530F 16                              PUSH    SS
 30111 00005310 1F                              POP     DS
 30112 00005311 803E[5703]00                    CMP     BYTE [CONSWAP],0
 30113 00005316 7403                            JZ      SHORT NOSWAP
 30114 00005318 E8B3E0                          CALL	SWAPBACK
 30115                                  NOSWAP:
 30116 0000531B FA                      	CLI				; Prepare to play with stack
 30117 0000531C 8E16[8605]              	MOV	SS,[USER_SS]		; User stack now restored
 30118 00005320 8B26[8405]              	MOV	SP,[USER_SP]
 30119 00005324 E81AB1                          CALL	restore_world       ; User registers now restored
 30120                                  
 30121                                  	; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 
 30122                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM - Offset 56ACh)
 30123                                          ; 14/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0
 30124                                  	;MOV	BYTE [CS:INDOS],0	
 30125                                          ;MOV	BYTE [CS:ERRORMODE],0
 30126                                          ;MOV	[CS:ConC_Spsave],SP
 30127                                  	;clc	;30/07/2018
 30128                                          ;INT	int_ctrl_c ; 23h    ; Execute user Ctrl-C handler
 30129                                  	;;int	23h	; DOS - CONTROL "C" EXIT ADDRESS
 30130                                  			; Return: return via RETF 2 with CF set
 30131                                  			; DOS will abort program with errorlevel 0
 30132                                  			; else
 30133                                  			; interrupted DOS call continues
 30134                                  
 30135                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30136                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS,91ECh) 
 30137                                  
 30138                                  	; CS was used to address these variables. We have to use DOSDATA
 30139                                  	
 30140 00005327 07                      	pop	es ; *	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, DOSCODE:91ECh)
 30141                                  			; (pop es, after 'call restore_world')	
 30142 00005328 1E                      	push	ds
 30143                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 30144 00005329 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 30145 0000532E C606[2103]00            	mov	byte [INDOS],0		; Go to known state
 30146 00005333 C606[2003]00            	mov	byte [ERRORMODE],0
 30147 00005338 8926[3203]              	mov	[ConC_Spsave],SP	; save his SP
 30148                                  	; User SP has changed because of push. Adjust for it
 30149 0000533C 8306[3203]02            	add	word [ConC_Spsave],2
 30150                                  
 30151 00005341 803E[3812]00            	cmp	byte [DosHasHMA],0	; Q: is dos running in HMA (M021)
 30152 00005346 1F                       	pop	ds	; restore ds
 30153 00005347 7505                    	jne	short do_low_int23	; Y: the int must be done from low mem
 30154 00005349 F8                      	CLC				
 30155 0000534A CD23                    	INT	int_ctrl_c  ; int 23h	; N: Execute user Ctrl-C handler
 30156 0000534C EB06                    	jmp	short ctrlc_ret_addr
 30157                                  
 30158                                  	; 05/05/2019
 30159                                  do_low_int23:
 30160 0000534E F8                      	clc
 30161 0000534F 2EFF1E[B551]            	call	far [cs:LowInt23Addr]	
 30162                                  
 30163                                  	; 30/07/2018 
 30164                                  
 30165                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM - Offset 56C0h)
 30166                                  
 30167                                  ; The user has returned to us. The circumstances we allow are:
 30168                                  ;
 30169                                  ;   IRET	We retry the operation by redispatching the system call
 30170                                  ;   CLC/RETF	POP the stack and retry
 30171                                  ;   ... 	Exit the current process with ^C exit
 30172                                  ;
 30173                                  ; User's may RETURN to us and leave interrupts on. 
 30174                                  ; Turn 'em off just to be sure
 30175

 30434                                  ;
 30435                                  ; Procedure Name : HardErr
 30436                                  ;
 30437                                  ; Hard disk error handler. Entry conditions:
 30438                                  ;	DS:BX = Original disk transfer address
 30439                                  ;	DX = Original logical sector number
 30440                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors to go (first one gave the error)
 30441                                  ;	AX = Hardware error code
 30442                                  ;	DI = Original sector transfer count	
 30443                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 30444                                  ;	[READOP] = 0 for read, 1 for write
 30445                                  ;	Allowed Set with allowed responses to this error (other bits MUST BE 0)
 30446                                  ; Output:
 30447                                  ;	[FAILERR] will be set if user responded FAIL
 30448                                  ;
 30449                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30450                                  
 30451                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 30452                                  HARDERR:
 30453                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30454                                  	; 30/07/2018
 30455                                  	; 08/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 30456 00005411 97                      	XCHG    AX,DI                   ; Error code in DI, count in AX
 30457                                          ;and	di,0FFh
 30458 00005412 81E7FF00                	AND     DI,STECODE              ; And off status bits
 30459                                          ;CMP	DI,WRECODE		; Write Protect Error?
 30460                                  	;cmp	di,0
 30461 00005416 83FF00                  	cmp	DI,error_I24_write_protect ; Write Protect Error?
 30462 00005419 750A                            JNZ     short NOSETWRPERR
 30463 0000541B 50                              PUSH    AX
 30464                                  	; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 30465                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]
 30466                                          ;;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+0]
 30467                                  	; 15/12/2022
 30468 0000541C 268A4600                	mov	al,[ES:BP]
 30469                                          	; 15/03/2018
 30470 00005420 36A2[2203]                      MOV     [SS:WPERR],AL		; Flag drive with WP error
 30471 00005424 58                              POP     AX
 30472                                  NOSETWRPERR:
 30473 00005425 29C8                            SUB     AX,CX                   ; Number of sectors successfully transferred
 30474 00005427 01C2                            ADD     DX,AX                   ; First sector number to retry
 30475 00005429 52                              PUSH    DX
 30476                                  	; 08/07/2018
 30477                                          ;MUL	word [ES:BP+2] 		; Number of bytes transferred
 30478 0000542A 26F76602                	MUL	word [ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 30479 0000542E 5A                              POP     DX
 30480 0000542F 01C3                            ADD     BX,AX                   ; First address for retry
 30481 00005431 30E4                            XOR     AH,AH                   ; Flag disk section in error
 30482                                          ;CMP	DX,[ES:BP+6] 		; In reserved area?
 30483 00005433 263B5606                	CMP	DX,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_FAT]
 30484 00005437 721A                            JB      SHORT ERRINT
 30485 00005439 FEC4                            INC     AH                      ; Flag for FAT
 30486                                          ;CMP	DX,[ES:BP+10H] ; MSDOS 3.3
 30487                                  	;cmp	dx,[ES:BP+11h] ; MSDOS 6.0 - 05/05/2019

 30489 0000543F 7308                    	JAE	short TESTDIR 		; No
 30490                                  		 ; Err in FAT must force recomp of freespace
 30491                                  	;mov	word [ES:BP+1Eh],-1 ; MSDOS 3.3
 30492                                  	;mov	word [ES:BP+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0 - 05/05/2019 
 30493 00005441 26C7461FFFFF            	MOV	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1
 30494 00005447 EB0A                    	JMP	SHORT ERRINT
 30495                                  TESTDIR:
 30496 00005449 FEC4                            INC     AH
 30497                                          ;CMP	DX,[ES:BP+0BH]		; In directory?
 30498 0000544B 263B560B                	CMP	DX,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_SECTOR] 
 30499 0000544F 7202                            JB      SHORT ERRINT
 30500 00005451 FEC4                            INC     AH                      ; Must be in data area
 30501                                  ERRINT:
 30502 00005453 D0E4                            SHL     AH,1                    ; Make room for read/write bit
 30503 00005455 360A26[7505]                    OR      AH,[SS:READOP] ; 15/03/2018
 30504                                  
 30505                                  	; 15/08/2018
 30506                                  					; SS override for allowed and EXITHOLD
 30507 0000545A 360A26[4B03]            	OR	AH,[SS:ALLOWED]		; Set the allowed_ bits
 30508                                  
 30509                                          ;entry   FATAL
 30510                                  FATAL:
 30511                                  	; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 30512                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]
 30513                                          ;;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+0]		; Get drive number
 30514                                  	; 15/12/2022
 30515 0000545F 268A4600                	MOV	AL,[ES:BP]

 30517                                  	;entry   FATAL1
 30518                                  FATAL1:  
 30519                                  	; 15/03/2018      
 30520 00005463 368C06[8205]            	MOV     [SS:EXITHOLD+2],ES
 30521 00005468 36892E[8005]                    MOV     [SS:EXITHOLD],BP	; The only things we preserve	
 30522                                  	;LES	SI,[ES:BP+12H] ; MSDOS 3.3
 30523                                  	;LES	SI,[ES:BP+13H] ; MSDOS 6.0 - 05/05/2019
 30524 0000546D 26C47613                	LES	SI,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVER_ADDR]
 30525 00005471 8CC5                            MOV     BP,ES                   ; BP:SI points to the device involved
 30526                                  
 30527                                  	; DI has the INT-24-style extended error. We now map the error code 
 30528                                  	; for this into the normalized get extended error set by using the 
 30529                                  	; ErrMap24 table as a translate table. Note that we translate ONLY 
 30530                                  	; the device returned codes and leave all others beyond the look up 
 30531                                  	; table alone.
 30532                                  
 30533                                  	; 08/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 30534                                  FATALC:

 30540                                  					;  Only come via GetExtendedError
 30541                                  ;** ----------------------------------------------------------------
 30542                                  ;
 30543                                  ; Entry point used by REDIRector on Network I 24 errors.
 30544                                  ;
 30545                                  ;	ASSUME	DS:NOTHING,ES:NOTHING,SS:DOSDATA
 30546                                  ;
 30547                                  ; ALL I 24 regs set up. ALL Extended error info SET. ALLOWED Set.
 30548                                  ;     EXITHOLD set for restore of ES:BP.
 30549                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------
 30550                                  	;entry	NET_I24_ENTRY
 30551                                  NET_I24_ENTRY:
 30552                                  GOT_RIGHT_CODE:
 30553 0000547E 36803E[2003]00          	CMP     BYTE [SS:ERRORMODE],0	; No INT 24s if already INT 24
 30554 00005484 7404                            JZ	SHORT NoSetFail
 30555 00005486 B003                    	MOV	AL,3
 30556 00005488 EB6C                    	JMP	short FailRet
 30557                                  NoSetFail:
 30558 0000548A 368926[8805]                    MOV     [SS:CONTSTK],SP		; SS override
 30559 0000548F 16                              PUSH	SS
 30560 00005490 07                              POP	ES
 30561                                      
 30562                                  	; Wango!!! We may need to free some user state info... In 
 30563                                  	; particular, we may have locked down a JFN for a user and he may 
 30564                                  	; NEVER return to us. Thus,we need to free it here and then 
 30565                                  	; reallocate it when we come back.
 30566                                  
 30567 00005491 36833E[AA05]FF          	CMP	word [SS:SFN],-1 ; 0FFFFh
 30568 00005497 740C                    	JZ	short _NoFree

 30576                                  _NoFree:

 30578                                  					; Prepare to play with stack
 30579 000054A6 36FE06[2003]                    INC     BYTE [SS:ERRORMODE]	; Flag INT 24 in progress
 30580 000054AB 36FE0E[2103]                    DEC     BYTE [SS:INDOS]		; INT 24 handler might not return
 30581                                  
 30582                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, MSDOS 6.21)
 30583                                  
 30584                                  	;; Extended Open hooks
 30585                                  					; AN000;IFS.I24 error disabled

 30589                                  faili24:				; AN000;

 30626

 30628

 30634

 30642                                  DoFail:

 30659                                  CleanUp2:
 30660 0000552A 1E                      	push	ds
 30661 0000552B 56                      	push	si

 30671                                  
 30672                                  	; The reply was IGNORE. See if we are allowed to ignore.
 30673

 30692

 30709 00005568 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL
 30710                                  
 30711                                  	; we are truly aborting the process. Go restore information from 
 30712                                  	; the PDB as necessary.
 30713                                  
 30714 0000556A E9B30D                  	jmp	exit_inner
 30715                                  
 30716                                  ;** --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30717                                  ;
 30718                                  ; reset_environment checks the DS value against the CurrentPDB. If they are
 30719                                  ; different, then an old-style return is performed. If they are the same,
 30720                                  ; then we release jfns and restore to parent. We still use the PDB at DS:0 as
 30721                                  ; the source of the terminate addresses.
 30722                                  ;
 30723                                  ; Some subtlety: We are about to issue a bunch of calls that *may* generate
 30724                                  ; INT 24s. We *cannot* allow the user to restart the abort process; we may
 30725                                  ; end up aborting the wrong process or turn a terminate/stay/resident into a
 30726                                  ; normal abort and leave interrupt handlers around. What we do is to set a
 30727                                  ; flag that will indicate that if any abort code is seen, we just continue the
 30728                                  ; operation. In essence, we dis-allow the abort response.
 30729                                  ;
 30730                                  ; output:   none.
 30731                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30732                                  
 30733                                  	;entry	reset_environment
 30734                                  	
 30735                                  reset_environment:
 30736                                  	; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 30737                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 588Ah 
 30738                                  
 30739                                  ;***	invoke	Reset_Version		; AN007 ;MS. reset version number
 30740

 30742

 30744                                  	; here with critical sections locked down, they are no longer 
 30745                                  	; relevant. We may safely free all allocated resources.

 30758                                  					; On process exit.

 30790                                  	; belonging to this PDB

 30796                                  	; to relevant network folks that this process is dead. Remember that

 30888 0000560C CF                      	IRET			; Long return back to user terminate address
 30889                                  
 30890                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30891                                  ;
 30892                                  ; Procedure Name : SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR
 30893                                  ;
 30894                                  ; This routine handles extended error codes.
 30895                                  ; Input : DI = error code from device
 30896                                  ; Output: All EXTERR fields are set
 30897                                  ;
 30898                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30899                                  
 30900                                  SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR:
 30901 0000560D 50                      	PUSH	AX
 30902                                  					; ErrMap24End is in DOSDATA
 30903 0000560E B8[0E0F]                	MOV	AX,ErrMap24End
 30904 00005611 2D[FE0E]                	SUB	AX,ErrMap24
 30905                                  					; Change to dosdata to access 
 30906                                  					; ErrMap24 and EXTERR -SR
 30907                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30908                                  	
 30909                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30910 00005614 1E                      	push	ds
 30911                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds ->dosdata
 30912 00005615 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 30913                                  
 30914                                  	; AX is the index of the first unavailable error. Do not translate 
 30915                                  	; if greater or equal to AX.
 30916                                  
 30917 0000561A 39C7                    	CMP	DI,AX
 30918 0000561C 89F8                    	MOV	AX,DI
 30919 0000561E 7306                    	JAE	short NoTrans
 30920                                  
 30921                                  	;MOV	AL,[CS:DI+ErrMap24]  ; MSDOS 3.3
 30922 00005620 8A85[FE0E]              	mov	al,[ErrMap24+di] ; MSDOS 6.0
 30923 00005624 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH
 30924                                  NoTrans:
 30925                                  	;MOV	[CS:EXTERR],AX
 30926 00005626 A3[2403]                	mov	[EXTERR],AX
 30927 00005629 1F                      	pop	ds
 30928                                  	;assume	ds:nothing
 30929 0000562A 58                      	POP	AX
 30930                                  
 30931                                  	; Now Extended error is set correctly. Translate it to get correct 
 30932                                  	; error locus class and recommended action.
 30933                                  
 30934 0000562B 56                      	PUSH	SI
 30935                                  					; ERR_TABLE_24 is in DOSCODE 
 30936 0000562C BE[AE0E]                	MOV	SI,ERR_TABLE_24
 30937 0000562F E881B0                  	call	CAL_LK			; Set other extended error fields
 30938 00005632 5E                      	POP	SI
 30939 00005633 C3                      	retn
 30940                                  
 30941                                  ;============================================================================
 30942                                  ; FAT.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 30943                                  ;============================================================================
 30944                                  ; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 30945                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30946                                  
 30947                                  ;	TITLE	FAT - FAT maintenance routines
 30948                                  ;	NAME	FAT
 30949                                  
 30950                                  ;**	FAT.ASM
 30951                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30952                                  ;	Low level local device routines for performing disk change sequence,
 30953                                  ;	setting cluster validity, and manipulating the FAT
 30954                                  ;
 30955                                  ;	IsEof
 30956                                  ;	UNPACK
 30957                                  ;	PACK
 30958                                  ;	MAPCLUSTER
 30959                                  ;	FATREAD_SFT
 30960                                  ;	FATREAD_CDS
 30961                                  ;	FAT_operation
 30962                                  ;
 30963                                  ;	Revision history:
 30964                                  ;
 30965                                  ;	  AN000  version Jan. 1988
 30966                                  ;	   A001  PTM	      -- disk changed for look ahead buffers
 30967                                  ;
 30968                                  ;	M014 - if a request for pack\unpack cluster 0 is made we write\read
 30969                                  ;	       from CL0FATENTRY rather than disk.
 30970                                  
 30971                                  ; DOSCODE:94FAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 30972                                  
 30973                                  ;Break <IsEOF - check the quantity in BX for EOF>
 30974                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30975                                  ;
 30976                                  ; Procedure Name : IsEOF
 30977                                  ;
 30978                                  ; IsEOF - check the fat value in BX for eof.
 30979                                  ;
 30980                                  ;   Inputs:	ES:BP point to DPB
 30981                                  ;		BX has fat value
 30982                                  ;   Outputs:	JAE eof
 30983                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 30984                                  ;
 30985                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30986                                  
 30987                                  IsEOF:
 30988                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Dh],0FF6h
 30989 00005634 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; is this 16 bit fat?
 30990 0000563A 730B                    	JAE	short EOF16			; yes, check for eof there
 30991                                  
 30992                                  ;J.K. 8/27/86
 30993                                  ;Modified to accept 0FF0h as an eof. This is to handle the diskfull case
 30994                                  ;of any media that has "F0"(Other) as a MediaByte.
 30995                                  ;Hopely, this does not create any side effect for those who may use any value
 30996                                  ;other than "FF8-FFF" as an EOF for their own file.
 30997                                  
 30998 0000563C 81FBF00F                	cmp	bx,0FF0h
 30999 00005640 7404                    	je	short IsEOF_other
 31000                                  
 31001 00005642 81FBF80F                	CMP	BX,0FF8h		; do the 12 bit compare
 31002                                  IsEOF_other:
 31003 00005646 C3                      	retn
 31004                                  EOF16:
 31005 00005647 83FBF8                  	CMP	BX,0FFF8h		; 16 bit compare
 31006 0000564A C3                      	retn
 31007                                  
 31008                                  ; DOSCODE:9511h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 31009                                  
 31010                                  ;Break	<UNPACK -- UNPACK FAT ENTRIES>
 31011                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31012                                  ;
 31013                                  ; Procedur Name : UNPACK
 31014                                  ;
 31015                                  ; Inputs:
 31016                                  ;	BX = Cluster number (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 31017                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 31018                                  ; Outputs:
 31019                                  ;	DI = Contents of FAT for given cluster (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 31020                                  ;	Zero set means DI=0 (free cluster)
 31021                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 31022                                  ; SI Destroyed, No other registers affected. Fatal error if cluster too big.
 31023                                  ;
 31024                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then DI = contents of CL0FATENTRY
 31025                                  ;
 31026                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31027                                  	
 31028                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 31029                                  	; DOSCODE:94B5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 31030                                  
 31031                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31032                                  UNPACK:
 31033                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; M014 - Start
 31034 0000564B 09DB                    	or	bx, bx			; Q: are we unpacking cluster 0
 31035 0000564D 7507                    	jnz	short up_cont		; N: proceed with normal unpack
 31036 0000564F 8B3E[8100]              	mov	di,[CL0FATENTRY]	; Y: return value in CL0FATENTRY
 31037 00005653 09FF                    	or	di,di 			; return z if di=0
 31038 00005655 C3                      	retn				; done
 31039                                  up_cont:				; M014 - End
 31040                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 31041                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:bp+0Dh]
 31042 00005656 263B5E0D                	CMP	BX,[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER]
 31043 0000565A 7726                    	JA	short HURTFAT
 31044 0000565C E8D600                  	CALL	MAPCLUSTER
 31045 0000565F 721E                    	jc	short _DoContext
 31046 00005661 8B3D                    	MOV	DI,[DI]
 31047 00005663 750E                    	JNZ	short High12		; MZ if high 12 bits, go get 'em
 31048 00005665 268B760D                	MOV	SI,[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER] ; MZ is this 16-bit fat?
 31049 00005669 81FEF60F                	CMP	SI,4096-10
 31050 0000566D 720C                    	JB	short Unpack12		; MZ No, go 'AND' off bits
 31051 0000566F 09FF                    	OR	DI,DI			; MZ set zero condition code, clears carry
 31052 00005671 EB0C                    	JMP	SHORT _DoContext 	; MZ go do context
 31053                                  High12:
 31054 00005673 D1EF                    	SHR	DI,1
 31055 00005675 D1EF                    	SHR	DI,1
 31056 00005677 D1EF                    	SHR	DI,1
 31057 00005679 D1EF                    	SHR	DI,1
 31058                                  Unpack12:
 31059 0000567B 81E7FF0F                	AND	DI,0FFFh		; Clears carry
 31060                                  _DoContext:
 31061 0000567F 16                      	PUSH	SS
 31062 00005680 1F                      	POP	DS
 31063 00005681 C3                      	retn
 31064                                  HURTFAT:
 31065                                  	;;mov	word [es:bp+1Eh],0FFFFh
 31066                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh  ; MSDOS 6.0
 31067 00005682 26C7461FFFFF            	MOV	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Err in FAT must force recomp of freespace
 31068 00005688 50                      	PUSH	AX
 31069 00005689 B488                    	MOV	AH,Allowed_FAIL+80h ; 88h
 31070                                  
 31071                                  ;hkn; SS override
 31072 0000568B 36C606[4B03]08          	MOV	byte [SS:ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL ; 8
 31073                                  ;
 31074                                  ; Signal Bad FAT to INT int_fatal_abort handler. We have an invalid cluster.
 31075                                  ;
 31076 00005691 BFFF0F                  	MOV	DI,0FFFh		; In case INT int_fatal_abort returns (it shouldn't)
 31077 00005694 E8C8FD                  	call	FATAL
 31078 00005697 3C03                    	CMP	AL,3
 31079 00005699 F8                      	CLC
 31080 0000569A 7501                    	JNZ	short OKU_RET 		; Try to ignore bad FAT
 31081 0000569C F9                      	STC				; User said FAIL
 31082                                  OKU_RET:
 31083 0000569D 58                      	POP	AX
 31084                                  hurtfat_retn:
 31085 0000569E C3                      	retn
 31086                                  
 31087                                  ; DOSCODE:9565h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 31088                                  
 31089                                  ;Break	<PACK -- PACK FAT ENTRIES>
 31090                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31091                                  ;
 31092                                  ; Procedure Name : PACK
 31093                                  ;
 31094                                  ; Inputs:
 31095                                  ;	BX = Cluster number
 31096                                  ;	DX = Data
 31097                                  ;	ES:BP = Pointer to drive DPB
 31098                                  ; Outputs:
 31099                                  ;	The data is stored in the FAT at the given cluster.
 31100                                  ;	SI,DX,DI all destroyed
 31101                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 31102                                  ;	No other registers affected
 31103                                  ;
 31104                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then data in DX is atored in CL0FATENTRY.
 31105                                  ;
 31106                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31107                                  
 31108                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 31109                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31110                                  PACK:
 31111                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; M014 - start
 31112 0000569F 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			; Q: are we packing cluster 0
 31113 000056A1 7505                    	jnz	short p_cont		; N: proceed with normal pack
 31114 000056A3 8916[8100]              	mov	[CL0FATENTRY],dx	; Y: place value in CL0FATENTRY
 31115 000056A7 C3                      	retn				; done
 31116                                  p_cont:					; M014 - end
 31117                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 31118 000056A8 E88A00                  	CALL	MAPCLUSTER
 31119 000056AB 72D2                    	JC	short _DoContext
 31120 000056AD 8B35                    	MOV	SI,[DI]
 31121 000056AF 740B                    	JZ	short ALIGNED 		; byte (not nibble) aligned
 31122 000056B1 51                      	PUSH	CX			; move data to upper 12 bits
 31123 000056B2 B104                    	MOV	CL,4
 31124 000056B4 D3E2                    	SHL	DX,CL
 31125 000056B6 59                      	POP	CX
 31126 000056B7 83E60F                  	AND	SI,0FH			; leave in original low 4 bits
 31127 000056BA EB14                    	JMP	SHORT PACKIN
 31128                                  ALIGNED:
 31129                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Dh],0FF6h
 31130 000056BC 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; MZ 16 bit fats?
 31131 000056C2 730A                    	JAE	short Pack16		; MZ yes, go clobber original data
 31132 000056C4 81E600F0                	AND	SI,0F000h		; MZ leave in upper 4 bits of original
 31133 000056C8 81E2FF0F                	AND	DX,0FFFh		; MZ store only 12 bits
 31134 000056CC EB02                    	JMP	SHORT PACKIN		; MZ go store
 31135                                  Pack16:
 31136 000056CE 31F6                    	XOR	SI,SI			; MZ no original data
 31137                                  PACKIN:
 31138 000056D0 09D6                    	OR	SI,DX
 31139 000056D2 8935                    	MOV	[DI],SI
 31140                                  
 31141                                  ;hkn; SS override
 31142 000056D4 36C536[E205]            	LDS	SI,[SS:CURBUF]
 31143                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 31144 000056D9 F6440540                	TEST	byte [SI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty
 31145                                  					;LB. if already dirty		  ;AN000;
 31146 000056DD 7507                    	JNZ	short yesdirty11	;LB.  don't increment dirty count ;AN000;
 31147                                  	; 10/06/2019
 31148 000056DF E8AB05                  	call	INC_DIRTY_COUNT		;LB.				  ;AN000;
 31149                                  	
 31150                                  	;or	byte [si+5],40h
 31151 000056E2 804C0540                	OR	byte [SI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty
 31152                                  yesdirty11:				;LB.				;AN000;
 31153                                  ;hkn; SS override
 31154 000056E6 36803E[7805]00          	CMP	BYTE [SS:CLUSSPLIT],0	; 15/08/2018
 31155                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 31156 000056EC 16                      	push	ss
 31157 000056ED 1F                      	pop	ds
 31158 000056EE 74AE                    	jz	short hurtfat_retn	; Carry clear
 31159 000056F0 50                      	PUSH	AX
 31160 000056F1 53                      	PUSH	BX
 31161 000056F2 51                      	PUSH	CX
 31162 000056F3 A1[8E05]                	MOV	AX,[CLUSSAVE]
 31163 000056F6 8E1E[E405]              	MOV	DS,[CURBUF+2]
 31164                                  	;;;add	si,16 ; MSDOS 3.3
 31165                                  	;;add	si,20 ; MSDOS 6.0
 31166                                  	; 02/01/2024
 31167                                  	;add	si,24 ; PCDOS 7.1 
 31168 000056FA 83C618                  	ADD	SI,BUFINSIZ
 31169 000056FD 8824                    	MOV	[SI],AH
 31170                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 31171                                  	;Context DS
 31172 000056FF 16                      	push	ss
 31173 00005700 1F                      	pop	ds
 31174                                  	
 31175 00005701 50                      	PUSH	AX
 31176                                  	
 31177                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 31178 00005702 8B16[9205]              	MOV	DX,[CLUSSEC+2]		;F.C. >32mb			;AN000;
 31179 00005706 8916[0706]              	MOV	[HIGH_SECTOR],DX	;F.C. >32mb			;AN000;
 31180                                  
 31181                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 31182 0000570A 8B16[9005]              	MOV	DX,[CLUSSEC]
 31183                                  
 31184                                  	;MOV	SI,1	  ; *
 31185                                  	;XOR	AL,AL     ; *
 31186                                  	;call	GETBUFFRB ; *
 31187                                  	; 22/09/2023
 31188 0000570E E86C03                  	call	GETBUFFRA ; *
 31189                                  
 31190 00005711 58                      	POP	AX
 31191 00005712 721B                    	JC	short POPP_RET
 31192 00005714 C53E[E205]              	LDS	DI,[CURBUF]
 31193                                  	
 31194                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 31195 00005718 F6450540                	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty  
 31196                                  					;LB. if already dirty		  ;AN000;
 31197 0000571C 7507                    	JNZ	short yesdirty12	;LB.  don't increment dirty count ;AN000;
 31198 0000571E E86C05                  	call	INC_DIRTY_COUNT 	;LB.				  ;AN000;
 31199                                  	
 31200                                  	;or	byte [di+5],40h
 31201 00005721 804D0540                	OR	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty 
 31202                                  yesdirty12:
 31203                                  	;;;add	di,16
 31204                                  	;;add	di,20 ; MSDOS 6.0
 31205                                  	;ADD	DI,BUFINSIZ
 31206                                  	;DEC	DI
 31207                                  	; 02/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 31208                                  	;add	di,23 ; PCDOS 7.1
 31209 00005725 83C717                  	add	di,BUFINSIZ-1 ; 23 ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 31210                                  	
 31211                                  	;add	di,[es:bp+2]
 31212 00005728 26037E02                	ADD	DI,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 31213 0000572C 8805                    	MOV	[DI],AL
 31214 0000572E F8                      	CLC
 31215                                  POPP_RET:
 31216 0000572F 16                      	PUSH	SS
 31217 00005730 1F                      	POP	DS
 31218 00005731 59                      	POP	CX
 31219 00005732 5B                      	POP	BX
 31220 00005733 58                      	POP	AX
 31221 00005734 C3                      	retn
 31222                                  
 31223                                  ; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 31224                                  
 31225                                  ;Break	<MAPCLUSTER - BUFFER A FAT SECTOR>
 31226                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31227                                  ;
 31228                                  ; Procedure Name : MAPCLUSTER
 31229                                  ;
 31230                                  ; Inputs:
 31231                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 31232                                  ;	BX Is cluster number
 31233                                  ; Function:
 31234                                  ;	Get a pointer to the cluster
 31235                                  ; Outputs:
 31236                                  ;	DS:DI Points to contents of FAT for given cluster
 31237                                  ;	DS:SI Points to start of buffer
 31238                                  ;	Zero Not set if cluster data is in high 12 bits of word
 31239                                  ;	Zero set if cluster data is in low 12 or 16 bits
 31240                                  ;	Carry set if failed.
 31241                                  ; SI is destroyed.
 31242                                  ;
 31243                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31244                                  
 31245                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31246                                  	; DOSCODE:9601h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 31247                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 31248                                  	; DOSCODE:95A5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 31249                                  
 31250                                  MAPCLUSTER:
 31251                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5A15h
 31252 00005735 C606[7805]00            	MOV	BYTE [CLUSSPLIT],0
 31253                                  	;SAVE	<AX,BX,CX,DX>
 31254 0000573A 50                      	push	ax
 31255 0000573B 53                      	push	bx
 31256 0000573C 51                      	push	cx
 31257 0000573D 52                      	push	dx
 31258 0000573E 89D8                    	MOV	AX,BX			; AX = BX
 31259 00005740 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10  ; MZ 16 bit fat?
 31260 00005746 7302                    	JAE	short Map16		; MZ yes, do 16 bit algorithm
 31261 00005748 D1E8                    	SHR	AX,1			; AX = BX/2
 31262                                  Map16:	
 31263                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; MZ skip prev => AX=2*BX
 31264 0000574A 31FF                    	XOR	DI,DI ; *		; >32mb fat ;AN000;
 31265                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 31266 0000574C 01D8                    	ADD	AX,BX			; AX = 1.5*fat = byte offset in fat
 31267 0000574E 11FF                    	ADC	DI,DI ; * MSDOS 6.0	; >32mb fat ;DI is zero before op;AN000;
 31268 00005750 268B4E02                	MOV	CX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 31269                                  
 31270                                  ;IF FastDiv
 31271                                  ;
 31272                                  ; Gross hack: 99% of all disks have 512 bytes per sector. We test for this
 31273                                  ; case and apply a really fast algorithm to get the desired results
 31274                                  ;
 31275                                  ; Divide method takes 157+4*4=173 (MOV and DIV)
 31276                                  ; Fast method takes 39+20*4=119
 31277                                  ;
 31278                                  ; This saves a bunch.
 31279                                  
 31280 00005754 81F90002                	CMP	CX,512			; 4  Is this 512 byte sector?
 31281 00005758 7510                    	jne	short _DoDiv		; 4  for no jump
 31282 0000575A 89C2                    	MOV	DX,AX			; 2  get set for remainder
 31283 0000575C 81E2FF01                	AND	DX,512-1		; 4  Form remainder
 31284 00005760 88E0                    	MOV	AL,AH			; 2  Quotient in formation in AL
 31285                                  	; MDOS 3.3
 31286                                  	;shr	al,1	
 31287                                  	; MDOS 6.0
 31288 00005762 D1EF                    	shr	di,1			; 2
 31289 00005764 D0D8                    	rcr	al,1			; 2
 31290                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 31291 00005766 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah			; 3
 31292 00005768 EB04                    	jmp	short DivDone		; 16
 31293                                  _DoDiv:
 31294                                  ;ENDIF
 31295                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 31296                                  	;xor	dx,dx
 31297                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 31298 0000576A 89FA                    	mov	dx,di			; 2
 31299                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)	
 31300 0000576C F7F1                    	DIV	CX			; 155 AX is FAT sector # DX is sector index
 31301                                  ;IF FastDiv
 31302                                  DivDone:
 31303                                  ;ENDIF
 31304                                  	;add	ax,[es:bp+6]
 31305 0000576E 26034606                	ADD	AX,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_FAT]
 31306 00005772 49                      	DEC	CX			; CX is sector size - 1
 31307                                  	;SAVE	<AX,DX,CX>
 31308 00005773 50                      	push	ax
 31309 00005774 52                      	push	dx
 31310 00005775 51                      	push	cx
 31311 00005776 89C2                    	MOV	DX,AX
 31312                                  
 31313                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 31314                                  	; 22/09/2023
 31315                                  	;MOV	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0 ; *! ;F.C. >32mb  low sector #
 31316                                  	;
 31317                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 31318                                  	;XOR	AL,AL	   ; *
 31319                                  	;MOV	SI,1	   ; *
 31320                                  	;;invoke GETBUFFRB ; *
 31321                                  	;call	GETBUFFRB  ; *
 31322                                  	; 22/09/2023
 31323 00005778 E8FC02                  	call	GETBUFFRC  ; *!
 31324                                  
 31325                                  	;RESTORE <CX,AX,DX>		; CX is sec siz-1, AX is offset in sec
 31326 0000577B 59                      	pop	cx
 31327 0000577C 58                      	pop	ax
 31328 0000577D 5A                      	pop	dx
 31329 0000577E 724C                    	JC	short MAP_POP
 31330                                  
 31331 00005780 C536[E205]              	LDS	SI,[CURBUF]
 31332                                  	;;lea	di,[si+16]
 31333                                  	;lea	di,[si+20] ; MSDOS 6.0
 31334 00005784 8D7C18                  	LEA	DI,[SI+BUFINSIZ]
 31335 00005787 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX
 31336 00005789 39C8                    	CMP	AX,CX
 31337 0000578B 752C                    	JNZ	short MAPRET
 31338 0000578D 8A05                    	MOV	AL,[DI]
 31339                                  	;Context DS		 	;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 31340 0000578F 16                      	push	ss
 31341 00005790 1F                      	pop	ds	
 31342 00005791 FE06[7805]              	INC	BYTE [CLUSSPLIT]
 31343 00005795 A2[8E05]                	MOV	[CLUSSAVE],AL
 31344 00005798 8916[9005]              	MOV	[CLUSSEC],DX
 31345                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 31346 0000579C C706[9205]0000          	MOV	WORD [CLUSSEC+2],0      ;F.C. >32mb	;AN000;
 31347 000057A2 42                      	INC	DX
 31348                                  
 31349                                  	; 22/09/2023
 31350                                  	;MOV	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0 ; *! ;F.C. >32mb FAT sector <32mb ;AN000;
 31351                                  	;
 31352                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 31353                                  	;XOR	AL,AL	   ; *
 31354                                  	;MOV	SI,1	   ; *
 31355                                  	;;invoke GETBUFFRB ; *
 31356                                  	;call	GETBUFFRB  ; *
 31357                                  	; 22/09/2023
 31358 000057A3 E8D102                  	call	GETBUFFRC  ; *!

 31360

 31364                                  	;Context DS			;hkn; SS is DOSDATA

 31366 000057B2 1F                      	pop	ds

 31371                                  MAPRET:

 31395                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31396                                  ; DOSCODE:96B3h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 31397                                  ; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 31398                                  ; DOSCODE:9657h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 31399                                  
 31400                                  ;Break	<FATREAD_SFT/FATREAD_CDS -- CHECK DRIVE GET FAT>
 31401                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31402                                  ;
 31403                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_SFT
 31404                                  ;
 31405                                  ; Inputs:
 31406                                  ;	ES:DI points to an SFT for the drive of interest (local only,
 31407                                  ;		giving a NET SFT will produce system crashing results).
 31408                                  ;	DS DOSDATA
 31409                                  ; Function:
 31410                                  ;	Can be used by an SFT routine (like CLOSE) to invalidate buffers
 31411                                  ;	if disk changed.
 31412                                  ;	In other respects, same as FATREAD_CDS.
 31413                                  ;	(note ES:DI destroyed!)
 31414                                  ; Outputs:
 31415                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 31416                                  ; NOTE: This routine may cause FATREAD_CDS to "miss" a disk change
 31417                                  ;	as far as invalidating curdir_ID is concerned.
 31418                                  ;	Since getting a true disk changed on this call is a screw up
 31419                                  ;	anyway, that's the way it goes.
 31420                                  ;
 31421                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31422                                  
 31423                                  FATREAD_SFT:
 31424 000057D1 26C46D07                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_devptr]
 31425                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 31426                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 31427                                  	; 15/12/2022
 31428 000057D5 268A4600                	mov	AL,[ES:BP]
 31429 000057D9 A2[7605]                	MOV	[THISDRV],AL
 31430 000057DC E888AE                  	call	GOTDPB			; Set THISDPB
 31431                                  	;CALL	FAT_GOT_DPB
 31432                                  	; 17/12/2022
 31433 000057DF E99F00                  	jmp	FAT_GOT_DPB
 31434                                  ;fatread_sft_retn:
 31435                                  	;retn
 31436                                  
 31437                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31438                                  ;
 31439                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_CDS
 31440                                  ;
 31441                                  ; Inputs:
 31442                                  ;	DS:DOSDATA
 31443                                  ;	ES:DI points to an CDS for the drive of interest (local only,
 31444                                  ;		giving a NET or NUL CDS will produce system crashing results).
 31445                                  ; Function:
 31446                                  ;	If disk may have been changed, media is determined and buffers are
 31447                                  ;	flagged invalid. If not, no action is taken.
 31448                                  ; Outputs:
 31449                                  ;	ES:BP = Drive parameter block
 31450                                  ;	THISDPB = ES:BP
 31451                                  ;	THISDRV set
 31452                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 31453                                  ; DS preserved , all other registers destroyed
 31454                                  ;
 31455                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31456                                  
 31457                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31458                                  	; DOSCODE:96C5h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 31459                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 31460                                  	; DOSCODE:9669h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 31461                                  
 31462                                  FATREAD_CDS:
 31463 000057E2 06                      	PUSH	ES
 31464 000057E3 57                      	PUSH	DI
 31465                                  	;les	bp,[es:di+45h]
 31466 000057E4 26C46D45                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 31467                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 31468                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 31469                                  	; 15/12/2022
 31470 000057E8 268A4600                	mov	AL,[ES:BP]
 31471 000057EC A2[7605]                	MOV	[THISDRV],AL
 31472 000057EF E875AE                  	call	GOTDPB			;Set THISDPB
 31473 000057F2 E88C00                  	CALL	FAT_GOT_DPB
 31474 000057F5 5F                      	POP	DI			;Get back CDS pointer
 31475 000057F6 07                      	POP	ES
 31476 000057F7 72D7                    	jc	short fatread_sft_retn
 31477 000057F9 7538                    	JNZ	short NO_CHANGE		;Media NOT changed
 31478                                  
 31479                                  ;	Media changed. We now need to find all CDS structures which use this
 31480                                  ;	DPB and invalidate their ID pointers.
 31481                                  
 31482                                  MED_CHANGE:

 31484 000057FD 48                      	DEC	AX			; AX = -1
 31485 000057FE 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 31486 000057FF 8A0E[4700]              	MOV	CL,[CDSCOUNT]
 31487 00005803 30ED                    	XOR	CH,CH			; CX is number of structures
 31488                                  	;lds	si,[es:di+45h]
 31489 00005805 26C57545                	LDS	SI,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr] ; Find all CDS with this devptr
 31490                                  
 31491                                  ;hkn; SS override
 31492                                  
 31493                                  ;	Find all CDSs with this DevPtr
 31494                                  ;
 31495                                  ;	(ax) = -1
 31496                                  ;	(ds:si) = DevPtr
 31497                                  
 31498 00005809 36C43E[3C00]            	LES	DI,[SS:CDSADDR]		; (es:di) = CDS pointer
 31499                                  frcd20: 
 31500                                  	;;test	word [es:di+43h],8000h
 31501                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet
 31502 0000580E 26F6454480              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],(curdir_isnet>>8)
 31503 00005813 7518                    	JNZ	short frcd25		; Leave NET guys alone!!
 31504                                  
 31505                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 31506                                  	;push	es
 31507                                  	;push	di
 31508                                  	;les	di,[es:di+45h]
 31509                                  	;;les	di,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 31510                                  	;call	POINTCOMP
 31511                                  	;pop	di
 31512                                  	;pop	es
 31513                                  	;jnz	short frcd25
 31514                                  
 31515                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 31517 00005819 7512                    	jne	short frcd25		; no match
 31518 0000581B 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds
 31519 0000581D 263B5D47                	cmp	bx,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr+2]
 31520 00005821 750A                    	jne	short frcd25		; CDS not for this drive
 31521                                  
 31522                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 31523                                  	;test	[es:di+49h],ax
 31524 00005823 26854549                	test	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],AX
 31525 00005827 7404                    	JZ	short frcd25		; If root (0), leave root
 31526                                  	;mov	[es:di+49h],ax
 31527 00005829 26894549                	MOV	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],AX	; else invalid
 31528                                  frcd25:	
 31529                                  	;;add	di,81  ; MSDOS 3.3
 31530                                  	;add	di,88  ; MSDOS 6.0

 31532 00005830 E2DC                    	LOOP	frcd20
 31533 00005832 1F                      	POP	DS

 31535 00005833 C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]
 31536 00005837 F8                      	CLC
 31537 00005838 C3                      	retn
 31538                                  
 31539                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31540                                  ; 05/01/2024 - Retro DOS 5.0
 31541                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A7Fh
 31542                                  ;;;
 31543                                  chk_set_first_access:
 31544 00005839 26837E0F00              	cmp	word [es:bp+0Fh],0	; DPB.FATSIZE
 31545 0000583E 750D                    	jnz	short chk_set_fa_1	; FAT (FAT12 or FAT16)
 31546                                  					; FAT32
 31547 00005840 26837E21FF              	cmp	word [es:bp+21h],0FFFFh	; DPB.FREE_CNT_HW
 31548 00005845 26C74621FFFF            	mov	word [es:bp+21h],0FFFFh	; High word of free cluster count
 31549 0000584B 7505                    	jne	short chk_set_fa_2

 31552                                  chk_set_fa_2:

 31554 00005858 7405                    	je	short chk_set_fa_3
 31555 0000585A 26804E1801              	or	byte [es:bp+18h],1	; DPB.FIRST_ACCESS
 31556                                  chk_set_fa_3:

 31611 000058A0 BB[5A03]                	MOV	BX,DEVCALL

 31613                                  	;lds	si,[es:bp+13h] ; MSDOS 6.0

 31628                                  	;xchg	ah,[es:bp+18h] ; MSDOS 6.0

 31631                                  ; See if we had changed volume id by creating one on the diskette

 31636                                  					; new volume label.

 31937                                  ;SETVISIT:

 31943                                  ;;      Set up a scan of I/O buffers

 31945                                  ;;      All visit flags = 0
 31946                                  ;;              NOTE: This pre-scan is needed because a hard disk error
 31947                                  ;;                    may cause a scan to stop in the middle leaving some
 31948                                  ;;                    visit flags set, and some not set.
 31949                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to [BUFFHEAD]
 31950                                  ;; No other registers altered
 31951                                  ;
 31952                                  ;       LDS     DI,[SS:BUFFHEAD] ; 15/03/2018
 31953                                  ;	PUSH    AX

 31956                                  ;	mov	al,~buf_visit

 31961                                  ;       LDS     DI,[DI]
 31962                                  ;       CMP     DI,-1
 31963                                  ;       JNZ     SHORT SETLOOP

 31975                                  ;; Function:

 31977                                  ;; Outputs:

 32032                                  ;Break	<GETCURHEAD -- Get current buffer header>
 32033                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32034                                  ; Procedure Name : GetCurHead
 32035                                  ; Inputs:
 32036                                  ;	 No Inputs
 32037                                  ; Function:
 32038                                  ;	Returns the pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 32039                                  ;	and updates FIRST_BUFF_ADDR
 32040                                  ;       and invalidates LASTBUFFER (recency pointer)
 32041                                  ; Outputs:
 32042                                  ;	DS:DI = pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 32043                                  ;	FIRST_BUFF_ADDR = offset ( DI ) of First buffer in Queue
 32044                                  ;       LASTBUFFER = -1
 32045                                  ; No other registers altered
 32046                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32047                                  
 32048                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32049                                  ; DOSCODE:98D2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 32050                                  ; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 32051                                  ; DOSCODE:9876h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 32052                                  
 32053                                  GETCURHEAD:
 32054 00005A12 36C53E[6D00]            	lds	di,[ss:BufferQueue]	; Pointer to the first buffer
 32055 00005A17 36C706[1E00]FFFF        	mov	word [ss:LastBuffer],-1	; invalidate last buffer
 32056 00005A1E 36893E[0E0F]            	mov	[ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR],di	; save first buffer address
 32057 00005A23 C3                      	retn
 32058                                  
 32059                                  ;Break	<SCANPLACE, PLACEBUF -- PUT A BUFFER BACK IN THE POOL>

 32077                                  ;	;les	si,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_link]
 32078                                  ;	call	PLACEBUF
 32079                                  ;	push	es

 32081                                  ;	mov	di,si
 32082                                  ;	pop	es

 32084                                  ;	retn

 32285                                  ;Break	<POINTCOMP -- 20 BIT POINTER COMPARE>
 32286                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32287                                  ;
 32288                                  ; Procedure Name : PointComp
 32289                                  ; Inputs:
 32290                                  ;         DS:SI & ES:DI
 32291                                  ; Function:
 32292                                  ;          Checks for ((SI==DI) && (ES==DS))
 32293                                  ;	   Assumes that pointers are normalized for the
 32294                                  ;	   same segment
 32295                                  ;
 32296                                  ; Compare DS:SI to ES:DI (or DS:DI to ES:SI) for equality
 32297                                  ; DO NOT USE FOR < or >
 32298                                  ; No Registers altered
 32299                                  ;
 32300                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32301                                  
 32302                                  POINTCOMP:
 32303                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 32304                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5D84h
 32305 00005A68 39FE                    	CMP	SI,DI
 32306 00005A6A 750A                    	jnz	short _ret_label	; return if nz
 32307                                  	;jnz	short placehead_retn 
 32308 00005A6C 51                      	PUSH	CX
 32309 00005A6D 52                      	PUSH	DX
 32310 00005A6E 8CD9                    	MOV	CX,DS
 32311 00005A70 8CC2                    	MOV	DX,ES
 32312 00005A72 39D1                    	CMP	CX,DX
 32313 00005A74 5A                      	POP	DX
 32314 00005A75 59                      	POP	CX
 32315                                  _ret_label:
 32316 00005A76 C3                      	retn

 32318                                  ; 01/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 32319                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5D93h 
 32320                                  
 32321                                  ;Break	<GETBUFFR, GETBUFFRB -- GET A SECTOR INTO A BUFFER>
 32322                                  
 32323                                  ;**	GetBuffr - Get a non-FAT Sector into a Buffer
 32324                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32325                                  ;	GetBuffr does normal ( non-FAT ) sector buffering
 32326                                  ;	It gets the specified local sector into one of the I/O buffers
 32327                                  ;	and shuffles the queue
 32328                                  ; 
 32329                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 32330                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 32331                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	      (LOW)
 32332                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 32333                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 32334                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 32335                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 32336                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 32337                                  ;		CURBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 32338                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 32339                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 32340                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32341                                  
 32342                                  ;**	GetBuffrb - Get a FAT Sector into a Buffer
 32343                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32344                                  ;	GetBuffrb reads a sector from the FAT file system's FAT table.
 32345                                  ;	It gets the specified sector into one of the I/O buffers
 32346                                  ;	and shuffles the queue. We need a special entry point so that
 32347                                  ;	we can read the alternate FAT sector if the first read fails, also
 32348                                  ;	so we can mark the buffer as a FAT sector.
 32349                                  ; 
 32350                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 32351                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 32352                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	     (LOW)
 32353                                  ;		(SI) != 0
 32354                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 32355                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 32356                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 32357                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 32358                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 32359                                  ;		CUR ddBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 32360                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 32361                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 32362                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32363

 32707                                  ;Break	<FLUSHBUF -- WRITE OUT DIRTY BUFFERS>
 32708                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32709                                  ; Input:
 32710                                  ;	DS = DOSGROUP
 32711                                  ;	AL = Physical unit number local buffers only
 32712                                  ;	   = -1 for all units and all remote buffers
 32713                                  ; Function:
 32714                                  ;	Write out all dirty buffers for unit, and flag them as clean
 32715                                  ;	Carry set if error (user FAILed to I 24)
 32716                                  ;	    Flush operation completed.
 32717                                  ; DS Preserved, all others destroyed (ES too)
 32718                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32719                                  
 32720                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32721                                  	; DOSCODE:9A35h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 32722                                  
 32723                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 32724                                  	; DOSCODE:99DAh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)

 32726                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 32727                                  	;;mov	ah,-1 ; 01/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 32728                                  	;lds	di,[BUFFHEAD]
 32729

 32805                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32806                                  ;
 32807                                  ; Procedure Name : CHECKFLUSH
 32808                                  ;
 32809                                  ; Inputs : AL - Drive number, -1 means do not check for drive
 32810                                  ;	   DS:DI - pointer to buffer
 32811                                  ;
 32812                                  ; Function : Write out a buffer if it is dirty
 32813                                  ;
 32814                                  ; Carry set if problem (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 32815                                  ;
 32816                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32817                                  
 32818                                  CHECKFLUSH:
 32819                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32820 00005BC7 B4FF                    	mov	ah,-1	; 01/08/2018 Retro DOS v3.0
 32821                                  	;cmp	[di+4],ah
 32822 00005BC9 386504                  	CMP	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],AH
 32823 00005BCC 74F8                    	jz	short flushbuf_retn	; Skip free buffer, carry clear
 32824 00005BCE 38C4                    	CMP	AH,AL			; 
 32825 00005BD0 7406                    	JZ	short DOBUFFER		; do this buffer
 32826                                  	;cmp	al,[di+4]
 32827 00005BD2 3A4504                  	CMP	AL,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID]
 32828 00005BD5 F8                      	CLC
 32829 00005BD6 75EE                    	jnz	short flushbuf_retn	; Buffer not for this unit or SFT
 32830                                  DOBUFFER:
 32831                                  	;test	byte [di+5],40h
 32832 00005BD8 F6450540                	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty
 32833 00005BDC 74E8                    	jz	short flushbuf_retn	; Buffer not dirty, carry clear by TEST
 32834 00005BDE 50                      	PUSH	AX
 32835                                  	;push	word [di+4]
 32836 00005BDF FF7504                  	PUSH	WORD [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID]
 32837 00005BE2 E80B00                  	CALL	BUFWRITE
 32838 00005BE5 58                      	POP	AX
 32839 00005BE6 7206                    	JC	short LEAVE_BUF		; Leave buffer marked free (lost).
 32840                                  	;and	ah,0BFh
 32841 00005BE8 80E4BF                  	AND	AH,~buf_dirty		; Buffer is clean, clears carry
 32842                                  	;mov	[di+4],ax
 32843 00005BEB 894504                  	MOV	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],AX
 32844                                  LEAVE_BUF:
 32845 00005BEE 58                      	POP	AX			; Search info
 32846                                  checkflush_retn:
 32847 00005BEF C3                      	retn
 32848                                  
 32849                                  ;Break	<BUFWRITE -- WRITE OUT A BUFFER IF DIRTY>
 32850                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32851                                  ;
 32852                                  ;	BufWrite writes a buffer to the disk, if it's dirty.
 32853                                  ;
 32854                                  ;	ENTRY	DS:DI Points to the buffer
 32855                                  ;
 32856                                  ;	EXIT	Buffer marked free
 32857                                  ;		Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 32858                                  ;
 32859                                  ;	USES	All buf DS:DI
 32860                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR
 32861                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32862                                  
 32863                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 32865

 32879                                  	;test	ah,40h
 32880 00005BFA F6C440                  	test	AH,buf_dirty
 32881 00005BFD 74F0                    	jz      short checkflush_retn	; Buffer is clean, carry clear.

 32995                                  ;**	Set_RQ_SC_Parms - Set Secondary Cache Parameters
 32996                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32997                                  ;	Set_RQ_SC_Parms sets the sector size and drive number value
 32998                                  ;	for the secondary cache. This updates SC_SECTOR_SIZE &
 32999                                  ;	SC_DRIVE even if SC is disabled to save the testing
 33000                                  ;	code and time
 33001                                  ;

 33003                                  ;
 33004                                  ;	EXIT	[SC_SECTOR_SIZE]= drive sector size
 33005                                  ;		[SC_DRIVE]= drive #
 33006                                  ;
 33007                                  ;	USES	Flags
 33008                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33009                                  
 33010                                  ; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 33011                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33012

 33016                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bp+2]

 33022                                  	; 15/12/2022

 33024 00005C87 36A2[030E]              	MOV	[ss:SC_DRIVE],al
 33025 00005C8B 58                      	pop	ax
 33026                                  srspx:
