 33074                                  
 33075                                  ; Pseudo EXEC system call for DOS
 33076                                  
 33077                                  ;	TITLE	MSPROC - process maintenance
 33078                                  ;	NAME	MSPROC
 33079                                  
 33080                                  ; =========================================================================
 33081                                  ;**	Process related system calls and low level routines for DOS 2.X.
 33082                                  ;	I/O specs are defined in DISPATCH.
 33083                                  ;
 33084                                  ;	$WAIT
 33085                                  ;	$EXEC
 33086                                  ;	$Keep_process
 33087                                  ;	Stay_resident
 33088                                  ;	$EXIT
 33089                                  ;	$ABORT
 33090                                  ;	abort_inner
 33091                                  ;
 33092                                  ;	Modification history:
 33093                                  ;
 33094                                  ;		Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 33095                                  ;		AN000	version 4.0 jan. 1988
 33096                                  ;		A007	PTM 3957 - fake vesrion for IBMCACHE.COM
 33097                                  ;		A008	PTM 4070 - fake version for MS WINDOWS
 33098                                  ;
 33099                                  ;		M000	added support for loading programs into UMBs 7/9/90
 33100                                  ;
 33101                                  ;		M004 - MS PASCAL 3.2 support. Please see under tag M003 in 
 33102                                  ;		       dossym.inc. 7/30/90
 33103                                  ;		M005 - Support for EXE programs with out STACK segment and 
 33104                                  ;		       with resident size < 64K - 256 bytes. A 256 byte 
 33105                                  ;		       stack is provided at the end of the program. Note that
 33106                                  ;		       only SP is changed.
 33107                                  ;		M020 - Fix for Rational bug for details see exepatch.asm
 33108                                  ;
 33109                                  ;		M028 - 4b04 implementation
 33110                                  ;
 33111                                  ;		M029 - Support for EXEs without stack rewritten. If EXE is
 33112                                  ;			in memory block >= 64K, sp = 0. If memory block
 33113                                  ;			obtained is <64K, point sp at the end of the memory
 33114                                  ;			block. For EXEs smaller than 64K, 256 bytes are still
 33115                                  ;			added for a stack segment which may be needed if it
 33116                                  ;			is loaded in low memory situations.
 33117                                  ;
 33118                                  ;		M030 - Fixing bug in EXEPACPATCH & changing 4b04 to 4b05
 33119                                  ;
 33120                                  ;		M040 - Bug #3052. The environment sizing code would flag a
 33121                                  ;			a bad environment if it reached 32767 bytes. Changed
 33122                                  ;			to allow 32768 bytes of environment.
 33123                                  ;
 33124                                  ;		M047 - Release the allocated UMB when we failed to load a 
 33125                                  ;		       COM file high. Also ensure that if the biggest block
 33126                                  ;		       into which we load the com file is less than 64K then
 33127                                  ;		       we provide atleast 256 bytes of stack to the user.
 33128                                  ;
 33129                                  ;		M050 - Made Lie table search CASE insensitive
 33130                                  ;
 33131                                  ;		M060 - Removed special version table from the kernal and
 33132                                  ;                      put it in a device drive which puts the address
 33133                                  ;                      in the DOS DATA area location UU_IFS_DOS_CALL
 33134                                  ;		       as a DWORD.
 33135                                  ;
 33136                                  ;		M063 - Modified UMB support. If the HIGH_ONLY bit is set on
 33137                                  ;		       entry do not try to load low if there is no space in
 33138                                  ;		       UMBs.
 33139                                  ;
 33140                                  ;		M068 - Support for copy protect apps. Call ChkCopyProt to 
 33141                                  ;		       set a20off_count. Set bit EXECA20BIT in DOS_FLAG. Also
 33142                                  ;		       change return address to LeaveDos if AL=5.
 33143                                  ;
 33144                                  ;               20-Jul-1992 bens  Added ifdef RESTRICTED_BUILD code that
 33145                                  ;                      controls building a version of MSDOS.SYS that only
 33146                                  ;                      runs programs from a fixed list (defined in the
 33147                                  ;                      file RESTRICT.INC).  Search for "RESTRICTED_BUILD"
 33148                                  ;                      for details.  This feature is used to build a
 33149                                  ;                      "special" version of DOS that can be handed out to
 33150                                  ;                      OEM/ISV customers as part of a "service" disk.
 33151                                  ;
 33152                                  ; =========================================================================
 33153                                  
 33154                                  ;SAVEXIT  EQU  10
 33155                                  
 33156                                  ;BREAK	<$WAIT - return previous process error code>
 33157                                  ; =========================================================================
 33158                                  ;	$WAIT - Return previous process error code.
 33159                                  ;
 33160                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 33161                                  ;
 33162                                  ;	    MOV     AH, WaitProcess
 33163                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 33164                                  ;
 33165                                  ;	ENTRY	none
 33166                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = exit code
 33167                                  ;	USES	all
 33168                                  ; =========================================================================
 33169                                  
 33170                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33171                                  	; DOSCODE:9B55h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 33172                                  
 33173                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 33174                                  	; DOSCODE:9A5Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)	
 33175                                  _$WAIT:
 33176                                  	; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 33177                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5E1h
 33178                                  
 33179 00005CA1 31C0                    	xor	AX,AX
 33180 00005CA3 368706[3403]            	xchg	AX,[ss:exit_code]
 33181 00005CA8 E9C5A9                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK
 33182                                  
 33183                                  ; =========================================================================
 33184                                  ;BREAK <$exec - load/go a program>
 33185                                  ;	EXEC.ASM - EXEC System Call
 33186                                  ;
 33187                                  ;
 33188                                  ; Assembler usage:
 33189                                  ;	    lds     DX, Name
 33190                                  ;	    les     BX, Blk
 33191                                  ;	    mov     AH, Exec
 33192                                  ;	    mov     AL, FUNC
 33193                                  ;	    int     INT_COMMAND
 33194                                  ;
 33195                                  ;	AL  Function
 33196                                  ;	--  --------
 33197                                  ;	 0  Load and execute the program.
 33198                                  ;	 1  Load, create the program header but do not
 33199                                  ;	    begin execution.
 33200                                  ;	 3  Load overlay. No header created.
 33201                                  ;
 33202                                  ;	    AL = 0 -> load/execute program
 33203                                  ;
 33204                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 33205                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 33206                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 33207                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 33208                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 33209                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 33210                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 33211                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 33212                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 33213                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 33214                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 33215                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 33216                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 33217                                  ;
 33218                                  ;	    AL = 1 -> load program
 33219                                  ;
 33220                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 33221                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 33222                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 33223                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 33224                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 33225                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 33226                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 33227                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 33228                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 33229                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 33230                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 33231                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 33232                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 33233                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 33234                                  ;	    | CS:IP			|
 33235                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 33236                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 33237                                  ;	    | SS:IP			|
 33238                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 33239                                  ;
 33240                                  ;	    AL = 3 -> load overlay
 33241                                  ;
 33242                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 33243                                  ;	    | WORD segment address where|
 33244                                  ;	    | file will be loaded.	|
 33245                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 33246                                  ;	    | WORD relocation factor to |
 33247                                  ;	    | be applied to the image.	|
 33248                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 33249                                  ;
 33250                                  ; Returns:
 33251                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_function
 33252                                  ;	       = error_bad_format
 33253                                  ;	       = error_bad_environment
 33254                                  ;	       = error_not_enough_memory
 33255                                  ;	       = error_file_not_found

 33257                                  ;
 33258                                  ;   Revision history:
 33259                                  ;
 33260                                  ;	 A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 33261                                  ;
 33262                                  ; =========================================================================
 33263                                  
 33264                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer		EQU	OPENBUF
 33265                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer_Size	EQU	(128+128+53+curdirLen)

 33291                                  _$EXEC:

 33294                                  
 33295                                  EXEC001S:
 33296                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Blk		,DWORD
 33297                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Func		,BYTE
 33298                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Load_High	,BYTE
 33299                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_FH		,WORD
 33300                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Rel_Fac	,WORD
 33301                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Res_Len_Para	,WORD
 33302                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Environ	,WORD
 33303                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Size		,WORD
 33304                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Load_Block	,WORD
 33305                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_DMA		,WORD
 33306                                  	;LocalVar    ExecNameLen 	,WORD
 33307                                  	;LocalVar    ExecName		,DWORD
 33308                                  	;
 33309                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_DMA_Save	,WORD
 33310                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_NoStack	,BYTE
 33311                                  
 33312                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 33313                                  	;%define	Exec_Blk	dword [bp-4]
 33314                                  	%define		Exec_Blk	[bp-4] ; 09/08/2018
 33315                                  	%define		Exec_BlkL	word [bp-4]	
 33316                                  	%define		Exec_BlkH	word [bp-2]
 33317                                  	%define		Exec_Func	byte [bp-5]
 33318                                  	%define		Exec_Load_High	byte [bp-6]
 33319                                  	%define		Exec_FH		word [bp-8]
 33320                                  	%define		Exec_Rel_Fac	word [bp-10]
 33321                                  	%define		Exec_Res_Len_Para word [bp-12]
 33322                                  	%define		Exec_Environ	word [bp-14]
 33323                                  	%define		Exec_Size	word [bp-16]
 33324                                  	%define		Exec_Load_Block	word [bp-18]
 33325                                  	%define		Exec_DMA	word [bp-20]
 33326                                  	%define		ExecNameLen	word [bp-22]

 33328                                  	%define		ExecName	[bp-26] ; 09/08/2018
 33329                                  	%define		ExecNameL	word [bp-26]	
 33330                                  	%define		ExecNameH	word [bp-24]

 33332                                  	%define		Exec_DMA_Save	word [bp-28]
 33333                                  	%define		Exec_NoStack	byte [bp-29]
 33334                                  	
 33335                                  	; ==================================================================
 33336                                  	; validate function
 33337                                  	; ==================================================================
 33338                                  		      	
 33339                                  	; M068 - Start
 33340                                  	;
 33341                                  	; Reset the A20OFF_COUNT to 0. This is done as there is a 
 33342                                  	; possibility that the count may not be decremented all the way to
 33343                                  	; 0. A typical case is if the program for which we intended to keep 
 33344                                  	; the A20  off for a sufficiently long time (A20OFF_COUNT int 21 
 33345                                  	; calls), exits pre-maturely due to error conditions.
 33346                                  
 33347                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 33348 00005CAB 36C606[8500]00          	mov	byte [SS:A20OFF_COUNT], 0
 33349                                  
 33350                                  	; If al=5 (ExecReady) we'll change the return address on the stack	
 33351                                  	; to be LeaveDos in msdisp.asm. This ensures that the EXECA20OFF
 33352                                  	; bit set in DOS_FLAG by ExceReady is not cleared in msdisp.asm
 33353                                  
 33354 00005CB1 3C05                    	cmp	al,5			; Q: is this ExecReady call
 33355                                  	;jne	short @f
 33356 00005CB3 7505                    	jne	short Exec_@f		; N: continue
 33357                                  					; Y: change ret addr. to LeaveDos.
 33358 00005CB5 59                      	pop	cx			; Note CX is not input to ExecReady
 33359 00005CB6 B9[F603]                	mov	cx,LeaveDOS
 33360 00005CB9 51                      	push	cx
 33361                                  ;@@:
 33362                                  Exec_@f:
 33363                                  	; M068 - End
 33364                                  	
 33365                                  	;Enter
 33366                                  
 33367 00005CBA 55                      	push	bp
 33368 00005CBB 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 33369                                  	;;sub	sp,26	; MSDOS 3.3
 33370                                  	; 30/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS compatibility)	
 33371                                  	;sub	sp,29	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 6.21)
 33372                                  	; 17/12/2022
 33373                                  	; 20/05/2019
 33374 00005CBD 83EC1E                  	sub	sp,30	; Retro DOS v4.0	
 33375                                  
 33376                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 33377 00005CC0 3C05                    	cmp	AL,5			; only 0, 1, 3 or 5 are allowed ;M028
 33378                                  					; M030
 33379 00005CC2 7614                    	jna	short Exec_Check_2
 33380                                  
 33381                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 33382                                  	;cmp	AL,3
 33383                                  	;jna	short Exec_Check_2
 33384                                  
 33385                                  Exec_Bad_Fun:
 33386 00005CC4 36C606[2303]01          	mov	byte [ss:EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Unk ; 1
 33387                                  					; Extended Error Locus	;smr;SS Override
 33388                                  	;mov	al,1
 33389 00005CCA B001                    	mov	al,error_invalid_function
 33390                                  
 33391                                  Exec_Ret_Err:
 33392                                  	;Leave
 33393 00005CCC 89EC                    	mov	sp,bp
 33394 00005CCE 5D                      	pop	bp

 33396 00005CCF E9A8A9                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 33397                                  
 33398                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 33399                                  ExecReadyJ:

 33402

 33405 00005CDA 74E8                    	je	short Exec_Bad_Fun
 33406

 33409 00005CDE 74E4                    	je	short Exec_Bad_Fun
 33410

 33419 00005CEA 8846FB                  	mov	Exec_Func,AL

 33422                                  
 33423                                  	;mov	[bp-26],dx
 33424 00005CF1 8956E6                  	mov	ExecNameL,DX		; set up length of exec name

 33426 00005CF4 8C5EE8                  	mov	ExecNameH,DS

 33430                                  	;mov	[bp-22],cx
 33431 00005CFC 894EEA                  	mov	ExecNameLen,CX		; save length
 33432                                  
 33433                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 33434 00005CFF 36A0[0203]              	mov	al,[ss:AllocMethod]	; M063: save alloc method in 
 33435 00005D03 36A2[8400]              	mov	[ss:ALLOCMSAVE],al	; M063: AllocMsave
 33436                                  
 33437 00005D07 30C0                    	xor	AL,AL			; open for reading
 33438 00005D09 55                      	push	BP
 33439                                  
 33440                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 33441                                  	;or	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],1
 33442 00005D0A 36800E[8600]01          	or	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],EXECOPEN ; this flag is set to indicate to 
 33443                                  					; the redir that this open call is
 33444                                  					; due to an exec.
 33445                                  
 33446                                  	;invoke	$OPEN			; is the file there?
 33447 00005D10 E80513                  	call	_$OPEN
 33448                                  
 33449                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 33450 00005D13 9C                      	pushf
 33451                                  	; 02/06/2019
 33452                                  	;and	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],0FEh
 33453 00005D14 368026[8600]FE          	and	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],~EXECOPEN ; reset flag
 33454 00005D1A 9D                      	popf
 33455                                  
 33456 00005D1B 5D                      	pop	BP
 33457                                  
 33458                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 33459 00005D1C 72AE                    	jc	short Exec_Ret_Err
 33460                                  
 33461                                  	;mov	[bp-8],ax
 33462 00005D1E 8946F8                  	mov	Exec_FH,AX

 33465                                  	;invoke	$Ioctl

 33467 00005D28 7207                    	jc	short Exec_BombJ
 33468                                  
 33469                                  	;test	dl,80h
 33470 00005D2A F6C280                  	test	DL,devid_ISDEV
 33471 00005D2D 740A                    	jz	short Exec_Check_Environ
 33472                                  
 33473                                  	;mov	al,2
 33474 00005D2F B002                    	mov	AL,error_file_not_found
 33475                                  Exec_BombJ:
 33476 00005D31 E9CA00                  	jmp	Exec_Bomb
 33477                                  
 33478                                  BadEnv:
 33479                                  	;mov	al,0Ah
 33480 00005D34 B00A                    	mov	AL,error_bad_environment
 33481 00005D36 E9C500                  	jmp	Exec_Bomb
 33482                                  
 33483                                  Exec_Check_Environ:
 33484                                  	;mov	word [bp-18],0
 33485 00005D39 C746EE0000              	mov	Exec_Load_Block,0

 33487 00005D3E C746F20000              	mov	Exec_Environ,0

 33497 00005D4E 09C0                    	or	AX,AX
 33498 00005D50 750C                    	jnz	short Exec_Scan_Env
 33499                                  
 33500 00005D52 368E1E[3003]            	mov	DS,[SS:CurrentPDB]	;smr;SS Override
 33501                                  	;mov	ax,[44]
 33502 00005D57 A12C00                  	mov	AX,[PDB.ENVIRON]
 33503                                  
 33504                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 33505                                  ;---------------------------------------------BUG 92 4/30/90-----------------
 33506                                  ;
 33507                                  ; Exec_environ is being correctly initialized after the environment has been
 33508                                  ; allocated and copied form the parent's env. It must not be initialized here.
 33509                                  ; Because if the call to $alloc below fails Exec_dealloc will deallocate the
 33510                                  ; parent's environment.
 33511                                  ;	mov	Exec_Environ,AX
 33512                                  ;
 33513                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33514                                  
 33515                                  	;mov	[bp-14],ax
 33516                                  	;mov	Exec_Environ,ax
 33517                                  
 33518 00005D5A 09C0                    	or	AX,AX
 33519 00005D5C 743D                    	jz	short Exec_Read_Header
 33520                                  
 33521                                  Exec_Scan_Env:
 33522 00005D5E 8EC0                    	mov	ES,AX
 33523 00005D60 31FF                    	xor	DI,DI
 33524                                  	;mov	cx,7FFFh ; MSDOS 3.3
 33525 00005D62 B90080                  	mov	CX,8000h ; MSDOS 6.0	; at most 32k of environment ;M040
 33526 00005D65 30C0                    	xor	AL,AL
 33527                                  
 33528                                  Exec_Get_Environ_Len:
 33529 00005D67 F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find that nul byte
 33530 00005D69 75C9                    	jnz	short BadEnv
 33531                                  
 33532 00005D6B 49                      	dec	CX			; Dec CX for the next nul byte test
 33533 00005D6C 78C6                    	js	short BadEnv		; gone beyond the end of the environment
 33534                                  
 33535 00005D6E AE                      	scasb				; is there another nul byte?
 33536 00005D6F 75F6                    	jnz	short Exec_Get_Environ_Len ; no, scan some more
 33537                                  
 33538 00005D71 57                      	push	DI
 33539                                  	;lea	bx,[DI+11h]
 33540 00005D72 8D5D11                  	lea	BX,[DI+0Fh+2]
 33541                                  	;add	bx,[bp-22]
 33542 00005D75 035EEA                  	add	BX,ExecNameLen		; BX <- length of environment
 33543                                  					; remember argv[0] length
 33544                                  					; round up and remember argc
 33545 00005D78 B104                    	mov	CL,4
 33546 00005D7A D3EB                    	shr	BX,CL			; number of paragraphs needed
 33547 00005D7C 06                      	push	ES
 33548                                  	;invoke	$Alloc			; can we get the space?
 33549 00005D7D E84406                  	call	_$ALLOC

 33551 00005D81 59                      	pop	CX
 33552                                  
 33553                                  	;jnc	short Exec_Save_Environ
 33554                                  	;jmp	SHORT Exec_No_Mem	; nope... cry and sob

 33557                                  	; 30/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 33558                                  	;jnc	short Exec_Save_Environ
 33559                                  	;jmp	SHORT Exec_No_Mem
 33560                                  
 33561                                  Exec_Save_Environ:
 33562 00005D84 8EC0                    	mov	ES,AX
 33563                                  	;mov	[bp-14],ax
 33564 00005D86 8946F2                  	mov	Exec_Environ,AX 	; save him for a rainy day
 33565 00005D89 31F6                    	xor	SI,SI
 33566 00005D8B 89F7                    	mov	DI,SI
 33567 00005D8D F3A4                    	rep	movsb			; copy the environment
 33568 00005D8F B80100                  	mov	AX,1
 33569 00005D92 AB                      	stosw
 33570                                  	;lds	si,[bp-26]
 33571 00005D93 C576E6                  	lds	SI,ExecName

 33575                                  
 33576                                  Exec_Read_Header:
 33577                                  	; We read in the program header into the above data area and
 33578                                  	; determine where in this memory the image will be located.
 33579                                  
 33580                                  	;Context DS
 33581 00005D9B 16                      	push	ss

 33599 00005DB5 F706[2710]FFFF          	test	word [exec_max_BSS],-1 	; indicate load high?

 33609 00005DC7 7408                    	jz	short Exec_Save_Start 	; assume com file if no signature
 33610

 33612 00005DC9 3D5A4D                  	cmp	AX,exe_valid_old_signature ; zibo arises!

 33614

 34320                                  ;issues the version check, it gets the lie version until the next overlay

 34843                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34844                                  ;SUBTTL Terminate and stay resident handler
 34845                                  ;
 34846                                  ; Input:    DX is  an  offset  from  CurrentPDB  at which to
 34847                                  ;	    truncate the current block.
 34848                                  ;
 34849                                  ; output:   The current block is truncated (expanded) to be [DX+15]/16
 34850                                  ;	    paragraphs long.  An exit is simulated via resetting CurrentPDB
 34851                                  ;	    and restoring the vectors.
 34852                                  ;
 34853                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34854                                  
 34855                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34856                                  	; DOSCODE:A19Bh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 34857                                  
 34858                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34859                                  	; DOSCODE:A13Bh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 34860                                  
 34861                                  _$KEEP_PROCESS:
 34862 000062D1 50                      	push	AX			; keep exit code around
 34863                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],3
 34864 000062D2 36C606[7C05]03          	mov	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_KEEP_PROCESS
 34865 000062D8 368E06[3003]            	mov	ES,[SS:CurrentPDB]
 34866 000062DD 83FA06                  	cmp	DX,6h			; keep enough space around for system
 34867 000062E0 7303                    	jae	short Keep_Shrink	; info
 34868                                  
 34869 000062E2 BA0600                  	mov	DX,6h
 34870                                  
 34871                                  Keep_Shrink:
 34872 000062E5 89D3                    	mov	BX,DX
 34873 000062E7 53                      	push	BX
 34874 000062E8 06                      	push	ES
 34875 000062E9 E82E02                  	call	_$SETBLOCK		; ignore return codes.
 34876 000062EC 1F                      	pop	DS
 34877 000062ED 5B                      	pop	BX
 34878 000062EE 7207                    	jc	short Keep_Done		; failed on modification
 34879                                  
 34880 000062F0 8CD8                    	mov	AX,DS
 34881 000062F2 01D8                    	add	AX,BX
 34882                                  	;mov	[2],ax
 34883 000062F4 A30200                  	mov	[PDB.BLOCK_LEN],AX	;PBUGBUG
 34884                                  
 34885                                  Keep_Done:
 34886 000062F7 58                      	pop	AX
 34887 000062F8 EB26                    	jmp	SHORT exit_inner	; and let abort take care of the rest
 34888

 34921                                  	; IBMDOSDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 6375h
 34922 00006309 30E4                    	xor	AH,AH

 34937 00006328 8F4414                  	pop	word [SI+user_env.user_CS] ;PBUGBUG
 34938 0000632B EB08                    	jmp	short abort_inner
 34939                                  
 34940                                  ;BREAK <$ABORT -- Terminate a process>
 34941                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34942                                  ; Inputs:
 34943                                  ;	user_CS:00 must point to valid program header block
 34944                                  ; Function:
 34945                                  ;	Restore terminate and Cntrl-C addresses, flush buffers and transfer
 34946                                  ;	to the terminate address
 34947                                  ; Returns:
 34948                                  ;	TO THE TERMINATE ADDRESS
 34949                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34950                                  
 34951                                  _$ABORT:
 34952 0000632D 30C0                    	xor	AL,AL
 34953                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],0
 34954                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],AL ; = 0
 34955 0000632F 36C606[7C05]00          	mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_ABORT
 34956                                  
 34957                                  	; abort_inner must have AL set as the exit code! The exit type
 34958                                  	; is retrieved from exit_type. Also, the PDB at user_CS needs
 34959                                  	; to be correct as the one that is terminating.
 34960                                  
 34961                                  abort_inner:
 34962 00006335 368A26[7C05]            	mov	AH,[SS:EXIT_TYPE]
 34963 0000633A 36A3[3403]              	mov	[SS:exit_code],AX
 34964 0000633E E836A1                  	call	Get_User_Stack
 34965                                  
 34966                                  	;mov	ds,[si+14h]
 34967 00006341 8E5C14                  	mov	DS,[SI+user_env.user_CS] ; set up old interrupts ;PBUGBUG
 34968 00006344 31C0                    	xor	AX,AX
 34969 00006346 8EC0                    	mov	ES,AX
 34970                                  	;mov	si,10
 34971 00006348 BE0A00                  	mov	SI,SAVEXIT
 34972                                  	;mov	di,88h
 34973 0000634B BF8800                  	mov	DI,addr_int_terminate
 34974 0000634E A5                      	movsw
 34975 0000634F A5                      	movsw
 34976 00006350 A5                      	movsw
 34977 00006351 A5                      	movsw
 34978 00006352 A5                      	movsw
 34979 00006353 A5                      	movsw
 34980 00006354 E916F2                  	jmp	reset_environment

 35060                                  ; xenix memory calls for MSDOS
 35061                                  ;
 35062                                  ; CAUTION: The following routines rely on the fact that arena_signature and
 35063                                  ; arena_owner_system are all equal to zero and are contained in DI.
 35064                                  ;
 35065                                  ;INCLUDE DOSSEG.ASM
 35066                                  
 35067                                  ;CODE	SEGMENT BYTE PUBLIC  'CODE'
 35068                                  ;       ASSUME  SS:DOSGROUP,CS:DOSGROUP
 35069                                  
 35070                                  ;.xlist
 35071                                  ;.xcref
 35072                                  ;INCLUDE DOSSYM.ASM

 35074                                  ;.cref

 35076                                  
 35077                                  ;TITLE ALLOC.ASM - memory arena manager
 35078                                  ;NAME Alloc
 35079                                  
 35080                                  ;SUBTTL memory allocation utility routines
 35081                                  ;PAGE
 35082                                  ;
 35083                                  ; arena data
 35084                                  ;
 35085                                  ;       i_need  arena_head,WORD         ; seg address of start of arena
 35086                                  ;       i_need  CurrentPDB,WORD         ; current process data block addr
 35087                                  ;       i_need  FirstArena,WORD         ; first free block found
 35088                                  ;       i_need  BestArena,WORD          ; best free block found
 35089                                  ;       i_need  LastArena,WORD          ; last free block found
 35090                                  ;       i_need  AllocMethod,BYTE        ; how to alloc first(best)last
 35091                                  
 35092                                  ;**	Arena_Free_Process
 35093                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35094                                  ;	Free all arena blocks allocated to a prOcess
 35095                                  ;
 35096                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = PID of process
 35097                                  ;	EXIT	none
 35098                                  ;	USES	????? BUGBUG
 35099                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35100                                  
 35101                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35102                                  	; DOSCODE:A1C2h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 35103

 35153                                  
 35154                                  ;**	Arena_Next - Find Next item in Arena
 35155                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35156                                  ;	ENTRY	DS - pointer to block head
 35157                                  ;		(di) = 0
 35158                                  ;	EXIT	AX,ES - pointers to next head
 35159                                  ;		'C' set iff arena damaged
 35160                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35161                                  
 35162                                  arena_next:
 35163 0000638B 8CD8                            MOV     AX,DS                   ; AX <- current block
 35164 0000638D 03060300                        ADD     AX,[ARENA.SIZE]		; AX <- AX + current block length
 35165 00006391 40                              INC     AX                      ; remember that header!
 35166                                  
 35167                                  ;       fall into check_signature and return
 35168                                  ;
 35169                                  ;       CALL    check_signature         ; ES <- AX, carry set if error
 35170                                  ;       RETN
 35171                                  
 35172                                  ;**	Check_Signature - Check Memory Block Signature
 35173                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35174                                  ;	ENTRY	(AX) = address of block header
 35175                                  ;		(di) = 0
 35176                                  ;	EXIT	 ES = AX
 35177                                  ;		'C' clear if signature good
 35178                                  ;		'C' set if signature bad
 35179                                  ;	USES	ES, Flags
 35180                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35181                                  
 35182                                  check_signature:        
 35183                                  
 35184 00006392 8EC0                    	MOV     ES,AX                   ; ES <- AX
 35185                                  	;cmp	byte [es:di],4Dh ; 'M'
 35186 00006394 26803D4D                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_normal
 35187                                                                          ; IF next signature = not_end THEN
 35188 00006398 7407                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 35189                                  	;cmp 	byte [es:di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 35190 0000639A 26803D5A                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_end
 35191                                                                          ; IF next signature = end then
 35192 0000639E 7401                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 35193 000063A0 F9                              STC                             ; set error
 35194                                  ret_label: ; MSDOS 6.0
 35195                                  AFP_RETN:
 35196                                   	; Retro DOS v2.0 - 05/03/2018
 35197                                  check_signature_ok:
 35198                                  COALESCE_RETN:
 35199 000063A1 C3                      	RETN
 35200                                  
 35201                                  ;**	Coalesce - Combine free blocks ahead with current block
 35202                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35203                                  ;	Coalesce adds the block following the argument to the argument block,
 35204                                  ;	iff it's free.  Coalesce is usually used to join free blocks, but
 35205                                  ;	some callers (such as $setblock) use it to join a free block to it's
 35206                                  ;	preceeding allocated block.
 35207                                  ;
 35208                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds) = pointer to the head of a free block
 35209                                  ;		(di) = 0
 35210                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 35211                                  ;		  (ds) unchanged, this block updated
 35212                                  ;		  (ax) = address of next block, IFF not at end
 35213                                  ;		'C' set if arena trashed
 35214                                  ;	USES	(cx)
 35215                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35216                                          
 35217                                  Coalesce:
 35218                                  	;cmp	byte [di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 35219 000063A2 803D5A                  	CMP     BYTE [DI],arena_signature_end
 35220                                                                          ; IF current signature = END THEN
 35221                                          ;retz				;   GOTO ok
 35222 000063A5 74FA                            jz	short COALESCE_RETN
 35223 000063A7 E8E1FF                  	CALL    arena_next              ; ES, AX <- next block, Carry set if error
 35224                                          ;retc				; IF no error THEN GOTO check
 35225 000063AA 72F5                    	jc	short COALESCE_RETN
 35226                                  
 35227                                  coalesce_check:
 35228                                  	;cmp	[es:1],di
 35229 000063AC 26393E0100                      CMP     [ES:ARENA.OWNER],DI
 35230                                          ;retnz				; IF next block isnt free THEN return
 35231 000063B1 75EE                            JNZ	SHORT COALESCE_RETN
 35232                                  	;mov	cx,[ES:3]
 35233 000063B3 268B0E0300              	MOV     CX,[ES:ARENA.SIZE]	; CX <- next block size
 35234 000063B8 41                              INC     CX                      ; CX <- CX + 1 (for header size)
 35235                                          ;ADD	[3],CX
 35236 000063B9 010E0300                	ADD     [ARENA.SIZE],CX		; current size <- current size + CX
 35237 000063BD 268A0D                          MOV     CL,[ES:DI]              ; move up signature
 35238 000063C0 880D                            MOV     [DI],CL
 35239 000063C2 EBDE                            JMP     SHORT Coalesce		; try again
 35240                                  
 35241                                  ; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35242                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 641Fh
 35243                                  
 35244                                  ;	BREAK  <$Alloc - allocate space in memory>
 35245                                  
 35246                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 35247                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35248                                  ;**	$Alloc - Allocate Memory Space
 35249                                  ;
 35250                                  ;	$Alloc services the INT21 that allocates memory space to a program.
 35251                                  ;	Alloc returns a pointer to a free block of memory that
 35252                                  ;	has the requested size in paragraphs.
 35253                                  ;
 35254                                  ;	If the allocation strategy is HIGH_FIRST or HIGH_ONLY memory is 
 35255                                  ;	scanned from umb_head if not from arena_head. If the strategy is
 35256                                  ; 	HIGH_FIRST the scan is continued from arena_head if a block of 
 35257                                  ;	appropriate size is not found in the UMBs. If the strategy is 
 35258                                  ;	HIGH_FIRST+HIGH_ONLY only the UMBs are scanned for memory.
 35259                                  ;
 35260                                  ;	In either case if bit 0 of UmbFlag is not initialized then the scan
 35261                                  ;	starts from arena_head.
 35262                                  ;
 35263                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 35264                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 35265                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 35266                                  ;           INT     21h
 35267                                  ;
 35268                                  ;	BUGBUG - a lot can be done to improve performance. We can set marks
 35269                                  ;	so that we start searching the arena at it's first non-trivial free
 35270                                  ;	block, we can peephole the code, etc. (We can move some subr calls
 35271                                  ;	inline, etc.) I assume that this is called rarely and that the arena
 35272                                  ;	doesn't have too many memory objects in it beyond the first free one.
 35273                                  ;	verify that this is true; if so, this can stay as is
 35274                                  ;
 35275                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = requested size, in bytes
 35276                                  ;		(DS) = (ES) = DOSGROUP
 35277                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if memory allocated
 35278                                  ;		  (ax:0) = address of requested memory
 35279                                  ;		'C' set if request failed
 35280                                  ;		  (AX) = error_not_enough_memory
 35281                                  ;		    (bx) = max size we could have allocated
 35282                                  ;		  (ax) = error_arena_trashed
 35283                                  ;	USES	All
 35284                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35285                                  
 35286                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 35287                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35288                                  ;SUBTTL $Alloc - allocate space in memory
 35289                                  ;
 35290                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 35291                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 35292                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 35293                                  ;           INT     21h
 35294                                  ;         AX:0 is pointer to allocated memory
 35295                                  ;         BX is max size if not enough memory
 35296                                  ;
 35297                                  ;   Description:
 35298                                  ;           Alloc returns  a  pointer  to  a  free  block of
 35299                                  ;       memory that has the requested  size  in  paragraphs.
 35300                                  ;
 35301                                  ;   Error return:
 35302                                  ;           AX = error_not_enough_memory
 35303                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed
 35304                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35305                                  
 35306                                  ; DOSCODE:A28Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 35307                                  
 35308                                  ; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35309                                  ; DOSCODE:A22Eh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)

 35567                                  ;%endif

 35622                                  ;	BREAK $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 35623                                  
 35624                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 35625                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35626                                  ;**	$SETBLOCK - Change size of an Allocated Block
 35627                                  ;
 35628                                  ;	Setblock changes the size of an allocated block. First, we coalesce
 35629                                  ;	any following free space onto this block; then we try to trim the
 35630                                  ;	block down to the size requested.
 35631                                  ;
 35632                                  ;	Note that if the guy wants to grow the block but that growth fails,
 35633                                  ;	we still go ahead and coalesce any trailing free blocks onto it.
 35634                                  ;	Thus the maximum-size-possible value that we return has already
 35635                                  ;	been allocated! This is a bug, dare we fix it? BUGBUG
 35636                                  ;
 35637                                  ;	NOTE - $SETBLOCK is in bed with $ALLOC and jumps into $ALLOC to
 35638                                  ;		finish it's work. For this reason we build the allocsf
 35639                                  ;		structure on the frame, to make us compatible with $ALLOCs
 35640                                  ;		code.
 35641                                  ;
 35642                                  ;	ENTRY	(es) = segment of old block
 35643                                  ;		(bx) = newsize
 35644                                  ;		(ah) = SETBLOCK
 35645                                  ;
 35646                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 35647                                  ;		'C' set if error
 35648                                  ;		  (ax) = error_invalid_block
 35649                                  ;		       = error_arena_trashed
 35650                                  ;		       = error_not_enough_memory
 35651                                  ;		       = error_invalid_function
 35652                                  ;		  (bx) = maximum size possible, iff (ax) = error_not_enough_memory
 35653                                  ;	USES	???? BUGBUG
 35654                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35655                                  
 35656                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 35657                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35658                                  ;SUBTTL $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 35659                                  ;
 35660                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 35661                                  ;           MOV     ES,block
 35662                                  ;           MOV     BX,newsize
 35663                                  ;           MOV     AH,setblock
 35664                                  ;           INT     21h
 35665                                  ;         if setblock fails for growing, BX will have the maximum
 35666                                  ;         size possible
 35667                                  ;   Error return:
 35668                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_block
 35669                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed
 35670                                  ;              = error_not_enough_memory
 35671                                  ;              = error_invalid_function
 35672                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35673                                  
 35674                                  _$SETBLOCK:        
 35675                                  	; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35676                                  	;EnterCrit   critMem
 35677 0000651A E8E1AE                  	call	ECritMEM ; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 35678                                  
 35679 0000651D BF0000                  	MOV     DI,ARENA.SIGNATURE
 35680 00006520 8CC0                            MOV     AX,ES
 35681 00006522 48                              DEC     AX
 35682 00006523 E86CFE                          CALL    check_signature
 35683 00006526 7303                            JNC     SHORT setblock_grab
 35684                                  
 35685                                  setblock_bad:
 35686 00006528 E905FF                          JMP     alloc_trashed
 35687                                  
 35688                                  setblock_grab:
 35689 0000652B 8ED8                            MOV     DS,AX
 35690 0000652D E872FE                          CALL    Coalesce
 35691 00006530 72F6                            JC      SHORT setblock_bad
 35692 00006532 8B0E0300                        MOV     CX,[ARENA.SIZE]
 35693 00006536 51                              PUSH    CX
 35694 00006537 39CB                            CMP     BX,CX
 35695 00006539 76A5                            JBE     SHORT alloc_get_size
 35696 0000653B E91EFF                          JMP     alloc_fail

 35703                                  ;

 35705                                  ;

 35707                                  ;		'C' set if error

 35710

 35768                                  ;	BREAK $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 35769                                  
 35770                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 35771                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35772                                  ;**	$AllocOper - Get/Set Allocation Mechanism
 35773                                  ;
 35774                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 35775                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 35776                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 35777                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 35778                                  ;           INT     21h
 35779                                  ;
 35780                                  ;	ENTRY	
 35781                                  ;		(al) = 0
 35782                                  ;		  Get allocation Strategy in (ax)
 35783                                  ;
 35784                                  ;		(al) = 1, (bx) = method = zw0000xy
 35785                                  ;		  Set allocation strategy.
 35786                                  ;		   w  = 1  => HIGH_ONLY
 35787                                  ;		   z  = 1  => HIGH_FIRST
 35788                                  ;		   xy = 00 => FIRST_FIT
 35789                                  ;		      = 01 => BEST_FIT
 35790                                  ;		      = 10 => LAST_FIT
 35791                                  ;
 35792                                  ;		(al) = 2
 35793                                  ;		  Get UMB link state in (al)
 35794                                  ;
 35795                                  ;		(al) = 3
 35796                                  ;		  Set UMB link state
 35797                                  ;		   (bx) = 0 => Unlink UMBs
 35798                                  ;		   (bx) = 1 => Link UMBs
 35799                                  ;
 35800                                  ;
 35801                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 35802                                  ;
 35803                                  ;		 if (al) = 0
 35804                                  ;		  (ax) = existing method
 35805                                  ;		 if (al) = 1
 35806                                  ;		  Sets allocation strategy
 35807                                  ;		 if (al) = 2
 35808                                  ;		  (al) = 0 => UMBs not linked
 35809                                  ;		  (al) = 1 => UMBs linked in
 35810                                  ;		 if (al) = 3
 35811                                  ;		  Links/Unlinks the UMBs into DOS chain
 35812                                  ;
 35813                                  ;		'C' set if error
 35814                                  ;		  AX = error_invalid_function
 35815                                  ;
 35816                                  ;	Rev. M000 - added support for HIGH_FIRST in (al) = 1. 7/9/90
 35817                                  ; 	Rev. M003 - added functions (al) = 2 and (al) = 3. 7/18/90
 35818                                  ;	Rev. M009 - (al) = 3 will return 'invalid function' in ax if
 35819                                  ;		    umbhead has'nt been initialized by sysinit and 'trashed
 35820                                  ;		    arena' if an arena sig is damaged.
 35821                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35822                                  
 35823                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 35824                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35825                                  ;SUBTTL $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 35826                                  ;
 35827                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 35828                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 35829                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 35830                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 35831                                  ;           INT     21h
 35832                                  ;
 35833                                  ;   Error return:
 35834                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_function
 35835                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35836                                  
 35837                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35838                                  _$ALLOCOPER:
 35839                                  	; 14/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35840                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 35842 00006575 741E                    	jz	short AllocGetStrat

 35845                                  	;jz	short AllocSetStrat

 36000                                  
 36001                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 36002                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36003                                  ; Procedure Name : GetLastArena		-  M003
 36004                                  ;
 36005                                  ; Inputs	 : cx = umb_head
 36006                                  ;
 36007                                  ;
 36008                                  ; Outputs	 : If UMBs are linked
 36009                                  ;			ES = umb_head
 36010                                  ;			DS = arena before umb_head
 36011                                  ;		   else
 36012                                  ;			DS = last arena
 36013                                  ;			ES = next arena. will be umb_head if NC.
 36014                                  ;
 36015                                  ;		   CY if error
 36016                                  ;
 36017                                  ; Uses		 : DS, ES, DI, BX
 36018                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36019                                  
 36020                                  ; 14/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36021                                  ; DOSCODE:A4D6h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36022                                  
 36023                                  ; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36024                                  ; DOSCODE:A476h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 36025                                  	
 36026                                  GetLastArena:
 36027 000065FE 50                      	push	ax			; save ax
 36028                                  
 36029 000065FF 36A1[2400]              	mov	ax,[ss:arena_head]
 36030 00006603 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; es = arena_head
 36031 00006605 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 36032                                  
 36033 00006607 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 36034                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 36035 0000660B 7419                    	je	short GLA_done		; Y: return last arena in ES		
 36036                                  					
 36037                                  GLA_next:
 36038 0000660D 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 36039 0000660F E879FD                  	call	arena_next		; ax, es -> next arena
 36040                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 36041                                  	;jc	short GLA_err
 36042                                  	; 17/12/2022
 36043 00006612 7228                    	jc	short GLA_err2
 36044                                  
 36045 00006614 36F606[8900]01          	test	byte [ss:UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; Q: are UMBs linked
 36046 0000661A 7506                    	jnz	short GLA_chkumb	; Y: terminating condition is 
 36047                                  					;    umb_head
 36048                                  					; N: terminating condition is 05Ah
 36049                                  
 36050 0000661C 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 36051                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 36052 00006620 EB02                    	jmp	short GLA_@f
 36053                                  GLA_chkumb:
 36054 00006622 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx			; Q: is this umb_head
 36055                                  GLA_@f:

 36144                                  ;hkn; TABLE	ENDS
 36145                                  
 36146                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36147                                  ;
 36148                                  ; Procedure Name : $ServerCall
 36149                                  ;
 36150                                  ; Inputs:
 36151                                  ;	DS:DX -> DPL  (except calls 7,8,9)
 36152                                  ; Function:
 36153                                  ;	AL=0	Server DOS call
 36154                                  ;	AL=1	Commit All files
 36155                                  ;	AL=2	Close file by name (SHARING LOADED ONLY) DS:DX in DPL -> name
 36156                                  ;	AL=3	Close all files for DPL_UID
 36157                                  ;	AL=4	Close all files for DPL_UID/PID_PID
 36158                                  ;	AL=5	Get open file list entry
 36159                                  ;		    IN: BX File Index
 36160                                  ;			CX User Index
 36161                                  ;		    OUT:ES:DI -> Name
 36162                                  ;			BX = UID
 36163                                  ;		    CX = # locked blocks held by this UID
 36164                                  ;	AL=6	Get DOS data area
 36165                                  ;		    OUT: DS:SI -> Start
 36166                                  ;			CX size in bytes of swap if indos
 36167                                  ;			DX size in bytes of swap always
 36168                                  ;	AL=7	Get truncate flag
 36169                                  ;	AL=8	Set truncate flag
 36170                                  ;	AL=9	Close all spool files
 36171                                  ;	AL=10	SetExtendedError
 36172                                  ;
 36173                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36174                                  
 36175                                  _$ServerCall:
 36176                                  	; 13/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36177                                  	; DOSCODE:A4D2h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)		
 36178                                  	; 10/06/2019
 36179                                  	; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 36181
