 36487                                  ;	BREAK	<pJFNFromHandle - return pointer to JFN table entry>
 36488                                  
 36489                                  ;**	pJFNFromHandle - Translate Handle to Pointer to JFN
 36490                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36491                                  ;	pJFNFromHandle takes a file handle and turns that into a pointer to
 36492                                  ;	the JFN entry (i.e., to a byte holding the internal file handle #)
 36493                                  ;
 36494                                  ;	NOTE:
 36495                                  ;	  This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 36496                                  ;	  at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 36497                                  ;
 36498                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 36499                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if ok
 36500                                  ;		  (es:di) = address of JFN value
 36501                                  ;		'C' set if error
 36502                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 36503                                  ;	USES	AX, DI, ES, Flags
 36504                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36505                                  
 36506                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36507                                  
 36508                                  pJFNFromHandle:
 36509                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36510                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 36511 00006791 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 36512                                  	
 36513                                  	;MOV	ES,[cs:CurrentPDB]	; get user process data block
 36514 00006796 268E06[3003]            	mov	es,[es:CurrentPDB]
 36515                                  
 36516                                  	;cmp	bx,[ES:32h]
 36517 0000679B 263B1E3200              	CMP	BX,[ES:PDB.JFN_Length]	; is handle greater than allocated
 36518 000067A0 7204                    	JB	short pjfn10		; no, get offset
 36519                                  ReturnCarry_inv_hndl: ; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 36520                                  	;mov	al,6
 36521 000067A2 B006                    	MOV     AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 36522                                  ReturnCarry:
 36523 000067A4 F9                      	STC                             ; signal error
 36524 000067A5 C3                      	retn				; go back
 36525                                  pjfn10: 
 36526                                  	;les	di,[es:34h]
 36527 000067A6 26C43E3400              	LES	DI,[ES:PDB.JFN_Pointer]	; get pointer to beginning of table
 36528 000067AB 01DF                    	ADD	DI,BX			; add in offset, clear 'C'
 36529                                  	;clc
 36530                                  pJFNFromHandle_error:
 36531 000067AD C3                      	retn
 36532                                  
 36533                                  ;BREAK <SFFromHandle - return pointer (or error) to SF entry from handle>
 36534                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36535                                  ;
 36536                                  ; Procedure Name : SFFromHandle
 36537                                  ;
 36538                                  ; SFFromHandle - Given a handle, get JFN and then index into SF table
 36539                                  ;
 36540                                  ;   Input:      BX has handle
 36541                                  ;   Output:     Carry Set
 36542                                  ;                   AX has error code
 36543                                  ;               Carry Reset
 36544                                  ;                   ES:DI has pointer to SF entry
 36545                                  ;   Registers modified: If error, AX,ES, else ES:DI
 36546                                  ; NOTE:
 36547                                  ;   This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 36548                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 36549                                  ;
 36550                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36551                                  
 36552                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36553                                  
 36554                                  SFFromHandle:
 36555 000067AE E8E0FF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get jfn pointer
 36556                                  	;retc				; return if error
 36557 000067B1 72FA                    	jc	short pJFNFromHandle_error
 36558 000067B3 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; unused handle
 36559                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 36560                                  	;;mov	al,6
 36561                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 36562                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 36563                                  	; 17/12/2022
 36564                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 36565 000067B7 74E9                    	jz	short ReturnCarry_inv_hndl ; Retro DOS v3.0 modification
 36566                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 36567                                  	;;mov	al,6
 36568                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 36569                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 36570                                  GetSF:
 36571 000067B9 53                      	push	bx			; save handle
 36572 000067BA 268A1D                  	MOV     BL,[ES:DI]		; get SFN
 36573 000067BD 30FF                    	XOR     BH,BH                   ; ignore upper half
 36574 000067BF E80200                  	CALL    SFFromSFN               ; get real sf spot
 36575 000067C2 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore
 36576 000067C3 C3                      	retn                        	; say goodbye
 36577                                  
 36578                                  ;BREAK <SFFromSFN - index into SF table for SFN>
 36579                                  
 36580                                  ;**	SFFromSFN - Get an SF Table entry from an SFN
 36581                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36582                                  ;	SFFromSfn uses an SFN to index an entry into the SF table. This
 36583                                  ;	is more than just a simple index instruction because the SF table
 36584                                  ;	can be made up of multiple pieces chained together. We follow the
 36585                                  ;	chain to the right piece and then do the index operation.
 36586                                  ;
 36587                                  ;   NOTE:
 36588                                  ;	This routine is called from SFFromHandle which is called
 36589                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 36590                                  ;
 36591                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has SF index
 36592                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 36593                                  ;		  ES:DI points to SF entry
 36594                                  ;		'C' set if index too large
 36595                                  ;	USES	BX, DI, ES
 36596                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36597                                  
 36598                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36599                                  
 36600                                  SFFromSFN:
 36601                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36602                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 36603 000067C4 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 36604                                  
 36605                                  	;LES	DI,[CS:SFT_ADDR]	; (es:di) = start of SFT table
 36606 000067C9 26C43E[2A00]            	les	di,[es:SFT_ADDR]
 36607                                  sfsfn5:	
 36608                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:di+4]
 36609 000067CE 263B5D04                	CMP	BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]	; is handle in this table?
 36610 000067D2 720E                    	JB	short sfsfn7		; yes, go grab it
 36611                                  	;sub	bx,[es:di+4]
 36612 000067D4 262B5D04                	SUB     BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]
 36613 000067D8 26C43D                  	les	di,[es:di] ; 14/08/2018
 36614                                  	;LES	DI,[ES:DI+SFT.SFLink]	; get next table segment
 36615 000067DB 83FFFF                  	CMP     DI,-1                   ; end of tables?
 36616 000067DE 75EE                    	JNZ	short sfsfn5		; no, try again
 36617 000067E0 F9                      	STC
 36618 000067E1 C3                      	retn				; return with error, not found
 36619                                  sfsfn7:
 36620 000067E2 50                      	push	ax
 36621                                  	;mov	ax,53 ; MSDOS 3.3
 36622                                  	;mov	ax,59 ; MSDOS 6.0
 36623                                  	;MOV	AX,SF_ENTRY.size	; put it in a nice place
 36624                                  	
 36625                                  	; 17/12/2022
 36626 000067E3 B03B                    	mov	al,SF_ENTRY.size ; 28/05/2019
 36627                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 36628                                  	;mov	ax,SF_ENTRY.size ; 59
 36629                                  	
 36630 000067E5 F6E3                    	MUL	BL			; (ax) = offset into this SF block
 36631 000067E7 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX			; add base of SF block
 36632 000067E9 58                      	pop	ax
 36633                                  	;add	di,6
 36634 000067EA 83C706                  	ADD	DI,SFT.SFTable		; offset into structure, 'C' cleared
 36635 000067ED C3                      	retn				; return with 'C' clear
 36636                                  
 36637                                  ;	BREAK <JFNFree - return a jfn pointer if one is free>
 36638                                  
 36639                                  ;**	JFNFree - Find a Free JFN Slot
 36640                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36641                                  ;	JFNFree scansthrough the JFN table and returnsa pointer to a free slot
 36642                                  ;
 36643                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 36644                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 36645                                  ;		  (bx) = new handle
 36646                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to JFN slot
 36647                                  ;		'C' set if error
 36648                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 36649                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, flags
 36650                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36651                                  
 36652                                  JFNFree:
 36653 000067EE 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX			; (bx) = initial JFN to try
 36654                                  jfnf1:	
 36655 000067F0 E89EFF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get the appropriate handle
 36656 000067F3 7209                    	JC	short jfnf5		; no more handles
 36657 000067F5 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; free?
 36658 000067F9 7405                    	je	short jfnfx		; yes, carry is clear
 36659 000067FB 43                      	INC     BX                      ; no, next handle
 36660 000067FC EBF2                    	JMP	short jfnf1		; and try again
 36661                                  
 36662                                  	; Error. 'C' set
 36663                                  jfnf5:	
 36664                                  	;mov	al,4
 36665 000067FE B004                    	MOV	AL,error_too_many_open_files
 36666                                  jfnfx:	
 36667 00006800 C3                      	retn				; bye
 36668                                  
 36669                                  ;	BREAK <SFNFree - Allocate a free SFN>
 36670                                  
 36671                                  ;**	SFNFree - Allocate a Free SFN/SFT
 36672                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36673                                  ;	SFNFree scans through the sf table looking for a free entry
 36674                                  ;	If it finds one it partially allocates it by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 36675                                  ;
 36676                                  ;	The problem is that we want to mark the SFT busy so that other threads
 36677                                  ;	can't allocate the SFT before we're finished marking it up.  However,
 36678                                  ;	we can't just mark it busy because we may get blown out of our open
 36679                                  ;	by INT24 and leave the thing orphaned.	To solve this we mark it
 36680                                  ;	"allocation in progress" by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1.  If we see
 36681                                  ;	an SFT with this value we look to see if it belongs to this user
 36682                                  ;	and process.  If it does belong to us then it must be an orphan
 36683                                  ;	and we reclaim it.
 36684                                  ;
 36685                                  ;	BUGBUG - improve the performance. I guess it's smaller to call SFFromSFN
 36686                                  ;		over and over, but we could at least set a high water mark...
 36687                                  ;		cause an N^2 loop calling slow SFFromSFN is real slow, too slow
 36688                                  ;		even though this is not a frequently called routine - jgl
 36689                                  ;
 36690                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 36691                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if no error
 36692                                  ;		  (bx) = SFN
 36693                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to SFT
 36694                                  ;		  es:[di].SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 36695                                  ;		'C' set if error
 36696                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 36697                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, Flags
 36698                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36699                                  
 36700                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36701                                  	; DOSCODE:A682h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36702                                  
 36703                                  SFNFree:
 36704                                  	; 12/08/2018
 36705                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 36706                                  	;
 36707                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36708 00006801 50                      	push	ax
 36709 00006802 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; (bx) = SFN to consider
 36710                                  sfnf5:	
 36711 00006804 53                      	push	bx
 36712 00006805 E8BCFF                  	call	SFFromSFN		; get the potential handle
 36713 00006808 5B                      	pop	bx
 36714 00006809 723A                    	jc	short sfnf95		; no more free SFNs
 36715 0000680B 26833D00                	cmp	word [ES:DI],0
 36716                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_Ref_Count],0 ; free?
 36717 0000680F 741D                    	je	short sfnf20			; yep, got one
 36718                                  	
 36719                                  	;cmp	word [es:di],0FFFFh ; -1
 36720 00006811 26833DFF                	cmp	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 36721                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 36722 00006815 7403                    	je	short sfnf10		; special busy mark
 36723                                  sfnf7:	
 36724 00006817 43                      	inc	bx			; try the next one
 36725 00006818 EBEA                    	jmp	short sfnf5
 36726                                  
 36727                                  ;	The SFT has the special "busy" mark; if it belongs to us then
 36728                                  ;	it was abandoned during a earlier call and we can use it.
 36729                                  ;
 36730                                  ;	(bx)	= SFN
 36731                                  ;	(es:di) = pointer to SFT
 36732                                  ;	(TOS)	= caller's (ax)
 36733                                  
 36734                                  sfnf10:	
 36735 0000681A 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]
 36736                                  	;cmp	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 36737 0000681E 2639452F                	cmp	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 36738 00006822 75F3                    	jnz	short sfnf7		; not ours
 36739 00006824 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID]
 36740                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 36741 00006828 26394531                	cmp	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 36742 0000682C 75E9                    	jnz	short sfnf7		; can't use this one, try the next
 36743                                  
 36744                                  ;	We have an SFT to allocate
 36745                                  ;
 36746                                  ;	(bx)	= SFN
 36747                                  ;	(es:di) = pointer to SFT
 36748                                  ;	(TOS)	= caller's (ax)
 36749                                  
 36750                                  sfnf20:
 36751                                  	; cf = 0 ;; Retro DOS v3.0
 36752                                  
 36753                                  	;mov	word [es:di],0FFFFh
 36754 0000682E 26C705FFFF              	mov	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 36755                                  					; make sure that this is allocated
 36756                                  	;mov	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 36757                                  
 36758 00006833 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]
 36759                                  	;mov	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 36760 00006837 2689452F                	mov	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 36761 0000683B 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID]
 36762                                  	;mov	[es:di+31h],ax
 36763 0000683F 26894531                	mov	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 36764                                  sfnf21: ;; Retro DOS v3.0
 36765                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 36766                                  	;pop	ax
 36767                                  	;;clc
 36768                                  	;retn				; return with no error
 36769                                  	; 17/12/2022
 36770 00006843 58                      	pop	ax
 36771                                  	;clc
 36772 00006844 C3                      	retn
 36773                                  
 36774                                  ;**	Error - no more free SFNs
 36775                                  ;
 36776                                  ;	'C' set
 36777                                  ;	(TOS) = saved ax
 36778                                  
 36779                                  sfnf95: 
 36780 00006845 58                      	pop	ax
 36781                                  	;mov	al,4
 36782 00006846 B004                    	mov	al,error_too_many_open_files
 36783 00006848 C3                      	retn				; return with 'C' and error
 36784                                  
 36785                                  ;============================================================================
 36786                                  ; HANDLE.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 36787                                  ;============================================================================
 36788                                  ; 13/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 36789                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36790                                  
 36791                                  ; DOSCODE:A72Bh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36792                                  
 36793                                  ;	BREAK <$Close - return a handle to the system>
 36794                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36795                                  ;
 36796                                  ;**	$Close - Close a file Handle
 36797                                  ;
 36798                                  ;	BUGBUG - close gets called a LOT with invalid handles - sizzle that
 36799                                  ;		path
 36800                                  ;
 36801                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 36802                                  ;	    MOV     BX, handle
 36803                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Close
 36804                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 36805                                  ;
 36806                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 36807                                  ;	EXIT	<normal INT21 return convention>
 36808                                  ;	USES	all
 36809                                  ;
 36810                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36811                                  
 36812                                  ; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36813                                  ; DOSCODE:A6CBh (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36814                                  
 36815                                  _$CLOSE:
 36816                                  ;	Grab the SFT pointer from the JFN.
 36817                                  
 36818 00006849 E85A02                  	call	CheckOwner		; get system file entry
 36819 0000684C 722B                    	jc	short CloseError	; error return
 36820 0000684E 16                      	push	ss
 36821 0000684F 1F                      	pop	ds			; For DOS_CLOSE
 36822 00006850 893E[9E05]              	MOV	[THISSFT],DI		; save offset of pointer
 36823 00006854 8C06[A005]              	MOV	[THISSFT+2],ES		; save segment value
 36824                                  
 36825                                  ; DS:SI point to JFN table entry.
 36826                                  ; ES:DI point to SFT
 36827                                  ;
 36828                                  ; We now examine the user's JFN entry; If the file was a 70-mode file (network
 36829                                  ; FCB, we examine the ref count on the SFT;  if it was 1, we free the JFN.
 36830                                  ; If the file was not a net FCB, we free the JFN too.
 36831                                  
 36832                                  	;CMP	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],1
 36833 00006858 26833D01                	cmp	word [ES:DI],1		; will the SFT become free?
 36834 0000685C 740A                    	jz	short FreeJFN 		; yes, free JFN anyway.
 36835                                  	;mov	al,[ES:DI+2]
 36836 0000685E 268A4502                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode]
 36837                                  	;and	al,0F0h
 36838 00006862 24F0                    	AND	AL,SHARING_MASK
 36839                                  	;cmp	al,70h
 36840 00006864 3C70                    	CMP	AL,SHARING_NET_FCB
 36841 00006866 7407                    	JZ	short PostFree		; 70-mode and big ref count => free it
 36842                                  
 36843                                  ; The JFN must be freed.  Get the pointer to it and replace the contents with
 36844                                  ; -1.
 36845                                  
 36846                                  FreeJFN:
 36847 00006868 E826FF                  	call	pJFNFromHandle		;   d = pJFN (handle);
 36848 0000686B 26C605FF                	MOV	BYTE [ES:DI],0FFh	; release the JFN
 36849                                  PostFree:
 36850                                  
 36851                                  ; ThisSFT is correctly set, we have DS = DOSDATA. Looks OK for a DOS_CLOSE!
 36852                                  
 36853 0000686F E8CFC7                  	call	DOS_CLOSE
 36854                                  
 36855                                  ; DOS_Close may return an error. If we see such an error, we report it but
 36856                                  ; the JFN stays closed because DOS_Close always frees the SFT!
 36857                                  
 36858 00006872 7205                    	JC	short CloseError
 36859                                  	;mov	ah,3Eh
 36860 00006874 B43E                    	MOV	AH,CLOSE		; MZ Bogus multiplan fix
 36861                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 36862                                  CloseOk:
 36863 00006876 E9F79D                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK
 36864                                  CloseError:
 36865 00006879 E9FE9D                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 36866                                  
 36867                                  ;	BREAK <$Commit - commit the file>
 36868                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36869                                  ;
 36870                                  ;**	$Commit - Commit a File
 36871                                  ;
 36872                                  ;	$Commit "commits" a file to disk - all of it's buffers are
 36873                                  ;	flushed out.  BUGBUG - I'm pretty sure that $Commit doesn't update
 36874                                  ;	the directory entry, etc., so this commit is pretty useless. check
 36875                                  ;	and fix this!! jgl
 36876                                  ;
 36877                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 36878                                  ;	    MOV     BX, handle
 36879                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Commit
 36880                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 36881                                  ;
 36882                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 36883                                  ;	EXIT	none
 36884                                  ;	USES	all
 36885                                  ;;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36886                                  
 36887                                  _$COMMIT:
 36888                                  ;	Grab the SFT pointer from the JFN.
 36889                                  
 36890 0000687C E82702                  	call	CheckOwner		; get system file entry
 36891 0000687F 7213                    	JC	short CommitError	; error return
 36892 00006881 16                      	push	ss
 36893 00006882 1F                      	pop	ds			; For DOS_COMMIT
 36894 00006883 893E[9E05]              	MOV	[THISSFT],DI		; save offset of pointer
 36895 00006887 8C06[A005]              	MOV	[THISSFT+2],ES		; save segment value
 36896                                  
 36897                                  ;	ThisSFT is correctly set, we have DS = DOSDATA. Looks OK for a DOS_COMMIT
 36898                                  ;
 36899                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 36900                                  
 36901 0000688B E801C9                  	call	DOS_COMMIT
 36902 0000688E 7204                    	JC	short CommitError
 36903                                  	; 07/12/2022
 36904                                  	;jc	short CloseError
 36905                                  	;mov	ah,68h
 36906 00006890 B468                    	MOV	AH,COMMIT
 36907                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 36908                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_OK
 36909                                  CommitOk:
 36910 00006892 EBE2                    	jmp	short CloseOk	
 36911                                  
 36912                                  CommitError:
 36913                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 36914                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 36915 00006894 EBE3                    	jmp	short CloseError
 36916                                  
 36917                                  ;	BREAK <$ExtHandle - extend handle count>
 36918                                  
 36919                                  ;**	$ExtHandle - Extend Handle Count
 36920                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36921                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 36922                                  ;	    MOV     BX, Number of Opens Allowed (MAX=65534;66535 is
 36923                                  ;	    MOV     AX, 6700H			 reserved to mark SFT
 36924                                  ;	    INT     int_command 		 busy )
 36925                                  ;
 36926                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = new number of handles
 36927                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 36928                                  ;		'C' set iff err
 36929                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 36930                                  ;			 AX = error_not_enough_memory
 36931                                  ;			      error_too_many_open_files
 36932                                  ;	USES	all
 36933                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36934                                  
 36935                                  _$ExtHandle:
 36936 00006896 31ED                    	XOR	BP,BP			; 0: enlarge   1: shrink  2:psp
 36937                                  	;cmp	bx,20
 36938 00006898 83FB14                  	CMP	BX,FILPERPROC
 36939 0000689B 7303                    	JAE	short exth2		; Don't set less than FilPerProc no
 36940 0000689D BB1400                  	MOV	BX,FILPERPROC
 36941                                  exth2:	
 36942 000068A0 368E06[3003]            	MOV	ES,[ss:CurrentPDB]	; get user process data block;smr;SS Override
 36943                                  	;mov	cx,[ES:32h]
 36944 000068A5 268B0E3200              	MOV	CX,[ES:PDB.JFN_Length]	; get number of handle allowed
 36945 000068AA 39CB                    	CMP	BX,CX			; the requested == current
 36946 000068AC 7455                    	JE	short ok_done 		; yes and exit
 36947 000068AE 7722                    	JA	short larger		; go allocate new table
 36948                                  
 36949                                  ;	We're going to shrink the # of handles available
 36950                                  
 36951 000068B0 BD0100                  	MOV	BP,1			; shrink
 36952                                  	;mov	ds,[ES:36h]
 36953 000068B3 268E1E3600              	MOV	DS,[ES:PDB.JFN_Pointer+2] ;
 36954 000068B8 89DE                    	MOV	SI,BX			;
 36955 000068BA 29D9                    	SUB	CX,BX			; get difference
 36956                                  
 36957                                  ;	BUGBUG - code a SCASB here, should be a bit smaller
 36958                                  chck_handles:
 36959 000068BC 803CFF                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],-1		; scan through handles to ensure close
 36960 000068BF 753D                    	JNZ	short too_many_files	; status
 36961 000068C1 46                      	INC	SI
 36962 000068C2 E2F8                    	LOOP	chck_handles
 36963 000068C4 83FB14                  	CMP	BX,FILPERPROC		; = 20
 36964 000068C7 7709                    	JA	short larger		; no
 36965                                  
 36966 000068C9 BD0200                  	MOV	BP,2			; psp
 36967                                  	;mov	di,24
 36968 000068CC BF1800                  	MOV	DI,PDB.JFN_TABLE	; es:di -> jfn table in psp
 36969 000068CF 53                      	PUSH	BX
 36970 000068D0 EB1D                    	JMP	short movhandl
 36971                                  
 36972                                  larger:
 36973 000068D2 83FBFF                  	CMP	BX,-1			; 65535 is not allowed
 36974 000068D5 747F                    	JZ	short invalid_func	; 10/08/2018
 36975 000068D7 F8                      	CLC
 36976 000068D8 53                      	PUSH	BX			; save requested number
 36977 000068D9 83C30F                  	ADD	BX,0FH			; adjust to paragraph boundary
 36978 000068DC B104                    	MOV	CL,4
 36979                                  	;ror	bx,cl			; MSDOS 3.3
 36980 000068DE D3DB                    	RCR	BX,CL			; DOS 4.00 fix		;AC000;
 36981 000068E0 81E3FF1F                	AND	BX,1FFFH		; clear most 3 bits
 36982                                  
 36983 000068E4 55                      	PUSH	BP
 36984 000068E5 E8DCFA                  	call	_$ALLOC			; allocate memory
 36985 000068E8 5D                      	POP	BP
 36986 000068E9 7266                    	JC	short no_memory		; not enough meory
 36987                                  
 36988 000068EB 8EC0                    	MOV	ES,AX			; es:di points to new table memory
 36989 000068ED 31FF                    	XOR	DI,DI
 36990                                  movhandl:
 36991 000068EF 368E1E[3003]            	MOV	DS,[ss:CurrentPDB] 	; get user PDB address	;smr;SS Override
 36992                                  
 36993 000068F4 F7C50300                	test	BP,3			; enlarge ?
 36994 000068F8 740C                    	JZ	short enlarge 		; yes
 36995 000068FA 59                      	POP	CX			; cx = the amount you shrink
 36996 000068FB 51                      	PUSH	CX
 36997 000068FC EB0C                    	JMP	short copy_hand
 36998                                  
 36999                                  ;	Done.  'C' clear
 37000                                  
 37001                                  ; 17/12/2022
 37002                                  ;ok_done:
 37003                                  ;	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 37004                                  ;	;jmp	short CommitOk
 37005                                  ;	; 17/12/2022
 37006                                  ;	jmp	SYS_RET_OK

 37410                                  ;BREAK <FileTimes - modify write times on a handle>
 37411                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37412                                  ;
 37413                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 37414                                  ;	    MOV AH, FileTimes (57H)
 37415                                  ;	    MOV AL, func
 37416                                  ;	    MOV BX, handle
 37417                                  ;	; if AL = 1 then then next two are mandatory
 37418                                  ;	    MOV CX, time
 37419                                  ;	    MOV DX, date
 37420                                  ;	    INT 21h
 37421                                  ;	; if AL = 0 then CX/DX has the last write time/date
 37422                                  ;	; for the handle.
 37423                                  ;
 37424                                  ;	AL=02		 get extended attributes
 37425                                  ;	   BX=handle
 37426                                  ;	   CX=size of buffer (0, return max size )
 37427                                  ;	   DS:SI query list (si=-1, selects all EA)
 37428                                  ;	   ES:DI buffer to hold EA list
 37429                                  ;
 37430                                  ;	AL=03		 get EA name list
 37431                                  ;	   BX=handle
 37432                                  ;	   CX=size of buffer (0, return max size )
 37433                                  ;	   ES:DI buffer to hold name list
 37434                                  ;
 37435                                  ;	AL=04		 set extended attributes
 37436                                  ;	   BX=handle
 37437                                  ;	   ES:DI buffer of EA list
 37438                                  ;
 37439                                  ;
 37440                                  ;   Error returns:
 37441                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_function
 37442                                  ;	       = error_invalid_handle
 37443                                  ;
 37444                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37445

 37545                                  ;BREAK <$DUP - duplicate a jfn>
 37546                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37547                                  ;
 37548                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 37549                                  ;	    MOV     BX, fh
 37550                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Dup
 37551                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 37552                                  ;	  AX has the returned handle
 37553                                  ;   Errors:
 37554                                  ;	    AX = dup_invalid_handle
 37555                                  ;	       = dup_too_many_open_files
 37556                                  ;
 37557                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37558                                  
 37559                                  _$DUP:
 37560 00006A7A 89D8                    	MOV	AX,BX			; save away old handle in AX
 37561 00006A7C E86FFD                  	call	JFNFree 		; free handle? into ES:DI, new in BX
 37562                                  DupErrorCheck:
 37563 00006A7F 72A8                    	JC	short DupErr		; nope, bye
 37564 00006A81 06                      	push	es
 37565 00006A82 57                      	push	di			; save away SFT
 37566 00006A83 5E                      	pop	si			; into convenient place DS:SI
 37567 00006A84 1F                      	pop	ds
 37568 00006A85 93                      	XCHG	AX,BX			; get back old handle
 37569 00006A86 E81D00                  	call	CheckOwner		; get sft in ES:DI
 37570 00006A89 729E                    	JC	short DupErr		; errors go home
 37571 00006A8B E8C4C0                  	call	DOS_Dup_Direct
 37572 00006A8E E800FD                  	call	pJFNFromHandle		; get pointer
 37573 00006A91 268A1D                  	MOV	BL,[ES:DI]		; get SFT number
 37574 00006A94 881C                    	MOV	[SI],BL			; stuff in new SFT
 37575                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 37576                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_OK		; and go home
 37577 00006A96 EBD5                    	jmp	short ok_ret
 37578                                  
 37579                                  	; 17/12/2022
 37580                                  ;DupErr:
 37581                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 37582                                  	;;jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 37583                                  	;jmp	short ft_error
 37584                                  
 37585                                  ;BREAK <$DUP2 - force a dup on a particular jfn>
 37586                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37587                                  ;
 37588                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 37589                                  ;	    MOV     BX, fh
 37590                                  ;	    MOV     CX, newfh
 37591                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Dup2
 37592                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 37593                                  ;   Error returns:
 37594                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 37595                                  ;
 37596                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37597                                  
 37598                                  _$DUP2:
 37599 00006A98 53                      	push	bx
 37600 00006A99 51                      	push	cx			; save source
 37601 00006A9A 89CB                    	MOV	BX,CX			; get one to close
 37602 00006A9C E8AAFD                  	call	_$CLOSE			; close destination handle
 37603 00006A9F 5B                      	pop	bx
 37604 00006AA0 58                      	pop	ax			; old in AX, new in BX
 37605 00006AA1 E8EDFC                  	call	pJFNFromHandle		; get pointer
 37606 00006AA4 EBD9                    	JMP	short DupErrorCheck	; check error and do dup
 37607                                  
 37608                                  ;Break	<CheckOwner - verify ownership of handles from server>
 37609                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37610                                  ;   CheckOwner - Due to the ability of the server to close file handles for a
 37611                                  ;   process without the process knowing it (delete/rename of open files, for
 37612                                  ;   example), it is possible for the redirector to issue a call to a handle
 37613                                  ;   that it soes not rightfully own. We check here to make sure that the
 37614                                  ;   issuing process is the owner of the SFT. At the same time, we do a
 37615                                  ;   SFFromHandle to really make sure that the SFT is good.
 37616                                  ;
 37617                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has the handle
 37618                                  ;		User_ID is the current user
 37619                                  ;	EXIT	Carry Clear => ES:DI points to SFT
 37620                                  ;		Carry Set => AX has error code
 37621                                  ;	USES	none
 37622                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37623                                  
 37624                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37625                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37626                                  CheckOwner:
 37627                                  	; 13/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37628                                  
 37629 00006AA6 E805FD                  	call	SFFromHandle
 37630 00006AA9 721B                    	jc	short co_ret_label	; retc
 37631                                  
 37632 00006AAB 50                      	push	ax
 37633                                  
 37634                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37635                                  
 37636                                  ;SR; WIN386 patch - Do not check for USER_ID for using handles since these 
 37637                                  ;SR; are shared across multiple VMs in win386.
 37638                                  
 37639 00006AAC 36F606[8310]01          	test	byte [ss:IsWin386],1 ; 02/06/2019
 37640 00006AB2 7404                    	jz	short no_win386		;win386 is not present
 37641 00006AB4 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			;set the zero flag
 37642 00006AB6 EB08                    	jmp	short _skip_win386	
 37643                                  
 37644                                  no_win386:
 37645 00006AB8 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]		;smr;SS Override
 37646                                  	;cmp	ax,[es:di+47]
 37647 00006ABC 263B452F                	cmp	ax,[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID]
 37648                                  
 37649                                  _skip_win386:
 37650 00006AC0 58                      	pop	ax
 37651                                  	
 37652                                  	; 17/12/2022
 37653 00006AC1 7403                    	jz	short co_ret_label
 37654                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 37655                                  	;jnz	short CheckOwner_err
 37656                                  	;retn
 37657                                  	
 37658                                  CheckOwner_err:
 37659                                  	;mov	al,6
 37660 00006AC3 B006                    	mov	al,error_invalid_handle
 37661 00006AC5 F9                      	stc
 37662                                  
 37663                                  co_ret_label:
 37664 00006AC6 C3                      	retn

 37669                                  ; Retro	DOS v3.0 - 11/07/2018
 37670                                  ; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37671                                  
 37672                                  ;	TITLE	MACRO - Pathname and macro related internal routines
 37673                                  ;	NAME	MACRO
 37674                                  
 37675                                  ;	Microsoft Confidential
 37676                                  ;	Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation 1991
 37677                                  ;	All Rights Reserved.
 37678                                  
 37679                                  ;**	MACRO.ASM
 37680                                  ;
 37681                                  ;	$AssignOper
 37682                                  ;	FIND_DPB
 37683                                  ;	InitCDS
 37684                                  ;	$UserOper
 37685                                  ;	GetVisDrv
 37686                                  ;	GetThisDrv
 37687                                  ;	GetCDSFromDrv
 37688                                  ;
 37689                                  ;   Revision history:
 37690                                  ;
 37691                                  ;	Created: MZ 4 April 1983
 37692                                  ;		 MZ 18 April 1983   Make TransFCB handle extended FCBs
 37693                                  ;		 AR 2 June 1983     Define/Delete macro for NET redir.
 37694                                  ;		 MZ 3 Nov 83	    Fix InitCDS to reset length to 2
 37695                                  ;		 MZ 4 Nov 83	    Fix NetAssign to use STRLEN only
 37696                                  ;		 MZ 18 Nov 83	    Rewrite string processing for subtree
 37697                                  ;				    aliasing.
 37698                                  ;
 37699                                  ;   MSDOS performs several types of name translation. First, we maintain for
 37700                                  ;   each valid drive letter the text of the current directory on that drive.
 37701                                  ;   For invalid drive letters, there is no current directory so we pretend to
 37702                                  ;   be at the root. A current directory is either the raw local directory
 37703                                  ;   (consisting of drive:\path) or a local network directory (consisting of
 37704                                  ;   \\machine\path. There is a limit on the point to which a .. is allowed.
 37705                                  ;
 37706                                  ;   Given a path, MSDOS will transform this into a real from-the-root path
 37707                                  ;   without . or .. entries. Any component that is > 8.3 is truncated to
 37708                                  ;   this and all * are expanded into ?'s.
 37709                                  ;
 37710                                  ;   The second part of name translation involves subtree aliasing. A list of
 37711                                  ;   subtree pairs is maintained by the external utility SUBST. The results of
 37712                                  ;   the previous 'canonicalization' are then examined to see if any of the
 37713                                  ;   subtree pairs is a prefix of the user path. If so, then this prefix is
 37714                                  ;   replaced with the other subtree in the pair.
 37715                                  ;
 37716                                  ;   A third part involves mapping this "real" path into a "physical" path.  A
 37717                                  ;   list of drive/subtree pairs are maintained by the external utility JOIN.
 37718                                  ;   The output of the previous translation is examined to see if any of the
 37719                                  ;   subtrees in this list are a prefix of the string. If so, then the prefix
 37720                                  ;   is replaced by the appropriate drive letter. In this manner, we can
 37721                                  ;   'mount' one device under another.
 37722                                  ;
 37723                                  ;   The final form of name translation involves the mapping of a user's
 37724                                  ;   logical drive number into the internal physical drive. This is
 37725                                  ;   accomplished by converting the drive number into letter:CON, performing
 37726                                  ;   the above translation and then converting the character back into a drive
 37727                                  ;   number.
 37728                                  ;
 37729                                  ;   There are two main entry points: TransPath and TransFCB. TransPath will
 37730                                  ;   take a path and form the real text of the pathname with all . and ..
 37731                                  ;   removed. TransFCB will translate an FCB into a path and then invoke
 37732                                  ;   TransPath.
 37733                                  ;
 37734                                  ;	A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 37735                                  
 37736                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 37737                                  
 37738                                  ;	I_need	ThisCDS,DWORD		; pointer to CDS used
 37739                                  ;	I_need	CDSAddr,DWORD		; pointer to CDS table
 37740                                  ;	I_need	CDSCount,BYTE		; number of CDS entries
 37741                                  ;	I_need	CurDrv,BYTE		; current macro assignment (old
 37742                                  ;					; current drive)
 37743                                  ;	I_need	NUMIO,BYTE		; Number of physical drives
 37744                                  ;	I_need	fSharing,BYTE		; TRUE => no redirection allowed
 37745                                  ;	I_need	DummyCDS,80h		; buffer for dummy cds
 37746                                  ;	I_need	DIFFNAM,BYTE		; flag for MyName being set
 37747                                  ;	I_need	MYNAME,16		; machine name
 37748                                  ;	I_need	MYNUM,WORD		; machine number
 37749                                  ;	I_need	DPBHEAD,DWORD		; beginning of DPB chain
 37750                                  ;	I_need	EXTERR_LOCUS,BYTE	; Extended Error Locus
 37751                                  ;	I_need	DrvErr,BYTE		; drive error
 37752                                  
 37753                                  ;BREAK <$AssignOper -- Set up a Macro>
 37754                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37755                                  ; Inputs:
 37756                                  ;	AL = 00 get assign mode 		    (ReturnMode)
 37757                                  ;	AL = 01 set assign mode 		    (SetMode)
 37758                                  ;	AL = 02 get attach list entry		    (GetAsgList)
 37759                                  ;	AL = 03 Define Macro (attch start)
 37760                                  ;	    BL = Macro type
 37761                                  ;	       = 0 alias
 37762                                  ;	       = 1 file/device
 37763                                  ;	       = 2 drive
 37764                                  ;	       = 3 Char device -> network
 37765                                  ;	       = 4 File device -> network
 37766                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 37767                                  ;	    ES:DI -> ASCIZ destination name
 37768                                  ;	AL = 04 Cancel Macro
 37769                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 37770                                  ;	AL = 05 Modified get attach list entry
 37771                                  ;	AL = 06 Get ifsfunc item
 37772                                  ;	AL = 07 set in_use of a drive's CDS
 37773                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=default  0=A,,
 37774                                  ;	AL = 08 reset in_use of a drive's CDS
 37775                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=A, 1=B,,,
 37776                                  ; Function:
 37777                                  ;	Do macro stuff
 37778                                  ; Returns:
 37779                                  ;	Std Xenix style error return
 37780                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37781                                  
 37782                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37783                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37784                                  _$AssignOper:
 37785                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37786 00006AC7 3C07                    	CMP	AL,7			      ; set in_use ?		;AN000;
 37787 00006AC9 7525                    	JNZ	short chk08		      ; no			;AN000;
 37788                                  srinuse:								;AN000;
 37789 00006ACB 50                      	PUSH	AX			      ; save al 		;AN000;
 37790 00006ACC 88D0                    	MOV	AL,DL			      ; AL= drive id		;AN000;
 37791 00006ACE E85601                  	CALL	GetCDSFromDrv		      ; ds:si -> cds		;AN000;
 37792 00006AD1 58                      	POP	AX			      ; 			;AN000;
 37793 00006AD2 7216                    	JC	short baddrv		      ; bad drive		;AN000;
 37794                                  	;cmp	word [si+45h],0
 37795 00006AD4 837C4500                	CMP	WORD [SI+curdir.devptr],0     ; dpb ptr =0 ?		;AN000;
 37796 00006AD8 7410                    	JZ	short baddrv		      ;     no			;AN000;
 37797 00006ADA 3C07                    	CMP	AL,7			      ; set ?			;AN000;
 37798 00006ADC 7506                    	JNZ	short resetdrv		      ; no			;AN000;

 37800                                  	; 17/12/2022
 37801                                  	;or	byte [si+44h],40h
 37802 00006ADE 804C4440                	or	byte [SI+curdir.flags+1],(curdir_inuse>>8)
 37803                                  	;OR	word [SI+curdir.flags],curdir_inuse ; set in_use	;AN000;
 37804 00006AE2 EB19                    	JMP	SHORT okdone		      ; 			;AN000;
 37805                                  resetdrv:
 37806                                  	;and	word [si+43h],0BFFFh									;AN000;
 37807                                  	; 18/12/2022
 37808 00006AE4 806444BF                	and	byte [SI+curdir.flags+1],0BFh ; (~curdir_inuse)>>8
 37809                                  	;AND	word [SI+curdir.flags],~curdir_inuse ; reset in_use	;AN000;
 37810 00006AE8 EB13                    	JMP	SHORT okdone		      ; 			;AN000;
 37811                                  
 37812                                  	; 17/12/2022
 37813                                  baddrv: 								;AN000;
 37814 00006AEA B80F00                  	MOV	AX,error_invalid_drive	      ; error			;AN000;
 37815                                  
 37816                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 37817                                  	;JMP	SHORT ASS_ERR		      ; 			;AN000;
 37818                                  	; 17/12/2022
 37819                                  	; 21/05/2019
 37820                                  ASS_ERR:
 37821 00006AED E98A9B                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 37822

 37824 00006AF0 3C08                    	CMP	AL,8			      ; reset inuse ?		;AN000;

 37826                                  
 37827                                    ;IF	NOT INSTALLED
 37828                                  	;transfer NET_ASSOPER
 37829                                    ;ELSE
 37830                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 37831 00006AF4 50                      	PUSH	AX

 37834 00006AF5 B81E11                  	mov	ax,(MultNET*256)+30
 37835 00006AF8 CD2F                    	int     2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - DO REDIRECTION
 37836                                  			; SS = DOS CS
 37837                                  			; STACK: WORD function to execute
 37838                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AX = error code
 37839                                  			; STACK unchanged
 37840 00006AFA 5B                      	POP	BX			; Don't zap error code in AX
 37841 00006AFB 72F0                    	JC	short ASS_ERR

 37852                                  ;Break <FIND_DPB - Find a DPB from a drive number>
 37853                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37854                                  ;**	FIND_DPB - Find a DPB from a Drive #
 37855                                  ;
 37856                                  ;	ENTRY	AL has drive number A = 0
 37857                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set

 37859                                  ;		'C' clear
 37860                                  ;		    DS:SI points to DPB for drive

 37865                                  FIND_DPB:

 37867                                  fdpb5:

 37882                                  ;	Break <InitCDS - set up an empty CDS>
 37883                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37884                                  ;**	InitCDS - Setup an Empty CDS
 37885                                  ;
 37886                                  ;	ENTRY	ThisCDS points to CDS
 37887                                  ;		AL has uppercase drive letter
 37888                                  ;	EXIT	ThisCDS is now empty
 37889                                  ;		(ES:DI) = CDS
 37890                                  ;		'C' set if no DPB associated with drive
 37891                                  ;	USES	AH,ES,DI, Flags
 37892                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37893                                  
 37894                                  ; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37895                                  ; DOSCODE:A9FDh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 37896                                  
 37897                                  ; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37898                                  ; DOSCODE:A99Dh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 37899                                  
 37900                                  InitCDS:
 37901                                  	; 19/08/2018
 37902                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37903                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37904 00006B15 50                      	push	ax			; save (AL) for caller
 37905 00006B16 36C43E[A205]            	LES	DI,[SS:THISCDS]		; (es:di) = CDS address
 37906                                  	;mov	word [es:di+67],0
 37907 00006B1B 26C745430000            	MOV	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],0 ; "free" CDS
 37908 00006B21 2C40                    	SUB	AL,"A"-1                ; A = 1
 37909 00006B23 363806[4600]            	CMP	[SS:NUMIO],AL		;smr;SS Override
 37910 00006B28 7236                    	JC	short icdsx		; Drive does not map a physical drive
 37911 00006B2A 48                      	dec	ax			; (AL) = 0 if A, 1 if B, etc.
 37912 00006B2B 50                      	PUSH	AX			; save drive number for later
 37913 00006B2C 0441                    	add	al,"A"
 37914 00006B2E B43A                    	MOV	AH,':'
 37915 00006B30 268905                  	mov	[ES:DI],ax
 37916                                  	;MOV	[ES:DI+curdir.text],AX 	; set "x:"

 37949                                  ;Break <$UserOper - get/set current user ID (for net)>
 37950                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37951                                  ;   $UserOper - retrieve or initiate a user id string.	MSDOS will only
 37952                                  ;	maintain this string and do no verifications.
 37953                                  ;
 37954                                  ;   Inputs:	AL has function type (0-get 1-set 2-printer-set 3-printer-get
 37955                                  ;				      4-printer-set-flags,5-printer-get-flags)
 37956                                  ;		DS:DX is user string pointer (calls 1,2)
 37957                                  ;		ES:DI is user buffer (call 3)
 37958                                  ;		BX is assign index (calls 2,3,4,5)
 37959                                  ;		CX is user number (call 1)
 37960                                  ;		DX is flag word (call 4)
 37961                                  ;   Outputs:	If AL = 0 then the current user string is written to DS:DX
 37962                                  ;			and user CX is set to the user number
 37963                                  ;		If AL = 3 then CX bytes have been put at input ES:DI
 37964                                  ;		If AL = 5 then DX is flag word
 37965                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 38225                                  ;BREAK <TransFCB - convert an FCB into a path, doing substitution>
 38226                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38227                                  ;   TransFCB - Copy an FCB from DS:DX into a reserved area doing all of the
 38228                                  ;       gritty substitution.
 38229                                  ;
 38230                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:DX - pointer to FCB
 38231                                  ;               ES:DI - point to destination
 38232                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path in final map
 38233                                  ;               Carry Clear - FCB has been mapped into ES:DI
 38234                                  ;                   Sattrib is set from possibly extended FCB
 38235                                  ;                   ExtFCB set if extended FCB found
 38236                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 38237                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38238                                  
 38239                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 38240                                  TransFCB:
 38241                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 38242                                  	; 12/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 38243                                  	;LocalVar FCBTmp,16
 38244                                  	;ENTER
 38245 00006C47 55                      	push	bp
 38246 00006C48 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 38247                                  	;sub	sp,15	; MSDOS 3.3
 38248 00006C4A 83EC10                  	sub	sp,16	; MSDOS 6.0
 38249 00006C4D 16                      	push	ss
 38250 00006C4E 07                      	pop	es
 38251 00006C4F 06                      	push	es
 38252 00006C50 57                      	push	di
 38253                                  	;lea	di,[bp-15] ; MSDOS 3.3
 38254                                  	;LEA	DI,FCBTmp
