 38319                                  ;BREAK <TransPath - copy a path, do string sub and put in current dir>
 38320                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38321                                  ;
 38322                                  ;   TransPath - copy a path from DS:SI to ES:DI, performing component string
 38323                                  ;       substitution, insertion of current directory and fixing . and ..
 38324                                  ;       entries. Perform splicing. Allow input string to match splice
 38325                                  ;       exactly.
 38326                                  ;
 38327                                  ;   TransPathSet - Same as above except No splicing is performed if input path
 38328                                  ;       matches splice.
 38329                                  ;
 38330                                  ;   TransPathNoSet - No splicing/local using is performed at all.
 38331                                  ;
 38332                                  ;   The following anomalous behaviour is required:
 38333                                  ;
 38334                                  ;       Drive letters on devices are ignored. (set up DummyCDS)
 38335                                  ;       Paths on devices are ignored. (truncate to 0-length)
 38336                                  ;       Raw net I/O sets ThisCDS => NULL.
 38337                                  ;       fSharing => dummyCDS and no subst/splice. Only canonicalize.
 38338                                  ;
 38339                                  ;   Other behaviour:
 38340                                  ;
 38341                                  ;       ThisCDS set up.
 38342                                  ;       FatRead done on local CDS.
 38343                                  ;       ValidateCDS done on local CDS.
 38344                                  ;
 38345                                  ;   Brief flowchart:
 38346                                  ;
 38347                                  ;       if fSharing then
 38348                                  ;           set up DummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 38349                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 38350                                  ;           splice
 38351                                  ;           fatRead
 38352                                  ;           return
 38353                                  ;       if \\ or d:\\ lead then
 38354                                  ;           set up null CDS (ThisCDS)
 38355                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 38356                                  ;           return
 38357                                  ;       if device then
 38358                                  ;           set up dummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 38359                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 38360                                  ;           return
 38361                                  ;       if file then
 38362                                  ;           getCDS (sets (ThisCDS) from name)
 38363                                  ;           validateCDS (may reset current dir)
 38364                                  ;           Copy current dir
 38365                                  ;           canonicalize (set cMeta)
 38366                                  ;           splice
 38367                                  ;           generate correct CDS (ThisCDS)
 38368                                  ;           if local then
 38369                                  ;               fatread
 38370                                  ;           return
 38371                                  ;
 38372                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 38373                                  ;               DI - point to buffer in DOSDATA
 38374                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 38375                                  ;                   syntax, etc. or user FAILed to I 24.
 38376                                  ;               WFP_Start - points to beginning of buffer
 38377                                  ;               Curr_Dir_End - points to end of current dir in path
 38378                                  ;               DS - DOSDATA
 38379                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 38380                                  ;
 38381                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38382                                  
 38383                                  ; 22/05/2019
 38384                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 38385                                  ; DOSCODE:AB99h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 38386                                  
 38387                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 38388                                  ; DOSCODE:AB39h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 38389                                  
 38390                                  TransPath:
 38391 00006CA9 30C0                    	XOR     AL,AL
 38392 00006CAB EB02                    	JMP     SHORT SetSplice
 38393                                  TransPathSet:
 38394 00006CAD B0FF                    	MOV     AL,-1
 38395                                  SetSplice:
 38396 00006CAF 36A2[4C03]              	MOV	[SS:NoSetDir],AL	;   NoSetDir = !fExact; ;smr;SS Override
 38397 00006CB3 B0FF                    	MOV     AL,-1
 38398                                  TransPathNoSet:
 38399 00006CB5 36A2[7105]              	MOV	[SS:FSPLICE],AL		;   fSplice = TRUE;     ;smr;SS Override
 38400 00006CB9 36C606[7A05]FF          	MOV	byte [ss:CMETA],-1      			;smr;SS Override
 38401 00006CBF 36893E[B205]            	MOV     [SS:WFP_START],DI 				;smr;SS Override
 38402 00006CC4 36C706[B605]FFFF        	MOV	word [SS:CURR_DIR_END],-1 ; crack from start	;smr;SS Override
 38403 00006CCB 16                      	push	ss
 38404 00006CCC 07                      	pop	es
 38405                                  	;lea	bp,[di+134]
 38406 00006CCD 8DAD8600                	LEA     BP,[DI+TEMPLEN]         ; end of buffer
 38407                                  ;
 38408                                  ; if this is through the server dos call, fsharing is set. We set up a
 38409                                  ; dummy cds and let the operation go.
 38410                                  ;
 38411 00006CD1 36F606[7205]FF          	TEST	byte [SS:FSHARING],-1	; if no sharing		;smr;SS Override
 38412 00006CD7 7435                    	JZ	short CheckUNC		; skip to UNC check
 38413                                  ;
 38414                                  ; ES:DI point to buffer
 38415                                  ;
 38416 00006CD9 E8FC02                  	CALL	DriveFromText           ; get drive and advance DS:SI
 38417 00006CDC E8F3FE                  	call	GETTHISDRV              ; Set ThisCDS and convert to 0-based
 38418 00006CDF 722A                    	jc	short NoPath
 38419 00006CE1 E80A03                  	CALL	TextFromDrive		; drop in new
 38420 00006CE4 8D5D01                  	LEA	BX,[DI+1]               ; backup limit
 38421 00006CE7 E83401                  	CALL	Canonicalize            ; copy and canonicalize
 38422 00006CEA 72BC                    	jc	short TransPath_retn	; errors
 38423                                  ;
 38424                                  ; Perform splices for net guys.
 38425                                  ;
 38426 00006CEC 16                      	push	ss
 38427 00006CED 1F                      	pop	ds
 38428 00006CEE 8B36[B205]              	MOV     SI,[WFP_START] 		; point to name
 38429 00006CF2 F606[7105]FF            	TEST	byte [FSPLICE],-1
 38430 00006CF7 7403                    	JZ	short NoServerSplice
 38431 00006CF9 E83102                  	CALL    Splice
 38432                                  NoServerSplice:
 38433 00006CFC 16                      	push	ss
 38434 00006CFD 1F                      	pop	ds                      ; for FATREAD
 38435 00006CFE C43E[A205]              	LES     DI,[THISCDS]		; for fatread
 38436 00006D02 E8F9A6                  	call	ECritDisk
 38437 00006D05 E8DAEA                  	call	FATREAD_CDS
 38438 00006D08 E80EA7                  	call	LCritDisk
 38439                                  NoPath:
 38440                                  	;mov	al,3
 38441 00006D0B B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 38442 00006D0D C3                      	retn				; any errors are in Carry flag
 38443                                  
 38444                                  ; Let the network decide if the name is for a spooled device. It will map
 38445                                  ; the name if so.
 38446                                  
 38447                                  CheckUNC:
 38448 00006D0E 36C706[A205]FFFF        	MOV     WORD [SS:THISCDS],-1	; NULL thisCDS		;smr;SS Override
 38449                                  	;CallInstall NetSpoolCheck,MultNET,35
 38450 00006D15 B82311                  	mov	ax,1123h
 38451 00006D18 CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - QUALIFY REMOTE FILENAME
 38452                                  			; DS:SI -> ASCIZ filename to canonicalize
 38453                                  			; ES:DI -> 128-byte buffer for qualified name
 38454                                  			; Return: CF set if not resolved
 38455 00006D1A 7329                    	JNC	short UNCDone
 38456                                  
 38457                                  ; At this point the name is either a UNC-style name (prefixed with two leading
 38458                                  ; \\s) or is a local file/device. Remember that if a net-spooled device was
 38459                                  ; input, then the name has been changed to the remote spooler by the above net
 38460                                  ; call. Also, there may be a drive in front of the \\.
 38461                                  
 38462                                  NO_CHECK:
 38463 00006D1C E8B902                  	CALL    DriveFromText		; eat drive letter
 38464 00006D1F 50                      	PUSH    AX                      ; save it
 38465 00006D20 8B04                    	MOV     AX,[SI]			; get first two bytes of path
 38466 00006D22 E883E4                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; convert to normal form
 38467 00006D25 86E0                    	XCHG    AH,AL                   ; swap for second byte
 38468 00006D27 E87EE4                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; convert to normal form
 38469 00006D2A 751F                    	JNZ	short CheckDevice	; not a path char
 38470 00006D2C 38C4                    	CMP     AH,AL                   ; are they same?
 38471 00006D2E 751B                    	JNZ	short CheckDevice	; nope
 38472                                  
 38473                                  ; We have a UNC request. We must copy the string up to the beginning of the
 38474                                  ; local machine root path
 38475                                  
 38476 00006D30 58                      	POP     AX
 38477 00006D31 A5                      	MOVSW                           ; get the lead \\.
 38478                                  UNCCpy:
 38479 00006D32 AC                      	LODSB                           ; get a byte
 38480 00006D33 E81DE4                   	call	UCase                   ;AN000;; convert the char
 38481 00006D36 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL
 38482 00006D38 740E                    	JZ	short UNCTerm		; end of string. All done.
 38483 00006D3A E86BE4                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it a path char?
 38484 00006D3D 89FB                    	MOV     BX,DI                   ; backup position
 38485 00006D3F AA                      	STOSB
 38486 00006D40 75F0                    	JNZ	short UNCCpy		; no, go copy
 38487 00006D42 E8D900                  	CALL    Canonicalize            ; wham (and set cMeta)
 38488                                  UNCDone:
 38489 00006D45 16                      	push	ss
 38490 00006D46 1F                      	pop	ds
 38491 00006D47 C3                       	retn				; return error code
 38492                                  UNCTerm:
 38493 00006D48 AA                      	STOSB                           ;AN000;
 38494 00006D49 EBFA                    	JMP	short UNCDone		;AN000;
 38495                                  
 38496                                  CheckDevice:
 38497                                  
 38498                                  ; Check DS:SI for device. First eat any path stuff
 38499                                  
 38500 00006D4B 58                      	POP     AX                      ; retrieve drive info
 38501 00006D4C 803C00                  	CMP     BYTE [SI],0		; check for null file
 38502 00006D4F 7504                    	JNZ	short CheckPath
 38503                                  	;mov	al,2 
 38504 00006D51 B002                    	MOV     AL,error_file_not_found ; bad file error
 38505 00006D53 F9                      	STC                             ; signal error on null input
 38506 00006D54 C3                      	RETN				; bye!
 38507                                  CheckPath:
 38508 00006D55 50                      	push	ax
 38509 00006D56 55                      	push	bp			; save drive number
 38510                                  
 38511                                  
 38512                                  ; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 38513                                  %if 0
 38514                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 38515                                  ;;;BUGBUG BUG 10-26-1992 scottq
 38516                                  ;;;This is a hack for the CDROM extensions (2.1) who scan looking
 38517                                  ;;;for the following POP BP == 5Dh (restore <bp,ax>).
 38518                                  ;;;The problem is that a direct call to CheckThisDevice can (and did)
 38519                                  ;;;end up having a 5D in the opcode's displacement field. The
 38520                                  ;;;scanning code would choke on this thinking it was a POP BP instruction.
 38521                                  ;;;
 38522                                  ;;;What we do here is do a call to a function that is less than 5Dh
 38523                                  ;;;bytes away (and assert its not exactly 5D away) that jmps (transfers)
 38524                                  ;;;to the correct function. This cannot accidently insert a 5Dh.
 38525                                  ;;;
 38526                                  ;;;More info:
 38527                                  ;;;  This particular scan is begun at the UNCdone label for 32 bytes
 38528                                  ;;;looking for pop BP, so you cannot put a 5D between here and there.
 38529                                  ;;;
 38530                                  	call	no5Dshere
 38531                                  start5Dhack:
 38532                                  ;following is replaced with 5Dhack code--Invoke CheckThisDevice         
 38533                                  backfrom5Dhack:
 38534                                  
 38535                                  %endif
 38536                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 38537                                  	; Note: 'call no5Dshere' is not required for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
 38538 00006D57 E8D0D6                  	call    CheckThisDevice	; E8h,6Fh,0D6h
 38539                                  
 38540 00006D5A 5D                      	pop	bp
 38541 00006D5B 58                      	pop	ax			; get drive letter back
 38542 00006D5C 731C                    	JNC	short DoFile		; yes we have a file.
 38543                                  
 38544                                  ; We have a device. AX has drive letter. At this point we may fake a CDS ala
 38545                                  ; sharing DOS call. We know by getting here that we are NOT in a sharing DOS
 38546                                  ; call.
 38547                                  
 38548 00006D5E 36C606[7205]FF          	MOV	byte [SS:FSHARING],-1	; simulate sharing dos call;smr;SS Override
 38549 00006D64 E86BFE                  	call	GETTHISDRV              ; set ThisCDS and init DUMMYCDS
 38550 00006D67 36C606[7205]00          	MOV     byte [SS:FSHARING],0	;                       ;smr;SS Override
 38551                                  
 38552                                  ; Now that we have noted that we have a device, we put it into a form that
 38553                                  ; getpath can understand. Normally getpath requires d:\ to begin the input
 38554                                  ; string. We relax this to state that if the d:\ is present then the path
 38555                                  ; may be a file. If D:/ (note the forward slash) is present then we have
 38556                                  ; a device.
 38557                                  
 38558 00006D6D E87E02                  	CALL    TextFromDrive
 38559 00006D70 B02F                    	MOV     AL,'/'                  ; path sep.
 38560 00006D72 AA                      	STOSB
 38561 00006D73 E84CA5                  	call	StrCpy			; move remainder of string
 38562                                  
 38563 00006D76 F8                      	CLC                             ; everything OK.
 38564 00006D77 16                      	push	ss
 38565 00006D78 1F                      	pop	ds                      ; remainder of OK stuff
 38566                                  DoFile_retn:
 38567 00006D79 C3                      	retn
 38568                                  
 38569                                  ; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 38570                                  %if 0
 38571                                  
 38572                                  no5Dshere:
 38573                                  	; 10/08/2018
 38574                                  	jmp	CheckThisDevice		; snoop for device
 38575                                  %endif
 38576                                  
 38577                                  ;.erre (no5Dshere - start5Dhack - 5D)
 38578                                  
 38579                                  ; We have a file. Get the raw CDS.
 38580                                  
 38581                                  DoFile:
 38582                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 38583                                  
 38584 00006D7A E839FE                  	call	GetVisDrv               ; get proper CDS
 38585                                  	;mov	al,3 
 38586 00006D7D B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad file error
 38587 00006D7F 72F8                    	jc	short DoFile_retn  ; CARRY set -> bogus drive/spliced
 38588                                  
 38589                                  ; ThisCDS has correct CDS. DS:SI advanced to point to beginning of path/file.
 38590                                  ; Make sure that CDS has valid directory; ValidateCDS requires a temp buffer
 38591                                  ; Use the one that we are going to use (ES:DI).
 38592                                  
 38593                                  	;SAVE    <DS,SI,ES,DI>		; save all string pointers.
 38594 00006D81 1E                      	push	ds
 38595 00006D82 56                      	push	si
 38596 00006D83 06                      	push	es
 38597 00006D84 57                      	push	di
 38598 00006D85 E8E6D5                  	call	ValidateCDS             ; poke CDS and make everything OK
 38599                                  	;RESTORE <DI,ES,SI,DS>		; get back pointers
 38600 00006D88 5F                      	pop	di
 38601 00006D89 07                      	pop	es
 38602 00006D8A 5E                      	pop	si
 38603 00006D8B 1F                      	pop	ds
 38604                                  	;mov	al,3
 38605 00006D8C B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 38606                                  	;retc				; someone failed an operation
 38607 00006D8E 72E9                    	jc	short DoFile_retn
 38608                                  
 38609                                  ; ThisCDS points to correct CDS. It contains the correct text of the
 38610                                  ; current directory. Copy it in.
 38611                                  
 38612 00006D90 1E                      	push	ds
 38613 00006D91 56                      	push	si
 38614 00006D92 36C536[A205]            	LDS     SI,[SS:THISCDS]		; point to CDS	;smr;SS Override
 38615 00006D97 89FB                    	MOV     BX,DI                   ; point to destination
 38616                                  	;add	bx,[si+79] ; MSDOS 6.0
 38617 00006D99 035C4F                  	ADD     BX,[SI+curdir.end]	; point to backup limit
 38618                                  	;lea	bp,[di+134]
 38619 00006D9C 8DAD8600                	LEA     BP,[DI+TEMPLEN]         ; regenerate end of buffer
 38620                                  					;AN000;
 38621 00006DA0 E82EA5                  	call	FStrCpy                 ; copy string. ES:DI point to end
 38622 00006DA3 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ; point to NUL byte
 38623                                  
 38624                                  ; Make sure that there is a path char at end.
 38625                                  
 38626 00006DA4 B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'
 38627 00006DA6 263845FF                	CMP     [ES:DI-1],AL
 38628 00006DAA 7401                    	JZ	short GetOrig
 38629 00006DAC AA                      	STOSB
 38630                                  
 38631                                  ; Now get original string.
 38632                                  
 38633                                  GetOrig:
 38634 00006DAD 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ; point to path char
 38635 00006DAE 5E                      	pop	si
 38636 00006DAF 1F                      	pop	ds
 38637                                  
 38638                                  ; BX points to the end of the root part of the CDS (at where a path char
 38639                                  ; should be). Now, we decide whether we use this root or extend it with the
 38640                                  ; current directory. See if the input string begins with a leading 
 38642 00006DB0 E8D000                  	CALL    PathSep                 ; is DS:SI a path sep?
 38643 00006DB3 7511                    	JNZ	short PathAssure	; no, DI is correct. Assure a path char
 38644 00006DB5 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL                   ; end of string?
 38645 00006DB7 7410                    	JZ	short DoCanon		; yes, skip.
 38646                                  ;
 38647                                  ; The string does begin with a \. Reset the beginning of the canonicalization
 38648                                  ; to this root. Make sure that there is a path char there and advance the
 38649                                  ; source string over all leading \'s.
 38650                                  ;
 38651 00006DB9 89DF                    	MOV     DI,BX                   ; back up to root point.
 38652                                  SkipPath:
 38653 00006DBB AC                      	LODSB
 38654 00006DBC E8E9E3                  	call    PATHCHRCMP
 38655 00006DBF 74FA                    	JZ	short SkipPath
 38656 00006DC1 4E                      	DEC     SI
 38657 00006DC2 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL
 38658 00006DC4 7403                    	JZ	short DoCanon
 38659                                  
 38660                                  ; DS:SI start at some file name. ES:DI points at some path char. Drop one in
 38661                                  ; for yucks.
 38662                                  
 38663                                  PathAssure:
 38664 00006DC6 B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'	; 5Ch
 38665 00006DC8 AA                      	STOSB
 38666                                  
 38667                                  ; ES:DI point to the correct spot for canonicalization to begin.
 38668                                  ; BP is the max extent to advance DI
 38669                                  ; BX is the backup limit for ..
 38670                                  
 38671                                  DoCanon:
 38672 00006DC9 E85200                  	CALL    Canonicalize            ; wham.
 38673                                  	;retc				; badly formatted path.
 38674 00006DCC 72AB                    	jc	short DoFile_retn
 38675                                  
 38676                                  ; The string has been moved to ES:DI. Reset world to DOS context, pointers
 38677                                  ; to wfp_start and do string substitution. BP is still the max position in
 38678                                  ; buffer.
 38679                                  
 38680 00006DCE 16                      	push	ss
 38681 00006DCF 1F                      	pop	ds
 38682 00006DD0 8B3E[B205]              	MOV     DI,[WFP_START]		; DS:SI point to string
 38683 00006DD4 C536[A205]              	LDS     SI,[THISCDS]		; point to CDS
 38684 00006DD8 E81B02                  	CALL    PathPref                ; is there a prefix?
 38685 00006DDB 7514                    	JNZ	short DoSplice		; no, do splice
 38686                                  
 38687                                  ; We have a match. Check to see if we ended in a path char.
 38688                                  
 38689 00006DDD 8A44FF                  	MOV     AL,[SI-1]		; last char to match
 38690 00006DE0 E8C5E3                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; did we end on a path char? (root)
 38691 00006DE3 740C                    	JZ	short DoSplice		; yes, no current dir here.
 38692                                  Pathline:                               ; 2/13/KK
 38693 00006DE5 26803D00                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],0		; end at NUL?
 38694 00006DE9 7406                    	JZ	short DoSplice
 38695 00006DEB 47                      	INC     DI                      ; point to after current path char
 38696 00006DEC 36893E[B605]            	MOV     [SS:CURR_DIR_END],DI	; point to correct spot ;smr;SS Override
 38697                                  
 38698                                  ; Splice the result.
 38699                                  
 38700                                  DoSplice:
 38701 00006DF1 16                      	push	ss
 38702 00006DF2 1F                      	pop	ds			; back to DOSDATA
 38703 00006DF3 8B36[B205]              	MOV     SI,[WFP_START]		; point to beginning of string
 38704 00006DF7 31C9                    	XOR     CX,CX
 38705 00006DF9 F606[7105]FF            	TEST	byte [FSPLICE],-1
 38706 00006DFE 7403                    	JZ	short SkipSplice
 38707 00006E00 E82A01                  	CALL    Splice                  ; replaces in place.
 38708                                  SkipSplice:
 38709                                  
 38710                                  ; The final thing is to assure ourselves that a FATREAD is done on the local
 38711                                  ; device.
 38712                                  
 38713 00006E03 16                      	push	ss
 38714 00006E04 1F                      	pop	ds
 38715 00006E05 C43E[A205]              	LES     DI,[THISCDS]		; point to correct drive
 38716                                  	;test	word [es:di+67],8000h
 38717                                  	; 17/12/2022
 38718                                  	;test	byte [es:di+68],80h
 38719 00006E09 26F6454480              	test	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],curdir_isnet>>8 ; 04/12/2022
 38720                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet ; 8000h
 38721 00006E0E 750D                    	JNZ	short Done		; net, no fatread necessary (retnz)
 38722 00006E10 E30B                    	JCXZ    Done
 38723 00006E12 E8E9A5                  	call	ECritDisk
 38724 00006E15 E8CAE9                  	call	FATREAD_CDS
 38725 00006E18 E8FEA5                  	call	LCritDisk
 38726                                  	;mov	al, 3
 38727 00006E1B B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 38728                                  Done:   
 38729 00006E1D C3                      	retn                         ; any errors in carry flag.
 38730                                  
 38731                                  ; 13/07/2018
 38732                                  
 38733                                  ;BREAK <Canonicalize - copy a path and remove . and .. entries>
 38734                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38735                                  ;   Canonicalize - copy path removing . and .. entries.
 38736                                  ;
 38737                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 38738                                  ;               ES:DI - point to buffer
 38739                                  ;               BX - backup limit (offset from ES) points to slash
 38740                                  ;               BP - end of buffer
 38741                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 38742                                  ;                   syntax, etc.
 38743                                  ;               Carry Clear -
 38744                                  ;                   DS:DI - advanced to end of string
 38745                                  ;                   ES:DI - advanced to end of canonicalized form after nul
 38746                                  ;   Registers modified: AX CX DX (in addition to those above)
 38747                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38748                                  
 38749                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 38750                                  
 38751                                  Canonicalize:
 38752                                  
 38753                                  ; We copy all leading path separators.
 38754                                  
 38755 00006E1E AC                      	LODSB                           ;   while (PathChr (*s))
 38756 00006E1F E886E3                  	call    PATHCHRCMP
 38757 00006E22 7507                    	JNZ	short CanonDec
 38758 00006E24 39EF                    	CMP     DI,BP                   ;       if (d > dlim)
 38759 00006E26 7319                    	JAE	short CanonBad		;           goto error;
 38760 00006E28 AA                      	STOSB
 38761 00006E29 EBF3                    	JMP	short Canonicalize	;           *d++ = *s++;
 38762                                  CanonDec:
 38763 00006E2B 4E                      	DEC     SI
 38764                                  
 38765                                  ; Main canonicalization loop. We come here with DS:SI pointing to a textual
 38766                                  ; component (no leading path separators) and ES:DI being the destination
 38767                                  ; buffer.
 38768                                  
 38769                                  CanonLoop:
 38770                                  
 38771                                  ; If we are at the end of the source string, then we need to check to see that
 38772                                  ; a potential drive specifier is correctly terminated with a path sep char.
 38773                                  ; Otherwise, do nothing
 38774                                  
 38775 00006E2C 31C0                    	XOR     AX,AX
 38776 00006E2E 3804                    	CMP     [SI],AL                 ;       if (*s == 0) {
 38777 00006E30 751A                    	JNZ	short DoComponent
 38778 00006E32 26807DFF3A              	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI-1],':'	;           if (d[-1] == ':')
 38779 00006E37 7505                    	JNZ	short DoTerminate
 38780 00006E39 B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'                  ;               *d++ = '\';
 38781 00006E3B AA                      	STOSB
 38782 00006E3C 88E0                    	MOV     AL,AH
 38783                                  DoTerminate:
 38784 00006E3E AA                      	STOSB                           ;           *d++ = 0;
 38785 00006E3F F8                      	CLC                             ;           return (0);
 38786 00006E40 C3                      	retn
 38787                                  
 38788                                  CanonBad:
 38789 00006E41 E8CB01                  	CALL	ScanPathChar            ; check for path chars in rest of string
 38790                                  	;mov	al,3
 38791 00006E44 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for bad path error
 38792 00006E46 7402                    	JZ	short PathEnc		; path character encountered in string
 38793                                  	;mov	al,2
 38794 00006E48 B002                    	MOV     AL,error_file_not_found ; Set bad file error
 38795                                  PathEnc:
 38796 00006E4A F9                      	STC
 38797                                  CanonBad_retn:
 38798 00006E4B C3                      	retn
 38799                                  
 38800                                  ; We have a textual component that we must copy. We uppercase it and truncate
 38801                                  ; it to 8.3
 38802                                  
 38803                                  DoComponent:                            ;           }
 38804 00006E4C E85000                  	CALL    CopyComponent		;       if (!CopyComponent (s, d))

 39242                                  Prefix:

 39244 0000700E C3                      	retn

 39277                                  ; MSDOS 2.11
 39278                                  ;BREAK <$Open - open a file handle>
 39279                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39280                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 39281                                  ;           LDS     DX, Name
 39282                                  ;           MOV     AH, Open
 39283                                  ;           MOV     AL, access
 39284                                  ;           INT     int_command
 39285                                  ;
 39286                                  ;       ACCESS          Function
 39287                                  ;       ------          --------
 39288                                  ;       open_for_read   file is opened for reading
 39289                                  ;       open_for_write  file is opened for writing
 39290                                  ;       open_for_both   file is opened for both reading and writing.
 39291                                  ;
 39292                                  ;   Error returns:
 39293                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_access
 39294                                  ;              = error_file_not_found
 39295                                  ;              = error_access_denied
 39296                                  ;              = error_too_many_open_files
 39297                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39298                                  
 39299                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 39300                                  ;	BREAK <$Open - open a file from a path string>
 39301                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39302                                  ;
 39303                                  ;**	$OPen - Open a File
 39304                                  ;
 39305                                  ;	given a path name in DS:DX and an open mode in AL, $Open opens the
 39306                                  ;	file and and returns a handle
 39307                                  ;
 39308                                  ;	ENTRY	(DS:DX) = pointer to asciz name
 39309                                  ;		(AL) = open mode
 39310                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 39311                                  ;		  (ax) = file handle
 39312                                  ;		'C' set if error
 39313                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 39314                                  ;	USES	all
 39315                                  ;
 39316                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39317                                  
 39318                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39319                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 39320                                  
 39321                                  _$OPEN:       
 39322 00007018 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah  ; MSDOS 6.0	
 39323                                  _$Open2:
 39324                                  	;mov	ch,16h
 39325 0000701A B516                    	mov	ch,attr_hidden+attr_system+attr_directory
 39326 0000701C E85702                  	call	SetAttrib
 39327 0000701F B9[882C]                	mov	cx,DOS_OPEN
 39328                                  
 39329                                  	;xor	ah,ah  ; MSDOS 3.3
 39330                                  
 39331 00007022 50                      	push	ax
 39332                                  
 39333                                  ;*	General file open/create code. The $CREATE call and the various
 39334                                  ;	$OPEN calls all come here.
 39335                                  ;
 39336                                  ;	We'll share a lot of the standard stuff of allocating SFTs, cracking
 39337                                  ;	path names, etc., and then dispatch to our individual handlers.
 39338                                  ;	WARNING - this info and list is just a guess, not definitive - jgl
 39339                                  ;
 39340                                  ;	(TOS) = create mode
 39341                                  ;	(CX) = address of routine to call to do actual function
 39342                                  ;	(DS:DX) = ASCIZ name
 39343                                  ;	SAttrib = Attribute mask
 39344                                  
 39345                                  ;	Get a free SFT and mark it "being allocated"
 39346                                  
 39347                                  AccessFile:
 39348 00007023 E8D8A3                  	call	ECritSFT
 39349 00007026 E8D8F7                  	call	SFNFree			; get a free sfn
 39350 00007029 E8EDA3                  	call	LCritSFT
 39351 0000702C 7214                    	jc	short OpenFailJ		; oops, no free sft's
 39352 0000702E 36891E[AA05]            	MOV	[SS:SFN],BX		; save the SFN for later;smr;SS Override
 39353 00007033 36893E[9E05]            	MOV	[SS:THISSFT],DI		; save the SF offset	;smr;SS Override
 39354 00007038 368C06[A005]            	MOV	[SS:THISSFT+2],ES	; save the SF segment	;smr;SS Override
 39355                                  
 39356                                  ;	Find a free area in the user's JFN table.
 39357                                  
 39358 0000703D E8AEF7                  	call	JFNFree			; get a free jfn
 39359 00007040 7303                    	jnc	short SaveJFN
 39360                                  OpenFailJ:
 39361 00007042 E99300                  	JMP	OpenFail		; there were free JFNs... try SFN
 39362                                  
 39363                                  SaveJFN:
 39364 00007045 36893E[AE05]            	mov	[ss:PJFN],DI		; save the jfn offset	;smr;SS Override
 39365 0000704A 368C06[B005]            	MOV	[ss:PJFN+2],ES		; save the jfn segment	;smr;SS Override
 39366 0000704F 36891E[AC05]            	MOV	[ss:JFN],BX		; save the jfn itself	;smr;SS Override
 39367                                  
 39368                                  ;	We have been given an JFN. We lock it down to prevent other tasks from
 39369                                  ;	reusing the same JFN.
 39370                                  
 39371 00007054 368B1E[AA05]            	MOV	BX,[ss:SFN]					;smr;SS Override
 39372 00007059 26881D                  	MOV	[ES:DI],BL		; assign the JFN
 39373 0000705C 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; get name in appropriate place
 39374 0000705E BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; appropriate buffer
 39375 00007061 51                      	push	cx			; save routine to call
 39376 00007062 E844FC                  	call	TransPath		; convert the path
 39377 00007065 5B                      	pop	bx			; (bx) = routine to call
 39378                                  
 39379 00007066 36C536[9E05]            	LDS	SI,[SS:THISSFT]					;smr;SS Override
 39380 0000706B 720A                    	JC	short OpenCleanJ	; no error, go and open file
 39381 0000706D 36803E[7A05]FF          	CMP	byte [ss:CMETA],-1				;smr;SS Override
 39382 00007073 7404                    	JZ	short SetSearch
 39383                                  	;mov	al,2
 39384 00007075 B002                    	MOV	AL,error_file_not_found ; no meta chars allowed
 39385                                  OpenCleanJ:
 39386 00007077 EB50                    	JMP	short OpenClean
 39387                                  
 39388                                  SetSearch:
 39389 00007079 58                      	pop	ax			; Mode (Open), Attributes (Create)
 39390                                  
 39391                                  ;	We need to get the new inheritance bits.
 39392                                  
 39393 0000707A 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 39394                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 39395                                  	;mov	[si+2],cx ; 0
 39396 0000707C 894C02                  	MOV	[SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode],cx ; initialize mode field to 0
 39397                                  	;mov    [si+51],cx ; 0
 39398 0000707F 894C33                  	MOV	[SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_MFT],cx	 ; clean out sharing info
 39399                                  	;
 39400 00007082 81FB[882C]              	CMP	BX,DOS_OPEN
 39401 00007086 7509                    	JNZ	short _DoOper
 39402                                  	;test   al,80h
 39403 00007088 A880                    	test	AL,SHARING_NO_INHERIT	; look for no inher
 39404 0000708A 7405                    	JZ	short _DoOper ; 10/08/2018
 39405 0000708C 247F                    	AND	AL,7Fh			; mask off inherit bit
 39406                                  	;mov	cx,1000h
 39407 0000708E B90010                  	MOV	CX,sf_no_inherit
 39408                                  _DoOper:
 39409                                  	;; MSDOS 3.3
 39410                                  	;;mov	word [si+2], 0
 39411                                  	;;mov	word [si+33h], 0
 39412                                  	;MOV	word [SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode],0
 39413                                  	;MOV	word [SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_MFT],0
 39414                                  
 39415                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 39416                                  ;**	Check if this is an extended open. If so you must set the
 39417                                  ;	modes in sf_mode. Call Set_EXT_mode to do all this. See
 39418                                  ;	Set_EXT_mode in creat.asm
 39419                                  
 39420                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 39421                                  	;SAVE	<di, es>                ;M022 conditional removed here
 39422 00007091 57                      	push	di
 39423 00007092 06                      	push	es
 39424 00007093 1E                      	push	ds
 39425 00007094 07                      	pop	es
 39426 00007095 56                      	push	si
 39427 00007096 5F                      	pop	di			; (es:di) = SFT address
 39428 00007097 E8DABB                  	call	Set_EXT_mode
 39429                                  	;RESTORE <es, di>
 39430 0000709A 07                      	pop	es
 39431 0000709B 5F                      	pop	di
 39432                                  
 39433                                  	;Context DS
 39434 0000709C 16                      	push	ss
 39435 0000709D 1F                      	pop	ds	
 39436                                  
 39437 0000709E 51                      	push	cx
 39438 0000709F FFD3                    	CALL	BX			; blam!
 39439 000070A1 59                      	pop	cx
 39440 000070A2 C536[9E05]              	LDS	SI,[THISSFT]
 39441 000070A6 721A                    	JC	short OpenE2		;AN000;FT. chek extended open hooks first
 39442                                  	;jc	short OpenE ; MSDOS 3.3
 39443                                  
 39444                                  ;	The SFT was successfully opened. Remove busy mark.
 39445                                  
 39446                                  OpenOK:
 39447                                  	;MOV	word [SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],1
 39448 000070A8 C7040100                	mov	word [SI],1
 39449                                  	;or	[SI+5],cx
 39450 000070AC 094C05                  	OR	[SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],CX ; set no inherit bit if necessary
 39451                                  
 39452                                  ; If the open mode is 70, we scan the system for other SFT's with the same
 39453                                  ; contents. If we find one, then we can 'collapse' thissft onto the already
 39454                                  ; opened one. Otherwise we use this new one. We compare uid/pid/mode/mft
 39455                                  ;
 39456                                  ; Since this is only relevant on sharer systems, we stick this code into the
 39457                                  ; sharer.
 39458                                  
 39459 000070AF 36A1[AC05]              	MOV	AX,[ss:JFN]				;smr;SS Override
 39460 000070B3 36FF1E[C000]            	Call	far [ss:JShare+(12*4)]	; 12 = ShCol	;smr;SS Override
 39461                                  
 39462 000070B8 36C706[AA05]FFFF        	MOV	word [ss:SFN],-1	; clear out sfn pointer	;smr;SS Override
 39463                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 39464                                  OpenOkj:
 39465 000070BF E9AE95                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK		; bye with no errors
 39466                                  
 39467                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 39468                                  ;Extended Open hooks check
 39469                                  OpenE2:					;AN000;;EO.
 39470 000070C2 83F857                  	CMP	AX,error_invalid_parameter ;AN000;;EO. IFS extended open ?
 39471 000070C5 7503                    	JNZ	short OpenE		;AN000;;EO. no.
 39472 000070C7 EB11                    	JMP	short OpenCritLeave	;AN000;;EO. keep handle
 39473                                  
 39474                                  ;	Extended Open hooks check
 39475                                  ;
 39476                                  ;	AL has error code.  Stack has argument to dos_open/dos_create.
 39477                                  
 39478                                  OpenClean:

 39480                                  OpenE:

 39482 000070CA C7040000                	mov	word [SI],0

 39484 000070D3 C604FF                  	MOV	BYTE [SI],0FFh		; free the SFN...
 39485 000070D6 EB02                    	JMP	SHORT OpenCritLeave
 39486                                  
 39487                                  OpenFail:

 39489 000070D9 59                      	pop	cx			; Clean stack
 39490                                  OpenCritLeave:
 39491 000070DA 36C706[AA05]FFFF        	MOV	word [SS:SFN],-1	; remove mark.

 39701                                  ;BREAK <$RENAME - move directory entries around>
 39702                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39703                                  ;
 39704                                  ;   Assembler usage:

 39795                                  ;Break <$CreateNewFile - Create a new directory entry>
 39796                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39797                                  ;   CreateNew - Create a new directory entry.  Return a file handle if there
 39798                                  ;	was no previous directory entry, and fail if a directory entry with
 39799                                  ;	the same name existed previously.
 39800                                  ;
 39801                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to an ASCIZ file name
 39802                                  ;		CX contains default file attributes
 39803                                  ;   Outputs:	Carry Clear:
 39804                                  ;		    AX has file handle opened for read/write
 39805                                  ;		Carry Set:
 39806                                  ;		    AX has error code
 39807                                  ;   Registers modified: All
 39808                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39809                                  
 39810                                  _$CreateNewFile:
 39811 000071D8 51                      	push	cx			; Save attributes on stack
 39812 000071D9 B9[2B2C]                	MOV	CX,DOS_Create_New	; routine to call
 39813 000071DC E914FF                  	JMP	AccessSet		; use good ol' open
 39814                                  
 39815                                  ;**	BinToAscii - convert a number to a string.
 39816                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39817                                  ;	BinToAscii converts a 16 bit number into a 4 ascii characters.
 39818                                  ;	This routine is used to generate temp file names so we don't spend
 39819                                  ;	the time and code needed for a true hex number, we just use
 39820                                  ;	A thorugh O.
 39821                                  ;
 39822                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = value
 39823                                  ;		(es:di) = destination
 39824                                  ;	EXIT	(es:di) updated by 4
 39825                                  ;	USES	cx, di, flags
 39826                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39827                                  
 39828                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 39829                                  ;BinToAscii:
 39830                                  ;	mov     cx,4
 39831                                  ;bta5:
 39832                                  ;	push    cx
 39833                                  ;	mov     cl,4
 39834                                  ;	rol     ax,cl
 39835                                  ;	push    ax
 39836                                  ;	and     al,0Fh
 39837                                  ;	add     al,'0'
 39838                                  ;	cmp     al,'9'
 39839                                  ;	jbe     short bta6
 39840                                  ;	add     al,7
 39841                                  ;bta6: 
 39842                                  ;	stosb
 39843                                  ;	pop     ax
 39844                                  ;	pop     cx
 39845                                  ;	loop    bta5
 39846                                  ;	retn
 39847                                  
 39848                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 39849                                  BinToAscii:
 39850 000071DF B90404                  	mov	cx,404h			; (ch) = digit counter, (cl) = shift cnt
 39851                                  bta5:	
 39852 000071E2 D3C0                    	ROL	AX,CL			; move leftmost nibble into rightmost
 39853 000071E4 50                      	push	ax			; preserve remainder of digits
 39854 000071E5 240F                    	AND	AL,0Fh			; grab low nibble
 39855 000071E7 0441                    	ADD	AL,'A'			; turn into ascii
 39856 000071E9 AA                      	STOSB				; drop in the character
 39857 000071EA 58                      	pop	ax			; (ax) = shifted number
 39858 000071EB FECD                    	dec	ch
 39859 000071ED 75F3                    	jnz	short bta5		; process 4 digits
 39860 000071EF C3                      	retn
 39861                                  
 39862                                  ;Break	<$CreateTempFile - create a unique name>
 39863                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39864                                  ;   $CreateTemp - given a directory, create a unique name in that directory.
 39865                                  ;	Method used is to get the current time, convert to a name and attempt
 39866                                  ;	a create new. Repeat until create new succeeds.
 39867                                  ;
 39868                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to a null terminated directory name.
 39869                                  ;		CX  contains default attributes
 39870                                  ;   Outputs:	Unique name is appended to DS:DX directory.
 39871                                  ;		AX has handle
 39872                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 39873                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39874                                  
 39875                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 39876                                  
 39877                                  _$CreateTempFile:
 39878                                  	;Enter
 39879 000071F0 55                      	push	bp
 39880 000071F1 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 39881                                  
 39882                                  	;LocalVar  EndPtr,DWORD
 39883                                  	;LocalVar  FilPtr,DWORD
 39884                                  	;LocalVar  Attr,WORD
 39885                                  
 39886 000071F3 83EC0A                  	sub	sp,10
 39887                                  
 39888                                  	;test	cx,0FFD8h
 39889 000071F6 F7C1D8FF                	test	CX,~attr_changeable
 39890 000071FA 7405                    	JZ	short OKatts		; Ok if no non-changeable bits set
 39891                                  
 39892                                  ; We need this "hook" here to detect these cases (like user sets one both of
 39893                                  ; vol_id and dir bits) because of the structure of the or $CreateNewFile loop
 39894                                  ; below. The code loops on error_access_denied, but if one of the non
 39895                                  ; changeable attributes is specified, the loop COULD be infinite or WILL be
 39896                                  ; infinite because CreateNewFile will fail with access_denied always. Thus we
 39897                                  ; need to detect these cases before getting to the loop.
 39898                                  
 39899                                  	;mov	ax, 5
 39900 000071FC B80500                  	MOV	AX,error_access_denied
 39901 000071FF EB69                    	JMP	SHORT SETTMPERR
 39902                                  
 39903                                  OKatts:
 39904                                  	;MOV	attr,CX 		; save attribute
 39905 00007201 894EF6                  	mov     [bp-10],cx
 39906                                  	;MOV	FilPtrL,DX		; pointer to file
 39907 00007204 8956F8                  	mov	[bp-8],dx
 39908                                  	;MOV	FilPtrH,DS
 39909 00007207 8C5EFA                  	mov	[bp-6],ds
 39910                                  	;MOV	EndPtrH,DS		; seg pointer to end of dir
 39911 0000720A 8C5EFE                  	mov	[bp-2],ds
 39912 0000720D 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 39913 0000720E 07                      	POP	ES			; destination for nul search
 39914 0000720F 89D7                    	MOV	DI,DX
 39915 00007211 89F9                    	MOV	CX,DI
 39916 00007213 F7D9                    	NEG	CX			; number of bytes remaining in segment
 39917                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 39918 00007215 09C9                    	OR	CX,CX			;AN000;MS. cx=0 ? ds:dx on segment boundary
 39919 00007217 7501                    	JNZ	short okok		;AN000;MS. no
 39920                                  	;MOV	CX,-1			;AN000;MS.
 39921                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 39922                                  	; 17/12/2022
 39923 00007219 49                      	dec	cx  ; mov cx,-1
 39924                                  	;mov	cx,-1 ; 0FFFh
 39925                                  okok:					;AN000;
 39926 0000721A 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX			;AN000;
 39927 0000721C F2AE                    	REPNZ	SCASB			;AN000;
 39928                                  					;AN000;
 39929 0000721E 4F                      	DEC	DI			; point back to the null
 39930 0000721F 268A45FF                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI-1]		; Get char before the NUL
 39931 00007223 E882DF                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; Is it a path separator?
 39932 00007226 7403                    	JZ	short SETENDPTR		; Yes
 39933                                  STOREPTH:
 39934 00007228 B05C                    	MOV	AL,'\'
 39935 0000722A AA                      	STOSB				; Add a path separator (and INC DI)
 39936                                  SETENDPTR:
 39937                                  	;MOV	EndPtrL,DI		; pointer to the tail
 39938 0000722B 8856FC                  	mov	[bp-4],dl
 39939                                  CreateLoop:
 39940 0000722E 16                      	push	ss			; let ReadTime see variables
 39941 0000722F 1F                      	pop	ds
 39942 00007230 55                      	push	bp
 39943 00007231 E86299                  	call	READTIME		; go get time
 39944 00007234 5D                      	pop	bp
 39945                                  ;
 39946                                  ; Time is in CX:DX. Go drop it into the string.
 39947                                  ;
 39948                                  	;les	di,EndPtr		; point to the string
 39949 00007235 C47EFC                  	les	di,[BP-4]
 39950 00007238 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx

 39952 0000723D 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx

 39956                                  	;LDS	DX,FilPtr		; get name

 39962 0000724F 5D                      	pop	bp
 39963 00007250 7319                    	JNC	short CreateDone	; failed, go try again
 39964                                  
 39965                                  ; The operation failed and the error has been mapped in AX. Grab the extended
 39966                                  ; error and figure out what to do.
 39967                                  
 39968                                  	;; MSDOS 3.3			; M049 - start
 39969                                  ;;	mov	ax,[ss:EXTERR]				;smr;SS Override
 39970                                  ;;	cmp	al,error_file_exists

 39983                                  					;    to the network drive. Note that
 39984                                  					;    the redir will set the exterr
 39985                                  					;    to error_cannot_make if this is 
 39986                                  					;    so.

 40001                                  	;jmp	short CreateLoop

 40038                                  ;Break	<Extended_Open- Extended open the file>
 40039                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40040                                  ; Input: AL= 0 reserved  AH=6CH
 40041                                  ;	 BX= mode
 40042                                  ;	 CL= create attribute  CH=search attribute (from server)
 40043                                  ;	 DX= flag
 40044                                  ;	 DS:SI = file name
 40045                                  ;	 ES:DI = parm list
 40046                                  ;			   DD  SET EA list (-1) null
 40047                                  ;			   DW  n  parameters
 40048                                  ;			   DB  type (TTTTTTLL)
 40049                                  ;			   DW  IOMODE

 40053                                  ;		     CX=1 file opened

 40262                                  ;BREAK <$LockOper - Lock Calls>
 40263                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40264                                  ;
 40265                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 40266                                  ;	    MOV     BX, Handle	       (DOS 3.3)
 40267                                  ;	    MOV     CX, OffsetHigh
 40268                                  ;	    MOV     DX, OffsetLow
 40269                                  ;	    MOV     SI, LengthHigh
 40270                                  ;	    MOV     DI, LengthLow
 40271                                  ;	    MOV     AH, LockOper
 40272                                  ;	    MOV     AL, Request
 40273                                  ;	    INT     21h
 40274                                  ;
 40275                                  ;   Error returns:
 40276                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 40277                                  ;	       = error_invalid_function
 40278                                  ;	       = error_lock_violation
 40279                                  ;
 40280                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 40281                                  ;	    MOV     AX, 5C??	       (DOS 4.00)
 40282                                  ;
 40283                                  ;				    0? lock all
 40284                                  ;				    8? lock write
 40285                                  ;				    ?2 lock multiple
 40286                                  ;				    ?3 unlock multiple
 40287                                  ;				    ?4 lock/read
 40288                                  ;				    ?5 write/unlock
 40289                                  ;				    ?6 add (lseek EOF/lock/write/unlock)
 40290                                  ;	    MOV     BX, Handle
 40291                                  ;	    MOV     CX, count or size
 40292                                  ;	    LDS     DX, buffer
 40293                                  ;	    INT     21h
 40294                                  ;
 40295                                  ;   Error returns:
 40296                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 40297                                  ;	       = error_invalid_function
 40298                                  ;	       = error_lock_violation
 40299                                  ;
