 41988                                  	; 28/12/2022
 41989                                  	;jmp	short ExePackPatch
 41990                                  
 41991                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 41992                                  ;
 41993                                  ; Procedure Name 	: ExePackPatch
 41994                                  ;
 41995                                  ; Inputs	 	: DS 			-> DOSDATA
 41996                                  ;			  ES:0 			-> read in image
 41997                                  ;			  ax:cx = start cs:ip of program
 41998                                  ; Output		:		
 41999                                  ;
 42000                                  ;	1. If ES <= 0fffh
 42001                                  ;	   2. if exepack signature ('RB') found
 42002                                  ;	      3. if common code to patch compares (for 3 diff. versions)
 42003                                  ;	       	 4. if rest of the code & checksum compares
 42004                                  ;	  	    5. overlay buggy code with code in 
 42005                                  ;		       doscode:str1.
 42006                                  ;		 6. endif
 42007                                  ;	      7. endif
 42008                                  ;	   8. endif
 42009                                  ;	9. endif
 42010                                  ;
 42011                                  ;
 42012                                  ; Uses			: NONE
 42013                                  ;
 42014                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 42015                                  		
 42016                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42017                                  	; 23/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 42018                                  ExePackPatch:
 42019 00007685 53                      	push	bx
 42020 00007686 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; bx has load segment
 42021 00007688 81FBFF0F                	cmp	bx,0FFFh		; Q: is the load segment > 64K
 42022 0000768C 7602                    	jbe	short ep_cont		; N: 
 42023 0000768E 5B                      	pop	bx			; Y: no need to patch
 42024 0000768F C3                      	retn
 42025                                  ep_cont:
 42026 00007690 1E                      	push	ds
 42027 00007691 06                      	push	es
 42028 00007692 50                      	push	ax
 42029 00007693 51                      	push	cx
 42030 00007694 56                      	push	si
 42031 00007695 57                      	push	di
 42032                                  	
 42033                                  		; M033 - start
 42034                                  		; exepacked programs have an IP of 12h (>=2)
 42035                                  
 42036 00007696 83E902                  	sub	cx,2			; Q: is IP >=2 
 42037 00007699 7303                    	jnb	short epp_1		; N: exit
 42038 0000769B E9C500                  	jmp	ep_notpacked
 42039                                  					; ax:cx now points to location of
 42040                                  					; 'RB' if this is an exepacked file.
 42041                                  		; M033 - end
 42042                                  epp_1:
 42043 0000769E 89CF                    	mov	di,cx
 42044 000076A0 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 42045 000076A2 36893E[8700]            	mov	[ss:UNPACK_OFFSET],di	; save pointer to 'RB' in 
 42046                                  					; unpack_offset
 42047                                  
 42048 000076A7 26813D5242              	cmp	word [es:di],'RB' ; 4252h
 42049                                  	;ljne	ep_notpacked
 42050 000076AC 7403                    	je	short epp_2
 42051 000076AE E9B200                  	jmp	ep_notpacked
 42052                                  epp_2:
 42053 000076B1 0E                      	push	cs
 42054 000076B2 1F                      	pop	ds			; set ds to cs
 42055                                  
 42056                                  	;add	di,6Ch

 42207                                  ; 	Procedure Name	: chk_common_str
 42208                                  ;
 42209                                  ;	Input		: DS = DOSCODE
 42210                                  ;			; ES:DI points to string in packed file
 42211                                  ;

 42223 00007771 F3A6                    	repe	cmpsb	       
 42224                                  
 42225                                  					; M046 - start
 42226                                  	; a fourth possible version of these exepacked programs have a 
 42227                                  	; 056h instead of 06Bh. See scan_com above
 42228                                  	;
 42229                                  	; 	db  75h, 6Bh		;jne CorruptExe		
 42230                                  	;

 42232                                  	; we shall try to match the rest of the string

 42237 0000777A 7502                    	jnz	short ccs_done

 42240                                  ccs_done:				; M046 - end
 42241 0000777E C3                      	retn

 42243                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42244                                  ;
 42245                                  ;	Procedure Name	: chk_patchsum
 42246                                  ;
 42247                                  ;	Input		: DS:SI -> string we're looking for
 42248                                  ;			: ES:DI -> offset in packed file
 42249                                  ;			: CX 	= scan length
 42250                                  ;			: BX	= length of check sum
 42251                                  ;			: AX 	= value of check sum
 42252                                  ;
 42253                                  ;	Output		: if patch & check sum compare
 42254                                  ;				NC
 42255                                  ;			  else
 42256                                  ;				CY
 42257                                  ;
 42258                                  ;	Uses		: AX, BX, CX, SI
 42259                                  ;
 42260                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42261                                  
 42262                                  	; 23/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42263                                  chk_patchsum:
 42264 0000777F 57                      	push	di
 42265                                  
 42266 00007780 F3A6                    	repe	cmpsb			   
 42267                                  
 42268 00007782 7518                    	jnz	short cp_fail		; Q: does the patch match
 42269                                  					; N: exit
 42270                                  					; Y:	
 42271                                  
 42272                                  		; we do a check sum starting from the location of the 
 42273                                  		; exepack signature 'RB' up to 11c/2 bytes, the end of the
 42274                                  		; unpacking code.
 42275                                  
 42276 00007784 368B3E[8700]            	mov	di,[ss:UNPACK_OFFSET]	; di -> start of unpack code
 42277 00007789 89D9                    	mov	cx,bx			; cx = length of check sum
 42278                                  
 42279 0000778B 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax			; save check sum passed to us in bx
 42280 0000778D 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 42281                                  ep_chksum:
 42282 0000778F 260305                  	add	ax,[es:di]
 42283 00007792 83C702                  	add	di,2
 42284 00007795 E2F8                    	loop	ep_chksum
 42285                                  
 42286 00007797 5F                      	pop	di			; restore di
 42287                                  
 42288 00007798 39D8                    	cmp	ax,bx		 	; Q: does the check sum match
 42289                                  	;jne	short cp_fail		; N: exit
 42290                                  					; Y: 
 42291                                  	; 25/09/2023
 42292                                  	;clc	
 42293                                  	;retn
 42294 0000779A 74E2                    	je	short ccs_done ; cf=0
 42295                                  	
 42296                                  cp_fail:
 42297 0000779C F9                      	stc
 42298 0000779D C3                      	retn

 42304                                  
 42305                                  ; M020 : BEGIN
 42306                                  ;
 42307                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42308                                  ;
 42309                                  ; procedure : RationalPatch
 42310                                  ;
 42311                                  ; A routine (in Ration DOS extender) which is invoked at hardware interrupts
 42312                                  ; clobbers CX register on 286 machines. (123 release 3 uses Rational DOS
 42313                                  ; extender). This routine identifies Buggy Rational EXEs and fixes the bug.
 42314                                  ;
 42315                                  ; THE BUG is in the following code sequence:
 42316                                  ;
 42317                                  ;8b 0e 10 00	mov	cx, ds:[10h]		; delay count
 42318                                  ;90		even				; word align
 42319                                  ;e2 fe		loop	$			; wait		CLOBBERS CX
 42320                                  ;e8 xx xx	call	set_A20			; enable A20
 42321                                  ;
 42322                                  ; This patch routine replaces the mov & the loop with a far call into a
 42323                                  ; routine in DOS data segment which is in low memory (because A20 line
 42324                                  ; is off). The routine (RatBugCode) in DOS data saves & restores CX around
 42325                                  ; a mov & loop.
 42326                                  ;
 42327                                  ; Identification of Buggy Rational EXE
 42328                                  ; ====================================
 42329                                  ;
 42330                                  ; (ALL OFFSETS ARE IN THE PROGRAM SECTION - EXCLUDING THE EXE HEADER)
 42331                                  ;
 42332                                  ; OFFSET				Contains
 42333                                  ; ------				--------
 42334                                  ; 0000h			100 times Version number in binary
 42335                                  ;			bug exists in version 3.48 thru 3.83 (both inclusive)
 42336                                  ;
 42337                                  ; 000ah			the WORDS : 0000h, 0020h, 0000h, 0040h, 0001h
 42338                                  ;
 42339                                  ; 002ah			offset where version number is stored in ASCII
 42340                                  ;				e.g. '3.48A'
 42341                                  ;
 42342                                  ; 0030h			offset of copyright string. Copyright strings either
 42343                                  ;			start with "DOS/16M Copyright...." or
 42344                                  ;			"Copyright.....". The string contains
 42345                                  ;			"Rational Systems, Inc."
 42346                                  ;
 42347                                  ; 0020h			word : Paragraph offset of the buggy code segment
 42348                                  ;				from the program image
 42349                                  ; 0016h			word : size of buggy code segment
 42350                                  ;
 42351                                  ;	Buggy code is definite to start after offset 200h in its segment
 42352                                  ;
 42353                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42354                                  
 42355                                  ; 23/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42356                                  ; DOSCODE:B976h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 42357                                  
 42358                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42359                                  ; DOSCODE:B654h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 42360                                  
 42361                                  RScanPattern1:
 42362                                  	db	0, 0, 20h, 0, 0, 0, 40h, 0, 1, 0
 42363                                  
 42364                                  RLen1 equ $ - RScanPattern1
 42365                                  
 42366                                  RScanPattern2:
 42367                                  	db	8Bh, 0Eh, 10h, 00h, 90h, 0E2h, 0FEh, 0E8h
 42368                                  
 42369                                  RLen2 equ $ - RScanPattern2
 42370                                  
 42371                                  RScanPattern3:
 42372                                  	db	8Bh, 0Eh, 10h, 00h, 0E2h, 0FEh, 0E8h
 42373                                  
 42374                                  RLen3 equ $ - RScanPattern2
 42375                                  
 42376                                  ; DOSCODE:B98Fh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 42377                                  ; DOSCODE:B66Dh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 42378                                  
 42379                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42380                                  ;
 42381                                  ; INPUT : ES = segment where program got loaded
 42382                                  ;
 42383                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42384                                  
 42385                                  RationalPatch:
 42386                                  	cld
 42387                                  	push	ax
 42388                                  	push	bx
 42389                                  	push	cx
 42390                                  	push	dx
 42391                                  	push	si
 42392                                  	push	di
 42393                                  	push	es
 42394                                  	push	ds			; we use all of them
 42395                                  	mov	di,0Ah			; look for pat1 at offset 0Ah
 42396                                  	push	cs
 42397                                  	pop	ds
 42398                                  	
 42399                                  	mov	si,RScanPattern1
 42400                                  	;mov	cx,10
 42401                                  	mov	cx,RLen1
 42402                                  	rep	cmpsb			; do we have the pattern ?
 42403                                  	jne	short rpexit
 42404                                  	mov	ax,[es:0]
 42405                                  	cmp	ax,348			; is it a buggy version ?
 42406                                  	jb	short rpexit
 42407                                  	cmp	ax,383			; is it a buggy version
 42408                                  	ja	short rpexit
 42409                                  
 42410                                  	call	VerifyVersion
 42411                                  	jne	short rpexit
 42412                                  
 42413                                  	mov	cx,[es:16h]		; Length of buggy code seg
 42414                                  	sub	cx,200h			; Length we search (we start
 42415                                  					;  at offset 200h)
 42416                                  	mov	es,[es:20h]		; es=buggy code segment
 42417                                  	mov	si,RScanPattern2
 42418                                  	;mov	dx,8	
 42419                                  	mov	dx,RLen2
 42420                                  	call	ScanCodeSeq		; look for code seq with nop
 42421                                  	jz	short rpfound
 42422                                  
 42423                                  	mov	si,RScanPattern3
 42424                                  	;mov	dx,15
 42425                                  	mov	dx,RLen3
 42426                                  	call	ScanCodeSeq		; look for code seq w/o nop
 42427                                  	jnz	short rpexit
 42428                                  
 42429                                  rpfound:
 42430                                  	
 42431                                  ;	we set up a far call into DOS data
 42432                                  ;	dx has the length of the code seq we were searching for
 42433                                  
 42434                                  	mov	al,9Ah			; far call opcode
 42435                                  	stosb
 42436                                  	mov	ax,RatBugCode
 42437                                  	stosw
 42438                                  	mov	ax,ss
 42439                                  	stosw
 42440                                  	mov	cx,dx
 42441                                  	sub	cx,6			; filler (with NOPs)
 42442                                  	mov	al,90h
 42443                                  	rep	stosb
 42444                                  rpexit:
 42445                                  	pop	ds
 42446                                  	pop	es
 42447                                  	pop	di
 42448                                  	pop	si
 42449                                  	pop	dx
 42450                                  	pop	cx
 42451                                  	pop	bx
 42452                                  	pop	ax
 42453                                  	retn
 42454                                  
 42455                                  ; M020 END
 42456                                  
 42457                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42458                                  ; (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42459                                  
 42460                                  ; DOSCODE:B6D8h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 42461                                  
 42462                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42463                                  ;
 42464                                  ; ScanCodeSeq
 42465                                  ;
 42466                                  ; Looks for a pattern pointed to by DS:SI & len DX in ES:200 to ES:200+CX-1
 42467                                  ;
 42468                                  ; returns in ES:DI the start of the pattern if Zero flag is set
 42469                                  ;
 42470                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42471                                  
 42472                                  ScanCodeSeq:
 42473                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42474                                  	mov	di,200h
 42475                                  ;ScanCodeSeq_di:
 42476                                  	push	cx
 42477                                  	sub	cx,dx
 42478                                  	inc	cx
 42479                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42480                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42481                                  	;mov	di,200h
 42482                                  scsagain:
 42483                                  	push	si
 42484                                  	push	di
 42485                                  	push	cx
 42486                                  	mov	cx,dx
 42487                                  	rep	cmpsb
 42488                                  	pop	cx
 42489                                  	pop	di
 42490                                  	pop	si
 42491                                  	je	short scsfound
 42492                                  	inc	di
 42493                                  	loop	scsagain
 42494                                  scsfound:
 42495                                  	pop	cx
 42496                                  vvexit:		; 18/12/2022
 42497                                  	retn
 42498                                  
 42499                                  
 42500                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42501                                  ; (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42502                                  
 42503                                  ; DOSCODE:B6F0h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 42504                                  
 42505                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42506                                  ;
 42507                                  ; VerifyVersion
 42508                                  ;
 42509                                  ; Checks whether the binary version from ES:0 matches the ASCII version
 42510                                  ; from ES:2A.
 42511                                  ;
 42512                                  ;       Entry: AX = binary version number 
 42513                                  ;       Exit : Z flag set if version numbers match
 42514                                  ;
 42515                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42516                                  
 42517                                  VerifyVersion:
 42518                                  	mov	si,[es:2Ah]		; offset of version number
 42519                                  					;  in ascii
 42520                                  	mov	bl,10
 42521                                  	add	si,3			; point to last digit
 42522                                  
 42523                                  	call	VVDigit
 42524                                  	jne	short vvexit
 42525                                  	call	VVDigit
 42526                                  	jne	short vvexit
 42527                                  	cmp	byte [es:si],'.' ; 2Eh
 42528                                  	jne	short vvexit
 42529                                  	dec	si
 42530                                  	;call	VVDigit
 42531                                  	; 18/12/2022
 42532                                  	;jmp	short VVDigit
 42533                                  ;vvexit:
 42534                                  	;retn
 42535                                  VVDigit:
 42536                                  	div	bl
 42537                                  	add	ah,'0' ; 30h
 42538                                  	dec	si
 42539                                  	cmp	[es:si+1],ah
 42540                                  	mov	ah,0			; do not xor or sub we need Z
 42541                                  	retn
 42542                                  
 42543                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 42544                                  %endif	; 28/12/2022
 42545                                  
 42546                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42547                                  ;
 42548                                  ;	M068
 42549                                  ;
 42550                                  ; 	Procedure Name	: IsCopyProt
 42551                                  ;
 42552                                  ;	Inputs		: DS:100 -> start of com file just read in
 42553                                  ;
 42554                                  ;	Outputs		: sets the A20OFF_COUNT variable to 10 if 
 42555                                  ;			  the program loaded in DS:100 uses a MICROSOFT
 42556                                  ;			  copy protect scheme that relies on the A20 line
 42557                                  ;			  being turned off for it's scheme to work.
 42558                                  ;
 42559                                  ;			  Note: The int 21 function dispatcher will turn 
 42560                                  ;				a20 off, if the A20OFF_COUNT is non-zero 
 42561                                  ;				and dec the A20OFF_COUNT before	iretting 
 42562                                  ;				to the user. 
 42563                                  ;
 42564                                  ;	Uses		: ES, DI, SI, CX
 42565                                  ;
 42566                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42567                                  
 42568                                  ; 23/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42569                                  
 42570                                  CPStartOffset	EQU	0175h
 42571                                  CPID1Offset	EQU	011Bh
 42572                                  CPID2Offset	EQU	0173h
 42573                                  CPID3Offset	EQU	0146h
 42574                                  CPID4Offset	EQU	0124h
 42575                                  ID1		EQU	05343h
 42576                                  ID2		EQU	05044h
 42577                                  ID3		EQU	0F413h
 42578                                  ID4		EQU	08000h
 42579                                  
 42580                                  ; DOSCODE:B9FAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 42581                                  
 42582                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42583                                  ; DOSCODE:B71Ch (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 42584                                  
 42585                                  CPScanPattern:
 42586 0000779E 89264801                	db	89h,26h,48h,01h		 ; mov [148],sp
 42587 000077A2 8C0E4C01                	db	8Ch,0Eh,4Ch,01h		 ; mov [14C],cs
 42588 000077A6 C7064A010001            	db	0C7h,06h,4Ah,01h,00h,01h ; mov [14A],100h 
 42589 000077AC 8C0E1301                	db 	8Ch,0Eh,13h,01h		 ; mov [113],cs
 42590 000077B0 B82001                  	db	0B8h,20h,01h		 ; mov ax,120h
 42591 000077B3 BE0001                  	db	0BEh,00h,01h		 ; mov si,100h
 42592

 43534                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43535                                  ;
 43536                                  ;	check_XMM: routine to check presence of XMM driver
 43537                                  ;
 43538                                  ;	Exit:   Sets up the XMM entry point in XMMcontrol in DOSDATA
 43539                                  ;
 43540                                  ;	USED:	none
 43541                                  ;
 43542                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43543                                  
 43544                                  check_XMM: ; proc near
 43545                                  ;
 43546                                  ; determine whether or not an XMM driver is installed
 43547                                  ;
 43548 00007AE6 50                      	push	ax
 43549                                  	;mov	ax,(XMM_MULTIPLEX<<8)+XMM_INSTALL_CHECK
 43550 00007AE7 B80043                  	mov	ax,4300h
 43551 00007AEA CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 43552                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - INSTALLATION CHECK
 43553                                  		; Return: AL = 80h XMS driver installed
 43554                                  		; AL <> 80h no driver
 43555 00007AEC 3C80                    	cmp	al,80h			; Q: installed
 43556 00007AEE 751D                    	jne	short cXMM_no_driver	; N: set error, quit
 43557                                  ;
 43558                                  ; get the XMM control functions entry point, save it, we
 43559                                  ; need to call it later.
 43560                                  ;
 43561 00007AF0 53                      	push	bx
 43562 00007AF1 52                      	push	dx
 43563 00007AF2 1E                      	push	ds
 43564 00007AF3 06                      	push	es
 43565                                  	;mov	ax,(XMM_MULTIPLEX<<8)+XMM_FUNCTION_ADDR
 43566 00007AF4 B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 43567 00007AF7 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 43568                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 43569                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 43570                                  
 43571 00007AF9 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 43572                                  
 43573 00007AFE 891E[8F11]              	mov	[XMMcontrol],bx
 43574 00007B02 8C06[9111]              	mov	[XMMcontrol+2],es
 43575                                  cXMMexit:
 43576 00007B06 F8                      	clc
 43577 00007B07 07                      	pop	es
 43578 00007B08 1F                      	pop	ds
 43579 00007B09 5A                      	pop	dx
 43580 00007B0A 5B                      	pop	bx
 43581 00007B0B 58                      	pop	ax
 43582 00007B0C C3                      	retn				; done
 43583                                  ;
 43584                                  ; set carry if XMM driver not present
 43585                                  ;
 43586                                  cXMM_no_driver:
 43587 00007B0D F9                      	stc
 43588 00007B0E 58                      	pop	ax
 43589 00007B0F C3                      	retn

 43615                                  				; has been called. (0 or 1)

 43618                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BAB7h

 43731                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43732                                  ;
 43733                                  ; Procedure Name : WhatCPUType
 43734                                  ;
 43735                                  ; Inputs	 : none
 43736                                  ;
 43737                                  ; Outputs	 : AL = 0 if CPU <  286
 43738                                  ;		      = 1 if CPU == 286
 43739                                  ;		      = 2 if CPU >= 386
 43740                                  ;
 43741                                  ; Regs. Mod.	 : AX
 43742                                  ;
 43743                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43744                                  
 43745                                  WhatCPUType:
 43746                                  	; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 43747                                  	;get_cpu_type	; done with a MACRO which can't be generated > once
 43748                                  
 43749                                  	;CPUTYPE.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 43750                                  
 43751                                  ; Note: this must be a macro, and not a subroutine in the BIOS since
 43752                                  ; 	it is called from both CODE and SYSINITSEG.
 43753                                  ;
 43754                                  ;------GET_CPU_TYPE-----------------------------------May, 88 by M.Williamson
 43755                                  ;  Returns: AX = 0 if 8086 or 8088
 43756                                  ;              = 1 if 80286
 43757                                  ;              = 2 if 80386
 43758                                  
 43759                                  	; 04/11/2022
 43760                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BB03h
 43761                                  
 43762                                  Get_CPU_Type:	;macro
 43763                                  	pushf
 43764                                  	push	bx			; preserve bx
 43765                                  	xor	bx,bx			; init bx to zero
 43766                                  
 43767                                  	xor	ax,ax			; 0000 into AX
 43768                                  	push	ax			; put it on the stack...
 43769                                  	popf				; ...then shove it into the flags
 43770                                  	pushf				; get it back out of the flags...
 43771                                  	pop	ax			; ...and into ax
 43772                                  	and	ax,0F000h		; mask off high four bits
 43773                                  	cmp	ax,0F000h		; was it all 1's?
 43774                                  	je	short cpu_8086		; aye; it's an 8086 or 8088
 43775                                  
 43776                                  	mov	ax,0F000h		; now try to set the high four bits..
 43777                                  	push	ax
 43778                                  	popf
 43779                                  	pushf
 43780                                  	pop	ax			; ...and see what happens
 43781                                  	and	ax,0F000h		; any high bits set ?
 43782                                  	jz	short cpu_286		; nay; it's an 80286
 43783                                  
 43784                                  cpu_386:				; bx starts as zero
 43785                                  	inc	bx			; inc twice if 386
 43786                                  cpu_286:				; just inc once if 286
 43787                                  	inc	bx
 43788                                  cpu_8086:				; don't inc at all if 086
 43789                                  	mov	ax,bx			; put CPU type value in ax
 43790                                  	pop	bx			; restore original bx
 43791                                  	popf
 43792                                  	
 43793                                  	;endm
 43794                                  
 43795                                  	; 04/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43796                                  	retn	; 19/09/2023
 43797                                  
 43798                                  ; 19/09/2023
 43799                                  ;	; 04/11/2022
 43800                                  ;	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BB27h
 43801                                  ;	cmp	al,1
 43802                                  ;	jne	short sr_done 		; we need Rational Patch only
 43803                                  ;					;  on 286 systems
 43804                                  ;	mov	word [RationalPatchPtr],RationalPatch
 43805                                  
 43806                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43807                                  %endif	; 28/12/2022

 43809                                  	; 19/09/2023

 44171                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44172                                  ;
 44173                                  ; 	Procedure Name	:	patch_in_nops
 44174                                  ;
 44175                                  ; 	Entry		: 	ES -> DOSDATA
 44176                                  ;
 44177                                  ;	Regs Mod	: 	cx, di
 44178                                  ;
 44179                                  ;	Description:
 44180                                  ;		This routine patches in 2 nops at the offsets specified in 
 44181                                  ;	patch_table. This basically enables the low mem stub to start 
 44182                                  ;	making XMS calls.
 44183                                  ;
 44184                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44185                                  
 44186                                  	; 04/11/2022
 44187                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 44188                                  	; DOSCODE:0BC50h
 44189                                  
 44190                                  patch_table:	; label	byte
 44191                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i0patch
 44192                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i20patch
 44193                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i21patch
 44194                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i25patch
 44195                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i26patch
 44196                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i27patch
 44197                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i2fpatch
 44198                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:cpmpatch
 44199 00007C55 [B610]                  	dw	i0patch
 44200 00007C57 [C010]                  	dw	i20patch
 44201 00007C59 [CA10]                  	dw	i21patch
 44202 00007C5B [D410]                  	dw	i25patch
 44203 00007C5D [DE10]                  	dw	i26patch
 44204 00007C5F [E810]                  	dw	i27patch
 44205 00007C61 [F210]                  	dw	i2fpatch
 44206 00007C63 [FC10]                  	dw	cpmpatch
 44207                                  
 44208                                  patch_table_size equ ($-patch_table)/2
 44209                                  
 44210                                  patch_in_nops:
 44211 00007C65 50                      	push	ax
 44212 00007C66 56                      	push	si
 44213 00007C67 BE[557C]                	mov	si,patch_table
 44214 00007C6A B89090                  	mov	ax,9090h ; nop, nop
 44215                                  	; 17/12/2022
 44216                                  	; cx = 0
 44217                                  	;mov	cx,8
 44218                                  	;mov	cx,patch_table_size ; 8
 44219 00007C6D B108                    	mov	cl,patch_table_size ; 8
 44220                                  pin_loop:
 44221 00007C6F 2E8B3C                  	mov	di,[cs:si]
 44222 00007C72 AB                      	stosw
 44223                                  	;add	si,2
 44224                                  	; 17/12/2022
 44225 00007C73 46                      	inc	si
 44226 00007C74 46                      	inc	si
 44227 00007C75 E2F8                    	loop	pin_loop
 44228 00007C77 5E                      	pop	si
 44229 00007C78 58                      	pop	ax
 44230 00007C79 C3                      	retn

 44321                                  ;Break <Initialized data and data used at DOS initialization>
 44322                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44323                                  
 44324                                  ; We need to identify the parts of the data area that are relevant to tasks
 44325                                  ; and those that are relevant to the system as a whole. Under 3.0, the system
 44326                                  ; data will be gathered with the system code. The process data under 2.x will
 44327                                  ; be available for swapping and under 3.0 it will be allocated per-process.
 44328                                  ;
 44329                                  ; The data that is system data will be identified by [SYSTEM] in the comments
 44330                                  ; describing that data item.

 44426                                  ;; 16/07/2018
 44427                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 44428                                  ;; NOTE: INT 21H AH=52H !  (http://stanislavs.org/helppc/int_21-52.html)
 44429                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 44430                                  ;; INT 21,52 - Get Pointer to DOS "INVARS" (Undocumented)
 44431                                  ;;
 44432                                  ;;	AH = 52h
 44433                                  ;;
 44434                                  ;;	on return:
 44435                                  ;;	ES:BX = pointer to DOS "invars", a table of pointers used by DOS.
 44436                                  ;;		Known "invars" fields follow (varies with DOS version):
 44437                                  ;;
 44438                                  ;;	Offset Size		 Description
 44439                                  ;;
 44440                                  ;;	 -12   word   sharing retry count (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 44441                                  ;;	 -10   word   sharing retry delay  (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 44442                                  ;;	  -8   dword  pointer to current disk buffer (DOS 3.x)
 44443                                  ;;	  -4   word   pointer in DOS code segment of unread CON input;
 44444                                  ;;		      0 indicates no unread input (DOS 3.x)
 44445                                  ;;	  -2   word   segment of first Memory Control Block (MCB)
 44446                                  ;;	  00   dword  pointer to first DRIVE PARAMETER TABLE (A:) in chain
 44447                                  ;;	  04   dword  pointer to DOS System File Table (SFT)
 44448                                  ;;	  08   dword  pointer to $CLOCK device driver
 44449                                  ;;	  0C   dword  pointer to CON device driver
 44450                                  ;;	  10   byte   number of logical drives in system
 44451                                  ;;	  11   word   maximum bytes/block of any block device
 44452                                  ;;	  13   dword  pointer to DOS cache buffer header
 44453                                  ;;	  17 18bytes  NUL device header, first 4 bytes of device header
 44454                                  ;;		      point to the next device in device chain
 44455                                  ;;
 44456                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 44457                                  
 44458                                  ; The following block of data is used by SYSINIT. 
 44459                                  ; Do not change the order or size of this block

 44548                                  ; manager ---- MOHANS
 44549                                  ;
 44550                                  	;I_am	UU_BUF_EMS_FIRST_PAGE,3,<0,0,0>  
 44551                                  UU_BUF_EMS_FIRST_PAGE:	
 44552 0000007E 000000                  	db	0,0,0	; holds the first page above 640K
 44553                                  
 44554                                  	;;I_am	UU_BUF_EMS_NPA640,WORD,<0> ; holds the number of pages 
 44555                                  ;UU_BUF_EMS_NPA640:			   ; above 640K	
 44556                                  ;	dw	0			
 44557                                  
 44558                                  CL0FATENTRY:
 44559 00000081 FFFF                    	dw	-1	; M014:	Holds the data that
 44560                                  			; is used in pack/unpack rts.
 44561                                  			; in fat.asm if cluster 0 is specified.
 44562                                  			; SR;
 44563                                  IoStatFail:
 44564 00000083 00                      	db	0	; IoStatFail has been added to 
 44565                                  			; record a fail on an I24 
 44566                                  			; issued from IOFUNC on a status call. 
 44567                                  
 44568                                  ;***	I_am	UU_BUF_EMS_MODE,BYTE,<-1>	; EMS mode 	;AN000;
 44569                                  ;***	I_am	UU_BUF_EMS_HANDLE,BYTE		; buffer EMS handle ;AN000;
 44570                                  ;***	I_am	UU_BUF_EMS_PAGE_FRAME,WORD ,<-1>; EMS page frame # ;AN000;
 44571                                  ;***	I_am	UU_BUF_EMS_SEG_CNT,WORD,<1>	; EMS seg count	;AN000;
 44572                                  ;***	I_am	UU_BUF_EMS_PFRAME,WORD		; EMS page frame seg address ;AN000;
 44573                                  ;***	I_am	UU_BUF_EMS_RESERV,WORD,<0> 	; reserved	;AN000;
 44574                                  ;
 44575                                  ;***	I_am	UU_BUF_EMS_MAP_BUFF,1,<0>	; this is not used to save the 
 44576                                  						; state of the 	buffers page.
 44577                                  						; This one byte is retained to 
 44578                                  						; keep the size of this data 
 44579                                  						; block the same.;
 44580                                  ALLOCMSAVE:
 44581 00000084 00                      	db	0	; M063: temp var. used to 
 44582                                  			; M063: save alloc method in
 44583                                  			; M063: msproc.asm
 44584                                  A20OFF_COUNT:
 44585 00000085 00                      	db	0	; M068: indiactes the # of 
 44586                                  			; M068: int 21 calls for 
 44587                                  			; M068: which A20 is off
 44588                                  DOS_FLAG:
 44589 00000086 00                      	db	0	; see DOSSYM.INC for Bit 
 44590                                  			; definitions
 44591                                  UNPACK_OFFSET:
 44592 00000087 0000                    	dw	0	; saves pointer to the start
 44593                                  			; of unpack code in exepatch.
 44594                                  			; asm.
 44595                                  UMBFLAG:
 44596 00000089 00                      	db	0 	; M003: bit 0 indicates the 
 44597                                  			; M003: link state of the UMBs
 44598                                  			; M003: whether linked or not 
 44599                                  			; M003: to the DOS arena chain
 44600                                  SAVE_AX:
 44601 0000008A 0000                    	dw	0	; M000: temp varibale to store ax
 44602                                  			; M000: in msproc.asm
 44603                                  UMB_HEAD:
 44604 0000008C FFFF                    	dw	-1	; M000: this is initialized to  
 44605                                  			; M000: the first umb arena by 
 44606                                  			; M000: BIOS sysinit.
 44607                                  START_ARENA:
 44608 0000008E 0100                    	dw	1	; M000: this is the first arena 
 44609                                  			; M000: from which DOS will 
 44610                                  			; M000: start its scan for alloc.
 44611

 44667                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0 
 44668                                  ; 16/07/2018 - Retro DOS 3.0	
 44669                                  
 44670                                  ;Break <Initialized data and data used at DOS initialization>
 44671                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44672                                  
 44673                                  ; We need to identify the parts of the data area that are relevant to tasks
 44674                                  ; and those that are relevant to the system as a whole.  Under 3.0, the system
 44675                                  ; data will be gathered with the system code.  The process data under 2.x will
 44676                                  ; be available for swapping and under 3.0 it will be allocated per-process.
 44677                                  ;
 44678                                  ; The data that is system data will be identified by [SYSTEM] in the comments
 44679                                  ; describing that data item.
 44680                                  
 44681                                  ;DOSDATA SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 44682                                  
 44683                                  ;
 44684                                  ; Table of routines for assignable devices
 44685                                  ;
 44686                                  ; MSDOS allows assignment if the following standard devices:
 44687                                  ;   stdin  (usually CON input)
 44688                                  ;   stdout (usually CON output)
 44689                                  ;   auxin  (usually AUX input)
 44690                                  ;   auxout (usually AUX output)
 44691                                  ;   stdlpt (usually PRN output)
 44692                                  ;
 44693                                  ; SPECIAL NOTE:
 44694                                  ;   Status of a file is a strange idea. We choose to handle it in this manner:
 44695                                  ;   If we're not at end-of-file, then we always say that we have a character.
 44696                                  ;   Otherwise, we return ^Z as the character and set the ZERO flag. In this
 44697                                  ;   manner we can support program written under the old DOS (they use ^Z as EOF
 44698                                  ;   on devices) and programs written under the new DOS (they use the ZERO flag
 44699                                  ;   as EOF).
 44700                                  
 44701                                  ; Default SFTs for boot up
 44702                                  
 44703                                  		;PUBLIC	SFTABL
 44704                                  
 44705                                  SFTABL:	   ; LABEL   DWORD		; [SYSTEM] file table
 44706 000000CC FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link to next table
 44707 000000CE FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link seg to next table
 44708 000000D0 0500                    		DW sf_default_number	; [SYSTEM] Number of entries in table
 44709                                  		;times 295 db 0 ; MSDOS 6.0
 44710 000000D2 00<rep 127h>            		times (sf_default_number*sf_entry_size) db 0
 44711                                  
 44712                                  ; the next two variables relate to the position of the logical stdout/stdin
 44713                                  ; cursor. They are only meaningful when stdin/stdout are assigned to the
 44714                                  ; console.
 44715                                  		; DOSDATA:01F9h (MSDOS 6.21)
 44716 000001F9 00                      CARPOS:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] cursor position in stdin
 44717 000001FA 00                      STARTPOS:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] position of cursor at beginning
 44718                                  					;	   of buffered input call
 44719 000001FB 00<rep 80h>             INBUF:		times 128 db 0		; [SYSTEM] general device input buffer
 44720 0000027B 00<rep 83h>             CONBUF:		times 131 db 0		; [SYSTEM] The rest of INBUF and console buffer
 44721                                  		; DOSDATA:02FEh (MSDOS 6.21)
 44722 000002FE 00                      PFLAG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] printer echoing flag
 44723 000002FF 00                      VERFLG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] Initialize with verify off
 44724 00000300 03                      CHARCO:		db 00000011b		; [SYSTEM] Allows statchks every 4 chars...
 44725                                  switch_character:
 44726 00000301 2F                      chSwitch:	db '/'			; UNUSED - obsolete datum, can be reused
 44727 00000302 00                      AllocMethod:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] how to alloc first(best)last
 44728 00000303 00                      fShare:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] TRUE => sharing installed
 44729 00000304 01                      DIFFNAM:	db 1			; [SYSTEM] Indicates when MYNAME has changed
 44730 00000305 20<rep 10h>             MYNAME:		times 16 db 20h		; [SYSTEM] My network name
 44731

 44740

 44744                                  ;

 44927                                  ;============================================================================
 44928                                  ; MS_DATA.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 44929                                  ;============================================================================
 44930                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 44931                                  
 44932                                  ; Retro DOS v4.0 NOTE: (by Erdogan Tan, 25/04/2019)
 44933                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------
 44934                                  ; This data section which was named as uninitialized data
 44935                                  ; (as overlayed by initialization code) but follows 
 44936                                  ; initialized data section from DOSDATA:03B6h address
 44937                                  ; (in otherwords, the method is different than MSDOS 3.3,
 44938                                  ; and there is not overlaying..)
 44939                                  ; **********************************************************
 44940                                  ; Reference: MSDOS 6.21 kernel DOSDATA section (4970 bytes)
 44941                                  ; follows DOSCODE section in the kernel file (MSDOS.SYS) 
 44942                                  ; (it is located at offset 0BF70h, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h) 
 44943                                  ; but starts from offset 0 (ORG 0) and ends at offset 1370h.
 44944                                  ; TIMEBUF is at offset 03B6h.
 44945                                  ; **********************************************************	
 44946                                  
 44947                                  ;Break <Uninitialized data overlayed by initialization code>
 44948                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44949                                  ;DOSDATA    SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 44950                                  ; Init code overlaps with data area below
 44951                                  
 44952                                  ; 	ORG     0
 44953                                  
 44954                                  MSDAT001S:	; label byte
 44955                                  
 44956                                  ; DOSDATA:03B6h	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h+3B6h)
 44957                                  TIMEBUF: ;	times 6 db 0
 44958 000003B6 0000<rep 3h>            	times 3 dw	0		; Time read from clock device
 44959 000003BC 0000                    DEVIOBUF:	dw	0		; Buffer for I/O under file assignment
 44960                                  
 44961                                  ; The following areas are used as temp buffer in EXEC system call
 44962                                  
 44963                                  ; DOSDATA:03BEh
 44964                                  OPENBUF: ;times 64  dw	0
 44965 000003BE 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for name operations
 44966                                  RENBUF:	
 44967 0000043E 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for rename destination
 44968                                  
 44969                                  ; Buffer for search calls
 44970                                  SEARCHBUF:	
 44971 000004BE 00<rep 35h>             	times	53  db	0		; internal search buffer
 44972                                  DUMMYCDS:  ;times 88 db 0
 44973 000004F3 00<rep 58h>             	times	curdirLen db 0
 44974                                  
 44975                                  ; End of contiguous buffer
 44976                                   
 44977                                  ; Temporary directory entry for use by many routines. Device directory
 44978                                  ; entries (bogus) are built here.
 44979                                  
 44980                                  ; DOSDATA:054Bh
 44981                                  
 44982                                  DEVFCB:	; LABEL   BYTE			; Uses NAME1, NAME2, combined
 44983                                  
 44984                                  ; WARNING..  do not alter position of NAME1 relative to DEVFCB
 44985                                  ; without first examining BUILD_DEVICE_ENT. Look carefully at DOS_RENAME
 44986                                  ; as well as it is the only guy who uses NAME2 and DESTSTART.
 44987                                  
 44988                                  NAME1:	
 44989 0000054B 00<rep Ch>                      times 	12 db	0		; File name buffer
 44990                                  NAME2:
 44991 00000557 00<rep Dh>              	times	13 db	0 		;
 44992                                  DESTSTART:
 44993 00000564 0000                    	dw	0			;
 44994                                          ;DB      ((SIZE DIR_ENTRY) - ($ - DEVFCB)) DUP (?)

 45431                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>----------------------
 45432                                  
 45433                                  ; DOSDATA:0CF5h
 45434                                  
 45435                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45436                                  ;
 45437                                  ;CASE MAPPER ROUTINE FOR 80H-FFH character range, DOS 3.3
 45438                                  ;     ENTRY: AL = Character to map
 45439                                  ;     EXIT:  AL = The converted character
 45440                                  ; Alters no registers except AL and flags.
 45441                                  ; The routine should do nothing to chars below 80H.
 45442                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45443                                  ; Example:
 45444                                  
 45445                                  MAP_CASE:
 45446                                  ;Procedure MAP_CASE,FAR
 45447                                  
 45448 00000D49 3C80                    	CMP	AL,80h
 45449 00000D4B 7301                    	JAE	short Map1	;Map no chars below 80H ever
 45450 00000D4D CB                      	RETF
 45451                                  Map1:
 45452 00000D4E 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80h		;Turn into index value
 45453 00000D50 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 45454 00000D51 53                      	PUSH	BX
 45455 00000D52 BB[030B]                	MOV	BX,UCASE_TAB+2
 45456                                  FINISH:
 45457 00000D55 0E                      	PUSH	CS		;Move to DS
 45458 00000D56 1F                      	POP	DS
 45459 00000D57 D7                      	XLAT			;Get upper case character
 45460 00000D58 5B                      	POP	BX
 45461 00000D59 1F                      	POP	DS
 45462                                  L_RET:	
 45463 00000D5A CB                      	RETF
 45464                                  
 45465                                  ;EndProc MAP_CASE
 45466                                  
 45467                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45468                                  
 45469                                  ; The variables for ECS version are moved here for the same data alignments
 45470                                  ; as IBM-DOS and MS-DOS.

 45716                                  ; The redir requires the following:
 45717                                  ;
 45718                                  ;	ERR_TABLE_21	offset DDBH
 45719                                  ;	ERR_TABLE_24	offset E5BH
 45720                                  ; 	ErrMap24	offset EABH
 45721                                  ;
 45722                                  ; WARNING! WARNING!
 45723                                  ;
 45724                                  ; MARK2 SHOULD NOT BE >= 0DDBH. IF SOME VARIABLE IS TO BE ADDED ABOVE DO SO
 45725                                  ; WITHOUT VIOLATING THIS AND UPDATE THE FOLL. LINE

 45731                                  	;ORG	0DDBh
 45732                                  
 45733                                  ; DOSDATA:0DDBh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 45734                                  
 45735                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45736                                  ;
 45737                                  ; The following table defines CLASS ACTION and LOCUS info for the INT 21H
 45738                                  ; errors. Each entry is 4 bytes long:
 45739                                  ;
 45740                                  ;       Err#,Class,Action,Locus
 45741                                  ;
 45742                                  ; A value of 0FFh indicates a call specific value (ie. should already
 45743                                  ; be set). AN ERROR CODE NOT IN THE TABLE FALLS THROUGH TO THE CATCH ALL AT
 45744                                  ; THE END, IT IS ASSUMES THAT CLASS, ACTION, LOCUS IS ALREADY SET.
 45745                                  ;
 45746                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45747                                  
 45748                                  ;ErrTab  Macro   err,class,action,locus
 45749                                  ;ifidn <locus>,<0FFh>
 45750                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,0FFh
 45751                                  ;ELSE
 45752                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,errLOC_&locus
 45753                                  ;ENDIF
 45754                                  ;ENDM

 46040                                  
 46041                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 46042                                  ; 04/11/2022
 46043                                  ; DOSDATA:1044h (MSDOS 6.21 & MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 46044                                  
 46045                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46046                                  ; Patch for Sidekick
 46047                                  ;
 46048                                  ; A documented method for finding the offset of the Errormode flag in the 
 46049                                  ; dos swappable data area if for the app to scan in the dos segment (data) 
 46050                                  ; for the following sequence of instructions.
 46051                                  ;
 46052                                  ; Ref: Part C, Article 11, pg 356 of MSDOS Encyclopedia
 46053                                  ;
 46054                                  ; The Offset of Errormode flag is 0320h
 46055                                  ;
 46056                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46057                                  
 46058                                  	db	036h, 0F6h, 06h, 020h, 03h, 0FFh ; test ss:[errormode], -1
 46059                                  	db	075h, 0Ch			 ; jnz  NearLabel
 46060                                  	db	036h, 0FFh, 036h, 058h, 03h	 ; push ss:[NearWord]
 46061                                  	db	0CDh, 028h			 ; int  28h
 46062                                  
 46063                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46064                                  ; Patch for PortOfEntry - M036
 46065                                  ;
 46066                                  ; PortOfEntry by Sector Technology uses an un documented way of determining
 46067                                  ; the offset of Errormode flag. The following patch is to support them in 
 46068                                  ; DOS 5.0. The corresponding code is actually in msdisp.asm
 46069                                  ;
 46070                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46071                                  
 46072                                  	db 	080h, 03Eh, 020h, 03h, 00h 	 ; cmp 	[errormode], 0
 46073                                  	db	075h, 037h			 ; jnz	NearLabel
 46074                                  	db 	0BCh, 0A0h, 0Ah		  	 ; mov	sp, dosdata:iostack
 46075                                  
 46076                                  %endif ; 29/12/2022

 46133                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46134                                  ;
 46135                                  ; LOW MEM STUB:
 46136                                  ;
 46137                                  ; The low mem stub contains the entry points into DOS for all interrupts 
 46138                                  ; handled by DOS. This stub is installed if the user specifies that the 
 46139                                  ; DOS load in HIMEM. Each entry point does this.
 46140                                  ;
 46141                                  ; 	1. if jmp to 8 has been patched out
 46142                                  ;	   2. if A20 OFF
 46143                                  ;	      3. Enable A20
 46144                                  ;	   4. else 
 46145                                  ;	      5. just go to dos entry
 46146                                  ;	   6. endif
 46147                                  ;	7. else
 46148                                  ;	   8. just go to dos entry
 46149                                  ;	9. endif
 46150                                  ;
 46151                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46152                                  
 46153                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 46154                                  
 46155                                  ; DOSDATA:108Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 46156                                  
 46157                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46158                                  ;
 46159                                  ; DIVIDE BY 0 handler
 46160                                  ;
 46161                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46162                                  
 46163                                  ldivov:
 46164                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 46165                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 46166                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 46167                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 46168                                  i0patch:
 46169 000010B6 EB03                    	jmp	short divov_cont
 46170                                  
 46171 000010B8 E8D800                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 46172                                  divov_cont:
 46173 000010BB 2EFF2E[8E10]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE]	; jmp to DOS
 46174                                  
 46175                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46176                                  ;
 46177                                  ; INT 20 Handler
 46178                                  ;
 46179                                  ; Here we do not have to set up the stack to return here as the abort call
 46180                                  ; will return to the address after the int 21 ah=4b call. This would be the
 46181                                  ; common exit point if A20 had been OFF (for TOGGLE DOS) and the A20 line
 46182                                  ; will be restored then.
 46183                                  ;
 46184                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46185                                  
 46186                                  lquit:
 46187                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 46188                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 46189                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 46190                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 46191                                  i20patch:
 46192 000010C0 EB03                    	jmp	short quit_cont
 46193                                  
 46194 000010C2 E8CE00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 46195                                  quit_cont:
 46196 000010C5 2EFF2E[9210]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+4]	; jump to DOS
 46197                                  
 46198                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46199                                  ;
 46200                                  ; INT 21 Handler
 46201                                  ;
 46202                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46203                                  
 46204                                  lcommand:
 46205                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 46206                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 46207                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 46208                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 46209                                  i21patch:
 46210 000010CA EB03                    	jmp	short command_cont
 46211                                  
 46212 000010CC E8C400                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 46213                                  command_cont:
 46214 000010CF 2EFF2E[9610]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+8]	; jmp to DOS
 46215                                  
 46216                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46217                                  ;
 46218                                  ; INT 25 
 46219                                  ;
 46220                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46221                                  
 46222                                  labsdrd:
 46223                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 46224                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 46225                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 46226                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 46227                                  i25patch:
 46228 000010D4 EB03                    	jmp	short absdrd_cont
 46229                                  
 46230 000010D6 E8BA00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 46231                                  absdrd_cont:
 46232 000010D9 2EFF2E[9A10]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+12]	; jmp to DOS
 46233

 46235                                  ;
 46236                                  ; INT 26
 46237                                  ;
 46238                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 46239

 46242                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is

 46257

 46260                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
