 46291                                  ;
 46292                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46293                                  
 46294                                  lcall_entry:
 46295                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 46296                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 46297                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 46298                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 46299                                  cpmpatch:
 46300 000010FC EB03                    	jmp	short callentry_cont
 46301                                  
 46302 000010FE E89200                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 46303                                  callentry_cont:
 46304 00001101 2EFF2E[AA10]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+28]	; jmp to DOS
 46305                                  
 46306                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46307                                  
 46308                                  lirett:
 46309 00001106 CF                      	iret
 46310                                  
 46311                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46312                                  ;
 46313                                  ; LowIntXX:
 46314                                  ;
 46315                                  ; Interrupts from DOS that pass control to a user program must be done from
 46316                                  ; low memory, as the user program may change the state of the A20 line or
 46317                                  ; they may require that the A20 line be OFF. The following piece of code is
 46318                                  ; far call'd from the following places in DOS:
 46319                                  ;
 46320                                  ;	1. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 23h (ctrlc)
 46321                                  ;	2. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 24h (critical error)
 46322                                  ;	3. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 28h (idle int)
 46323                                  ;
 46324                                  ; The int 23 and int 24 handlers may decide to do a far return instead of an
 46325                                  ; IRET ane leave the flags on the stack. Therefore we save the return address
 46326                                  ; before doing the ints and then do a far junp back into DOS.
 46327                                  ;
 46328                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46329                                  
 46330 00001107 00000000                DosRetAddr23:	dd	0
 46331 0000110B 00000000                DosRetAddr24:	dd	0
 46332 0000110F 00000000                DosRetAddr28:	dd	0
 46333                                  
 46334                                  	; Execute int 23h from low memory
 46335                                  LowInt23:
 46336                                  					; save the return address that is on
 46337                                  					; the stack
 46338 00001113 2E8F06[0711]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23]
 46339 00001118 2E8F06[0911]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23+2]
 46340                                  
 46341 0000111D CD23                    	int	23h			; ctrl C
 46342                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 46343                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 46344                                  
 46345 0000111F E87100                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF 
 46346                                  
 46347 00001122 2EFF2E[0711]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr23]	; jump back to DOS
 46348                                  
 46349                                  
 46350                                  	; Execute int 24h from low memory
 46351                                  LowInt24:
 46352                                  					; save the return address that is on
 46353                                  					; the stack
 46354 00001127 2E8F06[0B11]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24]
 46355 0000112C 2E8F06[0D11]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24+2]
 46356                                  
 46357 00001131 CD24                    	int	24h			; crit error
 46358                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 46359                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 46360                                  
 46361 00001133 E85D00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 46362                                  
 46363 00001136 2EFF2E[0B11]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr24]	; jump back to DOS
 46364                                  
 46365                                  
 46366                                   
 46367                                  	; Execute int 28h from low memory
 46368                                  LowInt28:
 46369 0000113B CD28                    	int	28h			; idle int
 46370                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 46371                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 46372                                  
 46373 0000113D E85300                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 46374                                  
 46375 00001140 CB                      	retf
 46376                                  
 46377                                  ; DOSDATA:1115h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 46378                                  
 46379                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46380                                  ;
 46381                                  ; int 21 ah=4b (exec) call will jump to the following label before xferring
 46382                                  ; control to the exec'd program. We turn off A20 inorder to allow programs
 46383                                  ; that have been packed by the faulty exepack utility to unpack correctly.
 46384                                  ; This is so because exepac'd programs rely on address wrap.
 46385                                  ;
 46386                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 46387                                  
 46388                                  disa20_xfer:
 46389 00001141 E83F00                  	call	XMMDisableA20		; disable A20
 46390                                  
 46391                                  	; Look at msproc.asm at label exec_go for understanding the following:
 46392                                  
 46393                                  	; DS:SI points to entry point
 46394                                  	; AX:DI points to initial stack
 46395                                  	; DX has PDB pointer
 46396                                  	; BX has initial AX value
 46397                                  
 46398 00001144 FA                      	cli
 46399 00001145 2EC606[2103]00          	mov	byte [cs:INDOS],0	; SS Override
 46400                                  
 46401 0000114B 8ED0                    	mov	SS,AX			; set up user's stack
 46402 0000114D 89FC                    	mov	SP,DI			; and SP
 46403 0000114F FB                      	sti
 46404                                  
 46405 00001150 1E                      	push	DS			; fake long call to entry
 46406 00001151 56                      	push	SI
 46407 00001152 8EC2                    	mov	ES,DX			; set up proper seg registers
 46408 00001154 8EDA                    	mov	DS,DX
 46409 00001156 89D8                    	mov	AX,BX			; set up proper AX
 46410 00001158 CB                      	retf
 46411                                  
 46412                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46413                                  ;
 46414                                  ; M003:
 46415                                  ;
 46416                                  ; If an int 21 ah=25 call is made immediately after an exec call, DOS will
 46417                                  ; come here, turn A20 OFF restore user stack and registers before returning 
 46418                                  ; to user. This is done in dos\msdisp.asm. This has been done to support 
 46419                                  ; programs compiled with MS PASCAL 3.2. See under TAG M003 in DOSSYM.INC for 
 46420                                  ; more info.	
 46421                                  ;
 46422                                  ; Also at this point DS is DOSDATA. So we can assume DS DOSDATA. Note that 
 46423                                  ; SS is also DOS stack. It is important that we do the XMS call on DOS's 
 46424                                  ; stack to avoid additional stack overhead for the user.
 46425                                  ;
 46426                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46427                                  
 46428                                  disa20_iret:
 46429 00001159 E82700                  	call	XMMDisableA20
 46430 0000115C FE0E[2103]              	dec	byte [INDOS]
 46431 00001160 8E16[8605]              	mov	SS,[USER_SS]		; restore user stack
 46432 00001164 8B26[8405]              	mov	SP,[USER_SP]
 46433 00001168 89E5                    	mov	BP,SP
 46434                                  	;mov	[BP+user_env.user_AX],AL
 46435 0000116A 884600                  	mov	[bp],al
 46436 0000116D A1[F205]                	mov	AX,[NSP]
 46437 00001170 A3[8405]                	mov	[USER_SP],AX
 46438 00001173 A1[F005]                	mov	AX,[NSS]
 46439 00001176 A3[8605]                	mov	[USER_SS],AX
 46440                                  
 46441 00001179 58                      	pop	AX			; restore user regs
 46442 0000117A 5B                      	pop	BX
 46443 0000117B 59                      	pop	CX
 46444 0000117C 5A                      	pop	DX
 46445 0000117D 5E                      	pop	SI
 46446 0000117E 5F                      	pop	DI
 46447 0000117F 5D                      	pop	BP
 46448 00001180 1F                      	pop	DS
 46449 00001181 07                      	pop	ES
 46450 00001182 CF                      	iret
 46451                                  
 46452                                  ;**************************************************************************
 46453                                  ;***	XMMDisableA20 - switch 20th address line			      
 46454                                  ;									      
 46455                                  ;	This routine is used to disable the 20th address line in 	      
 46456                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.					      
 46457                                  ;									      
 46458                                  ;	ENTRY	none		;ds = _DATA				      
 46459                                  ;	EXIT	A20 line disabled					      
 46460                                  ;	USES	NOTHING					      
 46461                                  ;									      
 46462                                  ;**************************************************************************
 46463                                  
 46464                                  XMMDisableA20:
 46465 00001183 53                      	push	bx
 46466 00001184 50                      	push	ax
 46467                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_DISABLE_A20
 46468 00001185 B406                    	mov	ah,6
 46469 00001187 2EFF1E[8F11]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 46470 0000118C 58                      	pop	ax
 46471 0000118D 5B                      	pop	bx
 46472 0000118E C3                      	retn
 46473                                  
 46474                                  ; The entry point in the BIOS XMS driver is defined here.
 46475                                  
 46476                                  XMMcontrol:
 46477 0000118F 00000000                	dd	0
 46478                                  
 46479                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46480                                  ;
 46481                                  ;***	EnsureA20ON - Ensures that A20 is ON
 46482                                  ;									      
 46483                                  ;	This routine is used to query the A20 state in		 	      
 46484                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.					      
 46485                                  ;									      
 46486                                  ;	ENTRY: none		
 46487                                  ;
 46488                                  ;	EXIT : A20 will be ON
 46489                                  ;		
 46490                                  ; 	USES : NONE								      
 46491                                  ;									      
 46492                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46493                                  
 46494                                  ; 19/09/2023
 46495                                  ;LowMemory:	; label dword		; Set equal to 0000:0080
 46496                                  ;	dw	00080h
 46497                                  ;	dw	00000h
 46498                                  ;
 46499                                  ;HighMemory:	; label dword
 46500                                  ;	dw	00090h			; Set equal to FFFF:0090
 46501                                  ;	dw	0FFFFh
 46502                                  
 46503                                  EnsureA20ON:
 46504 00001193 9C                      	pushf
 46505 00001194 1E                      	push    ds
 46506 00001195 06                      	push	es
 46507 00001196 51                      	push	cx
 46508 00001197 56                      	push	si
 46509 00001198 57                      	push	di
 46510                                  
 46511                                  	; 19/09/2023
 46512                                  	;lds	si,[cs:LowMemory]	; Compare the 4 words at 0000:0080
 46513                                  	;les	di,[cs:HighMemory]	; with the 4 at FFFF:0090
 46514                                  
 46515 00001199 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 46516 0000119B 8EC7                    	mov	es,di
 46517 0000119D 4F                      	dec	di
 46518 0000119E BE9000                  	mov	si,90h	; 0FFFFh:0090h	; HighMemory
 46519 000011A1 8EDF                    	mov	ds,di
 46520 000011A3 BF8000                  	mov	di,80h ; 0000h:0080h	; LowMemory
 46521                                  	
 46522 000011A6 B90400                  	mov	cx,4
 46523 000011A9 FC                      	cld
 46524 000011AA F3A7                    	repe    cmpsw
 46525                                  
 46526 000011AC 7407                    	jz	short EA20_OFF
 46527                                  EA20_RET:
 46528 000011AE 5F                      	pop	di
 46529 000011AF 5E                      	pop	si
 46530 000011B0 59                      	pop	cx
 46531 000011B1 07                      	pop	es
 46532 000011B2 1F                      	pop	ds
 46533 000011B3 9D                      	popf
 46534 000011B4 C3                      	retn
 46535                                  
 46536                                  EA20_OFF:
 46537                                  	; We are going to do the XMS call on the DOS's AuxStack.
 46538                                  	; NOTE: ints are disabled at this point.
 46539                                  
 46540 000011B5 53                      	push	bx
 46541 000011B6 50                      	push	ax
 46542                                  
 46543 000011B7 8CD0                    	mov	ax,ss			; save user's stack pointer
 46544 000011B9 2EA3[B210]              	mov	[cs:SS_Save],ax
 46545 000011BD 2E8926[B410]            	mov	[cs:SP_Save],sp
 46546 000011C2 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 46547 000011C4 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 46548 000011C6 BC[A007]                	mov	sp,AUXSTACK
 46549                                  					; ss:sp -> DOSDATA:AuxStack
 46550                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_ENABLE_A20
 46551 000011C9 B405                    	mov	ah,5
 46552 000011CB 2EFF1E[8F11]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 46553 000011D0 09C0                    	or	ax,ax
 46554 000011D2 740F                    	jz	short XMMerror		; AX = 0 fatal error
 46555                                  
 46556 000011D4 2EA1[B210]              	mov	ax,[cs:SS_Save]		; restore user stack
 46557 000011D8 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 46558 000011DA 2E8B26[B410]            	mov	sp,[cs:SP_Save]
 46559                                  
 46560 000011DF 58                      	pop	ax
 46561 000011E0 5B                      	pop	bx
 46562                                  
 46563 000011E1 EBCB                    	jmp	short EA20_RET
 46564                                  
 46565                                  XMMerror:				; M006 - Start
 46566 000011E3 B40F                    	mov	ah,0Fh			; get video mode
 46567 000011E5 CD10                    	int	10h
 46568 000011E7 3C07                    	cmp	al,7			; Q: are we an MDA
 46569 000011E9 7406                    	je	short XMMcont			; Y: do not change mode
 46570 000011EB 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah ; 0			; set video mode
 46571 000011ED B002                    	mov	al,02h			; 80 X 25 text
 46572 000011EF CD10                    	int	10h
 46573                                  XMMcont:
 46574 000011F1 B405                    	mov	ah,05h			; set display page
 46575 000011F3 30C0                    	xor	al,al			; page 0
 46576 000011F5 CD10                    	int	10h
 46577                                  	
 46578 000011F7 BE[4612]                	mov	si,XMMERRMSG
 46579 000011FA 0E                      	push	cs
 46580 000011FB 1F                      	pop	ds
 46581 000011FC FC                      	cld				; clear direction flag
 46582                                  XMMprnt:
 46583 000011FD AC                      	lodsb
 46584 000011FE 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'			; indicates end of XMMERRMSG
 46585 00001200 7409                    	jz	short XMMStall		; function 0Eh	
 46586 00001202 B40E                    	mov	ah,0Eh
 46587 00001204 BB0700                  	mov	bx,7
 46588 00001207 CD10                    	int	10h
 46589 00001209 EBF2                    	jmp	short XMMprnt
 46590                                  
 46591                                  XMMStall:
 46592 0000120B FB                      	sti				; allow the user to warm boot
 46593 0000120C EBFD                    	jmp	short XMMStall		; M006 - End
 46594                                  
 46595                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46596                                  
 46597                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 46598

 46600                                  ALTAH	equ 0Ch
 46601                                  
 46602                                  ;This has been put in for WIN386 2.XX support. The format of the instance 
 46603                                  ;table was different for this. Segments will be patched in at init time.
 46604

 46607 00001210 0000                    	dw	0	;indicate stacks in SYSINIT area
 46608 00001212 0600                    	dw	6	;6 instance items
 46609

 46616                                  
 46617 00001214 0000[2200]0200          	dw	0,CONTPOS,2
 46618 0000121A 0000[3200]0400          	dw	0,BCON,4
 46619 00001220 0000[F901]0601          	dw	0,CARPOS,106h

 46623

 46626                                  ; M021-
 46627                                  ;

 46629                                  ; 	takes control of the HMA. When running, this word is a reliable

 46690 00001246 0D0A                    	db	0Dh,0Ah
 46691 00001248 413230204861726477-     	db	'A20 Hardware Error',0Dh,0Ah,'$'
 46691 00001251 617265204572726F72-

 46692                                  
 46693                                  ;############################################################################
 46694                                  ;
 46695                                  ; ** HACK FOR DOS 4.0 REDIR **
 46696                                  ;
 46697                                  ; The dos 4.X redir requires that country_cdpg is at offset 0122ah. Any new
 46698                                  ; data variable that is to be added to DOSDATA must go in between Mark3
 46699                                  ; COUNTRY_CDPG if it can. 
 46700                                  ;
 46701                                  ; MARK3 SHOULD NOT BE > 122AH 
 46702                                  ;
 46703                                  ; As of 9/6/90, this area is FULL!
 46704                                  ;
 46705                                  ;############################################################################
 46706                                   
 46707                                  	;ORG	0122Ah
 46708                                  
 46709                                  ; DOSDATA:122Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 46710                                  ; 09/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 46711                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:122Ah
 46712                                  
 46713                                  ; The following table is used for DOS 3.3
 46714                                  ;DOS country and code page information is defined here for DOS 3.3.
 46715                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCountry is 1 (USA).
 46716                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCodepage is 850.
 46717                                  
 46718                                  ; country and code page information
 46719                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46720                                  COUNTRY_CDPG:	; label  byte
 46721 0000125D 0000000000000000        	db   0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0		; reserved words
 46722 00001265 5C434F554E5452592E-     	db   '\COUNTRY.SYS',0		; path name of country.sys
 46722 0000126E 53595300           
 46723                                  	;db   51 dup (?)
 46724 00001272 00<rep 33h>             	times 51 db 0
 46725                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 46726                                  ;ifdef	DBCS
 46727                                  ;  ifdef JAPAN

 46729                                  ;  endif

 46732                                  ;  endif

 46735                                  ;  endif
 46736                                  ;else
 46737 000012A5 B501                    	dw   437			; system code page id
 46738                                  ;endif

 46740 000012A7 0600                    	dw   6				; number of entries
 46741                                  COUNTRY_CDPG_76: ; COUNTRY_CDPG + 76

 46894                                  ; first and second DOS patches
 46895                                  ;	Non-console device read/write (system calls 3Fh and 40h)

 46900                                  ;

 46919                                  ;

 46933                                  DOSP3_CONBUF:	db	029h,002h,0E8h

 46935                                  		db	09Ah,0E3h,05Fh,007h	; ???? , pop di, pop es
 46936                                  DOSP4_ID:	db	059h			; pop cx
 46937                                  DOSP4_ID_OFF	equ	(DOSP4_ID - DOSP3_ID)
 46938

 46946                                  ;      WRCONLP: lodsb

 46958                                  ; DOSDATA:12F6h
 46959                                  
 46960                                  ; Seventh DOS patch - System call entry, patch USER_ID with VMid for share
 46961                                  ;
 46962                                  ; Code in disp.asm, 1 location
 46963                                  ;
 46964                                  ;
 46965                                  ;	mov [SaveDS],ds
 46966                                  ;	mov [SaveBX],bx
 46967                                  ;	mov bx,cs
 46968                                  ;	mov ds,bx
 46969                                  ;	inc [indos]

 46972

 46974                                  DOSP7_SAVEDS:	db	07Eh,05h		; mov [SaveDS],ds
 46975                                  		db	02Eh,089h,01Eh
 46976                                  DOSP7_SAVEBX:	db	07Ch,05h		; mov [SaveBX],bx
 46977                                  		db	08Ch,0CBh		; mov bx,cs
 46978                                  		db	08Eh,0DBh		; mov ds,bx
 46979                                  		db	0FEh,006h

 46981                                  		db	033h,0C0h		; xor ax,ax
 46982                                  DOSP7_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP7_ID

 46999                                  		db	036h,0A1h
 47000                                  DOSP8_USER_ID:	db	0EAh,002h		; mov  ax,ss:[USER_ID]
 47001                                  		db	026h,03Bh,045h		; cmp  ax,es:[di+2F]
 47002                                  DOSP8_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP8_ID
 47003                                  		db	02Fh,058h		; pop  ax
 47004                                  
 47005                                  ; DOSDATA:1314h
 47006                                  
 47007                                  ; 10th, 11th, 12th DOS patch - System call 3Fh (Read) in raw mode
 47008                                  ;
 47009                                  ;   Take RAW read to STDIN SFT and turn it into a polling loop doing
 47010                                  ;   a yeild when a character is not ready to be read.
 47011                                  ;
 47012                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 3 locations
 47013                                  ;
 47014                                  ;   DVRDRAW:
 47015                                  ;	    PUSH    ES
 47016                                  ;	    POP     DS
 47017                                  ;   ReadRawRetry:				<- Patch 10
 47018                                  ;	    MOV     BX,DI
 47019                                  ;	    XOR     AX,AX			<- Reenter #2
 47020                                  ;	    MOV     DX,AX
 47021                                  ;	    call    SETREAD
 47022                                  ;	    PUSH    DS				<- Reenter #1
 47023                                  ;	    LDS     SI,[THISSFT]
 47024                                  ;	    call    DEVIOCALL
 47025                                  ;	    MOV     DX,DI
 47026                                  ;	    MOV     AH,86H
 47027                                  ;	    MOV     DI,[DEVCALL.REQSTAT]
 47028                                  ;	    TEST    DI,STERR
 47029                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDROK
 47030                                  ;	    call    CHARHARD
 47031                                  ;	    MOV     DI,DX
 47032                                  ;	    OR	    AL,AL
 47033                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDROK
 47034                                  ;	    CMP     AL,3
 47035                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDFERR
 47036                                  ;	    POP     DS
 47037                                  ;	    JMP     ReadRawRetry
 47038                                  ;
 47039                                  ;   CRDFERR:
 47040                                  ;	    POP     DI				<- Patch 11
 47041                                  ;   DEVIOFERR:
 47042                                  ;	    LES     DI,[THISSFT]
 47043                                  ;	    jmp     SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 47044                                  ;
 47045                                  ;   CRDROK:
 47046                                  ;	    POP     DI				<- Patch 12
 47047                                  ;	    MOV     DI,DX
 47048                                  ;	    ADD     DI,[CALLSCNT]
 47049                                  ;	    JMP     SHORT ENDRDDEVJ3
 47050                                  
 47051                                  DOSP10_ID:		db	006H,01FH
 47052                                  DOSP10_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 47053                                  DOSP10_LOC:		db	08BH,0DFH
 47054                                  DOSP10_REENT2_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 47055                                  			db	033H,0C0H,08BH,0D0H,0E8H
 47056                                  DOSP10_ID_LEN		equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 47057                                  			db	0DFH,00EH
 47058                                  DOSP10_REENT1_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 47059                                  			db	01EH,036H,0C5H,036H,036H,005H,0E8H,0AFH,00EH
 47060                                  			db	08BH,0D7H,0B4H,086H,036H,08BH,03EH
 47061                                  DOSP10_PACKVAL_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 47062                                  			db	009H,003H
 47063                                  			db	0F7H,0C7H,000H,080H,074H,019H,0E8H,047H,017H
 47064                                  			db	08BH,0FAH,00AH,0C0H,074H,010H,03CH,003H,074H,003H
 47065                                  			db	01FH,0EBH,0CFH
 47066                                  DOSP11_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 47067                                  			db	05FH
 47068                                  DOSP11_REENT_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 47069                                  			db	036H,0C4H,03EH,036H,005H,0E9H,0A1H,004H
 47070                                  
 47071                                  DOSP12_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 47072                                  			db	05FH,08BH,0FAH
 47073                                  ; DOSDATA:1353h
 47074                                  
 47075                                  ; 13th DOS patch - Actually a SYSINIT patch. Patches the stack fault code
 47076                                  ;		which prints the fatal stack fault error on DOS >= 3.20.
 47077                                  ;
 47078                                  ;	    Sets focus to current VM so user can see fatal message.
 47079                                  ;
 47080                                  ;
 47081                                  ;	l0: lodsb		<- Setfocus here
 47082                                  ;	    cmp al, '$'
 47083                                  ;	    je l1
 47084                                  ;	    mov bl, 7
 47085                                  ;	    mov ah, 0Eh
 47086                                  ;	    int 10h
 47087                                  ;	    jmp l0
 47088                                  ;	l1: jmp $
 47089                                  
 47090                                  DOSP13_ID:	db	0ACh			; l0: lodsb
 47091                                  		db	03Ch,024h		;     cmp al, '$'
 47092                                  		db	074h,008h		;     je l1
 47093                                  		db	0B3h,007h		;     mov bl, 7
 47094                                  		db	0B4h,00Eh		;     mov ah, 0Eh
 47095                                  		db	0CDh,010h		;     int 10h
 47096                                  		db	0EBh,0F3h		;     jmp l0
 47097                                  		db	0EBh,0FEh		; l1: jmp $
 47098                                  DOSP13_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP13_ID

 47111                                  ;============================================================================
 47112                                  ; MPATCH.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1993)
 47113                                  ;============================================================================
 47114                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 47115                                  
 47116                                  ;mpatch.asm -- holds data patch location for callouts 
 47117                                  ; -- allocate cluster in rom.asm
 47118                                  ;
 47119                                  ; This area is pointed to by OffsetMagicPatch[609h] in fixed DOS data.
 47120                                  ; Currently, this location is used only by magicdrv.sys's patch to
 47121                                  ; cluster allocation, however it can be expanded to be used by other
 47122                                  ; patches. This is important since we have an easy-access pointer to
 47123                                  ; this location in OffsetMagicPatch. Magicdrv.sys is guaranteed to
 47124                                  ; only patch out a far call/retf, so any space after that could be
 47125                                  ; used as a patch by using OffsetMagicPatch+6. See rom.asm on how
 47126                                  ; to call out here.
 47127                                  ;
 47128                                  ; Currently, we allocate only the minimum space required for the 6
 47129                                  ; byte magicdrv patch, so if you change the dos data, you may want
 47130                                  ; to reserve space here if your new data will be position dependent
 47131                                  ; and would prohibit growing of this table.
 47132                                  ;       
 47133                                  ;history	-	created 8-7-92 by scottq
 47134                                  ;		-	added Rational386PatchPtr 2-1-93 by jimmat
 47135                                  ;
 47136                                  ;Exported Functions
 47137                                  ;==================
 47138                                  ;MagicPatch     -       callout patched by magidrv.sys for cluster allocations
 47139                                  
 47140                                  ; DosData Segment
 47141                                  
 47142                                  ; DOSDATA:1362h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 47143                                  
 47144                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47145                                  
 47146                                  ; Rational386PatchPtr points to either a RET instruction (80286 or less) or
 47147                                  ; a routine to fix buggy versions of the Rational DOS Extender (80386 or
 47148                                  ; greater). Added to this file because it needed to be somewhere and is
 47149                                  ; 'patch' related.
 47150                                  
 47151                                  Rational386PatchPtr:
 47152 00001371 0000                    	dw	0	; points to patch routine or RET instr.
 47153                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47154                                  
 47155                                  MagicPatch:
 47156                                  ;MagicPatch proc far
 47157 00001373 CB                              retf            ;default is to just return to allocate
 47158 00001374 90                              nop             ;however, this code will be patched
 47159 00001375 90                              nop             ;by magicdrv.sys to
 47160 00001376 90                              nop             ; call far ?:?     
 47161 00001377 90                              nop             ; retf or perhaps just jmp far
 47162 00001378 90                              nop             ;retf/nop take one byte, so we need six instructions
 47163                                                          ;for 6 byte patch
 47164                                  ;MagicPatch endp
 47165                                  
 47166                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47167                                  
 47168                                  ;DosData Ends
 47169                                  
 47170                                  ; DOSDATA:136Ah
 47171                                  
 47172                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47173                                  
 47174                                  ;DOSDATALAST SEGMENT
 47175                                  
 47176                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 47180
